description:
Definitely one of my favorite crepes places in the city. I always end up visiting here when I'm around japantown.
My favorite has been the Nutella and mandarin Oranges crepes.
The crepes themselves are very well done and tasty and the choices of fillings are pretty wide and should satisfy most people.
author: Alok M.

description:
Every time I visit Japan town, I have to grab a crepe for dessert with my mom. It's tradition! 
And tradition has never looked or tasted so good! I love that they have various crepe options from sweet to savory, even gelato and the kawaii way they style the crepes. Taste is always on point, but I would change the fact that they are Cash Only. 
I only wish we had these types of crepes back in Sacramento.
author: Esca N.

description:
My cousin recommended this place for desert after our dinner. All types of crepes and gelato ice cream. Small place with a few tables and chairs. 

The cashier was nice. My boyfriend pointed out that no one was wearing gloves. The man who was making the crepe was touching the spreading knife or whatever it was, with his fingers like fondling with it. I didn't see if they washed their hands before starting our order either. Then a girl, also gloveless, putting the fruits in it and wrapping the crepe up to be placed inside the paper.

Overall it tasted really good, the fruits was fresh. Mines had kiwi, banana and strawberries. I never had a crepe like that before, usually it's just banana and Nutella or something. So the strawberry ice cream made it really delicious!
author: Yee W.

description: Like most crêpé places, it's a bit on the pricey side for dessert. Their crepes are fresh and made with fresh ingredients and honestly, they are delicious
author: Shaeli Z.

description:
Red bean paste with green tea ice cream was everything I loved wrapped in a crepe. It was the perfect treat for hot Summer day. 
I think it was enough to be shared for 2. 

Btw cash only! Be ready.
author: Michele L.

description:
Really good ice cream and crepes! 
This place is small but super busy. 
Their food items are tasty but in my opinion I thought it was pricy. I got a double scoop cup and it was $7 
Their crepes are good. The crepe itself is a little chewy. The ice cream, and whip cream in the crepe makes it tasty and the crepe itself is well presented. I'd come again
author: Amy N.

description:
This is a decent place to get dessert right after ramen or udon. 

It is inside the Japantown center surrounded by many restaurants. There are just a few tables inside, but most people eat outside since there are so many areas to do so. All crepes are made to order and you can watch their every move :)

Order: I got a Nutella banana crepe. It was a good crepe batter, sweet, soft, and chewy. I wished they put more Nutella since some parts were more filled and the edges were bare. The bananas were perfectly sliced where the slices were not too thick or thin.

I would come back to try a crepe with ice cream if I'm in the area again.
author: Lisa H.

description:
WOW

Look at this new interior!  It has been forever since I have been here.  Seating upgraded, chairs are a bit more comfortable.  And more lighting, the place looks extremely bright.

Yet it still is only Cash only.

The quality of the crepes are always on point.  They serve pretty unique ice creams here.  I have no had any of their savory crepes, so this review is just on their dessert crepes.

I got to build mine, with strawberry banana Nutella with green tea ice cream.  It was magnificent.  I know it was kind of expensive BUT the amount that is in it, definitely is worth your money.

The crepes itself doesn't fall apart like most places that serve this.  Its nice and crispy but at the same time, on the inside is soft.  So you get this amazing texture of soft and crispy.  The ice cream scoop was wonderful.  And know its fresh and not waiting for other crepes to be made because it wasn't melting like crazy.

Definitely something not to miss out on.
author: Dang M.

description:
5 star review over due for Sophie's Crepes. 
First off, cash only! There's an ATM there in case you forget. 
I've only had one kind of crepe here and it's the only one that everyone should get. Nutella crepe and add gelato!!!! They use Fiorello's gelato and it's the best gelato out there. I love Sophie's crepe above all the other crepe places in Japantown because something about their batter causes the crepe to crisp up and the crepe becomes crispy yet still soft, not soggy. Not the traditional soft crepe, but for wonderful reason. 

I always get the mixed fruit Nutella crepe (banana, strawberry, and kiwi) -- but you can choose any combo or fruit you desire. Whatever you choose, you MUST add gelato. It's extra money, but very very worth it. Highly recommend green tea gelato, hazelnut gelato (nocciola = hazelnut in Italian), or black sesame gelato. They're all good to be honest.
author: Audrey D.

description:
I walked through Japantown and read the good reviews on this place so decided to try it.
I am not much into sweets so I picked the chicken salad crepe.

The girl was very patient and friendly. I felt awkward taking pictures as there is a large sign saying you cannot do so. But I wouldn't have ordered here if it wasn't for other customers pictures and reviews!?!

The crepe was really large and flavorful. Made perfectly for me. The chicken salad pesto filling was delicious. And this is similar to eating a large sandwich. I was FULL after finishing this! However, I would not order again as for some reason I found filling and crepe not really matching. 

I did enjoy both and I was pleased about size versus price. I paid $7.05 and that is a very fair price for SF, especially Japantown which is a more expensive area. 

I recommend to order the sweet crepes over the savory ones. If I would ever come back, I'd go for a fruit one.
author: Apple S.

description: When I go to Japan Town, I have to stop here. You know what I'm saying? Yes. The best crapes. Can't wait to go there again.
author: Jeong D.

description: love this place!!! The desserts are amazing and the the crepe melts in your mouth. I always make a point to be here for dessert when I visit San Francisco.
author: Twee W.

description:
CASH ONLY (with ATM inside the store)

I've been meaning to check out Sophie's Crepes for the longest time since their dessert crepes on display always looked super cute. But I usually come to Japantown for food and am never quite hungry enough afterwards to manage a whole crepe.

Until....recently I came by during the Cherry Blossom Festival, and the portions at the food vendors outside were so small that I was still hungry after eating, and Sophie's Crepes sounded like the perfect (and filling) dessert I was looking for!

There was a short line around noon when we got here, but it moved fairly quickly. Waiting in line gave us ample time to peruse their menu of savory and sweet crepes, which I was grateful for as I was super undecided between a couple of crepes. 

Also note that they have an additional menu of sweet and savory crepes both at the counter. My friend was planning to go with the egg melt crepe until he saw the veggie crepe on the separate menu.

I ended up going with #13 mixed fruits (strawberry banana, and kiwi) and whipped cream with a scoop of green tea ice cream. The crepe itself was the perfect thickness and its bland flavor provided a good contrast to the sweeter fillings inside. Overall I really enjoyed my crepe and would come back again if I was in the area and looking for a heavier dessert!

It was nice watching the employees making the crepes through the window while I waited for my order. They really have this whole process down to a T!
author: Dianna H.

description:
Black sesame!!! I've never seen this flavor anywhere before. My friend suggested this place and there were so many yummy flavors, but she always ends up getting back sesame so so did i. I got it in a crepe w red bean and matcha, so yummy. The crepe itself was chewy and crunchy, perfectly cooked even tho they were slammed. A little expensive but we were visiting so i think it was worth it. If i was a local I'd prob just get a plain scoop. 

Now i want some ice cream.

Btw, it's located at the upper end of the plaza, across the "bridge". The bridge isn't the stairway that you take upstairs. It's the covered bridge that crosses over the actual street outside. Enter the plaza on the side that is slightly closer to the pagoda, opposite from Daiso.
author: Priscilla Y.

description: I always have to stop by Sophie's Crepes when on Japantown. Their gelato ice cream has wonderful texture and they always have my favorite flavors: black sesame, green tea and mocha chip. I like my crepe with strawberries, Nutella and whichever ice cream I'm craving for at the moment. It never ceases to amaze me how delicious Sophie's crepes is.
author: Katherine N.

description:
Wonderful crepes!  A savory crepe is a meal!  We each had one, two of us didn't even finish ours and were full for hours!  We had plans for a dessert crepe later, but that never happened!  My suggestion is, if you plan to try both, then share! 

I had the avocado and cheese.  It was super yummy and flavorful!  So filling!  

My daughter had the turkey and cheese.  She didn't care much for the turkey and took it off, but ate the rest (with a little of my avocado added). 

My husband had the ham and cheese with veggies.  He inhaled it!  

I probably would have given 5 stars, except the service wasn't super friendly.
author: Sunshine L.

description: Lured by the smell of fresh crepes, we stopped here after dinner. We got a strawberries, whipped cream and ice cream crepe to share. It was about $7 for a really good dessert. I wasn't super hungry so I had only a few bites. But definitely enough for a hungry dude. You can choose the type of ice cream you want but we just got vanilla. There was plenty of strawberries and whip cream.  It was good combo. And the freshly made, hot crepe is really good. Lots of different combinations so I try to come back to try other things off their menu.
author: Alison W.

description: O M G! Please open one up in San Mateo / Burlingame! I am a huge fan! Wow, so much better than CrepeVine. You even have the option of putting ice cream in your crepe (which you should!!) because it tastes uhhhhh-mazing! I'd definitely come back.
author: Angelina H.

description:
Mmmmm...

Located in Japantown, we came across Sophie's Crepes while walking around. This place was quite packed when we visited. Little seating is available inside. Employees are quick and do a great job preparing these fresh crepes. They wrap your crepe in cone, so you can enjoy your crepe while walking around. I appreciate that the crepe was light and the ingredients weren't overly sweet and fresh. The crepe was crispy. I did miss the light chew crepes usually have, but this was still well prepared. A bit pricey, but quality ingredients are used and our taste buds were happy. If you're in the area and in the mood for a crepe, give this place a try. 

Cash Only.
author: Kimberly J.

description:
Super good crepes if you're waiting in line for Marafuku's. I tried the #18 Japan special which I never would have ordered on my own but man do the flavors go  together well ( Green tea gelato, matcha sause and red bean I believe).  

The fruit mix crepe was also very good and I'm sure all of the crepes are solid based on the other reviews and our experience here.
author: Rod M.

description: Cute place for anyone looking for dessert. They have an array of gelato to choose from. But they are known for their crepes. Make sure to carry cash on you if you want to try this place out. CASH ONLY. Plus they warn you to make sure your order is correct because if it isn't, it's hard to fix. I got the E selection: Strawberry, chocolate sauce, whip cream and vanilla ice cream crepe. Pretty basic just to try this place out. But it was good. Cost about $8.41.
author: Martine D.

description: Was very impressed with this place! When I went here I was actually looking for the belly good cafe and crepes but ended up coming across this place first so decided to give them a try and I'm so glad I did! I got a crepe cone with lychee gelato and kiwi pieces and it had to be one of the best things I've ever had and it was cheap and service was quick! The crepe tasted like a waffle cone and the gelato was super creamy and the kiwi was fresh! Looking forward to coming here again.
author: Jenna C.

description:
Crepes are interesting little treats. They're delicate and fancy, but the minute you start adding in crazy toppings, these dainty desserts become every kid's sweet-tooth dream. Even though I was incredibly full from a hefty lunch, there was no way I was going to say no to a fresh crepe.

Tugging the hubby alongside me, we stepped into the shop and instantly smelled the crisp batter. There were so many choices, making it hard to choose just one. I knew for sure I had to get one with Nutella, and after some contemplation, I added vanilla ice cream to it too. 

I will say that the little parlor has A LOT of rules. There are no cameras or pictures allowed. No credit card or debit card, cash only. No exchanges or returns of food. And you need to count your change BEFORE you leave the shop. I honestly felt as if I had to be on my best behavior. 

So perhaps the parlor isn't the most customer-friendly, but the crepe itself is so good that I'm sure you'll forget all about it. The smell of the Nutella and the warm crepe together was delicious, and the generous scoop of vanilla ice cream on the inside was incredibly creamy and decadent. The contrast between the warm crepe and the cool ice cream, then the combination of the hazelnut and vanilla made for one of the most addicting desserts we've ever had. Even the hubby had to come back for a few more bites. This crepe is also very car-friendly, due to the thick wrapping and how neatly the crepe is layered. Absolutely mess-free!

The crepes may be a bit on the pricey side, but it will be a treat you'll enjoy in every single bite.
author: Quyen L.

description: We got the Nutella & strawberry crepe, the red bean something crepe and the chicken salad crepe! I didn't have lunch so I thought I was going to be left out by choosing something savoury, but MAN THIS WAS A GOOD CREPE. Even the chicken salad tasted special since it wasn't too heavy and it was fantastic! Plus the crepe is really thin (not so much that anything spills out, but still crunchy) and I was floored. It's not a regular tourist eat, but good regardless if you're looking for a snack:)
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
The crepes here aren't fantastic nor are any of the menu options. Also, compared to the other crepe places in SF, this one is expensive for the stuff you get in your crepes. If you're in Japantown, just head to the opposite side of the mall and do the other crepe place which is way better (but still not the best in SF in my opinion).

The crepes are crispy and fresh, but that's standard at every crepe place. And beyond that, there's nothing here that would make me recommend this place beyond any other restaurant.
author: Michelle E.

description:
After having dinner in San Francisco, we were looking for a good spot to grab some dessert, and were craving crepes, so we found this small spot in the Japantown area!  

It's inside of a Japanese shopping center with a lot of very cute shops and cafes, and is very crowded!!  At least, that's how it felt, because it's so small and cramped inside of Sophie's Crepes itself.  There's not really anywhere to sit inside of it.  Luckily, there's ample benches outside of it inside the shopping center to sit on.  

The service was a bit crude and rushed - they certainly won't the friendliest workers that we've come across, that's for sure.  They were fast and efficient with getting them out, however, so I can't really complain that much.  Another thing that bothered me was that it was cash only.  That's very inconvenient when your main food items, crepes, are all at least $6 or more.  Luckily I had cash on me and was able to make a purchase here.

The crepe itself tasted great!  It wasn't the most amazing thing I've ever had, but it doesn't disappoint either!  I liked the ice cream here, it was supreme and sublime.  In fact, I liked it even more than the crepe itself.  I got a mango sorbet ice cream, and it was perfectly soft and delicious.  It was my favorite part about this place.

Great little dessert spot in the Japantown area.  Incredible ice cream as well that I recommend, maybe even more so than the crepes themselves!
author: Parker G.

description:
#45 (2017)

We stopped by after some checkin out of Japantown! 

Sometimes you just gotta go with ya gut y'all. It was just O-K as I imagined.
Pretty basic here, but at the same token how do you get extra?
Not too far away they have a crepe joint that dresses up crepes like your favorite animals (lol) Someone walked by with a Pokemon Pikachu looking crepe (thats just for show).

They have a lengthy menu. One for savory options and the other for the sweet dessert options.
We went basic options. Strictly Gelato in a Crepe and out the do'e! 
She got the Black Sesame gelato while I got the Geman Chocolate gelato. The gelato was smooth and creamy how gelato is supposed to be. The flavors they offered were limited and they just didn't pack much. I just expected more.
The crepes themselves where chewy in the right places and very crisp edges.

If ya go at the wrong time good luck! I caught myself in a 10 minute line but I heard it can get pretty cray cray. 

CASH ONLY!
author: Nik E.

description:
I knew we had to try this place after we saw a lot of people sitting around outside enjoying huge crepes. They have both savory and sweet crepes, priced reasonably (most crepes were around $6-8). We decided to get #18, the Japanese special ($8), which was a crepe with green tea gelato, red bean paste, matcha sauce, and whipped cream. 

The crepe itself is huge! It comes to you as a cone which you can eat on the go, which is nice because you don't have to use utensils. I thought that the matcha sauce was too bitter, but the green tea gelato itself was creamy and had good green tea flavor. The red bean paste was sweet and delicious. The crepe itself was freshly made, crunchy, and airy. Overall, a very solid crepe place and a chance to try something new.
author: Amy C.

description:
Simple fresh made crepes popular with the visitors to this area and those waiting in line for the ramen places nearby.  Savory crepes are pricier than expected but everything is made fast and fresh.  Our order:

Ham and Cheese Crepe - $7.  I pointed to the build your own crepe ingredients of ham ($3) and Cheese ($2) but was told the combo cost $7.  Not really sure why. Made fresh. Simple.  A-ok. 


Sophie's Crepes accepts credit cards.
author: Randy F.

description: Very busy!!! Wish they would call out the number louder . If you waiting outside you differently can't hear when they call your number. Cash only please.
author: Lili L.

description: Cash only! This place has solid crepe with your choice of ice-cream, fruits, and sauce. I'm a matcha addict so obviously I went for crepe with matcha ice cream, strawberry, and matcha sauce. I think the portion is huge at $8, at least compared to crepe places in NYC. I got a ton of strawberry. The matcha sauce was not sweet at all, which I like. When I was half way through, the crepe started dripping very quickly lol. So I couldn't finish all but it was good.
author: Hannah V.

description:
If you ever want crepes in the city, you've either heard of this place or have a friend that knows of this place. 

IMO the crepes here were satisfactory but wasn't the best of them all. I got the Mixed Fruits w/ Nutella (~$8) which is pretty pricey and can get more if you want add ons of ice cream or whipped cream. I wished the crepe had more of a crunchy taste to it. 

There were only 2 workers there at the time so there was a little wait. No pictures or camera allowed in the store. Convenient location upstairs in Japantown if you ever want a snack.
author: Hong L.

description:
I don't have a huge sweet tooth so it's very rare I save room for any dessert. I have to say though that Sophie's crepes is a must try if you're a Japanese dessert lover! Came here after dinner with my parents and the line was out of the restaurant! However, the line moved pretty quickly and we received our desserts fast. The workers were busy but super friendly and didn't mind answering the questions we had for him. 

We got two to share: their fruit crepe with green tea gelato and their black sesame gelato. The black sesame gelato was sooo good! The flavors weren't too sweet or savory and had a perfect balance. They definitely didn't skimp out on the fruits and ice cream inside the crepe either. Strawberry, banana, and kiwi were our fruit choices but they have all sorts of different flavors that you can try. Next time I'll definitely try their red bean gelato!
author: Christina L.

description: I've been wanting to try Sophie's Crepes for a long time, and at last I got to try it! Their crepes have to be one of the best I've tried in the United States and not to mention how affordable each crepe is! My family got three crepes: the Japanese crepe and two gelato crepes filled with mocha mint and pistachio! Though there weren't any toppings on the gelato crepes, the creamy and rich flavor of the gelato well made up for it. The actual crepe itself was my favorite part. I've found crepes in the US to be very floppy, but Sophie's crepes had a very nice thin and crunchy feeling that blended perfectly with the gelato inside! Overall, a store well worth the hype!
author: Christopher K.

description: Stopped here while on the wait list for lunch.  We had strawberry nutella and strawberry kiwi crepes.  Both were tasty and super fresh.  Quick, easy, delicious snack.
author: Michele B.

description: Finally got to try this place. As the crepes were coming out each one looked delicious, and though sometimes (on rare occasions) things can look delicious but taste awful. However, I am pleased to say that the crepe I had was delicious. I got a little funky with the flavors but highly recommend the green tea gelato with strawberries and whip cream. They fill it just right with fresh strawberries and the gelato was perfect too. The only regret I have is that I only ordered one. Also, if you're wondering why I didn't give it five stars it is because I had to go get cash since they do not take cards so it was a little bahumbug but worth the extra work.
author: David P.

description: Lovely crispy crepes with exotic flavors. I once ordered a simple ham and cheese and it was still yummy!
author: Lin S.

description:
Cash only!

They have great black sesame ice cream, which instantly puts this place at the top of my favorite Japanese crepe places. Do yourself a favor and get a Nutella crepe with black sesame ice cream, then eat it by squishing it together and taking bites out of it like a sandwich. It's a bit messy, but it's the best way to get all of the flavors and crispiness of the crepe in one bite.
author: Allison Y.

description: This place is one of the best crepe places I've been to! The crepe has the perfect crunch to it and its not too soft like french crepes. I've only tried their sweet crepes and they're delicious! I don't know about their savory ones, as I have not tried them myself. Their ice cream is delicious! The only downside is that they open at noon. Most of the time when I come to San Francisco, I arrive before noon to avoid the traffic so it would be nice if they were open at around 11. Oh and they accept cash only but they have an ATM machine inside of their shop.
author: Vanessa O.

description: Awesome crepes! Always have to stop here when a visit to Japan Town in San Francisco is overdue. My family loves the sweet desert type crepes but I love the breakfast types myself. Favorite of mine is the ham and cheese crepe (sometimes with pineapple). I believe it's the way they make their crepes on the grill that makes it tasty. It maybe a trade secret so no photos or videos are allowed. I took one anyway because what's a review without a photo, right? It's a cash only eatery and the staff is friendly, food is great and location is awesome! We always enjoy this stop when we're in the area.
author: J L.

description:
Sophie's serves some wonderful-tasting crepes. My favorite is the Japanese crepe (green tea gelato, red bean paste, matcha sauce). It is SO GOOD. The crepe is freshly made, soft, a little crispy, and cooked just right with a beautiful tan color. The green tea gelato is pretty concentrated and goes so well with the red bean. It's a yummy treat! 

Bring cash because cash only. Worth it though!
author: Jessica H.

description: This place is okay, crepes too dry and too much cream and not enough strawberry. Crepes are decent price, most under ten dollars. Maybe would come again if I was nearby.
author: Maria G.

description:
Cash only! Speedy service. 

$4 for a Nutella crepe and another $3 for a scoop of ice cream. This shop is unique because of the creeper still crispy despite the Generous toppings.

It might be a little tricky driving here and looking for free parking but the garage rate is fairly cheap.

Not your typical dine in restaurant but it's a great place to hang out.
author: Danae L.

description:
Yeah! Whenever I came to Japantown, I'll definitely try to visit this crepe shop. Their crepes
are always good and crispy. This time my hubby ordered mixed fruits with Nutella and chocolate Gelato. The line was a little longer today because of the Cherry Blossom festival. But the wait for crepe still okay. I found out that their shop inside no longer has tables or chairs, so now they have more space for people to line or standing for their order.

As usual, their crepe always taste yummy and crispy to me. You will always take times to decide which crepe to order. They only accept cash, so do remember bring cash.
author: Jaane F.

description:
The one thing I like about Sophie's is that they make their crepe skin crunchy. They crunchiness of the skin lets you pick of the crepe easily when the paper is getting in the way. They have a limited menu for crepes but there is other things you can order. 

The biggest problem for me is that the crepes are quite costly (~$6) for only having 3-4 ingredients in them. They are still quite good and if you're willing to pay a little extra for a good quality crepe, this is a great place. I don't have a big sweet tooth but their gelato is definitely one of my favorites. 

This is the only crepe place in Japantown that closes a little later during the weekends. So if you finish dinner pretty late (before 9pm) on a Sunday then I recommend coming here for dessert. 

One of my favorite crepe places but there are often times where I feel that it is too pricey for me.
author: Erica C.

description:
I ordered the Strawberry and Nutella Crepe with Ice Cream ($8). Adding ice cream to the crepe costed $1.50 extra. 

The vanilla ice cream was super creamy and I waa given one large scoop. It matched very well with the strawberry and nutella.

I was given tons of strawberry slices. Luckily, they were fresh and not the ones dipped in syrup. 

The crepe was very thin. Most of it was crunchy and broke off very easily. I think I would have preferred the crepe to be thicker.

This place is cash only and there's signs near the cashier register saying to make sure you got your exact change back before leaving the cashier area or else you will not get your money back. In addition, you cannot change your order after paying for the food.
author: Kristina M.

description:
This is my favorite crepe place when I'm in the city! Like seriously. I've tried plenty of crepe places, cus crepes are my favorite and I'm always craving them, and this place definitely the all time best! 

Price is reasonable. Nutella & strawberries starting at $6.50... but I add ice cream and whip cream. Their crepes are soooo perfect. Enough crisp, enough fluff! The strawberries always taste so fresh too! I've never had a problem of unappetizing strawberries. 

The best part about this place is the location. It's inside Japantown's shopping area. The environment feels like you're in Japan, kinda lol. There's some seating inside and extra seating outside the place. They only accept cash only unfortunately ... so don't forget to bring cash! I literally stop by here on my way out of the city all the time.
author: Jamaica B.

description: That was fun! I had the banana-cute-bear-ice cream crepes. Sorry, I forgot the name. It not only looks fun, but tastes soft, creamy, flavored with chocolate and banana, with a perfect balance of crunchy flaky stuff inside. Very satisfying. I enjoyed it.
author: Jacky C.

description: Best place to go to for crepes! The ice cream is very creamy and the fruits go well with the crepe. The overall taste isn't very sweet which I liked. The designs they have on each crepe are very unique and cute. The wait isn't very long depending on what time you go. Highly recommend.
author: Monica D.

description:
A go-to for crepes located in Japantown.

I'm not normally a sweets person except for pumpkin pie, the occasional chocolate, or homemade cookies. But crepes will do for a palate cleanser post dinner. 

You get to creep on the workers making your crepe on their nifty machines after studying all the gelato flavors and patting yourself on the back for not going overboard.

The crepe is just crispy enough, the whipped cream is light, and strawberries are a nice complement. I usually just get a relatively simple crepe, but mixed fruit is available as well as nutella.
author: Aerin Y.

description:
Looking for somewhere to go when you're in need of a snack or dessert? Look no further!

Sophie's Crepes is a reliable crepe store, with a MUCH shorter line than Belly Good Cafe & Crepes.

Although they don't make your crepe into a cute picture-worthy ice cream animal, they taste just as good!

P.S. I always go for a strawberry, banana, Nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream.
author: Elsa M.

description:
I enjoy the pleasant customer service and the quality of their crepes. They can be quite busy on weekends, so I usually opt for weekdays. Remember that it's cash only, but they have an ATM.

I always order the egg salad without lettuce. It's quite smooth, perhaps pureed. I've eaten some of the dessert crepes, which are delicious. I suggest the matcha/red bean, any with fruit combinations or just nutella/banana is good. Their gelato (matcha or black sesame!) is excellent, if you don't want a crepe. Visit when you're in Japantown!
author: Carol W.

description: My favorite spot in Japantown mall! My sisters and I always go here to get crepes after a nice bowl of ramen. I usually order the chocolate gelato crepe with add-ons of whipped cream and nutella!!! The crepe itself is really thin, crispy, and is not "gummy" in texture compared to other crepe places I've been to. And the whipped cream is to die for!! It's not too sweet and its sooooo creamy! Definitely delicious!!!
author: Alyssa D.

description: Cash only! (that's the only thing that's really bad about this place) - The crepe is delicious and their options are great. I usually get the strawberry, banana, matcha ice cream, whip cream, and chocolate syrup crepe! I totally recommend it! The line can be long but the max I waited for my crepe was around 15min. Totally worth it!
author: Amy C.

description:
Am I ever so glad that this place is far enough away for me not to indulge here whenever the whim strikes me!  It's so addictive and it's been one of my favorite go-tos in Japantown since I was a kid.  Anytime I've been in Japantown, I've visited the bookstore next to it, browsed through the shops with their beautiful trinkets and teas, and I've enjoyed a crepe.

Now some warning for those who've never been here:  Get your order right and make sure you check what you get before you accept it.  Once you take a bite, any errors are on you for not voicing your concerns.  There's signage that says a much predominantly displayed. Not that they've screwed up an order for me, but I've seen very indecisive people here switch and babble through an order that sometimes what comes out doesn't fulfill their final requests.  However, if you catch an error and speak up immediately, they'll fix it.

What I go for here is a sweet crepe.  They make the crepes right at the front (you can even watch through the window outside the store).  They offer both savory and sweet varieties of crepes as well as have an option for you to create your own.  On top of that, they offer shorbets and ice creams with toppings galore.  Today, I made my own crepe with fresh strawberries, whipped cream, and a dollop of vanilla ice cream.  Between the crunchiness of the crepe, the creaminess of the whipped cream and ice cream, and the slight tartness of the strawberries, I was so in heaven.  

This place will continue to be my go-to for desserts whenever I'm in Japantown.
author: Angela K.

description: Always love their crepes. Came yesterday and got a strawberry + nutella with hazelnut ice cream. Came back today for mandarin orange + nutella with pistachio ice cream. My man decided he wanted his own (no sharing!) So he got a banana + nutella with banana walnut ice cream. All 3 were great! Been coming here for years since I moved to the bay area. Yummyyyyyyyyy!
author: Jessie C.

description:
Overpriced ($7-8 per handheld sweet crepe) for a hand-held dessert crepe. The flavors and textures were alright, but nothing superb or exciting to draw me back a second time or ever recommend to others. 

Separate, I question their food safety handling--those making the crepes with their gloved hands also are handling money in between each customer.
author: Alison A.

description: Warm, delicious, fresh, and filling! Multiple flavors to choose from, and the staff was very patient while I asked multiple questions. The one issue I had was with finding the location. This is no fault of Sophie's Crepes, but it would be helpful if there was a sign of sorts that indicated where the restaurants are located.
author: Leslie O.

description:
More like 3.5 stars, but bumped it up a bit because I did like the place and would go back again. However, it may just be my personal preference but I didn't love it as much as I like Genki crepes. I will give this place the benefit of the doubt because I think it's just the style/type of crepe (thin, soft and slightly chewy, lukewarm) versus the type at Genki (crispy on the outside, thick and chewy, hot). I thought the ice cream was good, but nothing to write home about, and the sesame drizzle and red bean paste weren't as flavorful as I had hoped. I added mixed fruit (mix of strawberries, bananas, kiwis) for $2. 

Cash only.
author: Sally C.

description: Not as long of a wait anymore with new popular desert places nearby. Same taste and everything. I swear the prices have increased. $9 for a desert crepe with ice cream. I was shocked when they rang me up since I've been here numerous times before and don't recall it being so much.
author: Justin Y.

description: I will give this place 5 stars because the crepes were absolutely delicious! The only thing that disappointed me was they only accept cash, and not card. That is something I believe they should change because that could lose customers.
author: Zeta A.

description: Love the crispiness of the crepe. I'm not a huge fan of overly sweet desserts but the banana nutella combination is something I can't let pass. I believe it's a cash only place, though, so be prepared.
author: David Y.

description:
Finally! I was able to try this place.  Lovey and I shared a sweet crepe with mixed fruits (kiwi, strawberry, banana) with added Nutella, Chocolate Sauce, whip cream and no ice cream for $10.04 with tax. Wow that's some expensive crepe with all the add ins but it was worth it. Very light and fluffy , big size of crepe with all delightful fixings included. Why not , right? It's the original and has been in the Japan mall for decades. I hope they continue their quality of crepes. They don't allow people to take videos and pics of the guy making the crepe so respect their rules pls. 
TIP: BRING CASH! No Kurejitto kado!!!!
author: Claudine V.

description: My favorite spot in Japantown! I've been going to Sophie's for almost 10 years and have never been let down, which I can't say for other spots in Japan Center on recent visits. I love the hand-held, crispy Japanese style crepes served here - don't get me started on the whipped cream! Whether you get fruit crepes, nutella, or add a scoop of ice cream, you can't go wrong. It gets busy at times but it's always worth the wait. Don't forget to bring cash!
author: Edwina D.

description:
Japanese crepes!! Unless you are a xenophobic trumpster, there is no denying a huge crepe cone filled with ice cream, fruits, and whipped cream, that you can blissfully carry around like carnival food while window-shopping all the kawaii paraphernalia of Japantown.

It's fun to watch the crepe being made behind the counter: the batter is spread out and smoothed with the ladle which doubles as a crepe-flattener (for lack of a better word). The result is a paper-thin, crispy crepe which contrasts well with the hearty dessert toppings. One could argue the crepe is a bit too dry and papery, but I guess this is what makes it most fascinating; the concept reminds me of Japanese stationery with all its precision and eccentricity.

My favorite combination is black sesame ice cream, green tea sauce, and red bean paste--the trifecta of Japanese desserts. Yes it is a bit pricey for a dessert, but rather standard for the SF price range.

The store itself is down-to-earth, with sufficient seating, ice cream on display, and the magic circular crepe grill. It's no-frills and functions as an ideal pit stop during Japantown excursions.

The verdict? Sophie's crepes are photogenic and almost endearing in a sense, bringing out your inner child over the joy of simple desserts. Caution crepe purists: do not expect authentic French-style crepes with that fine balance between buttery and airy, the delicately precise velvety texture, and bouge toppings such as housemade compote. Sophie's are in the true spirit of Japanese crepes, light and thin with basic toppings.

Pro tip: for Japanese crepes with *cute animal faces*, check out Belly Good in the same plaza!
author: Edna C.

description: My girlfriend showed me her favorite crepe spot in Japan Town and it's definitely tasty. We ordered a nutella and strawberry crepe with an extra scoop of vanilla ice cream and bananas. It only took a few minutes to wait since there is always a line, but by the time I took my first bite I knew it was good. The ice cream with the nutella and fruits goes so well together. And the crepe was cooked correctly, firm/chewy with a slight crisp to the edges so it can hold it's shape with all of the toppings. Overall, a good experience, but I was hoping for a few more scoops of ice cream so there's enough in every bite.
author: Ryan J.

description: We arrived before they closed at 9pm and they told me they're closed and wouldn't serve us. I had my order ready and it was simple. That's not okay. Do not recommend because they clearly aren't hiring employees who care.
author: Kenny W.

description:
Waited for the line from the Sakura festival to die down and then came to get crepes but was disappointed. :(
I ordered a crepe with bananas and whipped cream like it said on the menu, but they gave me bananas and Cool Whip. I couldn't finish it because I don't like Cool Whip and would have been ok with whipped cream from a can instead. Menu options weren't the best either...I think they could have given more toppings for the price. I will give 2 stars instead of one because the service was fast and not bad, and the Japanese crepe with red bean and green tea ice cream tasted alright, better than the bananas and cream one I ordered. Next time I will stick to Belly Good's crepes.
author: Farrah L.

description: Sophie's has the best crepes. Plenty of choices.  Moreover, the crispy crepes taste better and make the crepe much easier to eat as a cone. The ice cream is delicious and their Italian sodas are tasty. It's cash only but they have an ATM. My favorite creperie hands down.
author: Damien Q.

description:
Located inside one of the plaza in Japan Town, Sophie's Crepes is probably the best crepes in the area. There are almost always a line. 

They have many options, ranging from savory or sweet, but I only get one thing here: Nutella & mandarin crepe with green tea ice cream. For some strange reason, the mandarin and nutella goes really well together. But I guess let's be honest, Nutella goes well with everything. Only downfall is cash only, remember to bring cash before coming here or you have to fork out a $2.50 fee from the ATM inside the shop.
author: Yen P.

description:
Best gelato I ever had!

If your in japan time stop by this spot for some gelato

It's such a great treat yummy
author: Chiu H.

description:
Up until experiencing Sophie's, I always thought crepes were like pancakes except thinner...soft and floppy and kind of blah unless you smothered it with nutella and powdered sugar.

Well, that wasn't the case at Sophie's where the crepes were crispy and hot and delicious! I'm not sure how they get it to be much more than blah, but they certainly do!

Last weekend while shopping in the Japantown plaza we decided to pop in for a snack before dinner. We kept it real with just butter and sugar for $3.75 and it was excellent -- warm and CRISPY.

There are three tiny tables inside if you manage to be able to get one.

What is weird is that they have signs here saying "NO PHOTOS" ... seriously, why?
author: Peijean T.

description:
CASH ONLY.  But there is an ATM inside.  

Review is purely for the black sesame gelato.  3.5 stars.  The taste is super yummy!  However, at $4 for one scoop (and $7 for two), it's definitely not cheap.  Another way to look at it is that you don't want too big of a portion anyway since the black sesame flavor is pretty heavy.  

One day I'll be back for the crepe!
author: Shannon L.

description: Went to Japan Town and was craving crepes. I luckily found this crepe shop and it had Really good crepes. Wish they took card but its alright. Got the strawberries with nutella and green tea ice cream. Overall the experience was really good. Would definitely come again when in the area.
author: Jovi S.

description: These were so amazing and the ingredients were so fresh. This is a once and a lifetime treat. The crepe is very filling and the fact that you can customize it is super fun.
author: Daniela V.

description:
I came here with my wife during the cherry blossom festival as we were craving something sweet. The shop is in the kinokuniya building right by the bookstore and is usually more accessible when you're not weaving through large groups of people due to events. The shop itself is fairly small so don't expect to sit in the shop. 

The prices of the crepes and ice cream is not too expensive. We ordered the mixed fruits with Nutella plus chocolate gelato. The crepe tasted sweet and light, and the ice cream added more depth. If anything, the only thing I wish they do better is that they make it easier to unwrap their cover for the crepe as it made the pastry a little hard to eat. Besides that, most of their selection is tasty and would definitely return if I was back in the area. 

For those wanting to beat the heat during the summer or wanting a quick dessert, this place is definitely worth a stop.
author: Chris A.

description:
Nobody talks about the understated Japantown Sundae! If you feel like eating lighter than an ice cream filled crepe, go for the sundae. It sounds like the total opposite, but no-no-no, it lifts your spirits up and makes you feel light as a feather. In a clear plastic cup, they layer azuki bean, whipped cream, matcha sauce, matcha gelato, more azuki bean, more whipped cream, and MORE MATCHA SAUCE!

If only there was more matcha sauce in this world..

Note: They only accept CASH and do NOT take pictures at the glass front. A few years ago, I took a picture of them making crepes and the worker gave me the stinkest eye ever with a "tisk, tisk" finger wave. Little did they know that their crepe was slowly burning..
author: Aimee I.

description:
Cash only! There's an ATM inside the shop, but there is a transaction fee. 

I came by around 4 pm on a Sunday afternoon and it was fairly busy. 
I got the strawberry and nutella crepe ($7.05 with tax). They were very generous with the amount of nutella - got a bit too sweet for me at the end though. Whip cream was an extra $1 and ice cream was an extra $2.  The crepes are freshly made and a bit on the softer side. 

It definitely satisfied my sweet tooth - I would come back again if I were in the area!
author: Maggie C.

description: Nutella and green tea gelato for $7ish. If we included mixed fruits, it would have over $10. It gets pricey pretty quick. However, it was a nice treat on a sunny Saturday afternoon.
author: Minh H.

description:
We love coming to Sophie's crepes whenever we are in the city.  There's always a line outside the store, and it's always fun to watch the making of goodness.

There are many flavors both sweet and savory.. but I always go for sweet.  My kids love getting ice cream in their crepes, I always get the strawberry, banana and nutella crepe.
author: Melinda R.

description:
A nice pit stop for some sweets in Japan Town.  We came for the gelato and crepes.  There were many different options to choose from a savory to a sweet crepe.  We opt for a simple nutella and vanilla ice cream crepe.  We did not regret our choice.  The freshly made crepe has the crispy outer edge.  With the nutella and ice cream, the center of the crepe was nice and soft.  It was a great consistency.  

I really enjoyed the crepe.  Also, I loved how I was able to watch them make my sweets.  The gelato was very tasty too.  The serving serve of the gelato sundae was a bit small for my liking.  I would definitely come back again.

Note:  CASH ONLY!
author: Felisha L.

description: My second favorite crepe place in SF (favorite is J-Shack). I always try to stop by if I'm in Japantown. What makes a crepe good for me is the shell texture and Sophie's makes theirs slightly crispy but still soft. You pretty much can't go wrong with any kind of filling. This place is cash only.
author: Lily L.

description: I've been here several times and the crepes here are always on pointe! Watch out for the long lines of hungry, crepe craving costumers because this shop is decently small. They have plenty of options when it comes to ice cream/gelato flavors and combinations of items to mix and match to make the crepe of your choosing. I very much enjoy their OG vanilla ice cream and their green tea ice cream. Either are always a must when I get their crepes. I feel like their specialty when it comes to crepes include either strawberries, bananas, or both. They also offer kiwi here as well. The strawberries and bananas work very well with ice cream, some whipped cream on top, and Nutella all around the inside. Wrap all those together and you've got yourself a recipe for a happy stomach. Any combination crepe you can come up with, rest assured, you'll definitely leave satisfied.
author: Brandon D.

description: We got the ham and lettuce and mayo crepe. It was extremely fresh and yummy tasting! I want more !
author: Khatherine P.

description: I barely get a savory crepe and it was the best decision ever!!! I got the ham and cheese crepe with avocado and it was DELICIOUS!!! The crepe is crunchy and full of flavor. The avocado was really fresh. This place needs to open up earlier and should start to accept credit card.
author: Susan L.

description:
Saw a line from a distance when I first walked up the stairs and then greeted by a number of flyers that said "no photography/video". Why so secretive? The line went by pretty quickly and it is CASH ONLY. There is an atm in the store, but if you would like to avoid paying an extra fee to get this delicious crepe, remember to bring some extra cashhhh. 

I knew I wanted ice cream and I love anything green tea, so I quickly decided that I would get the #17 Japanese crepe!($7) Inside the Japanese crepe has a red bean spread, a good sized scoop of their green tea gelato topped with maccha sauce. 

The red bean spread went super well with the green tea gelato and I loved how the maccha sauce wasn't too sweet and hardened on top of the gelato which added a nice texture! 

Parking was fairly easy as we found street parking around the plaza rather quickly. Will definitely pay a visit to Sophie's next time to try their savory crepes the next time I'm in SF!
author: Janice W.

description:
Quick service and numerous offerings. 
I really enjoyed my red bean crepe with green tea ice cream, which weighed at least a pound and could be used for my weak sauce bicep curls if it weren't so nommable. 
Only minor gripe is that staff could have been more welcoming, but they move people through, offerings are clear and product is delish so try it out! Definitely pay the extra $1 for whipped cream.
author: Angelique A.

description:
Had a crepe with nutella and pistachio gelato. Brilliant! Gelato was really good, paired well with the nutella and the crepe was like a cone. Awesome combination. Not usually a fan of crepes. This was my favorite so far.

My wife loves crepes. She really enjoyed her crepe as well. We'll definitely make a trip here again.
author: Sai M.

description: Purchased a crepe here today but decided to throw it away.   I asked the employees why is only 1 of you wearing gloves but the other 3 employees are not.   They were not able to answer me.   Standard food handling requires you to wear gloves.  Very unsanitary!!!!
author: Jasmine H.

description: I live about 3 hrs away. But every time I visit sf, I always try to swing by here, even if it out of the way. Love their crepes. I usually get the works (fruits crepes) and my husband gets the green tea and red beans one. I have tried other Japanese crepe shops all over cali and I have not found a place that makes the crepe itself as good as Sophie's. Wish there was one in the Sj or sac area.
author: Mai M.

description:
I had to try this place out to compare it to belly good. 

This place is definitely more expensive and I can see why! They add much more in their crepes. They put the ice cream all the way inside. With all the add ons, you can definitely have one to share. 

Don't be afraid to ask about trying out the ice cream before you purchase. I sampled lychee, banana walnut and red bean. I love them all but chose red bean with whip. I didn't know what else to put in it! I was definitely full after.

I absolutely love this place!
author: Lynn C.

description: Delicious pretty filling crepes, lots of options, not a lot of seating. Got the chocolate-strawberry-ice cream... really good size for sharing. you can see it as soon as you walk to the second floor of the japan center.
author: Livia R.

description:
I didn't come here for the crepes but for the ice cream. I had the matcha green tea and black sesame scoops. The ice cream themselves were good but a few things I don't like about this place:

1. Presentation. I thought the store was a little dirty and not presentable.

2. Employees making crepes weren't wearing gloves. Ew. If it weren't for this, I would've ordered myself a crepe.

Anyway, if you don't mind all that, feel free to try the crepes. This seems to be one of the few places that sell crepes around Japantown if I'm not mistaken.
author: Jeanne P.

description:
Sophie's Crepes is located on the 2nd floor of Japan Center. It's cash only! We parked in the plaza where Safeway is located (free parking) and walked here (right across the street).

We got a strawberry & whipped cream crepe with green tea ice cream and it was amazing. The crepe is a good portion size for one person and the price is also very reasonable and cheap.

I would highly recommend Sophie's Crepe for anyone who's looking to get a dessert or to anyone who's craving sweets. Their menu is diverse so there's something for everyone!

PS: cash only
author: Jen S.

description: This place is just an average crepe place. It's a bit pricey for the amount/ quality of the crepe. Me and my friend ordered two crepes ( one was a banana Nutella and the other strawberry Nutella both with a scoop of vanilla ice cream) the total came out too $17. The crepe itself is delicious but what I don't like is that they don't allow you to film them making a crepe. I really wanted to snapchat it. But the man who was working was giving us so much attitude. Overall I would come back once in a while only because it's pricey and the service is just meh.
author: Carissa C.

description:
CASH ONLY!

I came here around lunchtime on a Saturday and the line was short (yay!). They have a good selection of both savory and sweet crepes costing around 8 dollars. 

I tried the strawberry, banana & nutella crepe and banana nutella & whip cream. The portion size were very large and the crepes are on the sweeter side (probably from the nutella), but they were tasty and had great texture.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
If you don't mind waiting in line for 40+ minutes for an $8 crepe, you won't be disappointed. 
We tried a savory ham, cheese and veggie as well as a sweet Nutella & Strawberry. Both were delicious. The serving size looked adequate but felt tiny in our tummies. No matter, it was delicious! The wait did get upsetting and the fact that the 5 "kids" behind the counter were laughing and playing around did not help the mood of those waiting. Also, the shop is small and they don't call your number very loudly so people are crammed up by the front. If you can stand the crowd and the wait, enjoy your yummy crepe.  

*Don't get behind all the people standing around and think you're in line! I walked straight up to the cashier with no wait....the wait is people standing around for their order. There must have been 4 different sets of people who got up right behind me who I had to tell I was not in line. It happened over and over so, and to lots of other people too, so since it will be a long wait REGARDLESS, make sure you are waiting in the right place!*
author: Dale S.

description:
Not enough Nutella
Very bland crepe

And the maker of the crepe kept staring at girls boobs! Seriously!!!!! They have signs on the window so that he could stare at people
Like seriously what the heck???

Cash only

Way overrated
author: Julian L.

description:
Recommend #17 Crepe with Green Tea Gelato, Red Bean Paste, and Matcha Sauce.

Looking at the menu can be a bit overwhelming since everything sounds good! There are savory and sweet crepes to choose from as well as a list of ingredients you can customize your crepe with. We decided to go with #17, and the classic green tea red bean combination was absolutely delicious.

The crepes are freshly made, filled, and rolled giving to the perfect balance of crispy exterior and soft chewy interior. I especially love that the crepe was not too sweet with the sweetness of the red bean paste balancing well with the pleasant bitterness of the matcha. Also, the gelato did not melt too quickly, and the crepe was not soggy or messy to eat at all.

Good snack to have in Japantown.
author: Eva I.

description:
This is my go-to crepe place every time I am around Japan town. There are many crepe place in the same mall structure but Sophie's Crepes is the best in my opinion.

I like their black sesame, hazelnut and green tea ice cream. It is always difficult to narrow down the flavor I want... I recommend the Japanese crepe, which is kind of far down near the bottom of the menu as one of the special items. It is basically a crepe with green tea ice cream, some red bean and matcha sauce. The matcha sauce is SO amazing! It is strong in matcha flavor, while the ice cream is more on the 'green tea' flavor side. However, you can get a green tea ice cream crepe with less the price, which is equally good. I am still on the fence about whether the matcha sauce and red bean is worth the extra few dollars, but if you haven't tried it you should! 

I would say all their ice cream flavors are pretty good, so you can't really go wrong. If you do want ice cream, it is best to get the ice cream with crepe instead of just ice cream in a cup. With about the same price, you get a bigger scoop of ice cream AND the crepe so it's a better deal. I can't wait to come back for more Sophie's Crepes!
author: Karen C.

description:
In the past month or so, I've visited several of the most popular dessert crepe places in San Francisco - Sophie's, Belly Good & Genki Crepes & Mini-Mart. Unfortunately, I thought Sophie's was probably the worst of the three. Don't get me wrong - the crepes themselves were pretty good. It's just that in comparison to the other crepes that I've had, it wasn't as amazing as it could have been.

Regarding PRICE, I think other places have had more reasonable prices. I paid over $7 dollars plus tax for a strawberry & whipped cream crepe with added black sesame ice cream. It's an additional $2.50 to add an ice cream scoop, which is very expensive compared to other locations. If you don't want ice cream in your crepes, the price is much cheaper, but I personally think that ice cream adds a lot.

Regarding TASTE & TEXTURE, I think that the crepe texture was part soft and part crunchy. I wish that it could have been crunchier, but that might just be personal preference. The crepe layer was very thin though and didn't leak, which was super impressive. The mixture of ingredients was really good, and the gelato assortment has a lot of asian flavors (i.e. matcha, red bean, black sesame), which is great.

Regarding SERVICE & ATMOSPHERE, Sophie's is more of a take-out crepe place. There is very limited seating inside, so most people get their food to go and crowd around the square benches outside. The workers inside seemed to care a lot about efficiency and were not super friendly to me... if anything, they were quite cold and wanted me to order as quickly as possible, making for not the best experience.

I think that my experience at Sophie's could have been made better in many ways. However, if I am in the area again, I would get another one of their crepes because they were pretty good. I just think that there are better crepe experiences elsewhere in San Francisco.
author: Sheila D.

description:
Portion is larger than my hand! They have a variety of options to pick from and you can also make your own. 

This is the Japantown. It has a few places to sit on the inside of this place. They only sell crepes but you can find savory and also sweet ones. 

Savory ones will have like ham, meat and other ingredients. And the sweet ones will be Nutella, fruits, whipped cream and others things depending on what you pick.
author: Rogelio Q.

description:
I'm a fan. Thinking about their crepes again makes my mouth water because it was so good. The crepes here are thin with a crispy texture and their gelato is creamy and delicious. They have both savory and dessert crepes here too!

When I was here, I ordered the #17 Japanese-- green tea gelato, matcha sauce, and read bean paste in a crepe. It left me almost speechless because it was absolutely delicious. I would definitely try their crepes with gelato. Their gelato is so creamy and absolutely awesome. When you get to the end though, watch out because the melted gelato can spill all over you as you bite down on the ends of the crepe. Be careful and make sure you have some tissues/napkins close by.

They have an extended menu next to the register-- make sure you check that out to extend your options!

This is a very small store, so seats are pretty limited, but if you have a big crowd and need some seats, sit outside the store! Since it's inside a mall, there are some benches outside. Also, this is a CASH ONLY place, so make sure you have some cash if you're planning on making a visit here.
author: Susan S.

description: Crunchy Crepe shell with the choice of your ice cream. I got the gelato crepe because I only wanted the ice cream. The Black sesame ice cream is devine. This place can be very packed on the weekend.
author: David Dat T.

description: It was okay. We've had much better crepes in the past. The family and I were not impressed. Will prob not be going back.
author: Raman N.

description: I sold my soul to Sophie. Even though I had a very bad experience, I went back. Their crepes are delicious I can't lied.
author: Hung C.

description:
Sophie's crepe! Everyone talks about going to this place over the other crepe place in the plaza. Personally, I like both. Sophie's crepe is more on the harder side and crunchy while the other place have their crepe very soft and creamy texture. I usually get J here. The banana is freshly cut and ice cream they offer is vanilla flavored. 

I feel like it depends on your personal like to determine which crepe place suits you. Customer service is not as friendly as the other place.
author: Sammi L.

description: Decent crepe, but definitely not the best. We got the Strawberry Nutella for $6.50. The crepe had a good flavor but could improve in texture. It doesn't have that subtle crunch that I love with my crepes. I do appreciate the generous amounts of strawberry they give. Overall, for crepes in SF, I prefer Genki, where the texture is crispy yet soft. It's also cheaper at Genki ($4.95 for the same exact creole we order at Sophie's).
author: Lexi R.

description:
Yay for crepes! When I heard this place had crepes with matcha ice cream, I knew instantly that I had to try it out.

The Japanese special crepe is wrapped with delicious matcha ice cream, red bean paste, matcha syrup, and (if you pay a little extra) whipped cream. The matcha ice cream is definitely the highlight - very strong and sweet flavor. I felt the matcha ice cream goes very well with the sweetness from the red bean paste. 

The crepe wrap I felt was a bit bland. It usually came out a bit soggy, probably due to the soaking in the syrup and melted ice cream.

Definitely recommend trying this place, and if you are a big fan of Japanese sweets, definitely try out the Japanese special crepe!
author: Alvin W.

description: Can you even go wrong with a crepe from Sophie's? I'm not the biggest fan of crepes, but each one here is made fresh to order and you can practically put anything you want inside. I always go for a dessert crepe as I only come here after dinner, but the savory crepes sound delicious too. The wait is a bit long, even if there's no line because of the care taken to create each crepe. Also, it's cash only so be prepared!
author: Jenn T.

description: Ooooh! These were delicious! So much better than the other one that makes animals on their crepes because these are made to order! The crepe is fresh and crispy! Even fruit toppings are made just prior to the orders. KUDOS to the crepe maker! A must try when in Japantown
author: See B.

description:
Is this what people call a crepe here in the states?
A lot of people will probably disagree with my review including my fiance which apparently loves this place.

Let me start off by saying I've had plenty of crepes in Europe and I'm always very hesitant when it come to crepes out here.  From what I know crepes are not crunchy, matter of fact they're thin and slightly "soggy" but it still maintains its consistency.
Having said that, lets fast forward to the part when we got our order, we got an overcooked crepe that flakes apart, and apparently that's just how they do them, inside the crepe had nutella and green tea gelato, they were skimpy on the nutella and the gelato was ok.

In finality,  they sell overpriced overdone crepes.  Would I come back ? Mmmmm no unless my fiance will trick me to come here again.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: Sophies crepes is my childhood. I'd always remember going there with my parents to get crepes. Now that I'm older I have less stomach space, so I'm always so bummed when I can't eat one. That being said their crepes are always enjoyable. I brought my friends to enjoy the experience with me and they loved it too. I got the mixed fruits with Nutella and vanilla ice cream. The texture of the crepes are slightly crunch but also have a little chew. The fruits are always fresh and gives a good sweet/tart flavor. To top it off I added ice cream for that frozen sweet taste. The combination of these three flavors always makes me smile.  I highly recommend this spot for dates or just hanging out with family or friends. It's well worth the visit.
author: Calvin L.

description:
I ordered the japanese crepe (has matcha ice cream, red bean and matcha drizzle). The crepe was really good and slightly crispy, and the red bean texture and matcha ice cream went really well together. I also ordered the matcha and adzuki gelato which was also pretty good.

Only down side is the long wait. Crepes are pretty solid and reasonably priced.
author: Jessica Z.

description: Definitely had to get a crepe while I was in San Fran and decided to check out Sophie's. Sophie's is located in a little shopping center on the second floor and street parking was very easy to find. Cash only but there is an ATM machine inside. For $8, I got the mixed fruit with nutella & whipped cream and added vanilla ice cream. The crepe was huge! I would recommend sharing if you are not a crazy crazy sweets eater because even sharing with my husband, I got overwhelmed. With that being said, the crepe was delicious and placed in a cone that made it easy and less messy to eat.
author: Jessica D.

description:
I've been coming to this crepe house for over 10 years but will end it after being mistreated on an order. 

The situation goes...

Husband orders 3 different crepes. The last one should've had ice cream in it, but the cashier lady got wrong. So my husband goes back to tell her about it. She tells him, since it's been made already, he has to buy ice cream on the side for $4. We said it wasn't our fault she got the order wrong. 

The manager comes over and assumes that we wanted to change our order and tells us it's not fair to other customers when we want to change our mind. Meanwhile, the Cashier girl does not say anything and does not admit she got the last order wrong. The manager goes on to tell us that they won't be able to give us the ice cream they forgot on the side, back inside the crepe or without making a whole new one and charging us again twice.

As she continued to blame us for wanting to change our minds, she kept responding with, "it's not fair to other customers," which didn't mean anything in this situation.  So in the end, I simply asked for a refund for all three orders and left and will never return again.
author: Moua L.

description:
Got the crepe that had green tea gelato, red bean, and some matcha sauce. Was overall good. Halfway through eating the crepe though, there was some hardened matcha bit that was really bitter, but the overall was good. Also appreciated how the crepe was more crispy than just soft, made it easier to eat.

My friends got green tea and red bean ice cream. This was good. Very creamy and flavorful. Would get again.

The wait for Sophie's is rather long. Felt like we were waiting for a while.

Note: Cash only.
author: Paulina L.

description: The food was mediocre at best. Describing our experience as satisfactory would be a reach. The crepe was meh, the service was close to being rude. Many people seem to like this place, so judge for yourself. I will never return.
author: Alden K.

description: We never miss this oh-so-yummy crepe whenever we go to Japantown. The green tea ice cream with red bean paste, bananas, strawberries and nutella is my favorite!
author: Cherry R.

description:
Japanese crepes is a must-try desserts when you're visiting Japantown in San Fransisco, and I think Sophie's crepes is the place for it. 

I love how this place offers such a wide range of crepes, if you fancy sweet or savory they got them here! But if you got a sweet tooth like me, the sweet crepes are the best way to go. 

I tried their mixed fruit with whipped cream ($6) with green tea gelato for an extra $$. Slightly expensive for a crepe, but they are absolutely to-die for! Crispy & fluffy on the outside, sweet and creamy on the inside - probably, the best Japanese crepes I've ever had. They actually rival my favorite Marion Crepes from Japan (that came to the Bay Area once in every blue moon). 

I only wish they have more seating areas, and this place being cash only, is such a letdown. That aside, Sophie's crepes is still AH-Mazing! And if you never had a Japanese Crepes before, I would be happy to recommend this place. You won't be disappointed!
author: Veronica C.

description: It was my first time here with friends. The line was long and the wait time was longer. I had the crepe with green tea ice cream, matcha sauce & red bean paste. It was a mess trying to hold it when eating. The ice cream would melt. You have to eat it real fast. Plus, I couldn't push the crepe up to eat it. How do you eat these things? I had to tear up the crepe holder to be able to munch on it. The taste wasn't that bad. I should've just order the basic ones with Nutella and strawberries. It would've been easier to eat. Overall, not bad but just messy to eat.
author: Amy H.

description: Cash ONLY. This place is ok, they have a good selection of crepes and gelato.  Price for a single small scoop is $4 (a little over priced for the small serving).  The crepe artist chefs were great and entertaining. They looked like they were having fun and enjoy making crepes. I ordered the mocha coffee chip, it was delicious and not as chocolaty as I thought it would be. Also they do do samples, feel free to try before you pick your ice cream flavors.
author: Abby C.

description: Favorite dessert shop in Japantown! Great tasting crepes and other desserts in the Japantown mall.  You can even watch them make the crepes!
author: Theo Z.

description:
This is the best Crepe in the city-!!! I highly recommend for people who are sweets lovers-!!

All my family love their Crepes and this is the only place we go to get some Crepes-!!
author: Jang R.

description:
We got a strawberry, banana, nutella, whipped cream crepe with vanilla icecream. This is probably the best crepe that I've ever had. Everything was perfect from the texture to the flavor! 

-Edmund

They give it to you in a paper sleeve so you can eat it easily. Honestly, I thought this place was going to another overhyped dessert spot, but this was my favorite crepe ever. They make it on the spot and it's nice and warm!

-Kristen

5 stars from Edmund. 5 stars from Kristen.
author: Kristen L.

description: The crepes and ice cream are good but very pricey for what you get. If you want a very light dessert this is a good choice
author: Mike S.

description:
I love a good crepe--who doesn't? But this is not a story about eating crepes--it's one about just trying to get one. 

When I got here, I was pumped. Like I said, I love crepes and although there was a crowd, I was able to get right up to the line. What I didn't know at that time is that it would be another 50 minutes before I would get my crepe. Why? Because this place only has two machines to make crepes. In my opinion, this is ridiculous. 

Additional improvements this place should make:
- Have a visible number system that shows which customer's crepe is being served. It was difficult to hear your employees calling numbers out as many people were more than 15 feet away as they waited.
- Let people know from the beginning how long the wait will. Because my wife had an appointment, she couldn't eat any of the crepe. Neither of us could have predicted it would have taken as long as it did. 
- Add another two crepe machines. 

Like I said in the beginning, this place isn't bad but when it's busy, the customer experience takes a serious nose dive. 

PS - I think asking customers to not take photos of the crepes being made is ridiculous. They're trying to share your brand with their friends online and you're stopping them. Weird.
author: Kenji O.

description: My go to for Japanese crepes! I love the presentation and flavors. Do wish the crepes are a bit more chewy and thick, and it can be hard to eat. The best spot for crepes in the mall area. Bring cash!
author: Chelsea W.

description: The crepe tastes okay. However, the people works at the store is not very accommodating. Bad customer experience.
author: Jiayuan S.

description:
Hmm, yes please. I will always welcome their Nutella banana or Japanese crepes no matter how stuffed I am. *Happy dance*
Cash only establishment. Good thing I had my secret cash stash. Whew.
Good size, perfect crisp, didn't skimp out on the filling either. Yum!
author: Jenny T.

description:
Cash only! Located inside the mall in Japantown with limited seating but there's plenty of places to sit around the area.

You can order their combination crepes,
make one yourself, or get gelato. I got a double scoop of the red bean and black sesame gelato ($5). The black sesame was absolutely amazing! Such amazing texture and unique flavor.
author: Linda X.

description:
Eh, Crepe Temptations is wayy better. This is hella pricey, around ~8.00 for one crepe with ice cream!!!
They don't give enough ice cream.
author: Hanna M.

description:
After sampling top rated crepe places from Taiwan, Japan, and France, these guys still make my favourite dessert crepe. They get it to just the right thickness to give it the crunchy taste. Adding ice cream isn't that necessary, just stick with Nutella and your fave fruits and you'll be in for a treat.

Lineups are still common but they make your crepes fresh and are reasonably timely about it. Not a lot of seating so many people end up sitting in the mall benches by the stairs.
author: Elisa L.

description:
My go to spot when craving Crepes.

Banana and Nutella with Mango Sorbet is by far the best crepe I've eaten.

After the top layer, when you are able to take a chunk of the crepe with the banana, Nutella, and Mango Sorbet all at the same time.... 5 Star!

Always comparing any other crepe to this place, but they never reach any where near the expectation like Sophie's Crepes.

#LifeOfBD
author: Brian D.

description: Amazing crepes! I don't know what they put in their batter to make their crepes so light and airy! Their crepe "cones" that they create for you are huge and can be shared between two. And you just can't go wrong with Strawberry, Nutella and Vanilla Ice Cream!
author: Debra T.

description:
Cash Only!!!! ATM machines inside business. 

On weekends tend to have a long lines. 
Our family's favorite place to stop after our sushi  fix. 

We tried other locations around SF that also makes crepes. It's not the same . We tend to gravitate to this location. 
It's a lot of $ . We bought 5 different varieties of assorted flavors of the crepes comes to $37.50

I justify, paying $ since we don't have it as often. My kids loved it. That's important.
author: Vuoch. L.

description: Waiting for the ramen restaurant to be open and we came across to Sophies crepes.. i actually missed crispy crepes with fruits and Nutella and this place has it. The only down side they only except cash.
author: Syerine H.

description:
I love Sophie's Crepes. Every time I go to Japantown, I always come here. A lot of people go to the Belly Good for crepes in Japantown, but I personally find Sophie's Crepes better in terms of taste. 

Compared to Belly Good, the line is a lot shorter, but to me, the crepes are are crispier and tastier here. 

I would definitely recommend coming here if you're in the area!
author: Arianna B.

description:
BEST CREPES + GELATO EVER

Mixed Fruit Crepe: Came with kiwi, banana and strawberry, all wrapped up in a crepe lined with nutella. IS THIS HEAVEN OMG. The key thing that really made this crepe better than all the others I've had is how crispy the crepe skin is..I've never had a crepe with a skin this crispy. The batter also has a great aroma, very similar to a waffle/egg puff batter. I woudln't be surprised if it's the same haha. The fruit is also really fresh (they cut it on the spot). 

SESAME GELATO: BEST SESAME GELATO EVER! Tops the sesame soft serve at Matcha Love in San Jose. The sesame flavor is just so so strong and nutty and the gelato is so thick and creamy. I love it so much and I'd literally stop by for their sesame gelato as often as I could...if it wasn't for the wait. 

WAIT: The wait is just insane...to even order it takes a good 10-15 min and the wait to GET the order is another 20 min. (-1 star for that...)

Service: Staff is friendly but they don't have much time/patience to help you which is understandable given how long the line is. It's more of a "quick order'" and go wait outside.

OVERALL
Best crepes and sesame gelato ever! But do be prepared to be patient for it... Patience is a virtue...it'll bring you delicious crepes and gelato haha.
author: Cynthia H.

description:
MY FAVORITE CREPES OF ALL TIME!
I always get the F, sometimes I change the ice cream flavor.
The only downside is this place sometimes closes unannounced. 
Also, cash only!! They have ATM machine, but they charge fees.
author: Candice L.

description: Fairly inexpensive desserts with fresh fruit and crèpes. They also have non-dessert crèpes like Tuna Salad crepes and ham and cheese crepes. Their regular crepe is probably what I'll try the next time Im in Japan Town. Sophies is located indoors just past the restaurant row after walking into the indoor mall closest to the Peace Pagoda structure. Depending on the time of day you go there can be a line out the door. The crepes are made fresh and you can watch them make it behind the counter.  I got the ice cream with bananas and chocolate crepe. It was really good and filling. My friends got green tea ice cream crepe and mixed fruit crepe with ice cream and they really liked theirs also. Sophie's is a must for dessert in Japan Town.
author: Vince N.

description: There's dozens of people standing around waiting for their orders, and the line wraps around where people pick orders up, so it's hard to squeeze through and grab your food when your number is called. We even had an issue where people got duplicate order numbers, which made things even more confusing. Also, the menu options don't seem to correlate with what people tend to order, so you tend to have to pick an option and add/remove things as you choose. Seems a bit weird. What a bummer!
author: Hanna D.

description:
I'm a purist- Nutella and Strawberries please. Don't get crazy. Don't add a bunch of fancy stuff. No I don't want whipped cream, ice cream or any of those other things you youngins are clamoring for nowadays. 

It's cash only, so prepare accordingly. They close kind of early so consider moving your dinner reservation early so that you can get there before they close (its worth it). And enjoy!
author: Lai-Nin W.

description: Super delicious crepes full of ice cream, fruits and cream. Definitely would come back for a second try!
author: Tianjia C.
