description: Rating based solely on the crepes! I love it here, the crepe is always yummy - slightly crispy on the edges but soft overall to bite into. And get nutella spread with fruits and ice cream and of course it's amazing. Only cons would be they take cash only and when it's busy it could take a while because the line gets super long.
author: Jeana Y.

description:
Given the long lines and hype surround Sophie's, I can't give it more than 3 stars after my underwhelming experience today.

I ordered #17 (a crepe with green tea gelato, matcha sauce, and red bean paste) and it was just OK, but not great. Some parts of the gelato were too icy, and overall the sensation of biting into a freezing crepe was not pleasant. Quantity-wise, it was just one small scoop of gelato and a dollop of red paste stuffed inside a thin crepe. It came out to $7 with tax. It's annoying that they charge $1 for whipped cream.

Does it weird anyone else out that they don't use gloves and just continuously make crepes without washing their hands in between?
author: Valerie L.

description: Trust me, that one serving is sooo giant... me and my friend decided to skip dinner after having their crepes.... we got so full but it was good ~
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Sophie's Crepes is located in the second floors of the Japantown shopping center. There is always a huge line waiting.

There is a big window up front where you can watch them make the crepes. It fascinates me how fast and how efficiently they make these crepes.

I went for the the Japanese Crepe. It had Green Tea Gelato, Red Bean, and Matcha Sauce. The crepe was thin and crispy. It had just the right amount of sweetness and crunch to it. It really held together with all the sweet goodness inside. I was really sad when I reach the end because I just wanted more.

The place only accepts cash. There is no photography inside. Seating is very limited inside but there are plenty of benches just outside where you can enjoy this snack. The crepes are nicely wrapped so it can go anywhere.
author: Michael C.

description: No doubt our favorite crepery.  My daughter asks for crepe from this store whenever we come close to Japantown.
author: Stink C.

description:
This place hits the craving if you want some crepes. Location is good in that it's located in the Japan town mall. 

This place can get crowded but it's worth it.

I got a banana and nutella one and it was great The sad part is that it's messy to eat.
author: Derrick C.

description: Sophie's Crepes are hidden in Japan town. Their selections vary from each crepe. I got the Strawberry, Banana with Nutella. For the value you pay, this crepe is average. For the taste, it's ok. However, if you are in Japan town and are craving for crepes for the first time, this is the place. I've came here before 2 years ago and it was way better before. Now, they changed a lot.
author: Brenda C.

description:
This is a Japanese style crêpe which is soft and slightly chewy, with a texture that's very close to French crêpes.  It is folded into a cone shape and is filled with your toppings, ice cream and whipped cream. 

The crêpes are freshly made with a batter heated over a flat griddle heater.  Its thickness (or should I say "thinness") is perfectly paper-thin.  It has just the right degree of chewiness and firmness that we like.

There are many topping combinations to choose from; for example, tropical mixed fruits = kiwi + strawberry + banana + whipped cream + vanilla ice cream.

Alternatively, you can choose to build your own crêpe from a long list of available ingredients.  There are many flavors of ice cream to choose from, and I personally recommend the black sesame ice cream.

Most locals who frequent Japantown know this place well.  If you are from out of town and visiting Japantown in San Francisco, make sure you go grab one of those crêpes before you leave your heart behind.
author: Rob L.

description:
Sophie's crepes is located in San Francisco's Japantown. This area is alway busy because it has many stores and restaurants in the mall area. It was the first time many many years ago that I had eaten a crepe, let alone a dessert crepe. And it was here of all places.  This establishment is very popular with the natives and those who visit from far and wide has been around for a while. 

The line seems long but it moves rather quickly. You pick from a menu of predetermined favorites and they make it for you. Ice cream, fresh fruit and even food crepes.  The operation they have down to a science. No matter the style and toppings, customers get served in a timely and efficient manner while maintaining good customer service. 

Most likely if you have visited or will visit San Francisco, Japantown is on your list of stops. Therefore so is Sophie's.
author: Gregory C.

description:
Always walked by this place but never had a chance to try it since the lines have always been insane but decided to try it yesterday and glad I did. 

The shop is pretty small and operates on a order and pick up service. All crepes are freshly made on the spot. I got the banana, strawberry, nutella, and whip cream crepe and friend got the signature crepe which consisted of whip cream, green tea ice cream, and red bean paste. Both were really good, not overly sweet and the crepe was crispy and solid (hate crepes that get soggy easily or just breaks apart).

Definitely was not disappointed by the experience and would say it as worth waiting in line for.
author: Kelly Y.

description: This is my second time at Sophie's Crepes, It's in Japan town.  I didn't think I was able to finish a crepe by myself but it was just perfect for one person.  I ordered the  Strawberry and whip cream with pistachio gelato.  It was on point.  I'm lactose and I was worried that the gelato won't sit well.  (some gelatos are no problem for me) Luckily, no issues there.  They only take cash, line is usually long.  Only thing I would change, is they should get more flexible plastic spoons. I felt the spoon digging into the ice cream would break off any time.
author: Jenny L.

description: As a matcha lover, of course, I got the Japanese Crepe; however, instead of the matcha ice cream that it came with, I replaced it with azuki ice cream. The crepe also included red beans and matcha sauce..
author: Jenny D.

description:
Sophie's has always been one of my favorite places to go for crepes! I've been coming for years & this place never disappoints me. The only disappointment I have is if I leave Japantown without stopping by here! I always appreciate the size of the crepe because it is big so it's really filling or good to share as a dessert after a filling meal. The crepe batter tastes so simple yet delicious. They always manage to make their crepes nice & crispy on the outer layer yet warm & soft in the inner layer. Personally, I love having a crunchy factor in my crepes as opposed to an all soft one. I'm a pretty simple person so my usual order is letter E which is a crepe with strawberries, chocolate sauce, vanilla ice cream, & whipped cream. Sometimes I'll add an extra topping or substitute something here & there to change it up a little bit!

The customer service for this place always depends on how busy they are because there are some days where they have long lines. I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 because this place is not cheap! I always order the crepe combinations that are on the menu instead of creating my own crepes because the toppings here are pricey & they add up really fast! When I substitute certain toppings, they also have add on costs! Most importantly, this place is strictly CASH ONLY so come prepared or they do have an ATM in their storefront.
author: Sarah C.

description: Get the Japanese (#17). Don't think, just do it. Green tea gelato, red bean paste, topped off with matcha syrup. It was sooooo good! Not too sweet since the green tea gelato's slight bitterness complimented the red bean paste. The matcha syrup didn't really add anything unique in my opinion. I was originally going to get the nutella with strawberries and add a scoop of vanilla ice cream instead, which is my go-to, but the #17 has completely changed my mind from now on. Crepes are a little pricey for what you get, but taste totally makes up for it.
author: Daisy Y.

description:
Best crepes ever!!!!

The crepe tasted like a thin fortune cookie and then they stuffed it with a ton of fruit and ice cream!!!  So freakin' good!!!!

They have a huge variety on their menu to met anyone's dietary and taste needs!

Prices are very reasonable.  Customer service is okay.  The line is long, but worth the wait!!!!
author: Andrea B.

description:
I'm actually craving a crepe as I write this! Thinking about the delicious ice cream filled cone makes me wanted to go get one! Lol!

I came by at the beginning of this year after having dinner in Japantown. I got the Mixed fruit crepe (light whipped cream) for $5.25. It came with strawberries, kiwi and bananas. The vanilla ice cream and fruit went well with the chewy and slightly crunchy crepe cone. The only thing I didn't care for was the whipped cream. There was still too much of it. I probably should have added Nutella to cut into it, but I didn't think the whipped cream went well with just the ice cream and fruit.

Looking forward to the next time I can fulfill my crepe craving!
author: Elena N.

description:
CUTE crepe shop with TASTY crepe! 

Food: I got the Japanese crepe, which had red bean past, a scope of green tea gelato, and macha sauce. I always have gotten those three items separately, but surprisingly together tasted pretty good! The macha sauce was drizzled on top of the ice cream and tasted the strongest out of all three items. They also make the crepe fresh (you get to watch it! but no pictures...). For the price that I paid, I WISH THEY COULD HAVE GIVEN ME MORE RED BEAN PASTE. I mean, they don't cost that much for a bag...Also make sure to eat fast, because the gelato melts fast and will drop on your pants (like it did with mine)....

Setting: It's located inside of the Japantown mall and is right in front of the stairs, so pretty easy to find. But parking around Japantown may be hard to find. MAKE SURE TO READ THE PARKING SIGNS SO YOU DON'T GET A PARKING TICKET! There are 2 tables inside of the shop. There are also plenty of tables outside in the mall.

Price: I think I paid a little too much for the crepe...but it tasted pretty good so it's okay once in a while. They also sell regular gelato crepe for $4.50. Will try that next time. 

Service: They make the crepe fresh and I got my order within 10 minutes, which was pretty fast. But a crepe isn't that hard to make so not that impressed. 

Overall impression: Although the Japanese crepe I tried was pretty unique, I think it's a little on the expensive side. It wasn't a super large portion, so for the price I am paying, I am giving this place a 3 star.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Woo, Sophie! What is the secret to your delicate crepes!?

Sophie's Crepes is located inside the Japanese center. You might be able to easily find it if you start to follow all the people that are checking it out. I was actually surprised that even on a Thursday mid afternoon, people were coming in and out. My partner and I were looking for something to snack on and when I saw that this place had nearly 1500 reviews, I knew that there must be something special about this crepe place.

Now we've had our share of crepes at a wide variety of places. Whether they are on plates, in boxes or in a cone to hold, crepes are popular everywhere. So what makes Sophie's Crepes so special?

We decided to find out. They have a savory menu and a sweet menu like most places. We chose the sweet path like most people do. I saw one crepe that really made my heart beat. It's called the Japanese and it comes with green tea gelato, matcha powder and red bean paste. If you are a green tea lover, your jaw should be dropping now. You aren't going to find a crepe like this on a menu everywhere. However, my partner isn't so much of a green tea lover like I am and since I was too full to consume one of my own, we decided to go with the mixed fruit crepe. This crepe comes with strawberries, bananas, kiwis and whipped cream. Most of the dessert crepes come with some sort of fruit, whipped cream or nutella. You can also add a scoop of ice cream into your crepe for an additional cost if you want.

This place is CASH only so bring money if you want a crepe! We paid 6$ for ours and got a bit of change back. They give you your receipt with a number and you can watch your crepe being made.

The batter that they use for their crepes seemed slightly different and the crepe size seemed a bit bigger. The best thing is that they take time and effort to make sure your crepe is filled nicely and has the perfect look. They put plenty of whipped cream (almost too much!) and enough fruit so that every bite would have a piece. On the very top, they garnished it with a piece of kiwi, strawberry and banana. Now this place does place it in a cone like shape for you to hold. Most places the cone is very circular at the top (base), but Sophie makes it flatter. Surprisingly, it works better that way so that each bite can actually fit into your mouth.

First bite, woah. The batter is special. Most crepe places have too soft of a crepe that is absorbs all the moisture and starts to get soggy towards the end. Not Sophie's Crepes. These are crisp on the outside but soft on the inside! They maintain their shape very well and don't absorb much. The whipped cream tasted homemade and the fruits were very fresh. Definitely a scrumptious dessert crepe.

So far this is one of the best crepe places I have been. Out of all the ones that put them in a cone shape, this is the best. Sophie, you're doing something right. Keep the secret of your batter to yourself so that people can continue to love your crepes.
author: Liz C.

description:
Great place for desserts! I live in sacramento and cannot get crepes like this!! 
Plus I love Japan town and will return to Sophia's crepes next time I visit! 

This place is very crowded and there is a small sitting area inside but the majority will sit and relax right outside. 

I had the strawberry and vanilla crepe and with fresh strawberries!! So good!
author: Yao C.

description:
I love this place! How can you resist a dessert crepe?! I got the banana and ice cream crepe and added strawberries. :) It was delicious and extremely messy.. but worth it! 

On the weekends, the lines can get pretty long so be prepared to wait a while and make sure you have a spot to eat it.. Eating and standing is not the greatest idea. 

Also, this place is CASH ONLY. Bring cash! Or there's also an ATM located inside.
author: Meliza M.

description: DELISH!!!! sooo many options to choose from and service is super fast which is def a plus! love it
author: Jodie X.

description:
Every time I'm in town, this is my go to place for crepes. Their crepes are delicately crispy yet chewy and of course delicious. For 3 stars I took into account, the service which could be worked on. I get it was busy but the faces and tired attitudes from them was not very welcoming. I was greeted with no smile just a question, "Can I help you?" Ok fine, so I ordered my usual strawberries with ice cream, and Nutella, and before I could tell what flavor ice cream she tells me my total. Excuse me? Can I tell you I wanted what kind of ice cream before you move me along? Seeing there was a long wait I didn't want to hold up the line, I just wanted my crepe.
After 10 minutes of watching crepes and numbers being barked out and handed out with no smile, I thought how much I wish I had Yelped another crepe place. 
Anyway, my order didn't disappoint me. Yummy to the last bite. I just learned I won't come back and I'll just have to find another place.
author: Stacey K.

description:
I've always passed by this location, but I only actually tried the crepes here just recently and now I know I've really been missing out!

The Japanese Special crepe with red bean paste, green tea ice cream, and matcha sauce is oh so good. For a small bump in price, you can add in whip cream, but it's already so good the way it is. :)

If you're not into these flavors in your dessert, they always have your more traditional dessert crepes with strawberries, bananas, etc. Also, if I'm not mistaken, they also have savory crepes which would be interesting to try out.
author: Joshua M.

description:
First of all, this store was rather filthy; the tables weren't adequately wiped and the trash bins were brimming and overflowing with rubbish.

I ordered the Japanese crepe, with green gelato and red bean. I was very satisfied with the green tea gelato and its combination with the red bean, and I was also satisfied with the amount of filling in the crepe.

The crepe itself was very crunchy and thin; I did quite like the crunchy aspect of it, which complemented the creamy gelato and the red bean,  but it didn't strike me as a crepe.  It tasted like the crunchy bits of a waffle. The fact that it was served in a cone, almost like a burrito, may have contributed to this opinion of mine, however.  

The staff also gave off a bad vibe, which kind of explained the filthiness of the place.  Overall, I had a very mediocre experience at best.
author: Karen K.

description:
Excellent strawberry Nutella crêpe-
Worth going out of the way to get it.
Nice crispy light texture.
author: LBear B.

description: Cash only, and usually with a long line, but they make the crepes pretty quickly. I thought the crepes tasted pretty good, the fruits they use are fresh and you can add ice cream or nutella to it. A downside is how messy it can get - the paper wrapping they put the crepe in makes it a difficult to eat while walking around or even sitting down without napkins to cover for any dripping ice cream or fruit. I ended up going to get some napkins and a spoon for a friend after her crepe fell apart. Later, when I went to get a few more napkins I noticed they moved the napkins and spoons behind the counter, away from customers. I don't really have an issue with how friendly the staff has to be, but I thought that moving the napkins and spoons away was not very helpful.
author: Wayne H.

description:
I know when people think of crepes they usually think of the French version that you eat with a knife and fork... Well not these babies. This tasty lil buggers are crunchy and sweet (or savory). 
I usually just get banana, Nutella and whipped cream although you can get pretty much what you want because there are so many fixings (ice cream, fruits, sauces, Sammish fixings, etc). 

I see a lot of people come up to the counter where they hand out the crepes but you actually have to order inside (there is a sign hanging from the ceiling), otherwise you'll be sanding around for a while. 
This place is cash only! So make sure you have some change or hit up the arm they have there.
author: Em C.

description:
Ordered: the Japanese (#17), the Japanese w/ lychee instead, vanilla ice cream-strawberries-banana-nutella
What to get: the Japanese if you really love green tea

Just before writing this review, I read Minty R.'s down below. My girlfriend also noticed that he was angry and grabbed money out of her hand (we stopped by around 8:45PM 11/16/2014). Not really sure what was going on. The day before he seemed fine. Yup, second day in a row that we were here.

We only got dessert crepes. You should definitely get ice cream here. I never really had a crepe with ice cream before so this was quite the revelation. The crepes they make are more so on the flaky side and maybe 1 mm thicker than Paris's. This complements the ice cream really well, since it acts like a delicate ice cream cone. This is why I would get it with ice cream. Otherwise, a thinner and softer Parisian style dessert crepe would make more sense if you go w/o ice cream.

Worth coming the next day!
author: James N.

description:
Came on a Wed and waited for a while....and this Lady cut in front of us but the cashier did not even say anything eventho we told her she cut...wow great service isn't it. 
Ordered a strawberry Nutella with vanilla ice cream and it was almost 8 dollars. I can see why this place is popular, instead of the super soft crepe, it was crispy and soft. 
Strawberry were surprisingly sweet! Other than these two, I did not find their crepe to be that special. 
It does taste better than other crepe place but not by that much and it is not cheap.
author: Amy C.

description:
My #1 favorite crepe place so far! 

Whenever I'm in Japan town, I always stop by for a crepe at Sophie's and I'm never disappointed. The crepe is always the perfect texture of slight crunchy but soft and holds the ice cream really well. I'm a plane Jane and I always get vanilla ice cream with my crepes, but their ice cream is particularly good in general. Nutella, strawberries, whip cream and a scoop of vanilla is probably my favorite combo for a crepe. My mouth is drooling just thinking about it!
author: Tiffany H.

description: Located inside the mall in Japantown. The place has decent crepes, crispy, good combinations. Good amount of seating and also nice to just carry it to eat while walking around. I prefer Belly Good Crepes because I actually don't like the crepes crispy and they have more/better combos. Both places are quite popular though, so you can't go wrong.
author: Alice S.

description:
OMG! Their wasabi crepe ice cream, I think its called the Japanse Crepe... It just melts in your mouth with deliciousness.. Seriously, no joke. I would grab another one. Only one thing though, is I wish they can validate parking and offer choices on what to pay instead of cash... Using debit/credit would be nice.

Its nice they have an ATM MAchine for convenience, but holy crap, the convenience for it to withdraw money is ummmmz... Too much!
author: Joey B.

description: CASH ONLY! I ordered #17 which is what the cashier recommended since we were new to this place! It had red bean paste, green tea gelato, and matcha sauce drizzled over it. Cost is slightly pricey: $7 with tax. The line was super short so I got lucky and only had to wait for 5 minutes total to pay and get my crepe. It was perfectly crispy and wasn't too sweet so it satisfied my crepe cravings! Everything was fine until I was 3/4 finished with the crepe and it decided to drip melted green gelato all over my favorite jeans. Tragic, I know. It turns out that the bottom of the wrap that the crepe was in wasn't completely sealed off :( so I recommend eating it quickly
author: Isabelle N.

description:
Some time ago, I walked into Sophie's Crepes and checked out the menu but when I saw that it was ca$h only with no cash in hand, I left. It guess it was meant to be for me to finally try Sophie's Crepes as I was in the area, had cash, and wanted some dessert. 

I ordered a crepe with strawberries, vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. It was pretty exciting to watch my crepe being made right in front of the shop but what got me more excited was when I saw them piping the whipped cream out of a bag into my crepe. I'm a sucker for whipped cream and while I was expecting them to use some instant whipped cream in a can (which I'm normally fine with), Sophie's version was extra creamy and fluffy. But back to the crepe, it was crunchy and just delicious with the toppings. However, 3/4 of the way into my crepe, I was a bit disappointed because it was just lots of folded, dry, sad crepe at the bottom. None of the ice cream or whipped cream was spread down there so instead of a sweet dessert ending, it was a dry desert one. The staff was very sweet though.
author: Maya S.

description:
I've gotten crepes here a few times now. I'm not a fan of crepes without ice cream in it sooo I usually get #17, the crepe with green tea gelato, red bean paste, and matcha sauce :3 There is usually quite a line here but last time I came here a few minutes before it closed so there weren't as many people :) We got our crepe within 5 minutes :D The crepes here are pretty good, the crepe part is the perfect texture with some crispiness to it. The green tea and red bean go well together as always! 

We also tried the black sesame and red bean gelato. I loved both of them but the black sesame was my favorite flavor! It had a strong sesame flavor and it wasn't too sweet. I would definitely come here just to eat the black sesame gelato again :)
author: Sandra N.

description: This place has delicious crepes!! I love how the crepe is super crispy.  There was a nice crunch with every bite.  We ordered a nutella crepe with strawberry nutella inside.  I really enjoyed it!!  This place is a must for all crepe lovers.
author: Rita V.

description:
My favorite place to go for crepes and it has never disappointed. My favorite has always been the E option: strawberry, chocolate, whipped cream with vanilla ice cream. A classic crepe that is always made to perfection with the right amount of strawberry and chocolate syrup. 

It's always pleasant to watch the guy as he makes the crepe as he does it so effortlessly. The crepe is made super thin but still crispy and durable to hold everything and not fall apart. I have tried other crepe places in SF but Sophie is hands down the best in the city. A must try :)
author: Wendy Z.

description: It is located in Japantown within the Japan Center Mall. There was a small crowd, but it didn't take too long for me to get my crepe. I went with the Japanese (green tea gelato, red bean paste, matcha sauce) because I love green tea/matcha. The crepe was thin, light and crispy. I liked it, but thought it was overpriced. The other downside is that it is cash only.
author: Helen H.

description:
Hands down, best crepe in SF. I'm not a Crepe connoisseur, but I love this place. Not many places make the actual crepe as flaky as Sophie's does.  

A few things to remember when you come here 1. They take cash only so bring cash or be prepared to take some out of the ATM machine located in the store. 2. There usually is some kind of line, so be prepared to wait.

I usually get the Strawberry and Nutella with a scoop of Green Tea Gelato. The combination of the 3 just satisfies my taste buds in every way. 

They have a sister store located in the SoMa which is good too, but I feel that Sophie's is still superior. Maybe because it's the original store and the employees here know what they are doing. 

Located in Japantown, so you will either have to park in the parking lot or find street parking. Either way, worth a visit if you are in the area and want a snack/dessert.
author: Milton F.

description: The gelato they have is good, and crepe is crispy, soft and sweet. No complains here. I do feel for the price it can add more fillings, and there's just plain chairs in the tiny shop, not a date spot or somewhere to chat.
author: Julia Z.

description: So expensive now!! They raised their prices so dessert is almost $9!! Crazy! This may be the last time I come here.
author: Toni E.

description: Best crepes I've had in a while. Worth the wait. Bold flavors. I had the black sesame ice cream with strawberries and nutella. Definitely recommend!
author: Janet S.

description:
I think I own this place a review lol since I come here pretty often. The flaggreen style crepe ice cream is my favorite (red bean flavor, green tea ice cream plus tons of sugar lol).  
Tips: remember to bring cash(no Credit card is not accepted).  
The store also has lots of odd combinations (ham plus cheese? Lol) give a try :)
author: Alanda B.

description: My favorite crepe in SF. The crepe is crunchy and tasty, plus the price is better than other places. Mix fruits with vanilla ice cream and nutella is the only way to go!
author: Danh T.

description: I don't know, maybe my expectations were too high always seeing such long lines of hungry crepe-eaters.  I thought it was just ok.  I even thought the crepe part itself was just ok.  I don't have much of a sweet tooth so I got a savory one - maybe that is where the difference is and their sweeter ones are so much better.  Oh well.
author: Maile N.

description:
Stawberry and nutella with Strawberry Ice cream! Yum!!


-It is definitely something need to try when in Little Tokyo.
-You have the control for your flavor.
-$8.something for A scoop of ice cream, nutella, and 2pcs of strawberry.


CONS
-People don't know how to clean their table. And staff wont clean it.
-no picture or video.
-staff doesnt look very welcoming.
-not good for people who have no idea of what to match 
with other flavors.
author: Dan Asher D.

description: Delicious, CUTE AF designed crepes! Cash only. Very tasty.
author: Y W.

description:
I've been here twice, the first time I wasn't that blown away with it, however my second visit changed my mind! For my first time, I was pretty full from dinner so I just got a crepe with a scoop of ice cream. It was kinda disappointing how dinky the thing looked. It had like just one tiny scoop of ice cream so I was kinda just eating crepe with a bit of ice cream. I wasn't very impressed with it.

The second time, I wasn't quite full from dinner and I sampled both the sesame ice cream and the mocha chip. Both were delicious! But the sesame was too good to pass up. If you've had sesame flavored tang yuan (the little mochi dessert balls in a sugary type soup dessert), it tastes just like the sesame from it! So delicious! I got it with some strawberries which didn't really go with the ice cream too much, but it was still quite tasty. The crepe itself was on the softer side. 

If you're in Japantown, this place is definitely worth checking out! Make sure you get some samples of the sesame and green tea ice creams!
author: Angel K.

description: Always need a Sophie's crepe when we are in Japan town. I'm such a pig because we get one, walk around, then I need another one. My favorite is always the basic Nutella with strawberry and vanilla ice cream. I've tried other combinations but that's just what I need to be happy with my crepe fix. Maybe I'll have a banana Nutella one next time.
author: Natalie L.

description: The crepes are never a disappointment to me ever, the Gelato is always great. I actually don't mind the pricing if the crepes are worth it to me. But the Cashier she's a little heavy and has green hair with glasses ruined it for me various times wether it's her personal attitude to me or other customers it makes me irritated when her attitude is truly rude towards customers. One customer ask about the crepes and she Rudely told him to look at the menu himself I get it must be hard to answer questions all day but dam it's your job and even then apologize if you have offended someone instead of allowing them to walk out with a though of never coming back due to the lack of respect and the way she preform her attitude toward the guest.
author: Edgar T.

description:
233. This place is often crowded so I end up skipping dessert here.  Surprisingly, there wasn't a long line this past Saturday afternoon.  I got a sweet crepe with Nutella and mixed fruit.  The mixed fruit consisted of strawberries, kiwis, and bananas, and they were all pretty fresh.  The Nutella was pure delicious goodness as usual (: The crepe was thin and crispy.  I liked how it didn't quickly turn soggy with the added ingredients.

__________
My 2¢:
- Cash only!  Thank God for friends and mobile payment apps.
author: Katherine C.

description:
I love crepes and ice cream so I was really excited to try this place out. I got a nutella crepe with strawberries, green tea ice cream and whipped cream. It was soooo good. I came with my family and everyone else agreed. We all ordered another crepe since 1 wasn't enough. We also ended up coming back the next day because of these crepes.

I've been here a couple of times and always ordered the same thing. It never fails to disappoint me! Can't wait for my next trip here. (=
author: Vivian P.

description: The Ham & Cheese savory crêpe is very very delicious. I love the fusion of both the sweetness from the crêpe and the saltiness/savoriness from the ham/cheese/mayo. You can also never go wrong with the Banana & Strawberry with Nutella. Plus, watching the people delicately make the crêpes in the front of the window helps with waiting in line. (:
author: Jacqueline K.

description:
We love crepes so Sophie's Crêpes in Japantown was a must try on our visit. Unfortunately, it seemed like it was a "must try" for every other Japantown visitor as well! The lines and the crowds were pretty intense when we arrived around 6 PM on Saturday. So we decided to get dinner first and come back afterwards for dessert, at which time the lines were... way worse!  They told us the wait would be about 15 minutes, but at the time they were servicing numbers in the 30s and our number was 66, which should've told us something about their estimation accuracy. In fact, it was 30+ minutes before we got our crepe.  

We split a Japanese green tea gelato crepe with added whip cream. Although this is not your traditional type of crepe, we were in Japantown, so why not try a local specialty we thought. The crepe itself is shaped like an ice cream cone held in place by a paper cone on the outside. Odd, but it works. We both enjoyed the crepe, although this was my first ice cream crepe, and it's probably an acquired taste. The whipped cream however just didn't mix with the ice cream flavor, and next time I'll just save the added dollar. The crepe itself also was a little different, sweet enough to even eat plain, not as soft as some crepes I've had, a little on the firmer side, with a texture.  Again, different but good.

Still, although the crepe was tasty, I have to subtract a star for  the hassle of getting it. If you come at a busy time, you will be forced to carve out a half hour or more for the wait.
author: David F.

description:
Good crepes, but not the best. 

I came here after dinner on a Friday night and it was fairly empty. There isn't much seating space inside as the place is pretty small. Sophie's is definitely more of a grab your crepe and go style spot.

I ordered the strawberry and chocolate crepe with icecream and whipped cream. The crepe layers were thin and soft, with crunchy parts too. The inside had a nice combination of the strawberries, whipped cream, and icecream. However, they definitely could have added more chocolate on my crepe towards the bottom. 

What I really didn't like though was the price. My crepe came out to be a bit over $7, which is too overpriced in my opinion. This is was a major downside for me, and although I enjoyed the crepe, it was not good enough for me to pay $7. I've had better crepes at cheaper prices.
author: Pavi B.

description:
I don't think I could love another crepe place as much as I love Sophie's. To be honest, I don't know what it is exactly, but it's an intense bias for Sophie's crepes over any other crepe. Anyways, the place is CASH ONLY and they also don't allow photos inside or right at the window where they're making crepes. Sometimes there is a long line, but it moves relatively quick. You order at the cashier, they give you a number, and you can just wait for it in the store or outside of it near the window until they call your number. Don't lose your ticket because they'll need to see it!

I've been several times now and I haven't been disappointed since. Normally, I tend to share almost all my food because I just don't eat a lot, but for Sophie's, there's no such thing as sharing. 

I always order a strawberry and banana crepe with Nutella and green tea ice cream. Every time, it has been filled with toppings, fresh fruit, and a nice crispy crepe with just enough Nutella. (Just thinking about it makes me want more...)

Did I mention how much I love this place?
author: Alex L.

description:
My rating is 3.5 but I'll round it up. 

I got a very berry Sunday and my sister got a "make it your own." I think it's pretty expensive but that's SF for you.

The very berry Sunday consists of strawberry gelato, whip cream, strawberries, and raspberry sauce. It was about $6-7 tots including tax. The raspberry sauce was extremely sour and sat at the bottom of the cup. The strawberries were sweet though which is a plus. 

The crepe came out to be $7-8. There was strawberries, ice cream, and Nutella. Just adding Nutella was $2 which, in my opinion, is pretty expensive. It was delicious though so that's good. 

Super busy in the shop. There's another crepe shop in the same building so I'll be trying that place next time.
author: Julie N.

description: Love this place!!!! Saw this while walking through the mall and Japanese town and I just had to try it out! I got the mix fruit, which was banana, strawberry, and kiwi with whip cream. I added green tea ice cream with it as well. Mmmmm delicious! I would go back and try more flavor.
author: Choua K.

description:
ive had this bookmarked for sosososososo long and i finally got to try it over summer! Thankfully parking wasnt too bad so we didnt spend too much time driving around the streets. But we spent quite a lot of time looking for the place.... and figured out it was upstairs about 20 minutes of walking around the japantown mall (which wasnt bad because we ended up looking into all the shops and stuff)

We found the place upstairs and the line for ordering the crepes werent too long. the wait for GETTING one was pretty long. It was cool though because you can watch them make it from outside the store window. I shared a mixed fruit crepe with mango sorbet. It was pretty good, but i dont think the mango sherbert really mixed in well with the other fruit and crepe texture. and they didnt really give us that much ice cream either... and i loveeeeeee ice cream hahahaah

yuummm! definitely getting sophies crepes again while in the area and getting vanilla ice cream with my crepe
author: Vivian H.

description: Pretty spot on to actual Japanese crepes! Really good flavor but minus one star because the crepes were a little hard due to overcooking them. If it was nice and soft, would be five stars for sure !!
author: Chelsea M.

description:
Little crepe store located in Japantown, west of the peace plaza. 

We had ordered the strawberry, banana, nutella, crepe. It was around $6. The crepe itself was crispy and chewy. The fruits were pretty fresh. They put more bananas in there than strawberries, but there was a good amount of fruit in there and there was perfect amount of nutella. It was a really good crepe. 

The crepe came out very fast, as soon as I ordered it, it took less than five minutes for it to come out. Keep in mind though there was was only a handful of people there on a early friday afternoon. 

Theres about 4-6 little tables in there, but theres quite a few square bench seat thingys located outside the crepery. 

Oh, they have interesting photos on the wall...
author: Allen C.

description: If you're here but don't feel like getting a crepe, consider a Japantown sundae. Ice cream and gelato stores are everywhere and they offer sundaes of all types, but the aforementioned one offered here is more like a dessert that you get in a sit-down Asian dessert cafe. Matcha ice cream, matcha drizzle, and azuki bean are combined into a nice little sundae cup with whipped cream on top. It's a bit decadent but it's worth pointing out just because this creation doesn't really exist elsewhere in this exact form. It's quite tasty, maybe bordering a bit on overly sweet (I would go without whipped cream if I remember).
author: Tony D.

description:
What an experience! 

After a delicious dinner, I was craving something sweet, but not the typical restaurant dessert. I searched my trusted Yelp account and found Sophie's Crepes. 

Sophie's was closing at 10 pm and by 9:55 pm, I ran up the Japantown Center steps and burst through the still open doors. 

I ordered a nutella strawberry crepe and was very, very impressed with the freshness and tastiness of the crepe. 

Highly recommend!
author: Irina R.

description:
CASH ONLY 

The best crepe I had , it was very crispy , moist and light . The ingredients that they use are also very fresh . The employees were very quick at making the crepes to putting fillings in the crepe. I got number 17 the "Japanese" which has matcha gelato , red bean , matcha sauce $5.25 can u say that's a deal for crepe. I wouldn't be able to find a crepe like this in New York City . Few days I came back to get their strawberry,  Nutella $5 & then I added a vanilla gelato for $1 it ended up to be $6.51 tax included. I think this is a amazing price to have such fresh & good crepe . The gelato is good too ! Does not have a gooey texture . DELICIOUS
author: Sandy L.

description:
I have been coming here sporadically for what seems like a dozen years and the quality has been consistent as well as the demand for their treats as evidenced by their constant lines. I seem to always order some combination of fruit and add optional ice cream(green tea or vanilla).
The crepe menu is very straightforward and the process from ordering to paying to retrieving your hand rolled goodness is fairly quick. The crepe is fairly thin and sweet but not overpowering(and yes I have a major sweet tooth so this saying something). On this particular night, I had the mixed fruits(strawberries,banana, and kiwi with added vanilla ice cream). The whole combination works well and provides a light and not overly decadent snack.
author: Dennis W.

description:
So I may be a little biased because I love lychee and the ONLY place that has the BEST lychee ice cream/gelato is Japantown. So you could guess what's always in my crepes! Lychee gelato!

Sophie's Crepes is amazing. It is, by far, my favorite crepe place of all times. Yes, I've tried the other stand at Japantown and I've tried Genki before. When it comes to the quality of the crepe itself, I gotta love Sophie's and Genki's because it's nice and crispy. The other stand in Japantown, however, the crepe is still floppy and soft. But as for the INGREDIENTS, hands down Sophie -- yes, JUST because of the lychee gelato. 

The ONLY crepe combination I get is the one with strawberries and nutella with a scoop of lychee gelato. AMAZING. I encourage everyone to give it a try. I don't particularly suggest people to get a crepe without the ice cream in it because if there isn't ice cream, it's just filled with whipped cream and/or nutella and it's usually not as satisfying. 

As many others have said. CASH ONLY. Which sucks.

Also, there is usually a huge line and I don't particularly like the way the store is set. Too many people and too little space. They should just get rid of their tables/chairs. It's kind of hard to squeeze between people looking at the menu and people sitting down on chairs. 

If you're visiting or if you've never tried this place then you gotta try this place. It is awesome.
author: Doriee D.

description:
The crepes are ok. The annoying this is this place has many rules, such as no taking pics or videos, no changing your order, etc. And the cashier is not friendly thinking they are the only game in town. When you go out to have a good time you don't want to me made to conform the their rigid processes.

The other crepe store in the mall offer similar crepes at lower price point and without the attitude.
author: Baron F.

description: I love... sophies crepe! this crepe place is one of the best places i have ever been too... I ordered the matcha crepe w/ red bean and it was delicious, the crepe are always made to order! The crepe consist of matcha red bean, green tea gelato, and matcha sauce! it is perfectly made not burnt or too hard! this place is a good place if youre looking for a good dessert place, you can always choose other fruits if you dont want to go with green tea. there are many options for the gelato one of my favorite is the sesame gelato ! bomb, must try but bring CASH! and it does get really hot in that store due to all the fresh crepes being made!
author: Johnny L.

description:
I am in love with crepes but only a few places does that extra special thing that makes it awesome. You can't really put your finger on it but it's that taste that you get when you get your first bite into a crepe at this place.

Located in Japantown! After eating lunch or dinner, I stop by to get one of their sweet crepes. My favorite is the Kiwi Ice Cream crepe because they flavors blend so well together.

They also have a lot of other flavors too. It's a good place to stop by if you are near the area. Well, if you are in Japantown, you are going to be in the area since the crepe place is located in one of the main shopping centers. You can come here for a snack or desserts. Pretty good place to hang out with friends or go on a date or just to grab a quick bite to eat. Sometimes, there's a line because there's only two people making the crepes.
author: Kay T.

description:
Sophie's Crepes is located on the 2nd floor of Kintetsu Mall in San Francisco's Japantown.  This is a popular crepe/dessert shop where the workers make the crepes fresh and on display for all to see.  It's neat because you get to see the batter poured onto the griddle and then smoothly skimmed flat.  While photos and video recording is forbidden, I did find a very good video of Sophie's crepe-making process on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UM-qPLN09Vk.  It's interesting to watch.

Sophie's offers both savory and sweet crepes.  Most customers tend to go for the sweet crepes.  The shop also serves gelato and sundaes.  Most of the savory crepes run about $5 each and include ingredients such as cheese, ham, turkey, egg, avocado, lettuce, tomato, and mayo.  Most of the sweet crepes run about $4-5 each and include ingredients such as chocolate, Nutella, fruit, and gelato.  Yes, you can gelato in your crepes (win).  Examples of other toppings include whipped cream, butter, sugar, cinnamon, brown sugar, honey, and fruit jam.  There are about a dozen savory options and almost 20 sweet options.

I recommend the #8 Strawberry and Nutella crepe with your choice of gelato.  Watch them make it for you on the spot.  If you don't know what Nutella is, it's a chocolate hazelnut spread.  The fruit is ripe and the gelato is dense, smooth, and flavorful.  The crepes are big (see photo: http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=YzWGtloh9gruoRvOjVo1lg&userid=j14WgRoU_-2ZE1aw1dXrJg) and are an ideal flavor combination of sweet and tart.  The outer, pancake-like batter is warm, light, crispy, and soft.  It's delicious and appetizing.

Since Sophie's Crepes is at Japantown, it's a nice place to stop for an on-the-go snack or for dessert after dining at one of the many Japanese restaurants nearby.  The shop isn't very big with limited seating inside.  Fortunately, there's seating outside in the common area.  Plus, the crepes are neatly packaged in a paper cone, making them easily portable.  Service is efficient and the servers are nice.  Unfortunately, no free Wi-Fi.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Food:  We got the nutella and banana crepes.  I thought it was good but felt they didn't put enough nutella.

Food rating:  3.5/5

Price:  I think it was $6 plus CASH ONLY 

Overall:  I thought it was a good desert after eating Japanese food.  I would defintely would have added more toppings or at least gimme so mo' nutella!
author: Elvin W.

description:
My parents used to take me and my brothers to Japantown ALL the time when we were kids, and we would spend hours walking around the Kinokuniya Bookstore. We always asked for crepes from that little shop nearby (and back then I didn't even know what a crepe was) but they would never spoil us. Now that I'm much older, I can get my own crepes!! 

Finally I was able to try those mythical crepes of my childhood, and they were everything I ever dreamed of. I mean they're just crepes, but they're freaking amazing. Even when there is a long line, ordering is super quick (cash only) then you sit around and wait to be called. I got the Mixed Fruits WITH ICE CREAM and my friend got Mandarin Oranges WITH ICE CREAM. Yes you must have your crepes with ice cream. It's so good, especially on one of those rare hot days. It can be messy, but it's so much better than an ice cream cone.

If you are coming to Japantown, stop by Stophie's Crepes before touring the rest of the district. Enjoy your sweet treat!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Mandatory dessert stop on any SF Japantown trip! I will even go out of my way to come here sometimes when I'm in SF, just because I'm THAT in love with this crepe place. 

...Okay, I'm mostly just in love with one specific crepe that they have here, which is their Japanese crepe. It's an overload of matcha ice cream and matcha sauce, perfectly complimented by a generous scoop of red bean paste. While the combination of ingredients themselves isn't particularly unique, their ice cream is some of the best I've ever had. Furthermore, their crepe is nicely crispy without being too stiff or falling apart super easily with each bite. I'm normally a fan of soft crepes, but this is the one place I go to specifically for their crispy crepe. 

YOU MUST COME HERE. Just don't be surprised if there's a crazy line (which is just a testament to the quality of their crepes, especially considering there's another crepe place just a 30 second walk away!)
author: Ying X.

description:
Heard of this crepe place from friends before and decided to get dessert from here after eating sushi rolls for lunch. (Because ya kno, ya gotta even out that saltiness with the sweetness, ya feel?) 
Anyway, I could not decide what to order. Kinda sad there are only three types of fruits to choose from and they're personally my most hated fruits in the fruits category - bananas, strawberries, and kiwis. I chose mixed fruit despite this because I thought that since everything else is an unhealthy choice with all the Nutella and butter and whatnot, it would be ok. 
The wait wasn't long, which I liked. Maybe because I came here on a school day. Usually, I believe there is a long line that extends out the crepe place's door. So I got lucky with my timing, I guess.
Anyway, I got my crepe and it was pretty cute and simple. Well put together and cute for pictures I can post on my snapchat story or whatever. BUT it was so ssoooooo much whipped cream. I suggest you tell them ahead of time to lessen the whipped cream because boy, I was drowning tea bad in whipped cream. Like all I ate was whipped cream yo, I was not happy. Only ended up eating halfway and throwing it away because I started feeling sick. Not a good choice for me but maybe for someone who is a sweet tooth it'll be a perfect dessert for them. Now I think this was a reality heck to get myself checked at the doctors if I'm prediabetic or not.
Nonetheless, very cute place, cute crepes, also nice workers. :-)
author: Dyvinie A.

description: I love this place! Tried their #17 with greentea icecream, matcha sauce & red bean paste. It's a perfect combination! The price is also cheaper than the other crepe shop on the other side of Japantown. It'll be less messy if you get rid of the spoon & eat the whole thing like how you eat a subway sandwich! :)
author: Thao N.

description: Get the Japanese crepe! You might as well get something Japanese flavored in Japantown, afterall. Also, they have amazing black sesame ice cream! It's so creamy and flavorful. I regret not getting a scoop in addition to my crepe...
author: Janet H.

description:
I've heard so many great things about Sophie's Crepes but was disappointed by my anticipation for it. I think/hope it may just be an off day for Sophie's, my friend who's been here before also said she didn't think the crepe was as good today. 

I got a black sesame gelato + banana crepe per the recommendation of the cashier. The gelato itself was pretty darn good, not sure if the banana slices were necessary. The crepe was pretty thin and mine was slightly overdone. As I was eating it, bits of crepe kept flaking off, making it difficult to eat. 

For now, I think I prefer Genki Crepes because it's not as expensive as Sophie's and is a little bit thicker. If I ever come back to Japantown, I want to give Sophie's another try though.
author: Stacey L.

description:
BLACK SESAME GELATO! BLACK SESAME GELATO! BLACK SESAME GELATO! 

Get it, I swear you won't regret it. 

I haven't really tried anything else from here, but everything looks delicious! I haven't had the chance to try anything else, because I ALWAYS get the black sesame gelato, and the pistachio one as well! The black sesame tastes really similar to peanut butter, which is weird because I dislike the taste of peanut butter. But it's still ridiculously good! Also the pistachio gelato is cool, because they actually put pistachio bits inside! 

Weylie (my favorite youtuber) also loves this place, which is why I came here in the first place! It was love at first lick.
author: Amanda P.

description: Amazing place. Pretty small and super busy but the crepes are great. Been there multiple times and you wait about 10 mins but it looks like the crew works hard and has fun doing it. One con is that whipped cream is like a dollar extra
author: Bev S.

description:
Am I being cheap or is $2 for a drizzle of Nutella kind of obnoxious? I understand SF as a whole has just gotten ridiculously expensive but i can't justify a spread..er..'light drizzle' for $2. 

(Strawberry vanilla ice cream with Nutella) The crepe  was good. It was crisp just how I like them but is have to say Genki is still my #1 choice when it comes to crepes. 

I want to come back to try the other flavors and I'll be sure to not have any add ins next time!
author: Samantha S.

description:
I love, love, love  their crepes ever since crepe stores started to pop up in San Francisco!  

DO GET their "E" on the menu that consists of a freshly made crepe wrapped with a spread of nutella, ice cream, strawberry and whipped cream!  The perfect combo hands down!  Be prepared to get a bit messy from the the dripping of warm nutella and ice cream!

Picture of Crepe E - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sophies-crepes-san-francisco?select=CH1b6ekljZTSILnlZc_wlw

I call myself a loyal customer just because whenever I finish a meal in Japantown and feel like a dessert, I would go here! Also, whenever my family or friends want to grab desserts or crepes, I recommend this place!

It is a cash only place and they don't accept credit cards - how inconvenient!  

Adequate wait and dining area!  A lot of people linger outside or sit near the clear window display to see how the cooks make the crepe!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Came here because my brothers were craving crepes and the other crepe place was closed. We ordered a 2 mixed fruit crepes with ice cream and a banana with whip cream crepe. Three crepes came out to a total of $28. It took them 30 minutes to make the crepes which was kinda ridiculous. The fruits weren't that fresh and the crepes itself was meh.... soft and chewy i prefer my crepes crunchy. The only thing i liked about my crepe was the azuki bean gelato.
author: Tina H.

description: I quickly picked out the red bean and green tea ice cream.  It was a pretty large cup and I was surprised what a great combination with red bean paste and green tea.  My wife really liked the ice cream and glad that she enjoyed as much as I did.  The only downside is that this store like other ones in Japantown mall only takes cash unless you spend over a certain amount.  Oh well, I would buy another one in a heartbeat since this is the most authentic ice cream and red bean.
author: Phillip Y.

description:
Chill spot in J Town, good for the late night sweet tooth.  Crowded on a Saturday night, but lots of young chill folks to hang out with.

Excellent dessert crepe (mine had green tea ice cream in it).  yum
author: Jingo Django J.

description:
Sophie's Crepes is a must-visit destination for me whenever I come to SF Japantown.  I especially love their Japanese crepe, which has green tea gelato, matcha sauce, and red bean paste, but I've never gotten a crepe here that I didn't love.  The fruit is delicious and fresh and the crepe is cooked perfectly, so every bite is warm, soft, and filled with sweetness and heaven!

I'm docking one star, unfortunately, for the following reasons:
 - cash only
 - long wait (we waited about 45 minutes total from the time we ordered to when we got our crepes, though luckily the line to order moves relatively quickly)

If you come here during an off-hour or when it's not packed with people during a festival, you likely won't have to wait as long.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
Before you eat one of these crepes, it's important to understand what a "Japanese crepe" is. It's fairly similar to a French crepe, but served more casually (in a triangular paper cone, for example) and is thinner and crispier on the edges. It's also slightly sweeter and slightly less buttery and "egg"-y. In some ways, it tastes a little bit like a high-quality Fortune cookie.

Now that you know what to expect, I can tell you that Sophie's serves up a very standard Japanese-style crepe. It is everything I described above, served with whatever sweet or savory filling you choose. There's often a pretty long line but it moves fast so you'll have a hot, delicious crepe in your hands in no time. It's cash only, but a lot of the crepes are under $5 so you don't need too much cash on hand!

Sophie's is a great place to grab a quick snack or a dessert after shopping or dining in Japantown. I'm impressed that this place somehow manages to be cheap, fast, and tasty!
author: Brittany C.

description:
The crepes are good for what you pay for. 

One of the employees wearing a black SF cap was very rude to my friend when he asked a simple question because he is new to this crepe place.  My friend asked how build his own crepe and the employee responded with a small laugh and said " dude it's common sense " to a customer.
author: Alec E.

description:
This is one of the best crepe places ever!  It's inside Japantown, so it can get pretty busy.  Be prepared for a long line and hard parking.  You could either park in the parking garage available for Japantown or try to find street parking.

I always come back for their Japanese Ice Cream Crepe, which is the crepe with green tea ice cream, matcha sauce, and red bean.  I always add strawberries too.  The crepe is the best especially since it is the best texture with the perfect crispiness and the perfect amount of sweetness.  They make your crepe to order.  I'm craving right now as I think about it.   I guess I will be returning earlier than I expected!
author: Teresa W.

description: I'm not much of a crepe person but the crepe i had here was amazing. The crepe is thin and there's a bit of a crunch on parts of it which i liked. Get the one with ice cream in it.
author: Jess S.

description:
Really well made crepes. Not losing to the ones I had in Japan. Fruits are fresh and gelato is flavorful. The crepe wrap is also perfect with crispy edge but warm and soft body. 
Cash only but they have an ATM right in the shop. My favorite is F (mixed fruit with gelato) on the special menu.
author: Kai-wing B.

description:
Not the best customer service, that's for damn sure. The teenage BOY that helped me was so bland. 

Look, I get it. You obviously had a bad day... Guess what? I did, too. It happens... But don't bring your attitude to work. Seriously.

The crepes are just like any other crepe spot. I got the green tea gelato filling, which tasted sweet and creamy, HOWEVER, the wait was horrendous. So be prepared and/or only go if you have some serious time to kill.

I hope you all have a better experience than I did!
author: Kim T.

description:
Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing or came on an off day, but I wasn't especially impressed. The crepe itself did have an excellent texture (so I'll probably give it another shot), but the ingredients didn't quite fit together. 

I ordered a Turkey & Cheese, which also comes with lettuce and tomato. I added avocado. The result looked a bit like a sandwich, which seemed fine at first, but the texture and flavors didn't balance. There was about one slice of deli turkey mixed with a huge leaf of lettuce (that took half the volume), cheese melted on one side and then some tomato and avocado bits here and there.

To be fair, the French people I've spoken with have lectured me not to have more than two ingredients in any crepe, but this was a menu item (and the avocado definitely didn't ruin it) where I expected some QA. 

Additionally, it's cash only, and they have several weird signs prohibiting photographs (why would people necessarily *want* to photograph a crepe place, and why would it be a big deal if they did?) and warning people not to change their order after they've paid. The cashier was prompt to take my order but spoke very quickly without enunciating. Overall, not very welcoming to me.
author: Krista L.

description: The fact that my son know the exact location of this amazing crepe place, no distraction will steer him away. He actually eats their crepes too!
author: Angelica G.

description: One of the only place that you could get crepes here in San Francisco. But the downside is video or photo taking is prohibited in the store.
author: Leo W.

description: Im comparing this to Genkis and I prefer Genkis because the actual skin part was crunchier. The one at Sophies is soggier and not the best. I did really like the strawberries because they were super sweet but the rest was pretty average. I got the strawberry, banana, vanilla ice cream, with red bean and I totally forgot to get nutella. That may have affected my review so I would go for the nutella for sure. I think this place is so yelpy because it is right inside Japantown mall so it gets a lot of foot traffic. No one here seems to get the savory but the savory was really good at Genkis. Cash only!
author: Amy H.

description: When visiting Japantown, must stop by Sophie's crepes inside the shopping center. My ultimate favorite is the Japanese special which comes with green tea ice cream and red bean with maccha sauce. You can add fruits if needed but with an extra charge. I'm usually not a big fan of green tea ice cream but this is worth a second try. After one order, you will be begging for more.
author: Hillary T.

description: I've been here twice in the last couple of weeks. The first time I got a crepe with green tea gelato. The second time I got the #17 Japanese Crepe (green tea gelato, red bean paste, and maccha sauce). Both times the crepes were delicious and it was cool to see them make them in front of you. This place is CASH ONLY. They have an atm there in case you forget, but it's a $2.50 charge to withdraw cash. Overall, great experience.
author: Ryan F.

description: Bring cash and be ready to wait.I like the taste but Avocado sold out that day so its a little dry.
author: YT L.

description:
Been here a few times and I've enjoyed my crepe everytime. Crepes are one of my favorite desserts and it's pretty good here. The store is a little small but there are areas outside where you can sit down. They're also cash only, so that's a bummer. The wait for your crepe can also be a bit long at times on busy nights. I ended up waiting 25 mins for my crepe. I noticed there was one employee making the crepes, another employee putting the crepes together, and another employee scooping ice cream. In my opinion, it would be a lot more efficient if there wasn't just a person putting the crepe together and if they had two employees putting the crepes together. It would be a lot faster than having one order come per time. 

I've only tried the crepe with strawberries, whipped cream, nutella, and ice cream. I've also tried their gelato and it's pretty good.
author: Trang T.

description: Yum!!! I love their crepes! Especially crepe with banana, strawberry, nutella, and of course ice cream! Everytime I go to japantown, I have to grab a crepe. There aren't too many crepe places I know of that add ice cream to their crepes so this place is a must! The only thing I would change is that I think they cook the crepe for a little bit too long for my taste especially since I'm used to a lighter and softer crepe. I'll let them know next time though!
author: Julienne R.

description:
We were lucky enough to go when there was no line, in fact there was no one in there at all. No wait = YAY! I was sad to find out that they were out of green tea ice cream but quickly chose black sesame as a substitute. The crepe was made in less than 5 minutes and was delicious! The black sesame ice cream was the nuttiest tasting I've ever had but I really enjoyed it. We shared the crepe between 3 people so it is pretty big in size. None of us have that big of a sweet tooth but I think it was not overly sweet and all of the flavors complimented each other so well. The crepe itself was very good too. YUM!

HOT TIP: Cash only but they have an ATM machine in the store lol
author: Julie K.

description: To be honest, alot of crepe places taste the same to me. I would only come here if I have friends from out of town and wanted to come to Japantown to chill. Other than that I don't think I would come here that much. It's a small place upstairs in the Kinokuniya building. Tons of people waiting in line. The pricing is average just like all other places. It's in a convenient location if you're in Japantown with street parkings and garages but it's usually hard finding close parking spaces around here.
author: Monica W.

description:
I really liked this yummy crepe shop! I got the Japanese crepe which was AMAZING! It had matcha sauce and matcha ice cream with red bean paste which I loved!! All the crepes are fresh and made on the spot. I came at a time when it wasn't as crowded and the service was nice and quick. I recommend going here. 
The only drawback was the melting ice cream coming from the tip! (hence the 4 star rating) it was dripping out from the end so my suggestion to you if you go is to be sure to eat it fast! It could turn messy very quickly.
author: Jenny G.

description:
YUMMMMYYY! What a beautiful combination! This is a MUST-GO whenever you're in the city! It's located inside of Japantown center on the second floor. 

It is made FRESH! You can view crepes being made in the front because of the clear window! 

The crepes are perfectly crispy which goes very nicely with the ice cream and whip cream! I never ordered the food menu, only dessert crepes. I like really simple crepes so whip cream, vanilla gelato, and strawberries! So perfect! 

It's a dollar extra to add Nutella though.. Pricey$$
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I don't think you can find better crepes elsewhere! The crepe itself is cooked perfectly--it's warm, crispy, soft and light! Combine that with fruits of your choice, whipped cream or nutella and top it off with ice cream?! How can you go wrong?! Not to mention the fruits are always super fresh. 

The person that makes the crepe works in the window and is obviously a pro. As I watched her at work, I couldn't help but be amazed by her efficiency. 

Things to note:
- This place may get really busy. I paid for 30 min street parking and still couldn't get back to my car in time before the meter ran out. 
- Cash only
- They serve savory and sweet crepes. I haven't tried the savory yet though. 
- Though there's many options on their wall menu, note that there is a small menu with their specials (which is cheaper) on their counter beside the register.
author: Cindy N.

description:
Amazingly good crepes, OK service, but a little on the expensive side to rate a full five stars.

I had the strawberry with chocolate and ice cream.  My daughter had kiwi.  They were both VERY enjoyable.  Probably good that the were pricey, or I would have went back for seconds :-)
author: Matt B.

description:
A staple of Japantown. I usually come for dessert and get the Banana and Nutella Crepe but this time I got adventurous and got the Japanese (Green tea ice cream and red bean). It was pretty good and I would probably get it again. 

Crepes here are made fresh (you can literally see them make it). I am always amused when they make it. I wish I had those skills! I never had tried they savory crepes, but I can imagine they are good as well.
author: Juan F.

description:
I think I just like crepes in a very specific way and Sophie's is good, but it's not the best IMO.

Having just come back from Japan, I feel like I am even more able to explain why I don't like Sophie's as much. 

I think a true Japanese crepe (and maybe this is not what it's meant to be) is sort of soft. The whole thing has this nice chewy texture to it, it isn't crispy and it's mildly sweet. The doughy part of the batter really sits in the middle of the crepe and the tops are crispy.

I haven't experienced this every time I've been here. Sometimes the dough is a little dryer than other days. Sometimes my crepe is not very soft, and sometimes it's almost got this overcooked texture to it.

The ice cream is just ok as well, I think they can do a better job but overall it's a pretty solid crepe spot.
author: Lorrie M.

description: i never thought i would ever say this, but sophie's needs to cool it with the whipped cream! i ordered the strawberry and whipped cream crepe but received whipped cream with a side of crepe and strawberries. the crepe was okay, thin but crunchy and softer as you ate your way down the cone of cream. strawberries were fresh and tasty but were scarce. it was around $7 for the dessert; fun to watch them make it, but it definitely breaks the budget. i would only come back for the novelty otherwise i'll stick to a tub of ice cream for zerts.
author: Eric D.

description:
Nom.. don't mind the long lines. It moves fast. And this is a great stop when you're tired from all that exhausting shopping in Japantown...

Pictured: California (left) - 3.5 stars, #17 Japanese (right) - 4 stars
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cegatrLOnlyeSgDpYOua2g?select=Q7RwXLBdIchadXK-UrhWtQ#Q7RwXLBdIchadXK-UrhWtQ

* California - tried a bite of my friend's, seems like a good option if you want a savory crepe. The lettuce is crispy and fresh, and the sauce tasty. I just felt like the imitation crab was a little too rubbery, seems like it'd sat in their fridge for a while.

* Japanese - oh yes! I think sweet crepes are the way to go. The green tea gelato has that perfect balance between the bitterness of the tea and the sweetness of the ice cream, and the red bean paste goes great with it. Didn't taste the maccha syrup but it was probably just really well integrated into the crepe. Eat it fast before it starts melting out the bottom! 

Tip: take a few bites of any crepe with gelato, side the crepe up in its paper cone, and fold over the bottom of the paper cone to catch the drips. Then - keep on enjoying!

Oh, also tried a spoonful of the black sesame gelato (they were nice about letting us try it even though we'd already ordered something else) - delish!!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Whenever you are in Japantown, there are always certain places that you just HAVE to try, and Sophie's is one of these such places! 

Every time I come in I'm always looking forward to something super great, and I'm never disappointed! The cashiers and the makers are all very friendly and informative, and everything seems very efficient and orderly.

During weekends, it can get pretty crowded, but it's worth the wait! All crepes are made fresh and are perfect for dessert, or a quick lunch as well. My personal favorites are the California crepe for savory, and the Japanese for dessert, trust me, you will love these! You can also get creative and choose additional toppings to the different crepes as well which is super fun. 

The gelato here is also very good! I highly recommend the black sesame as it's totally unique but very good. 

Anyone who finds there way into Japantown definitely should give Sophie's crepes a try! Made me a happy cat! 

*chirp!*
author: Jei C.

description:
Very up sad!!!
I always eat the number 13 Or 15 I think which is: strawberry, banana, kiwi with Nutella! 

Yesterday after dinner, I decide to get one Togo since I was very full from dinner. Getting home super excited to eat my desert  guess what? The crepe is made with whipped cream and no Nutella at all!!! What the hell... I want Nutella!!!! 
Not ok, I want a free crepe next time! Or not going back!
author: Kim K.

description: My favorite crepe place! For some reason I don't see many places putting ice cream in their crepes. I think its a great idea to put in different ice cream flavors and the mandarin oranges are a bonus (I got order D). The layer also has a nice crispiness but softness to it. The only thing is too much whip cream. Next time I have to remember to order without whip cream.
author: Rachel L.

description: Had to get some desserts after a meal, so decided to stop by Sophie's crepes in Japantown San Francisco. Ordered a mixed fruit green tea ice cream with Nutella. One of the best tasting crepes I had for awhile, the green tea ice cream was on point and the crust of the crepes were crispy also. Fruits were fresh which included bananas, strawberry and kiwis. Cons about this place is they only accepts cash and it's a little bit pricey for two crepes which total $18 and some change but I guess that's explain why the soaring prices on housing over here also. Make sure to get some napkins and spoon because it might get a little drippy when the ice cream melt away . Would definitely be back here again if I'm around the areas.
author: Christopher N.

description:
Came here about 20 minutes before they closed and luckily there wasn't a really long line :D

I got their japanese crepe that came with green tea ice cream, matcha sauce, and red bean all wrapped up neatly into a beautiful crepe! It was delicious! I loved the red bean in the crepe, I thought that made it really special. Their crepe wasn't too thick or thin, it was perfect. I also tried their nutella and banana crepe and I thought that was okay, nothing really special or different. They have a variety of gelato flavors and some of them are unique like black sesame and I think adding those into the crepe would have been super good. Definitely would come back if I'm in the area!

CASH ONLY so come prepared!
author: Jennifer H.

description: I've never tried belly good crepes but my friends tell me that they're not as crispy as the crepes here. So if you're deciding between these two crepe shops the decision is easy if you have a strong preference between soft or crispy crepes. The down side to this crepe shop is that they don't do the cute animal decorations that belly good crepes do. A Nutella add on is $1.50 and an ice cream add on is $1. Getting a mixed fruit crepe with ice cream is cheaper than a banana Nutella crepe with ice cream (by about a dollar).  There's not much seating in the shop but there's benches outside the shop you can sit on.
author: Brenda L.

description: Really good crepes! Every time I come to Japantown, I make it a point to come here and indulge in their yummy crepes. I usually get a crepe with nutella, banana, and strawberries, with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, and it hits the spot every single time. It is a little pricey-- that comes out to about $8, but so worth it! Plus I "share" with my boyfriend so it's a little more justified :)
author: Tiffany J.

description: Delicious desserts! Ordered the strawberry and nutella crepe. It looked big so I decided to share but I was wrong. The crepe was so good I wanted another one. The perfect balance of the fresh strawberries and nutella is always a good way to go but they have a lot of other fruit options. The man made it super quick and it was very entertaining to watch. They also had gelato. We got the azuki (red bean) and it had great bean flavor. All the crepes looked delicious.
author: Melissa W.

description:
Crepes are one of the greatest food inventions of all times, and this place does not disappoint! Lines do get long, and it is CASH ONLY, so make sure you have cash before you arrive! 

There are plenty of options, but I decided to build my own crepe: I got the strawberry and whipped cream crepe, added Nutella and green tea ice cream. The wait was not bad at all, considering the line was super long. And it was amaaaaazing. It was definitely less than $8.00, from what I remember. Additional toppings start at $1.00 each, but they are worth adding. (:

Cashiers were nice and patient. And food did not take long to make either, like I said. Would definitely come back here again when I'm in SF!
author: Kelley L.

description:
After stuffing my face at the Pistahan festival, my roommates and I had a sudden craving for crepes.  There wasn't anything open near Yerba Buena, so we hopped it to Japantown thanks to the many reviews on Yelp.

It's a small venue with a few tables to sit.  I ordered the Japanese crepe which had green tea gelato, red bean paste, and matcha sauce.  The matcha sauce was strong at first, but I got used to it.  The crepe itself was a bit overdone, but all in all it satisfied my sweet tooth.

The chocolate sauce in my roommate's crepe went through the paper cone, so definitely bring some napkins just in case.
author: Vira P.

description:
The crepe itself is entertaining to watch them make. To see it be made on the special cast iron hot plate I found to be fascinating as they create this paper thin pancake. 
 When ordering your first decision is whether you are in the mood for sweet or savory. Does a crepe with meats and lettuce, tomato and mayo sound like it will hit the spot?Or maybe it is the sweet tooth after you finished your lunch that drags you there as it did me. There are fruits and ice cream, and many toppings or you can have simple butter and cinnamon sugar. What made my taste buds excited was the one I ordered. On the crispy edged, tender center crepe I got whipped cream, bananas, vanilla ice cream and the amazing delicious Nutella drizzled throughout. I was so happy I secretly hated anyone who would say "yes" to the bite I was offering to share and thankfully giddy inside when everyone was happy with their own crepe choice. So try one. The are worth finding out if you are a sweet or savory kind of person.
author: Orleana P.

description:
I've been coming here for dessert ever since I was a kid and I still love this place to this day!

I always get the crepe with strawberries, vanilla ice cream, chocolate syrup, and add nutella. All of their ingredients are super fresh. Can't say that I've ever had a bad one after all these years.

Their crepes are enough for two to share, but it's definitely doable for one person to finish their own. It's also convenient to eat while walking around the JapanTown center.

Of course their line can get a little long at times, but I think they do a pretty good job at not making customers wait too long. It's also very cool to be able to watch the workers make the crepes right in front of you. 

Definitely a must-try dessert for those visiting JapanTown/SF! Remember to bring cash (cash only!)
author: Josephine L.

description: This is a little cute place for desserts! I came here after having ramen downstairs and had a crepe cone with fruit and whipped cream. It was just perfect not too sweet and well balanced. Definitely coming back!
author: Janet S.
