description: I've been going to Sophie's since I was a kid & they are hands down the best crepes. I see a lot of people saying that "they're too crunchy or flaky". Lets get something straight here people, European crepes are COMPLETELY different from Japanese crepes. So just because it is a crepe place, doesn't mean they are European crepes. Go to Japan, get a crepe there & you'll see. Sophie's makes them exactly like how they are done in Japan. The strawberry & creme one is my all time fave =))
author: Nari M.

description:
After a somewhat large lunch, I didn't have a lot of room for dessert, but I really wanted to try Sophie's Crepes. Located on the second story of an inside mall, Sophie's Crepes had a good stream of customers around lunchtime on a Thursday. 

There are two or three small tables inside and some additional bench seating outside (not sure if those are actually part of the crepe restaurant though). Photos and videos are prohibited inside the shop, which I found interesting since I've never seen that restriction before. Service was efficient and fine.

Chocolate crepe with light chocolate chips:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sophies-crepes-san-francisco?select=ZhVeO9ilESwKeelJR80HmA#UuZR-hy_185IIaf5UTh-YQ)
I opted for just a chocolate crepe, and the cashier asked me whether I'd like the chocolate in the form of chocolate syrup or chocolate chips. I like that they offer the option, and I chose to get light chocolate chips. The crepe itself was more crunchy than chewy, and while I felt like the first few bites were good, towards the end it just got a little hard. With the other fancy fillings, I think it takes the focus away from the actual crepe and allows for the crepe to become softer and soggier as the ice cream melts. With just the crepe and chocolate though, I could really taste the crepe itself, which was fresh but a little bland. I could have used more egginess, and even though I don't like desserts that are too sweet, this was on the blander side even then. 

I might come back and try one of their fancier crepes when I'm not so full, but this time was nothing special. Also, this is probably just me being nitpicky, but it bothers me a little bit that the cooks flip the crepes with their bare hands.. no gloves or utensils or anything. I'm sure it's clean enough, just like sushi chefs handle food with their bare hands, but I noticed that one of the girls had chipped nail polish on her fingers, and that was a little worrisome to me.
author: Maggie X.

description: The crepes are extremely good.  We can see them make it right in front of our eyes, so it is really fresh and of good quality.  Definately recommend the strawberry chocolate crepe.
author: Yelp R.

description:
I used to live by Japantown so Sophie's crepes was close by. Their crepes are decent, it tends to run on the softer side and doesn't have much taste to it. More like it's there to hold the ice cream, fruits and topping as well as adding some texture to it. They're fruits tend to be pretty fresh and usually ripe (or at least the times I've had it). They're ice cream is pretty good and you can't go wrong with nutella.

Now it can be hard to find, it's on the second floor in the mall in Japantown. You can either test your luck by trying to find street parking, but there's also a garage if you're unlucky. Or if you live nearby like I did, you can walk.

They also have tables and chairs for you to sit and enjoy your crepe. But the store itself isn't very big.

But ever since I brought my car to the city, I haven't been back.

FYI: cash only. $10 will be enough.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Absolutely love! I've been coming here for years since I was in middle school! 

The staff is always quick and awesome!

Pricing is great, probably high for those that won't even spend $1 on candy. (I don't complain because I always get more than 1 for myself, I mean c'mon! who can resist! it's THAT good, I know i'll be back anyways so might as well stock up!)

Parking is... well it's S.F.... don't expect anything.

I've tried several crepes from different cities and states, this is definitely my #1! I ALWAYS come here for my crepes when I come to S.F. No way am I missing a chance at getting one of their amazing crepes.
author: Amy Z.

description: Meh. It's exactly what you would expect. Not as good as Genki crepes of course. Location inside japantown is a bit barren.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Decided to come here while we were waiting in line for dinner at Woodhouse which isn't too far away. (I know...who eats dessert before dinner?? Haha we do! We wanted to save time and try out this place since we were in the area) 

The shop is in a little shopping center. Where a crowd of people happen to be hanging around this one spot. It had to be good. We ordered the Japanese? (I think that's what it's called but can't remember) it came with green tea ice cream and red bean. Watching the workers make the creeps from the window was interesting haha the girl was so focused and calm. 

But anyways, crepes are definitely a nice treat to have. And the dessert crepes here were pretty good. If I wasn't having dinner afterwards, I would have bought my own crepe instead of sharing one haha.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Sophie's crepes was pretty good but not the best ice cream crepe place in the city. I like Genki crepes in sunset better. A good spot to stop by to if you're in Japantown though. 

I had a crepe with plain vanilla ice cream and strawberries and bananas. If you don't order gelato in the crepe, you are forced to have regular Smart and Final vanilla ice cream filling. I personally don't like the texture of gelato mixed with crepe so I went for the plain vanilla. Wasn't bad....just could have been better. The serving of fruit could have also been bigger.

One thing I didn't like was that the bottom of my crepe got really soggy and ice cream started dripping out of the end. The last few bites of it weren't the best. Again, Genki Crepes are better in this sense because they were crispier.

I would probably only revisit if I were in the Japantown mall and really craving something sweet.
author: Vidya K.

description:
Still can't get enough of that Strawberry Nutella w/ Vanilla Ice cream... mmmmm ... this is my favorite dessert place in the city and it's a must get every time I'm up here!  Crepe has the perfect amount of crispiness and the fillings aren't overbearing so you can still taste the tastiness of the actual crepe.  It's pretty filling, but I don't recommend sharing, because whenever I share, it's never satisfying.  :c 

Haven't had a better crepe place yet, so this is stillllll my favoritttttttttteeee!!! c: c: c:
author: Carena N.

description:
After a beautiful birthday dinner, my girlfriend and I decided to visit a little crepe shop we had passed by earlier in the evening because their desserts looked so good. There was a long line out front and there was an open window where you could watch crepes being made so it was definitely worth a try!

I ordered the strawberry with whipped cream with a scoop of hazelnut gelato. The crepe itself was nice and crispy, and the gelato had some nice bold flavors to compliment the thick cream and sweet strawberries. It was a delight to eat and I kind of even wanted a second one.

Service was fast and friendly, but finding a place to sit inside the shop was hard. Luckily there's plenty if benches out front where you can enjoy your warm treat. I can't wait to try other flavors and it's making my salivate just thinking about it.

Food: 8/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description:
The japanese-style crepes here are sweet and eggy; therefore more crisp and less floppy than some of it's french counterparts.  It was smaller than what I expected though. And the bottom 1/4 - 1/3 of the crepe didn't have filling, even with my squishing the gelato down with my spoon.
 
Speaking of gelato, the "Japanese" is a yummy concoction of green tea gelato and red bean paste.  The red bean paste is the Japanese azuki mixture and not the sickly sweet Korean paste variety.  The lighter tasting fillings balanced the sweet wrapper very well.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Got a mix fruit crepe w whipped cream and green tea. Perfect combo and i got it within a few minutes which was great!!
author: Katherine D.

description: Was strolling around after lunch today, and stumbled upon this place. I remember always seeing lines for Sophie's on the weekends, and there was no line today (Tuesday, 1pm) so we decided to get some gelato. I got the black sesame and lychee. both flavors were SO GOOD. The flavors were intense and super creamy. Honestly probably the best gelato I've had in a long time.. Definitely coming and on emptier stomach next time to get the crepes with gelato!!
author: Justine H.

description:
After trying two crepe places in Japan town, my by and I gave it up. The pancake is crispy, maybe someone would like it. We'd expect it to be more spongy. We still prefer Honey & Honey Crepes on Taylor & Post. However, the prices of the crepes here are relatively cheap. 

Cash only...An ATM is put in the store.
author: Carrie Z.

description: Best crepe place I've been to so far in my life. The batter of the crepe is so crispy I LOVE IT!! and the quality of the fruits, ice-cream, etc. is just amazing!
author: Rachel K.

description:
I have never had crepes before in my life but I always saw images of it! Until the day I went to go visit Japan Town! I found this cute little shop and thought id try it out. It was very nice because you could actually see the workers making it! I had the banana with ice cream and fudge. It took less than 5 minutes to receive and I was very happy with the result.

The ice cream was perfectly shaped into the crepe that was crispy and delicious! The fudge, whipped cream and bananas were just the final touch to perfection. Its a great size if you're really hungry for a fantastic desert! The fruits are very fresh and just overall I just cannot complain. I would love to visit again just to pick a crepe up!
author: Renata M.

description:
I visited this spot recently as I had fond memories of Sophie's Crepes as a kid during a trip to SF. I came in to get crepes for my boyfriend and myself to go.

It was dead, there was literally nobody in the cafe except for myself. I ordered two crepes...
1) Strawberries, Nutella, and whipped cream
2) Bananas, Nutella, whipped cream, and banana walnut gelato. FYI adding whipped cream or gelato to a crepe is an upcharge, nbd that's fair.

I paid the cashier, all was well, but then I noticed the guy making the crepes did not add bananas to the second crepe. It looked like strawberry sauce, chocolate sauce, and gelato. I told him it was supposed to be banana Nutella, and the cashier came over and asked what was wrong. I told her what the order was supposed to be and she apologized and said she entered it wrong into the computer. She then told me she needed to re-enter the order because there would be a price difference. 

The cashier re-enters the order, I pay her an extra 1.35, the dude remakes the crepe and packages it to go. I get outside, and guess what, no gelato this time! 

The fact that I had to pay an initial upcharge for the gelato and then a price difference when the cashier messed it up, and they still screwed up the order...come on. I could understand if this place was busy and this happened, but it was dead. I was the only person in there the entire time.

I would have come back for a refund for the damn gelato but I was already outside the mall. Crepes were still decent but nothing outstanding. I think I'll stick to the Japanese crepe places in NYC.
author: Megan M.

description:
I've been coming to Sophie's Crepes for some time now thanks to the recommendation of one of my SF friends. This is a cash only type of establishment so come prepared. Oh, and there is always a decent chance you'll need to wait in line for your crepe. This is a very popular hang-out spot for families and college/high school-aged friends and sometimes the workers get overwhelmed by the orders. That doesn't mean they don't do a good job! They really keep pace and make those crepes as fast as humanly possible. 

I like to keep things simple and order either the #7 or #9, which are the strawberry + whipped creme or the banana + whipped cream. Neither comes with gelato, but you have the option to add some to your order for a nomimal fee.
author: May W.

description: The crepes here are very good and fair priced . You can choose whatever you want on it and they'll make it . When there is a long line it is quite a wait took me 30 mins when the line was out the door. Cash only as well.
author: M Z.

description:
It took me a while to realize this place that it was on the 2nd floor of Kinokuniya Mall in Japantown. I came here on a Sunday evening with my boyfriend. We had one crepe with mixed fruit (strawberry, banana, kiwi) and whipped cream and another with banana and nutella both with an added scoop of lychee gelato. The fruits in our crepes were very fresh even though we came here when they were about to close. The lychee gelato was amazing. It was very light but still had that delicious lychee flavor. If you love lychee like I do, then I definitely suggest getting the lychee gelato here and I don't think you can go wrong with any of the sweet crepes here. 

Tip: Cash only, but there is an ATM in the store.
author: Melanie H.

description:
GREEN TEA FANS - Get #17!!!  It has green tea gelato, red bean paste, and matcha sauce!  It's delicious.  I want more!!  The crepe has a thin and crispy texture.  I also enjoy that the crepe comes in a paper cone container.  It allows you to eat on-the-go!  You can browse the shops in the mall while eating a yummy crepe.  How awesome is that?!  

P.S. Bring cash!
author: Francesca L.

description:
Can I add 10 stars to this review? First time I ever had a dessert like this and it was so heavenly! It's located on the second floor in the mall, small shop that can hold about 3 tables for seating. I didn't think the wait would take long but it was about 30 minutes. 

I recommend the strawberry Nutella with a scoop of green tea. Best combo! They use fresh fruit and all fresh ingredients. There's even someone who makes the crepes fresh off the pan. 

If you're ever in San Francisco, this place should be on the to do list. You won't regret the time you waited! My bf and I shared one and as both wanted to go back in line for more. So don't settle for sharing, get yourself a crepe per person :)
author: Surim H.

description: The hubby and I came here to relive one of our first dates, and it was just as yummy as we remembered it to be so many years ago.  This time, we got a strawberries and creme crepe and a Japanese crepe.  The texture of the thick whipped cream worked really well with the sweet, fresh strawberries and the crispy crepe.  The Japanese crepe had green tea ice cream with azuki beans and matcha sauce.  I couldn't really taste the matcha sauce, but liked the crepe in general.  By the time we were done with our crepes, I was stuffed.
author: Hoa Q.

description:
Average crepes, not the best, and a little pricey for the amount they give. However, still decent tasting. Slipped into the ultra corner of the mall in the general area of Pika Pika, Sophie's sometimes have lines out the door because their place is small and only has about three tables inside to sit down in. 

Similar to every other crepe place, they have set combinations on their menu where you can choose which ever sound appetizing to you, OR you can customize your own crepe. I usually get the usual strawberry ice cream on original batter with strawberries topped with nutella. I think the crepe came out to be on the crunchy side. They sliced the strawberries into think slices which I like because most places have the entire strawberry or half of it which is way to heavy and makes my crepe collapse fast. However, quality wise, it's nothing special but they charge a lot. I think it costed a little more than $6.75 for my basic crepe. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sophies-crepes-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#8npZ2G04vlz5qfv8Ab_V7Q

Fun part is being able to watch them make the crepe, however no photography allowed for that. Parking is a hassle usually on weekends because it is Japan Town, and if you know the area well you can easily find street parking and not get robbed by those garage parking lots.
author: Chena N.

description: A good dessert if you have room after eating in the area. It does get a bit expensive once you add the ice cream to it...BUT YOU MUST ADD THE ICE CREAM. The shell is very light which I really appreciated since some places overdo it with the shell. I get the red bean or green tea version and add fruit to it.
author: Lily P.

description:
We had the Japanese dessert crepe which had green tea gelato and red beans. Yum! I think this place is a little too popular for its own good...the wait was a little long, and the delicious smell only made me more impatient Hehe...

If everything was $1 less, I'd come here more regularly :)
author: Henna P.

description:
We ordered the mixed fruits with green tea ice cream, whipped cream and Nutella crepe. It is BOMBDOTCOM! Everything is on point! Especially their whipped cream and ice cream. Their crepe is perfectly made- crispy and flavorful. 

Definitely a must try! I'm in love :)
author: Anna H.

description:
Stopped by here for crepes because my cousin wanted some. 

She wanted the Japanese themed crepe: green tea gelato, red bean paste, matcha sauce. BUT she didn't want the red bean paste. So we asked the cashier if we could substitute. I figured we would have to pay the difference for whatever we were substituting for (strawberries) but she explained it to us anyway. It kind of took her a while. The crepe cost about $6 bucks or so.

The quality of the crepe was great and they made it really fast. I love that the crepe part is crispy and the quality of their food is always good. The matcha sauce was a bit bitter for my taste but..still ate it. 

This is my go to spot for crepes in Japantown so far.
author: Sofia R.

description: Incredibly tasty. Unlike other creperies, there's a crispy soft texture and not soggy. Strawberry, whip cream and mocha chip ice cream. Yum.
author: Jackie L.

description:
I love sophie's crepes! They're affordable, yummy, and can be customized to your liking. Try the Japanese crepe with green tea ice cream or the nutella and strawberry crepe with cookies and creme ice cream. You won't be sorry! 

The only downside of this place is that they only take cash (they have an ATM if people are wondering).  

I can't wait to come back here and eat another amazing crepe!
author: joanne c.

description:
I didn't know I liked ice cream mixed together fruit until I had the strawberry/ice cream/chocolate sauce/whipped cream crepe from Sophie's.

My crepe was so freaking delicious I wanted to cry.

The back of my foot was literally bleeding after making a super long trek to get to the place today, but I'm willing to be a little trooper and bleed for Sophie's again just to try their million other delicious options.  But hopefully I'll remember to wear better shoes next time.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Update 5/30/11

I went back today for #17 the green tea gelato/red bean paste/matcha sauce crepe.  It was so amazing and got me all emotional again.
author: Tian Q.

description:
$4 for a gelato crepe - I tried green tea and black sesame and went for the black sesame. Tasty!

I'm generally not a big crepe fan because I don't like the texture of whipped cream/strange soft things that smoosh each other... but having just ice cream in a crepe filling was surprisingly good! It's like eating ice cream in a cone except you're guaranteed a good ratio of cone to ice cream with every bite.

The black sesame ice cream definitely made me the happiest though, since it's not something I can typically get elsewhere.
author: Jenn W.

description:
CASH ONLY.

Sophie's is probably the best crepe place in SF. I haven't actually had a crepe from here in a couple of years, so am giving them a 4 star rating. There is usually always a line on the weekends, and it can take 10 minutes to get your crepe, but it's perfect for a hot day. I came here a couple weeks ago around 3pm on a Wednesday, and there was finally no line! Since I was eating an early dinner I only got an Italian Soda, which was refreshing. Parking around Japantown can be tough to find, but it was a little easier on a weekday afternoon. The meters on the main streets are PRICEY ($4/hr I believe), so try to find a spot a couple blocks away since there are unmetered parking spots available.
author: Amy D.

description:
We ordered the Japanese dessert crepe and it's delicious.  The green tea gelato nicely pairs with the red beans.  It's a nice crispy crepe that I prefer over the fluffy thick version of Genki's.
While it seems like there's a line and crowded, the wait wasn't that long.
author: Karen L.

description:
What does Japantown and French style crepes have in common? They're both awesome. 

It's the perfect crispy chewy texture that you expect from crepes and found in Japantown of all places. You can choose from different fillings from sweet to savory. They make their own gelato and have several fresh fruits to choose from. Being in Japantown, I was drawn to the green tea gelato with the macha sauce. It was the perfect combination that tied the two worlds together. 

If you happen to be around the area or in Japantown, then this is place that you must visit. Sophie's Crepes, come for the crepes and don't forget the homemade gelato.
author: Pari P.

description: A favorite must stop dessert shop in J-town! This place is always busy! Their crepes are thin with the right amount of vanilla and texture!
author: Sandara J.

description:
I had heard a lot of good things about this place so I really wanted to try it. The first time I tried Sophie's Crepes, I was disappointed... so I gave it another try yesterday when I was in Japantown, and I was once again disappointed.

I got a dessert crepe with strawberry, nutella, and vanilla ice cream. My crepe came out SO FAST. By the time I finished paying, they had it ready at the counter O_O. I was impressed by that, but that was short lived because the crepe was whatever. They probably used one and a half strawberry max for my crepe, and by the time I got to the bottom half, I was left with almost NOTHING (only a little bit of nutella)... I felt so ripped off. It was also too crunchy so every time I took a bite, I was scared that the bottom half of my crepe would break off. 

CASH ONLY! ATM machine was also out of service when I was there... so I had to borrow money from my friend.

Not coming back here again unless someone offers to buy a crepe...
author: Annie S.

description:
Love this place!!!! If you like your crepe wrap crispy, you have to come here instead of bellys crepe. 

Ive tried their chicken salad savory crepe and its pretty good and juicy:)  Id say the price is fair considering it made me full! I honestly think this place is good for their savory crepes.

Their royal banana sundae is good! I love banana and ice cream so its a must when I come here. 

Nice staff, fast pick up, barely any line unless theres a festival happening. You can also watch the workers make your crepes.
author: Josie D.

description: Nutella, Banana, Whipped Cream - 'nuf said ;)
author: Nicolette B.

description: One of my favorite places for sweet Japanese crepes. I normally get the Nutella vanilla ice cream crepe or the Japanese (green tea gelato, red bean and strawberry) crepe. While I think that the portion has gotten smaller throughout the years, the quality and taste is always on par.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Had #17 the Japanese crepe with green tea ice cream, red bean paste, and matcha sauce. This is probably one of the best crepes I have ever had. The store itself looks very underwhelming but the crepe is so worth. 

The crepe(pancake) is soft and chewy but also crunchy on the edges with a perfect egg-y taste that really made the combination with the other ingredients just that much better! The matcha powder also makes the green tea ice cream taste more authentic while adding a little bitterness! Yummm
author: Shelly L.

description:
Omg with one bite you will turn into a gluttonous sinner. 

Their gelato is the BEST I've had. My friend got the carmel gelato in a cup. It was so good. I got a crepe with green tea gelato, nutella, whippped cream and FRESH mixed fruit omg what a foodgasm! Turned into a glutton when my friend and I decided to split a carmel gelato, nutella, whipped cream, and banana crepe. If you ever go to SF you'd be a fool not to come here.
author: Sarah H.

description: Love this place. No trip to SF is complete without a stop in J-town for a Sophies crepe. Love the variety although my fav is the mixed fruit with a scoop of ice cream. I take off one star for the stupid no photo sign and the huge lines they always have.
author: James R.

description:
I never usually see this place open but I'm glad it opened on this day!
I had a horrible experience at Genki's Crepes, so I was debating if I should give crepes another chance. But since it was my friends birthday I decided to give it another shot. I ordered the Mixed Fruits crepe which included strawberries, bananas, kiwi, vanilla ice cream and a little bit of whipped cream (which I requested). It wasn't too bad. The crepe was warm and the fruits were just right. After I finished eating the fruits on top and slowly made my way down the ice cream, I discovered more fruits in the middle of the crepe. I was a happy camper
author: Linda K.

description:
Since there was the Cherry Blossom Festival it didn't surprise me that there was a line for this place, but then I realized ... no it's not just cause there's an event it's because this place is delicious!

I split a Mixed Fruit Ice Cream Crepe substituting regular ice cream with Green Tea and adding Nutella with a friend and it came out to roughly 9 dollars. Pretty pricey, but it's really filling and talk about quality. After we paid we stood in the window area to watch them prepare the crepes, the workers worked with such precision and were quite quick.

I would love to come back to try their more savory crepes, but this is probably the best crepe place I've been too. The crispy edges but moist center held everything in tact, it was perfect. The crepe came with a nice layer of Nutella, creamy ice cream and the bananas, strawberries and kiwi's were ripe and sweet as can be!

Pay attention to the "no camera" policy, as I stood watching them make crepes I would check my  incoming text messages and were shot looks by the workers almost immediately as soon as they saw my phone. Of course I wasn't going to take pictures, but those looks meant SRS BSNS.
author: Janet N.

description:
Love the crepes here.  Last time I came to visit, I had it 3 times in a row.  =X

Love getting the nutella with strawberries and bananas.  They give you a good amount of ingredients in the crepe..not too much, not too little.  Just delicious.
author: Audrey C.

description:
Solid crepes, but nothing about the crepes jumps out at me.  I found the crepe skin to be too thin and not particularly flavorful.

however, I think that the real magic and speciality of sophies crepes is in their ice cream/ gelato section.
-they have a very unique flavor and consistency compared to other places.

If you are getting a crepe, the gelato add on is a must! It really completes the crepe!
author: Mike L.

description: Meh. I'm pretty disappointed with you guys for giving this place 4 stars, I thought I could trust you. $8.98 for a sub par crepe.
author: Jb B.

description:
The place is small but has a great view overlooking part of the city!

And the crepes are the BOMB!
author: Sharon C.

description:
Best Crepe in town!

If you are a green tea lover, definitely try the Japanese crepe (#17) which comes with green tea gelato, matcha sauce and red bean paste. Their crepe is thin and crispy, and their green tea gelato is very delicious!

Wait can be long, but does worth trying it!
author: Louisa L.

description: Worth the wait! I love how the crepe was thin and crispy. I got nutella, banana, kiwi, and strawberry and it was so yummy! My brother had the same thing, but added some vanilla ice cream. I don't have many regrets in life, but not putting ice cream in that crepe is definitely one of them! Lol Definitely a must stop if you have a sweet tooth!
author: Joyce D.

description:
Came here during the Cherry Blossom Festival and there was a long line.  I guess you can say that it is normal to have the line out the door.  

I don't see anything special about this place.  It just tasted like a normal crepe to me.

I ordered the Nutella and Fresh Strawberry Crepe with a scoop of Green Tea gelato.  I have to say that the Green Tea Gelato did tasted a little different (in a good way) from the regular Green Tea ice cream.  I found the crepe to be a little too sweet for me. I love Nutella, but they put too much Nutella in the crepe.  It would of tasted better if they put less Nutella.  

Will probably come back here to try a different combination, but I just don't see anything special about this place.
author: Ashley L.

description:
My favorite dessert in the city. I go here for a Nutella strawberry crepe. It's a bit messy, but the taste is amazing.

They make the crepe right in front of you and all the ingredients are fresh.
author: Mallory D.

description:
I went to here with my sister and two cousins on a Saturday evening. The place was pretty packed! We waited about 3 minutes in line before we could order, but the cashier was friendly and patient despite the crowd. I ordered a crepe with banana and Nutella, and was asked if I wanted whipped cream with it. I answered, "Sure," but realized later that they charged me an extra dollar for it. Oh well. After we ordered we waited another 10 minutes for the crepes, but we spent the time watching the guy make them and guessing if he was making ours so the wait wasn't that bad. 

When we finally got our crepes, I was surprised by the amount of whipped cream on mine! The whipped cream was fresh and tasty though (I guess the amount was worth the extra $1), but I probably wouldn't order a crepe with whipped cream again since the first few bites were mainly just cool whipped cream. My crepe was also slightly crunchy, and I wished it had more nutella. My sister got a crepe with green tea ice cream, and since the crepes are served in cones the ice cream kept dripping out the bottom. My cousin also had ice cream with her crepe and hers was pretty messy to eat too. 

Nevertheless, it was a fun stop during our visit to Japantown, and we all ended up really full!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Located in the Japanese center, Sophie's crepe is a small restaurant that serves different kinds of crepes. I guess they don't like people taking pictures of their food because there was a sign on one of their glasses. We ordered a green tea mung bean with whipped cream dessert and a strawberry chocolate crepe. The green tea dessert was pretty good and deep in flavor. The mung bean (red-blackish) was soft and plentiful in the small cup the dessert came in. The strawberry chocolate crepe was huge! I had crepes at several places before and this has got to be the biggest by far. The crepe is crunchy kind of like a waffle which is different from your typical soft flour crepe. Overall, I enjoyed the desserts and if I had the option to stop by here more often, I would get fat.
author: Thy T.

description:
Quite a long wait for a simple food; Happy Crepe & Ice Cream or whatever it's called has a shorter line for sure.  

A little overrated in my opinoin.  Yes, the food is prepared right there and it does have a good selection of flavors, but the crepe itself is pretty unremarkable and they're a little stingy with ingredients, especially at the bottom of the crepe.

The location is extremely convenient, which would normally be a plus, but all it really accomplishes is creating a longer line for you.  Took about 15 minutes for a simple banana nutella crepe.  Next time I'll pass and try something else.
author: Mike P.

description:
The crepes are made fresh right in front of you.  You can watch them make the crepes from outside the shop. I went here during a festival and there was actually a line of people waiting to watch them make crepes. Note that the line to buy a crepe may be separate from that line. Me and my friends ended up in the wrong line for a bit.

The line for buying the crepes was long but moved at a decent speed. It takes a while for them to give you your crepe, again, because it is fresh, but I think it is worth the wait. I think these crepes have a slightly better flavor and much better texture than the other place in the Japantown mall. I had the crepe with whipped cream, chocolate sauce, and a scoop of cookies and cream gelato. It was a real treat after dinner.

This place is always busy during festivals, and for good reason, but if you are in a hurry this may not be the place for you. Also, it is cash only but there is an ATM inside. If you have time to wait, getting a crepe here is worth it, otherwise come on a not so busy day to try it out.
author: Audrey D.

description: Not sure what the hype is all about this place.  Had the strawberry and nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream and it was okay at best.  Because the crepe was rolled into a cone shape, it actually became too doughy such that the other ingredients were overshadowed.
author: Don L.

description: The food was good but the woman who served me, with the red bandana, was extremely unfriendly.
author: La R.

description: Checked  yelp this morning before driving  out to visit Japan town  we live  an hour and hour plus  away so it's a drive ... it says on line   opens at 11  we got there at 1050 am the gate still down tried calling got an  answering machine . Walked around Japan town a good hour and contemplated going to the other crepe place good belly .... but decided to keep our cravings In tact and wait it out by 1130 still not open tried calling again someone picked up and hung up on me, called back and got answering machine again ..... went walking and shopping and asked different  store merchants what time they opened said oh around noon ?!  We went back at noon the gate a quarter of the way up ??? Wtf man .... Ok then if you aren't going to be open on the hours you disclose hours then change  your times on yelp people!! Anyway super disappointed never  got to get in and eat !! Was starving wh we got there ended up getting in car and going to crepes a goof not to mention. the sign on the door at Sophie's  says cash only ... to me that means not good business , good businesses take all forms of payment business that take cash are just being shady on reporting what they're income is to the IRS ! That's not fair ! Needless to say we still love Japan down but I won't ever visit  this crepe business again !
author: Lynnette D.

description: I love this place as much I love SF. Always serves their best. Been here lots of times and amazed me that I haven't written for them. Their crepes wouldn't let you down any time. Beware of the long lines and carry cash.
author: Sharan N.

description: Their black sesame gelato is the best I've ever had  it's a must try if you like sweet black sesame desserts!
author: Corina C.

description:
I love the Japanese dessert menu, number #17.
Or number #14, then add green tea ice cream. So good, not too sweet.
I always try to come here whenever visiting SF
author: Vischa S.

description:
I went to J-town in san francisco and we went here for dessert. There was a big pack of people swarming in this place and it got me super excited. 
It's probably one of the better crepes I have but it's still not anything mind blowing. I like it but it's just not that special. I'm glad that it wasn't really like a taiwanese open shop because the skin isn't all crunchy and it had a good soft texture yet having a little crisp to it. I still would recommend people to come here if you're a local but it's not anything you have to go outta your way to just to come here and  eat crepes.
Strawberry + nutella + ice cream = WIN! 
:D
author: Ernest Y.

description:
3.5 solid stars

Ordered the strawberry banana vanilla ice cream crepe--they forgot my nutella :( ! Yum!! Dessert is always cherry on top for me--no pun intended! 

It is inside Japantown. The crepe is a little on the 'crispy' side. Delicious, but not "melt in your mouth" good. 

FYI: Cash only!
author: Jen H.

description: Terrible service. I paid 6 dollars for a Nutella and banana crepe. It didn't have any Nutella and just two piece of banana . I asked for my money back. We waited for 10 min. I don't get it !!! Why people pay so much for nothing.
author: Albert M.

description: Knocked off one star because I thought it was kind of pricey...or maybe I'm just a typical broke college student. Other than that, their crepes are cooked to perfection. I ordered a strawberry, whipped cream, Nutella, and banana in my crepes. Just thinking about it waters my mouth. I will definitely be back here though if I get the chance.
author: Priscilla L.

description: I love Sophie's Crepes.  Whenever I have my cravings and am in San Francisco, I always have to drop in and order #8, strawberries vanilla ice cream, chocolate drizzle, and whip cream all wrapped up in the crispy thin layer crepe.
author: Mung N.

description: Not bad. Thailand's crepes sort of ruined all crepe shops for me though. But I do remember before going to Thailand, this place was pretty freaking good.
author: Johnny N.

description: This place is a must visit when I come to Japantown. I absolutely love the freshness of the crepes here, and I love how you can watch them making it right in front of you. I have tried the butter cinnamon, green tea ice cream with red bean and whipped cream, and the strawberries with nutella and whipped cream, all of which do a swell job satisfying my sweet tooth. I have yet to try the savory crepes, but if they are anything like the dessert crepes, I'm sure they will not disappoint!
author: Nina Z.

description:
My friends and I came here after running a 10K on Embarcadero. My friends were craving these after looking at the pictures here. I thought, what the heck. Lets go!

First and foremost, the establishment is CASH ONLY. But, there is an ATM at the entrance to get some cash to pay.

You can't take pictures of the menu or the employees making the food (there is a sign). 

I got my crepe about 10-12 minutes after I ordered. I got a mixed fruit with whipped cream crepe. There was a ton of whipped cream and not a lot of fruit.

The crepe was okay. It wasn't too spectacular. I was a bit disappointed with it. Probably because I ordered something that didn't have much of a taste. I should have went all out with some ice cream, but I'm a health nut and like to cut calories whenever I have the chance. haha However, the price I paid wasn't really worth the crepe that I didn't even finish.
author: Terri L.

description:
Great place for sweet or savory crepes.  Seems as though everytime we've gone here its always busy.  

Ordering - there always seems to be a crowd by the entrance which looks as though there waiting in line...but the line is actually inside the store as the folks outside are most likely waiting for their crepe to be made.  also if not your craving crepes you can always just order a scoop or two of ice cream or gelato.  

Never tried the savory crepes, but the sweet crepes can come in any combinations of strawberry, kiwi, banana, nutilla, whip cream, and ice creams.  The ordering system is pretty easy and there's also a menu at the counter  just in case you forgot.  Also adding ice cream is extra....so a typical crepe will cost you somewhere between 5 to 6 dollars.

All crepes are made fresh to order, nice and warm when you receive it.  They use fresh fruits and with some nutilla and ice cream you got a great desert after a long day in japantown.  one thing to watch out is if you don't eat the ice cream fast enough, it may drip on your cloths since the holder on the bottom is sometimes loose.  There's also a crepe place downstairs, but their crepes are a lot smaller.
author: John P.

description: Cash only but one of my favorite crepe places for a sweets craving! Nice and thin, but filled well! I usually order the strawberries and nutella crepe, which is just awesome! The one with green tea ice cream and red bean paste is good too.
author: Cara R.

description:
Sophie's Crepes or Belly Good Crepes? Sophie's crepes are a little crispier on the edges and they use better ice cream/gelato (Fiorello's gelato at Sophie's, Double Rainbow ice cream at Belly Good). Belly Good Crepes has better prices, easier to eat crepes and amazing crepe artwork. Both have plastic crepes on display.

Order a specialty sweet or savory crepe or build your own ($2.50 and up) with gelato, Nutella, fruit, etc. 

* Japanese crepe ($5.25, $1 extra for whipped cream): A small scoop of Japanese green tea gelato drizzled with matcha sauce, with red beans spread inside a rolled up cone made with a super thin crepe. The gelato was rich, thick and sticky with sweet green tea flavor. The star was the matcha sauce; it hardens like magic shell! The crepe was very thin with crispy but not too brittle edges but on the bland side. You can get something similar at Belly Good for less and BG includes whipped cream. BG's actual crepe is better but the filling is better at Sophie's.

Pictures aren't allowed (annoying). Cash only.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Best crepe place ever!
I always get this on my crepe:
Nutella, Cookies-n-cream gelato, & red bean paste.
Super yummy! :D
author: Amy C.

description:
Had the Banana Nutella crepe w/ a scoop of ice cream. YUMZ! Crepe was thinly crispy and never got soggy. They were pretty generous w/ the spread and bananas.

My order came out to be $6.25 which is a bit pricey. Cash only.
author: Julie L.

description:
Had to see what the hype was all about. Got the banana-vanilla-nutella combo and it tasted like any other crepe.

Yup..maybe im just not a crepe lover. Four stars cause I love Nutella on anything
author: Paul Louie C.

description:
Searching far and wide for a crepe place that is better than this is IMPOSSIBLE. Even other crepe places have told me that they're trying to live up to the perfection of Sophie's Crepes. 

I always order the Banana Crepe with nutella and vanilla ice cream but I always replace the vanilla with Green Tea Gelato (it's a little extra with the green tea). As if it's not fattening enough, I tell them to not put the whip cream in.

You can't take pictures or video tape them making it. It's funny when people do it anyway and the people working just get upset about it. I guess they don't want to be like animals at a zoo with flashes constantly blinding them?

If you haven't, you gotta try this place! Well worth the wait and the crazy lines.
author: Lauren K.

description: One of the best crepe places in San Francisco, hands down. Every time I visit the city I have to go to JTown just to get crepe from this store. I live their Japanese crepe which has green tea gelato with red bean paste and fudge - such a flavorful combination.
author: Vicheth K.

description:
I've shared some fond memories here at Sophie's crepes.  I came here once back in high school when BART-ing and bussing into Japantown in SF on the weekends was a way to get away from the stress of school, and more recently as a way of sharing a final moment with fellow Yelper Yvonne L. before departing ways.

I'm not sure if I'll ever actually meet Sophie, but I can say that her crepes were a great way to end my time in Japantown.  Obviously, with over 700 reviews this small crepe bar is pretty famous, and for good reason.  They provide an array of both savory and sweet crepes to satisfy any taste bud.  Normally I get turned off by long lines that stretch outside the restaurant, but I knew then that these crepes were going to be worth it.

The restaurant is located in the second part of the plaza, with a couple of small tables and seats to sit at.  However, it may be uncomfortable to stay inside if it gets too busy.

The crepe Yvonne L. and I shared was delicious!  Filled with a generous amount of red beans and green tea ice cream, the flavors made it a refreshing dessert on a hot summer day.  Between two people, the crepe was more than enough, so if you're down to share with a friend, I would definitely recommend it.  You can also take your crepe to go and explore the rest of what Japantown has to offer.

The next time I return to this wonderful community, I will be making another stop at Sophie's Crepes.  Parking is available on the streets if you're lucky, or in various lots surrounding the plaza in Japantown.  Be careful because some charges more than others, so definitely do a bit of scoping out.
author: Andy N.

description: I always make it a must to stop here for a yummy crepe while shopping in Japantown. My boyfriend and I shared a crepe with Nutella and mixed fruit (strawberries, banana and kiwi). Excellent!
author: Chae C.

description:
When I saw this place I was not expecting to have one of the best food experiences of my life.  I'm not sure whether it was because I just ate, or because I had no expectations, but the crepe I had with banana and Nutella was so damn delicious I was actually kind of a jerk about sharing it with anyone in my group.  

This place isn't much to look at and the staff is a little rude, but the crepe I had made up for all the short comings.  Word to the wise, have your order ready!  The do not tolerate people taking up their time at the register while deciding what they want.
author: Nick M.

description: Delicious crepes! The only downside is cash only (though they do provide atm machines that places a fee every time you withdraw) and no picture taking.
author: Yan L.

description: One time I ordered a crepe with strawberries and green tea ice cream, and I had a pretty bad stomach ache. I was also with a date at the time so I would purposely untie my shoe every other block so I could re-tie it and pass gas. Otherwise, all the other times I've had a crepe with different fruits and ice cream, I wasn't gassy or on a date.
author: Laurie M.

description:
Mmm, Sophie's crepes are sooo delicious!  In my latest trip to San Francisco, my friends and I were in a crepe-fever!  This place definitely hit the spot.

The crepes itself are cooked semi-crispy, just the way I like it!  I'm not a fan of chewy soft crepes so it was a pleasant surprise when I bit into it.

The flavor itself is delicious!  It's not too sweet and the fruit is fresh.  It's probably my favorite crepe shop in San Francisco!
author: Joyce W.

description:
My favorite crepe place ever! I am in love with their japanese crepe! Omg that green tea gelato with red bean paste is orgasmic! I love it!

The savory crepes are also good.
Had some of the turkey and avocado crepe. It was really tasty but I still think I prefer the sweet crepes!

The savory crepe is also delicious!
author: Dilys Y.

description: There always seem to be a line here, but fortunately service is pretty fast.  They make delicious crepes!  The crepe itself is well prepared; thin and crispy.  I love their strawberry, banana, and nutella crepe!  Their gelato is also good, but I always opt for the crepes.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Something about this place makes me very unhappy.  Crepes with ice cream are supposed to make you happy right?  I cannot seem to put my finger on it.  

Maybe, it is the fact that it costs additional to add ice cream to your order.  Ice cream belongs in every crepe, so this is a clever marketing strategy on their part that there are so many items on the menu with no ice cream.  

Maybe, it is the long lines, even at night, that puts a damper on my spirits.  

Maybe, it is the fact that the crepe itself is cooked too much, and when the crepe is crispy, it tends to crumble.  

Or, just maybe, just MAYBE, it is the fact that they are rolling crepes with their bare hands.  These same hands, hold dirty towels, that the workers use to wipe the dirty counters where the crepes are created.  That just sounds dirty to me.  

Go to Belly Good Crepe instead!  They make their crepes with love, and I guarantee they are proud of every crepe they make.  They even took a picture of the crepe before they handed it to me because it looked so cute!
author: Victor L.

description: #17 Japanese crepe with green tea gelato and red bean paste,  so good! Not extremely sweet either. CASH ONLY! lines arent too long either,  which is perfect!
author: Stephanie C.

description: I've come here a few times, and it was great! The first time I went, I actually enjoyed it so much that I came back the next day... I've tried both the Japanese style with green tea gelato and read bean, and also the American style with strawberries, nutella, and vanilla gelato. The crepe itself is thin and crispy, and the cone style makes it very convenient for eating. Make sure to get gelato with your crepe! It's a must-have.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
One of my favorite crepe places! The crepe is always super thin and crispy, which is how I like it. Come on, who wants a soggy thick crepe? They have both savory and sweet crepes, but I prefer dessert crepes. You can choose from fruit toppings or a scoop of gelato or combine the two! They also serve scoops of gelato alone, but if you come to a crepe place, you just have to order a crepe! There's usually a line that sometimes extends out the door, but it's alright because while you're waiting, you can watch the expert at the storefront window cook crepes on the griddle. 

What I ordered:
- Green tea gelato crepe ($4): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cegatrLOnlyeSgDpYOua2g?select=qbVwiW2JNCX6xJkkvIjIQw#qZhDfS0jNRbFN9y_jMu3aw

Gelato? GOOD.. Crepe? GOOD. There's another crepe place in Japantown, but I don't think their crepes are as crispy, so I'll stick to Sophie's!
author: Jessica C.

description: We've gone here three time, always SO good! I just love the whole ice cream in a crepe instead of a cone" idea, so much tastier, and Sophie's are THE BEST!!! The Nutella and strawberry is my idea of heaven. I am a little concerned that Nutella isn't so great for you...sure hazelnuts are healthy, but what about all of that palm oil, that's gotta be bad. And it's partly Sophie's fault that I cannot give up Nutella, she makes it too good as a topping on their luscious crepes!!!!!!!! (Not really, go here, and thank you Sophie's!)
author: Maud R.

description:
You're in Japan town and are wondering which Crepe place to go to get your fill of a delicious treat. Search no more... this is one of my go-to places every time I come to Japan town. Even though this place isn't as decorative when it comes to their crepes as the other place (across from Sanrio), trust me... the taste more than compensates for the lack of decoration.
And also they have specials... One of the favorites is the Strawberry, Whipped Cream, Chocolate Syrup Crepe with a scoop of Vanilla Ice cream (5.50).
author: Kevin W.

description:
I love the gelato here.  It's very yummy and smooth.  Freshly made.  Whenever I'm in Japantown, I have to come here. I usually get the cookies and cream gelato crepe.  

They're a little stingy on their gelato.  I would be more happy if they give a little more.  They're still a cash only store so be sure to carry some cash with you if you decide to come here.
author: Susan B.

description: Does not compare to Crepes a Go Go or Saint-Germanie. While Sophie's has an easier menu to navigate and cheaper crepes, the portion is much smaller. I do prefer their actual crepe, as it's crispier and less buttery, but the fillings are pitiful in quantity. In my avocado and cheese crepe, the avocado and cheese were buried at the bottom and small in size to begin with. I guess it's the classic Japantown over-priced fare.
author: Danny C.

description: I've always passed by this place every time I've visited in the past, but I've never actually tried it out until my most recent visit with some friends. First thing that came to mind was that the shop was a bit cramped, especially since the entrance is usually blocked by people waiting for their order to be finished. Other than that, they had a decent menu selection of crepes and with decent prices. My friends and I went about an hour or two after we ate lunch so we weren't expecting the crepes to be as large as they were, always a good thing =) (haha!). Anyway, they're really delicious and I cannot wait to go back here!!
author: Paulamertha A.

description:
The ice cream crepes here are the best! The crepe here is pretty crispy, which is perfect with ice cream -- almost like a cone. The scoops of ice cream aren't huge, but the gelato is pretty dense, so it works out perfectly with the amount of crepe.

I've been meaning to try some of the other crepe fillings, but I can never stray from ice cream. TT_________TT
author: Ruby H.

description: Been here last few times never to get a fresh crepe. They pull them out of the cabinet or fridge (idk under the counter) and warm them up like a tortilla. My child thought it was one.  Do they still make crepes? Is it just for the weekend now? I now head down the way to the other crepe place because at least they can be bothered to make me a crepe. If they started making fresh crepes again I'll change my review.
author: Jennie S.

description: I thought it was really good and it was the perfect amount for me and my bf to share. The crepe was the perfect amount of crispy yet softness to it and it was really good with the ice cream inside. Had me craving crepes in SoCal
author: Esther L.

description: Love the green tea crepe here! It's definitely the best I've had. The crepe is thin + crispy and green tea gelato is creamy + delicious. It's a perfect balance of ingredients, especially with the red bean as well. I'm docking a star though because it's cash only, which is super inconvenient.
author: Sophia H.

description: Tastes good. Especially when you add banana with ice cream.^O^ Remember to being cash, they only accept cash.
author: Vivian S.

description:
Again, one of those places where I don't understand the hype.

They don't allow photos...what the heck!

You just said goodbye to all your tourists and foodies.

Got the mandarin orange and lychee gelatto crepe.  Above average but not worth close to $8.

PS
There's no where to sit or enjoy your food other than in the center area of the plaza....awkward and not intimate...
author: David W.

description: My girlfriend and I ordered two crepes and after he gave me my receipt I gave it to her to hold on to and go find a seat. I waited in the little shop for our crepes and when it came time for them to call my number I went to get them and they gave me a dirty look and said I could not get it without a receipt (no one else had shown one before me). So I angrily called my girlfriend over who is white and not black like myself and when she said she was order 95, they gave her our food without asking for the receipt. I was disrespected and a victim of blatant racism and even though their crepes are good, I will not be giving my money to this establishment that disrespects their customers based on skin color. Shameful coming from other people of color themselves.
author: Donovan H.

description:
I ended up going to Sophie's Crepes right after Belly Good during my last day in SF. Sophie's Crepes was an actual store. With double the reviews compared to Belly Good, there was a decent line with also a "no photography" sign.  

Sophie's Crepes is trendy and simple. I ordered #17 Japanese -  green tea gelato, red bean paste, and maccha sauce. The crepe was indeed thinner and slightly crispy compared to Belly Good. I don't like overly sweet desserts but Sophie's Crepes didn't satisfy my sweet tooth at all. The red bean paste tasted healthy and the maccha sauce was a bit bitter. Maybe I should've ordered #18 which also comes with whipped cream. Hard to give 5 stars to a place that I've only been to once but compared to Four Leaf Tea and Crepes in LA, I give Sophie's Crepes 4 stars.
author: Marika T.

description: Yum! We got the Japanese matcha crepe and it was so goos! The green tea gelato was so creamy and the red bean Gabe a nice texture and contrast. The crepe was chewy and nice and warm. A little pricey at 4.50 but worth it!
author: Jane H.

description: The food itself is pretty good. I came on a Saturday it was pretty packed, there was a line of like 3-4 people out the door, but it didn't take that long to get to the front. I got a mixed fruit crepe, it has strawberries, kiwi, and bananas in it. I ask if I could substitute the banana for a different fruit because I 'm not a huge fan of them, and they said I have to pay extra which I felt was weird. It comes with 3 fruits why should it matter if I want to change one of the fruits another....the lady at the front didn't even want to explain it to me. I've never eaten there before and didn't know anything about their rules, and she was being rude about. I just told her to leave the bananas then. (I don't hate bananas I would rather have to eat it with the fruit I like). I went to pay( I was going to use my card). Then she told me in an annoyed voice they don't accept card and they only accept cash. Luckily I had some cash on me, but I don't remember seeing a sign saying that....maybe they do, but I really didn't see one. They do have a sign saying not to take pictures in the shop thou....I thought that was weird. Also, no one working there was wearing gloves which is just unsanitary. I there's only 2 table inside which makes it kinda cramped. I don't think I'll be going there again. Not trying to bash them the food is good, but I think you can find a place just as good. Crepe are good, but their service is horrible, it's cramped, and I feel like people working with food need to wear gloves. I think there's another crepe place in the Japantown Mall with a higher review on yelp, I live like 4 hours from San Fran, so it kinda sucked that I had to have that experience.
author: Alilish S.

description: Amazing! Got a strawberry nutella crepe with mocha chip gelato on top, it was fricken delicious. After eating it I was stuffed but totally wanted to order another. Wish it wasn't so far away :(. Now I need to find a good alternative in San Jose!
author: Kenny N.

description: Worth that huge line I had to wait in super cheap I decided to get a veggie crepe and it was great my friends got strawberry banana and they loved it too awesome place try if you haven't already!
author: Talal L.

description: Went back last month and the place was as busy as usual and as great as ever! Had the strawberry, banana, nutella with ice cream and whipped topping. Sophie's never disappoints, oh! Except for the one time we flew in on a Monday and they are closed that day! Never noticed it before, but it's forever etched in my brain!
author: Joanne S.

description: The black sesame and green tea ice cream are great! However, for two scoops of ice cream, it is pretty pricey (~$5)!
author: JaeMin K.

description:
OK, I do have to give it the 4 stars because the huzbeau loved it.  He likes Sophie's better than Belly Good because they make their crepes crispy on the edges.  Here's a picture: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cegatrLOnlyeSgDpYOua2g?select=qbVwiW2JNCX6xJkkvIjIQw#zkKSKVzlfPe-sYClAf0trA

This was a true taste test because we're FATTIES like that and tried both places on the same day.  http://www.yelp.com/biz/belly-good-cafe-and-crepes-san-francisco#hrid:StR4N0gPyxGfu19mwI5kgg/src:self
If you are not familiar with Japantown, these two creperies are only a few paces away  from each other in the Kintetsu Mall, with Sophie's next to the large bookstore.

But what's up with the arrogant "no-cameras" policy?  You can see the guy making the crepe at the window, and its not like they do anything spectacular.  Meh.  I'd take a half a star off just for that, but I'd have round it back up anyway.  Cash only, and there really is a line any time of the day.
author: Teresa P.

description: Delicious! Every time I'm in San Fran I make a special trip over to Japan town for this lovely treat. There isn't any customer service or even a nice place to sit but the crepes and ice cream never disappoint!
author: Candice F.

description:
I love how you can watch them make the crepes while you wait for your food. The smell is intoxicating and pretty much forces you to buy a crepe. I also love the concept of putting gelato in your crepe. Nice idea and really popular place with long lines. 

I thought that the crepes were way over priced for what you got. I wanted a simple Nutella and strawberry crepe and it was about $6 with hardly any Nutella!
author: Erica C.

description:
PROs: Tasty and fairly quick.
CONs: Requires cash and a bit overpriced for the product.

We had lunch and strolled over here because of the good reviews. It was certainly good but not the best crepe I've ever had and there wasn't enough seating inside (sat outside in the plaza area). Also tried to take a picture of the people making crepes and was rudely waved off. Hadn't notice the "no pictures" sign. Kind of stupid since it would be promoting their business...it's not like they are using some proprietary technology. Had a banana and nutella crepe. It was a bit light on bananas and had only a thin layer of nutella (didn't cover everything). 

Not a bad place to stop if you are digging a crepe but there are plenty of other great dessert options around the mall, like the mochi and cupcakes.
author: William D.

description:
The sweet aroma wafting from this shop draws me in every time. Very hard to resist . This is my favorite creperie place to go to when I visit San Francisco  Japantown! The Fiorello Gelato is delicious. 
My favorite flavor is black sesame. 
For the crepes, so many combinations to choose from, savory and sweet or create your own.
We ordered the #7  strawberry whip cream with mocha chip, and #17 green tea Gelato with red bean. So incredibly yummy!  Can't wait for my next trip back!
By the way bring cash. This is a cash only establishment.
author: Irene K.

description:
This place is awesome. I don't think I've had a crepe this good in ages. The customer service is really good. The people making the crepes are fast and they don't burn them, and they aren't  overly dry and crumbly. I'm boring so I  just got one with Nutella and strawberries. 

It's a really busy little shop and sometimes the lines are out the door. This proves that they are a number one rated top notch crepe shop. People will go far and wide if they have a place that is good.

I'm going to become a regular here, I can tell.
author: Jamie S. R.

description: Unique spot in J-town that almost seems more J-authentic than the recently mushroomed and ubiquitous ramen and udon shops everywhere. Don't be fooled by the spartan decor and simple menu as the staff deliver a mean and clean crêpe. In my case, I was in the mood for savory instead of the more popular sweet options. I took the ham, cheese and avo with a dob of Japanese mayo. The crêpe was cooked to perfection-- a tad crispy on the edges but moist and spongy throughout. The real litmus test though was the avocado. Attention to detail or lack thereof can make or break a dish especially if the avo is too ripe and begins to taste like fetid, rotten bacon. But in my case, the avocado was perfectly ripe, firm enough to have the pleasant avo texture yet soft enough to blend in with the other ingredients upon a bite. I must have devoured the entire crepe in five minutes or less as the attendant didn't believe how fast it was gone. Best time to come is around 2p to avoid the long lines, but then again, this could be a prime people watching spot if you are into the fascinating J-town scene.
author: Brian J.

description:
1000+ reviews, and I'm still going to put in my 2 cents.

RED BEAN GELATO CREPE. $4 before tax.

Crepe. Thin. Crispy. Muted. Warm. Comforting.

Gelato. Bold. Cold. Delicious. Melted. Messy.

Perfect.

UPDATE (4/23/13): To me, Sophie's is better than Belly Good, especially for ice cream crepes. As most people have said, Sophie's crepes are thinner and crispier, which perfectly complements any and all ice cream and gelato fillings. Belly Good's crepes are much doughier and soggier, which drowns out the textural difference of the ice cream. If I wanted to eat a pancake, I'd go to a pancake house. Oh, and Sophie's serves gelato.
author: Adele F.

description: I love the dessert crepes here. The texture of the crepes are perfect, and their ice cream/sorbet... delicious! I usually get a crepe filled with nutella, strawberries and topped with green tea ice cream or raspberry sorbet. LOVE IT!!! The long lines however do deter me from going sometimes. I've been here once where they told me my crepe would take an hour, so I just left..... X_X BUT, that only happened once. All the other times, it was a fair wait. Must try!
author: Louisa T.

description: Haven't been here for a while. Had strawberry and Nutella for 5. Kind of pricy for a dessert crepe but its still so good. Its crispy at the top but soft you eat toward the middle and end. I was lucky enough to come on a day where there wasn't a lot of people so they gave me a lot of strawberry from top to bottom and their strawberries are big slices. The chocolate goes well with the strawberries.
author: Julie N.

description:
CASH only is bad business. Hiding from the IRS knowing that you have a very popular place. 

The ingredients, let's face it. The only thing you can't do is the crepe cake flour and maybe the machine. Just really think about it. 

Nothing extraordinary about this crepe joint and I have eaten better. 

Cheers!
author: Neo N.

description:
This place serves up somewhat similar cone crepes to Genki Crepes out over in the Richmond in either sweet or savory. I personally prefer it in the form of the former. Fruit and ice cream is always an ideal treat for me. 

We stopped by on a Monday and was extremely disappointed to see the gates drawn instead of happy patrons walking out stuffing their faces with a sweet, delicious treat. Yet another place that is closed on Mondays. 

Lesson learned. Whenever you get a craving on a Monday check to make sure the place is opened before driving across the city for it.
author: Esther A.

description: Had the crepe with green tea gelato and the gelato was just simply great!! Thick, creamy, tasty!!! Business is pretty popular but waiting time acceptable. However I realized that the staff preparing the crepe and the staff wrapping it were not wearing gloves. Just thought it would be more hygienic if they do. Nonetheless, this place is highly recommended as a after meal dessert place in Japan town!
author: Nina J.

description:
Thin, crispy, fresh, tasty crepes! What's not to love about this place! 
Just wished they would take cards but it is cash only!
author: Eri H.

description:
Ever since going to sophie's crepes on saturday, I've been craving them. 

Nestled in a building in Japan town, sophie's is a FIND. absolutely delicious crepes with pick-your-own fillings. Anything from avocado to chicken to nutella to fruits to gelato.  The batter for the crepe reminds me of asian buttermilk powder. it's absolutely delicious and they put it in a cute little cone for you to bring outside if needed.  My friend and I each ordered a savory and a sweet (with gelato, of course). they were so good that we ended up each ordering one more to go.  Everything came under $15 (for 3 crepes!)

Only downside is they only have 2 crepe pans going, so it does take a few minutes to get your order.  The people there are also a bit stingy - asked for an extra cup and they wanted to charge 20 cents.  The place is cash only but there is an ATM machine inside.
author: Alice Z.

description:
The crepes are beautifully made and are very good with fresh chopped fruit. I'm not a fan of overly sugarly sweets but Sophie's makes it just right.

My only reason for the 3 stars is for customer service which can make anything taste bad or good.

Now I have come here before and customer service is usually friendly enough. I went today during the J-pop summit. I understand that the place was crowded with orders coming in by the second and that the employees were dead tired, but that does not mean that they could take their frustration out on me. The cashier saw me taking out one dollar bills (all I had) and muttered under his breath "and don't be all day about it..." In a rude manner.

TL;DR Great fresh crepes but sometimes rude service.
author: Chi H.

description:
I like the crepes here. Yelp is also for customer service reviewing so this is for the Asian guy wearing the cap backward working at the counter Sunday night Nov 16, 2014 around 7:30PM. We waited for our turn to come up to the counter, he non-verbally asked for what we wanted with his chin up and threw his hand up gangster style. wth...? At first I thought this was like between brother and brother, you know, like wassup dog but non-verbally, but it turned out that somehow he was very aggressive... WTH... So we told him what we wanted, paid with cash and then he was like "No ice cream??" then he violently threw us back some coins on the tray, some of the coins bounced to the floor. He didn't even say sorry nor looked at us in our faces the whole time. I picked up the coins and walked out of the store confusingly waiting for our crepes. I just didn't want ice cream...

Anyway, the people manning the kitchen section were very cool and friendly though. The Hispanic guy who was flipping the crepes professionally, the tall Asian dude calling the numbers with his very friendly voice and the Asian girl who was helping those two.These are cool people with many smiles.

By the way, the sweet crepes that we got were really good. Loved them.
author: Minty R.

description:
I've been visiting this place for almost ten years and it's my favorite crepe place. The prices have gone up since then. But, the taste remains consistent. I personally prefer any of the sweet crepes, since I do not like savory crepes. You can also design your own crepes with extra charges for different toppings. I usually get the Mixed Fruit Crepe, which cost 6.00$+tax. 

Sophie's Crepes only accepts cash. There's a BOA ATM nearby and cash back is available at Nijiya Market if you're shopping there.
author: Elaine S.

description:
Delicious crepes to be had in Japantown!  This place has a lot of gelato to go along with the crepes.  There were Asian flavors (black sesame, green tea, red bean, etc.) along with traditional flavors (cookies and cream, pistachio, etc).

You can watch them make the crepe in front of you.  They scoop out some batter onto a circular griddle (?) and it bakes right before your eyes.  The whipped cream comes out of some bag.  It is pretty awesome whipped cream but they do charge you $1.00 extra for it, which seems a little pricey.

I got a cookies and cream gelato crepe with whipped cream.  Total was around $5-$6.  Very delicious!
author: Danielle C.

description: Whenever I go to Japan Town in SF, I always stops by at this place to get the dessert. They only accept cash though but the crepe is definitely worth trying. Also, I ordered Nutella-Banana plus green tea ice cream! It is the perfect taste that you should try. Also, they make right in front of you so it is perfectly honest about their food. You should definitely try this place :)
author: Alice C.

description: The line was huge on the weekend. After finally getting my mixed fruits and whip cream crepe, I was not impressed with it. The crepes were dry, with little fruits and only the whip cream. Nothing special.
author: Aigerim N.

description:
Finally, find a crispy crepe!!! We order mixed fruit + Nutella. They add a lot of fruit, so even the last bite is full of strawberry. 

But be aware of the line, it's  crazy...like 1 hour wait from ordering to get the food.
author: Peggy S.

description:
Oh LAWD! The crepes here are my absolute favorite.

I love the way you get to hold the crepes in your hand instead of eating it with a fork and on a plate.

I love the ambiance around it. Come on, your in san francisco and in japan town. After eating some ramen there,  you can get some crepes. If your not eating, your probably shopping around.

My favorite here is the green tea ice cream crepe with nutella, strawberries and whip cream. ^_^ mmmmm!
author: Serggio A.

description:
My favorite is #17, Japanese. It has green tea gelato, red bean paste, and some sauce. It's just all so good! $5.75 

It's better than your average Genki.
author: Jess W.

description: I came to Sophie's Crepes highly recommended, and I left with a pretty good portion of a strawberry, vanilla ice cream crepe that was very average. The service was pretty good and while there was really nothing wrong with the crepe itself, there was nothing special about it. The crepe itself was a little too hard (I like it a little more chewy) and the vanilla ice cream and strawberries tasted very average. For me personally, there's so much more delicious food in San Francisco, I'd rather go eat something more memorable.
author: Lalida S.

description:
I'm a crepe master and I think these crepes are pretty average. 

The gelato/ice cream option is a nice addition, but in reality it's still just a crepe and the several times I've come here nothing has super stood out. 

The pricing is a little eh for what you get, but I guess in SF it's not unexpected. The crepes are on the crunchy side and you have to hold them in the cone, which is not my style, so keep that in mind. Disclaimer: I totally let some stuff drop everytime I pitifully try and eat from the cone...but I pick it up! But such a waste...so sad.

Anyways, might as well stop by if you are in Japan Town and want to get some dessert.
author: Eric S.

description:
4.5 STARS but I'm rounding up! :)

SOPHIE'S IS AWESOME!! I love the consistency of the (sweet) crepes offered at Sophies. The crepe skin is perfectly thin, and the fruits are fresh! I remember the skin being more crispy a few years ago... but the one I had last night was still yummy regardless! These crepes never cease to fail me and I would probably eat one everyday if I lived closer to Sophies. The gelato here is also delicious. It's smooth and flavorful! Crepes, fruits, nutella, whipped cream, and gelato makes for a great combo! :) Though you're gonna feel a bit guilty afterwards, but hey, at least you're eating your serving of fruits! 

CASH ONLY.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Fresh perspective.

Almost eight years after my first visit with barely any details it was time for a return. Borderline disinterested staff did not make a good first impression.

Then came the delicious crêpes.

One with turkey, tomato, sprouts and lettuce. Another with red bean paste and strawberries. Both a very reasonable $2 base plus $1 per ingredient. 

Fresh four stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
There isn't much to say except that this is a pretty solid crepe place. It's not your super fancy crepe fix but its solid and tastes good. You can customize what you want in your crepe or get one of their suggested crepe mix on their menus. The pricing is okay slightly more expensive then what i would want to pay. But overall I'd say give this place a go! If you don't like this place there is a another crepe place called belly good crepes in the same building where the crepes feature cute kawaii characters! 
For some weird reason there are no pictures allowed I don't  know why but just a heads up.
author: Shelly C.

description: I use to love coming to Sophie's Crepes as a kid and thought they made the best crepes in San Francisco. I've gotten older and have tried other crepe places, and I have to say their crepes are OK. I like my crepes crunchy, but not too crunchy to the point where pieces are breaking off every time I take a bite. Unfortunately, this is the case with Sophie's Crepes. I like that they have a window for people to watch the workers make crepes. The service is pretty good and I would stop by if im in Japantown, but I would never go out of my way to get crepes from Sophies.
author: Kelly S.

description:
2.5 stars.

AMBIANCE: Always crowded with a line out the door, there isn't much to Sophie's Crepes' ambiance.  Most people grab and go, while a few loiter outside with their sweet treats.

SERVICE: BAD.  I get the terseness-- the staff look harried as they try and make the line snaking out the door move as fast as possible.  HOWEVER, the person manning the register has been consistently rude... especially when informing patrons of unavailable items AFTER they have paid for them!  Substitutions will probably cost you extra, though they won't inform you, only tell you the final total.  LAME.

FOOD: EL loves this place for the Japanese style crepes.  They essentially taste like uber thin waffle cones (lucky if you get a crispier one!), especially if you order something with ice cream in it.  

OVERALL: The crepes taste fine, but they don't make up for the terrible customer service.  Come if you really want a Japanese style crepe, but don't expect any niceties or smiles from the staff.
author: Susanna W.

description:
3.5 stars for this place. 

I was particularly impressed by how quickly my crepe was made. I ordered, and while I was paying my crepe was already made. 

The crepes are a little too crispy for me. I personally prefer softer crepes, but I guess if you like crispier crepes then this is the place for you. The crepes themselves are not very big either. I had no trouble just biting the crepes instead of having to use a fork/spoon. I definitely felt like they could have given me more ice cream and strawberries for the price I paid.

On another note, the ice cream in my crepe started to melt so I asked for a plate. They told me they didn't have any plates... which is a little unusual for a dessert cafe.
author: Victoria L.

description:
Hands down the best Japanese crepe place in the Bay Area!! I can't get over how tasty the whole thing put together- a fresh crepe with mixed fruits, nuttela, gelato (A MUST) and whipped cream. TO DIE FOR!! Living down in San Jose, I always crave for this crepe and have to fix the craving whenever I get a chance going to the city. 

Keep in mind it's CASH ONLY! Although I saw an ATM inside the place.
author: Julie P.

description: I love savory, but sweet crepes are a weakness of mine! I have not visited a crepe place that offers gelato in the crepe, so I was excited to try the Butter, Cinnamon & Sugar crepe with Pistachio gelato; perfection! I couldn't stop until it was gone. The shop is adorable, and the staff was very friendly! It was awesome to be able to watch them create the crepe while waiting.
author: Kuhray V.

description: Crepe is crispy!!! So good!! Try green tea ice-cream with red bean sauce... the best combination in the world...
author: Dorothy L.

description:
This place is amazing! I've ordered their green tea ice cream alone and their Japanese Matcha Crepe (it comes with green tea ice cream, red bean paste and matcha sauce).
