The crepe is crispy and tasty offering a good complement to the soft, cold ice cream. The matcha sauce and red bean paste offer the right flavors to add to the whole experience.

This is my favorite place for sweet crepes and it won't disappoint!
author: Lillian C.

description: First time here.  Went in midday and there was no line.  I ordered the japanese crepe with added strawberries and it was "soooooooo tasty"  (monster hunter ref anyone?)!!!
author: M G.

description:
Great selection of gelato, but only had one flavor of ice cream which was from Smart and Final (First Street.) The fruit was fresh and tasted good, but we would have enjoyed it a bit more if we had some more options. 

Great place to go to if in the area but there are better Creperies in San Francisco.
author: Krish P.

description:
The best crepes in San Francisco, hands down. I might be biased because I'm Asian, and when you tell me I can get a crepe with black sesame ice cream...I would probably cut you off and start sprinting towards Sophie's Crepes immediately.

Crepes + ice cream is already a winner but crepes + ASIAN ice cream is downright one of the best fusion of cultures ever!!
author: Esther Y.

description:
The crepes are great. They have a slight crunchy texture, which I personally like, and there are lots of options to choose from, from savory to sweet. On the weekdays, they aren't usually busy, but there can be long lines on the weekends.
The spoons are, and have always been, really flimsy. Back then, the edges of the spoons made my lips bleed, but I haven't noticed that recently. Don't know if they changed the spoons though, since they're still super flimsy.

Also, it's cash only, which can be annoying, but whatever.

The real reason I'm deducting 2 stars is not because it's cash only, or because of the spoons, but because of this one rude cashier. They don't wear name tags, so I hate to describe her, but if the employees or management are reading this then they really should be aware. The rude employee was a slightly chubby Asian girl with a blue bandana (but they probably all wear bandanas?) who wears/wore her long black hair in a low ponytail. She couldn't hear my order so she asked me to repeat it, which was fine. But when I wanted to double check that my order came with a crepe (as opposed to a cup), she was like "uh... yeah..." with a face and voice that told me I was stupid. My boyfriend even agreed that she was pretty rude to us. I work in customer service and this was appalling! Yes, customers can and do ask stupid questions, but you at least have to pretend to be nice. Give your employees a lesson on customer service before you even let them work!
author: Kirsten L.

description:
Every time I come to SF Japantown, I always get a crepe from here. It's that good. Strawberry with whip cream crepe is delicious and plentiful! Their gelato is also quite good, I tried the red bean and matcha.

Parking - you can park for free on the streets a few blocks away from japantown.
author: Annie H.

description:
The crepes are good but is it really worth the 30+ minutes wait to get your crepe on a weekend? I don't think so.

I would say this place is a little over-hyped. 
It is true that the the crepe shell is very light yet crispy.
It is also true that the filling are all fresh and delicious.

The service on the other hand left much to be desired. 10 minutes waiting in line to place order. Another 25 minutes waiting for my crepe to be made. There were exactly 10 orders in front of mine. With 2 chefs working that means it takes them an average of 5 minutes to make one simple crepe! They could certainly streamline some their operations. With such a long wait I was expecting something a little more magical. (Keep this mind this is coming from someone who waited 3 hours for an egg tart at Golden Gate Bakery) oh well...  

Still a 4 stars review because my crepe was tasty. Their gelato was also very delicious. Note to self - maybe I will pass on the crepe and just get gelato here next time since the wait would be shorter.
author: Mona W.

description: Intense green tea gelato crepe for less than $5?  Minus one star because the young man at the cash register wasn't very friendly.
author: Food S.

description:
Sophie's has been my favorite crepe place growing up. I think I started coming here when I was 13 or 14--definitely before I found out what nutella or good food was. I still remember my best friend at the time becoming incredulous when I said that I didn't like nutella when I just didn't know what it was because I never had nutella growing up. 

I use to wonder if Sophie's Crepes was a chain because of the branding! Super well done. 

Sophie's use to be really good. I've come here again recently and I must say, the quality isn't as good as it once was. Before, they would spread the ingredients out throughout the crepe but now it's all weird an haphazardly placed. I wish the Japanese lady (that I dubbed as "Sophie") would come here more often to kick people into gear :( she's probably overseeing the new location near the ballpark. Oh well. 

These have been my favorite over the years
* California Crepe
* Mixed Fruits Nutella
* Mixed Fruits Whipped Cream
* Strawberries with Whipped Cream

This place was once the best Japanese styled crepes in the city. So sad to see it deteriorate.

Japanese crepes are normally half as small as the ones here though.
author: Margaret S.

description: When I go to Japantown, I try to stop by here to get my gelato/crepe fix. Tried their black sesame, green tea, and red bean gelato and all were great! The crepe itself is nice and tender! They're great to carry around and eat while walking in Japantown's shopping center. I wish the gelato was just a little more creamy and that the flavors were a little stronger, but overall, you can't go wrong with Sophie's.
author: Trisha V.

description:
Sophie's Crepes has honestly ruined any other crepe place for me.  Yes, it's that good.  It's the crepe itself.  It is paper thin, crispy, lightly flavored.  Sooo delicious...  Did I just have a foodgasm?

I haven't yet tried the savory crepes, but my family and I usually go here for dessert after eating somewhere inside Japantown.  My favorite is the Japantown special.  I forget all of its ingredients.  What stands out is the green tea ice cream and red bean.

Location, it is inside Japantown, Kinokuniya Mall, 2nd floor, right next to Izumiya.  Parking is plentiful if you use the garage, which is extremely reasonably priced as far as parking garages go.  It's a small shop with a few tables, but not many people even use them.  There are a few benches in a court right outside where many usually gather informally.  For me, it's a perfect way to round off a very casual, very laid back and a very content kind of night.

Enjoy!
author: Juliet L.

description:
Best crepes.

It's always fun to go there drunk and make small talk w/ the master creper!  Make funny faces to him while he's flippin my jack~!  

Strawberry, bananas, nutella, and vanilla ice cream please!

I went on a friday night at about 8pm and had to wait about 20 minutes to experience my heaven....and oh it's so great!

I'll be back...drunker next time!  =P
author: Janet L.

description:
You never forget your first time. 

I wasn't expecting it to be good considering my inexperience, but I figured it'd get better with repetition. After trying it numerous times with different people in different places - because I'll admit, I was addicted - my first remains one of the best I ever had.

He and I got banana and nutella, plus a scoop of vanilla ice cream for extra fun and pleasure. Control was in his hands as we went in and out for a taste of overwhelming ecstasy each time. Liquid began seeping out from the bottom. I made a wet mess all over the place and had to lick it clean. We kept up a steady back-and-forth rhythm that only quickened as we approached the end. 

It was sad when I finally finished eating my first handheld dessert crepe, but I'm excited for more shared desserts here with my best friend!
author: Tanya A.

description: Although the crepes here are good, its the price point of their products that takes away from the enjoyment of eating a crepe.  2 for a scoop of nutella and 1.5 extra for a whole banana. if it was like a dollar more for nutella, .75 for the bananas then I think it would be worth while. 3 stars from me is what I give it.
author: Michael M.

description:
The crepes here are not as yummi-soft as Genki, but the gelato quality here really does bring their crepes up a notch! The coconut, the black sesame, and the lychee are all super tasty! Prices are a little high, with a crepe being about 4-5 dollars and a scoop of gelato bringing it up another $2 - **BUT REALLY, DON'T GET A CREPE WITHOUT THE ICE CREAM!** This is a great once-in-a-while treat, so take the dive! Thanks BF for treating ;P

P.S. Cash Only.
author: Lana N.

description:
3 stars because they have the shittiest customer service and I was literally forced to tip without my knowledge or being informed in anyway. The girl taking my order was rude as hell and they didn't know who's order was who's. Which was annoying as hell. 

Other than that, the food was pretty damn good. Good enough for me to ignore the shit ass service and get food their again. 

I got the Nutella, banana, and green tea ice cream crepe.
author: Maygan B.

description: Black Sesame ice cream...that's why this place gets 5 stars!  If you never had it, TRY IT!
author: C L.

description:
Best Crepes in SF!

When in Japantown this is a must stop for us.  To be honest though I've never actually ordered a savory crepe from here.   Their sweet crepes are the best though!  Light and fluffy.... so delicious. 

Highly suggest getting the J (Banana, chocolate sauce, fresh cream and vanilla ice cream) , but switch out the chocolate sauce for nutella.  Reeeeeeaaaaaaal good. 

Also don't forget, take plenty of napkins and a spoon, you'll need it.  

The biggest problem with this place is that there's no real sit down area.  The best thing to do is to sit at the plants outside in front of the place.   

Pro tip: Ask for a cup of water from them with your order.  Helps break up the crepe so its not sickly sweet.
author: Maggie F.

description:
yum yum yum. as others have said, cash only (though there is an ATM). I enjoyed my crepe with jam, and added whipped cream and ice cream to it. The "cone style" is convenient for eating on the go while you browse the rest of the mall.

Eat the ice cream and other goodies that you choose with a spoon until you get it thin enough to eat in your hands like a sandwich. Otherwise, you might get the overflow from biting into the crepe all over your mouth. Then my friends and I will make fun of you for not mentioning to your girlfriend that she has whipped cream all around her lips by making really bad puns/innuendos/immature jokes.
author: Darren P.

description: We got a strawberry chocolate crepe and thought it was ok. My kids thought there was too much whipped cream, and they love whipped cream. I thought the crepe seemed a little thin and dry.
author: Vince L.

description:
Absolutely LOVE ittttttttt here. I visited here from Los Angeles a few weeks ago. Reminds me of a local spot in LA called Genki Living. Very friendly staff, VERY reasonably priced, very delicious. Enjoyed it down to the last bite!!! It's located in the Japantown Mall. I really hope Little Tokyo here in Los Angeles eventually gets a Japanese crepe spot. The nearest ones are in Rowland Heights and Beverly Hills currently. 

Anyway, when I return to San Francisco (planning to actually relocate here soon), this will definitely be one of my go-to spots for Japanese-style crepes =)
author: Divinite L.

description:
This has got to be one of the BEST desert Crepe places I've been to but kind of pricey. 
I ordered a Mixed fruit Crepe (bananas, strawberries, and kiwi) and added a scoop of green tea gelato for and extra $2 (SO WORTH IT... it was ridiculously good). The fruits were fresh and the crepe itself was crispy and flaky. 
That entire cone of goodness was about $7 and the wait time was pretty fast. Service was good and the staff was very friendly. 
Only reason I gave it 4 stars because its CASH ONLY... which annoys me because I don't carry cash but non the less, one of the best crepes I had but a little expensive.
author: Emmellin T.

description: One star ONLY for the friendly and efficient service. Otherwise, this place would get No stars! I went here over belly good cafe because of yelp reviews and this is the first time I've been let down so badly. Hands down this was the very worst crepe I have eaten in my entire life and believe me, I am no stranger to a crepe au Nutella! This was shockingly bad. The crepe was so overcooked that it crackled when I bit into it. It literally sucked the spit out of my mouth it was so dry. And if that weren't bad enough, it had a smattering of Nutella. The chocolate and hazelnut was barely visible yet tasted. Real shame. I'm very sad about this experience.
author: Tera K.

description:
After revisiting Sophie's today, I've decided to add one whole star to the rating. Although the crepe itself was still thinner than Ryno's and Cynthia's, it was better and slightly softer than Genki. My mixed fruit with nutella and black sesame gelato was really outstanding. The use of rich and dense gelato to intertwine with a cohort of kiwi slices, strawberries, and bananas was awesome and the addition of nutella just put the entire crepe over the top delicious. Talking about smackin' crepe superiority! 

So what made the difference in this experience? They placed the scoop of gelato right at the center with plenty of fresh fruits. At the bottom, they even placed a gigantic whole strawberry to give an extra oomph to the finish line. To add to the surprise, the mix of bananas and black sesame really complimented each other. I loved it! It was one fun and furious ride and I almost ate the cardboard--oops. I would certainly love to do it again!

So why is this place not a 4.5 or 5 stars? In addition to the thin outer layer, how about being expensive when compares to other Asian crepe places?! My crepe was $5.25 and the addition of gelato cost me another two whole bucks! I must say though, that the quality of the gelato was what sent me to crepe heaven this afternoon for a few hours of sugar high. Service was brief and friendly. Cash only and no cameras allowed in the store--not a good way to treat their fans. 4 cautious stars for the noticeable improvements. I hope to come back to try their crepe with other gelato flavors such as red beans, green tea, pistachio, and banana walnut.

If they only have taro gelato...
author: Daniel L.

description:
Revisiting Sophie's after places like Genki's and Tuttimelon, I have to take a star away. 

The crepe itself is very thin. Crunchy rather fluffy like other places. Its still delicious when eaten with ice cream, but lets just say there's room for improvement. ANDDDD I think they're starting to skimp on the filling. So more ice cream and yummy goodness wouldn't hurt either. =D

Their gelato is still fabulous. Flavor to try: Banana Walnut, recommended by my friend and now me! Banana flavored gelato with walnut. Subtle banana flavor with bits of crunchy walnut. Yum!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cegatrLOnlyeSgDpYOua2g?select=dTNgO_SGKs_PY-AY6QDnYw
author: Marti L.

description: Came here for the first time today and I love it, just so you know this place is in the back and pretty tiny with a only 3 tables. I recommend that if you have a large group to eat outside. One of the best crepe I've tasted gosh I'm from LA and this hands down one of the best in Japan town.  I got the mixed fruit with Nutella and vanilla ice cream, freaken full of awesomeness. I will definitely stop by here again when I come by again.
author: Mable H.

description:
Yummy crepes, and they do a good job with the outside crepe part-- it's always made fresh, and they bake it on the crispier side, which I prefer.  

I've tried Strawberry Banana Whip and Strawberry Banana Nutella Whip.  I'd say with Nutella it gets a little cloyingly sweet, but just fruits and whip is always good :)  Prices is are reasonable, with a strawberry banana whip crepe being only a little over $5.00

Cash only!
author: Alice S.

description:
I give up going here. I asked for a softer crepe, and they gave me a dry overcooked flaking off crepe. I always go to Belly Good Crepes over them but they were closed. and that's the only time they get my business and they still disappoint.

customer service is terrible. they are not even friendly. just robots taking orders and making crepes. they have no care in the products they make unlike the other crepe place in Japantown. 

they get one star because savory crepes are available. they don't allow you to take pictures. posted sign on window. like they are afraid of you stealing their secret. no thanks. I would never come here again.
author: Jules L.

description:
Every time we're near here, we've already eaten lunch and are definitely not up for adding more on top of what we've just eaten, yet we always say "we need to have a crepe!"  Yesterday, we actually planned it out to get some walking in after lunch so we'd have some appetite for dessert. It worked, and we went over the menu before deciding on strawberry/nutella and banana/whipped cream/chocolate sauce crepes.

Some of the crepes I saw coming out of this place are large and stuffed full of goodies, looking more like an ice cream cone than anything else. Unlike what you get on a plate, this is a piece of crepe dough kind of formed into an ice cream cone shape and you eat it similarly. This meant of course that we got nutella and whipped cream all over (grab some napkins!) and the dough is a little stiffer than you'd expect, but really, who eats these things for the dough? It's the goodness inside that counts!

Delicious, fresh fruit, amazing combinations of flavour, this is definitely worth going to. It was light and didn't make me feel like I'd overeaten on anything super sweet or rich. Mine could have used a bit more nutella, but overall it was a great snack.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
CASH ONLY!!

There's only one thing I always order, and that's a gelato crepe. SO. GOOD. om nom nom. I've only tried their black sesame and green tea gelato, and both are fragrant and delicious. The crepe is crispy on the edge, and then fluffy towards the middle.

Be warned, it's usually pretty busy. I came here again during the Japantown Cherry Blossom Festival and I waited about 45 minutes. By the time I got mine, the line was SUPER long. In general though, it's not too bad of a wait.

GREAT spot for dessert :9 sooo yummyyy
author: Amanda L.

description:
I like this place over Belly and Genki (even though both are very good). 

My usual is the classic banana and nutella with vanilla icecream topped with whip. Boring but hits the spot every single time! 

Note. It's Cash only but there is an ATM inside the shop.
author: Emily Y.

description:
Thank goodness my mom was craving dessert, because otherwise, we would have never tried this place. I've been here when I was younger, but I don't remember how good it was. This time, we ordered the Japanese crepe and the Strawberry w/ chocolate sauce crepe.

- Japanese crepe: comes with green tea ice cream, red bean, green tea sauce, whipped cream. So simple, yet so delicious. There's something about their ice cream that is just more milky and refreshing than normal. The red bean with the green tea...can't get any better than that. Absolutely wonderful. Their whipped cream was so rich and creamy, it just paired well with everything. The crepe was really thin and crispy, which paired amazingly with the condiments inside. 

- Strawberry w/ chocolate sauce: vanilla ice cream, strawberries, chocolate sauce, whipped cream. While I like the Japanese crepe better personally, this crepe was also pretty good. A bit more on the sweet side. It's also pretty rich. This was still pretty good. Similar to a strawberry shortcake kind of taste, but instead of shortcake, you have the delicious crispiness of the crepe. Worth a try!

I also had a sample of their lychee gelato. There was this really delicious milky aftertaste that I wanted to savor in my mouth forever. I'm definitely coming back in the future!
author: Cindy Y.

description:
Just about the best japanese style crepe I had!! Don't get me wrong Belly Good crepes was delish too but omg, the crust is so thin and crunchy. 

I'm really jealous of you Californians and the abundance of crepe culture you guys get! I wish NYC had just as much. There's so much creativity and variety in the crepes offered here. Savory to sweet, and found almost anywhere! Taraval, Japantown, Chinatown, etc etc. I wish NYC took the creperie industry as serious as you guys!!

So of course I got the green tea gelato crepe since green tea's my favorite and it seems like it's a signature of sophie's! It was sooo good! I loved watching them make the crepe and knowing that it'll be hot and fresh unlike some other places I've tried in SF (cough cough) I loved the combination of red bean and green tea. Both complimented each other very well.  I have to say, my mouth was getting a bit of a brain freeze from the coldness of the gelato but it was so good!! 

My friend got the mixed fruits crepe with mango gelato and he said the fruits were super fresh!

Now the question is, WHY CAN'T YOU COME TO NYC SOPHIE!?
author: Virginia Y.

description:
Delicious!! And you can get whatever the hell you want in your crepe~ :9 There's almost always a line so expect a little bit of a wait, even though the staff are quick. 

CASH ONLY! There's an ATM in the shop in case you forget.
author: Mirae C.

description: Best crepe EVER! I got the Nutella and mixed fruit crepe and it did not disappoint! never thought of putting kiwis in my crepe but it was a nice tangy addition. The line wasn't long at all for a Sunday night, the crepe was ready in less than 5 minutes and they gave it in a sleeve fitted specially for crepes. Loved that there was no eggy taste to the crepe which is a relief! Super hard to come by a non-eggy crepe. SUPER YUMMY!
author: Chrissy N.

description:
OHMYFREAKINGOODNESS. I've had Sophie's Crepes before and thought it was pretty good, but NEVER with a scoop of gelato snuggled in its crepe-awesomeness! This just blew my mind. Wow.

Got the strawberries and nutella with a scoop of vanilla gelato. I passed on the whipped cream and glad I did, since this thing was messy enough. What a combination. This was dessert heaven, seriously. The crepe was light and crisp and held up pretty well with all the "filling." But watch out, especially if you got gelato in there too, the thing will start dripping all over the place!
author: Daniel K.

description:
This place has a special place in my heart; I've been a patron for well over 10 years, since I was in college and used to drive into the city to grab a late night crepe. Visiting here again during the Cherry Blossom Festival last weekend, I was so pleased to see that the prices hadn't changed.

Before the other Asian style creperies in SF, Sophie's was around. The thin, warm, crispy and less egg-y crepe that was wrapped several times around creamy, contrastedly cold gelato was crave worthy and special. 

Sophie's quality has remained consistent all these years. My favorite remains the Japanese crepe: with red bean paste, matcha sauce, green tea gelato-- it's unbeatable. For just under $6 it's a worthy dessert. I would pass on the savory crepes-- the highlights remain gelato plus thin warm crepe (like a waffle cone).

My biggest complaint now is the wait; my hubs and I waited almost THIRTY minutes for our two crepes. I understand the popularity... but wow, that's a really long time. I could have gotten a bowl of ramen next door in the meantime... and after ten years, it's still cash only. REALLY?
author: Debora L.

description: It was good strawberry nutella crepe.  I wasn't amazed, but I have never been that huge on crepes to begin with.
author: Nina H.

description:
They not only do crepes but sundae and gelato!
My minni me loved their green tea and vanilla bean gelato.
I loved the black sesame..something.. i totally forgot the name (it was that good!)
author: Ateh M.

description:
It took us half an hour to find parking and find our way to Sophie's Crepe inside the Japan Town mall. Sophie's Crepe is a small shop located in the West Wing of the mall on the second level. 

Fast customer service and cash only.

We ordered number 17 aka The Japanese (red bean, green tea ice cream, and matcha paste) and #14 (mixed fruits and whipped cream). I enjoyed the crispy texture of the crepe, but the whole crepe itself did not really wow any of us. In my opinion, it is not as good as Genki Crepe (SF) and way worse than Harajuku Crepe (LA).
author: Chau V.

description:
Service - meh, always busy and crowded, not much place to sit, and always less appreciated
Sight - glass window panel allows viewing of real-time crepe making. They used to use more egg and less likely to burn, so it's gotten down hill. 
Tourism - NO. Pictures aren't allowed, nor are videos.
Food - excellent. I like all the sweet ones especially strawberry chocolate syrup crepe. Fresh strawberry, whipped cream and chocolate delicious comb, definitely a 5 star by itself. 

I saw they have a relatively new flavored ice cream gelato style - Black Sesame. Really excited to try. I love the black sesame ice cream in Japan

Despite the 3 star. You should definitely try the crepe here. They are first class
author: Dilys S.

description: The crepes hereafter so thin and tasty, unlike some other places, their delicate layer with selected ice cream is a total enjoyment after dinner. And, I am not sharing it with anyone!
author: SJ L.

description:
NO LINE! Today was my first time not seeing a long line at this place. 

The crepes are made in front in you so you'll know everything they put in it and it smells so good that it makes you drool over it and it's probably not even your crepe they're making yet.

The usual wait takes about 10 minutes which is not that bad with the big crowd going around. Each crepe is about $6, but I have to admit the crepes have gotten smaller since the last time I came.
author: Vernice T.

description:
What makes Sophie's different than other places is the crunchiness in the wrap. Most crepe wraps are doughy-like and the stuffing inside can leak through. Making it a potentially messy dessert for a person who eats like a 5 years old. 

The wrap is sturdy and a crunch is a lovely surprise. It's not too sweet that when it's stuffed with kiwi and vanilla ice cream it equals the right taste. A balance of sweet and sour. You don't feel like you'll be needing an insulin shot anytime soon. 

Go to Sophie's and crunch away!
author: Vicky L.

description:
This is the reason I want to move to the Bay Area.... Pretty much the only reason.
This place is what locals know about. 

After a day spent in Japantown, we headed to Sophie's Crepes. There are some crepes downstairs but from what I hear not as good as these...

Waited in line for 5 mins but didn't mind

I got the nutella, whipped cream, strawberries, & vanilla ice cream crepe (Classic) 

In Paris, I got a nutella crepe. Couldn't even finish half of it.. But I came here and wiped out the whole thing. Fingers licked & all. In my opinion, that's saying a lot. 

Well, why can't I l live in SF just to get these crepes?... On the search of comparable crepes..
author: Sarah T.

description: Been here so many times and never wrote a review. Love their crepes here. Still think it's the best in SF. Strawberry and banana with nutella and vanilla ice cream.
author: Karen H.

description:
3 1/2 stars - I've been here a couple times now. I'm a huge fan of crepes and  when I tried it the first time a while ago, I remember my crepe being really good! I came here again last Saturday and thought it was pretty good, but not as good as I remembered. We were pretty full from lunch, so four of us split the nutella & mixed fruit crepe and the green tea gelato sundae. A main thing is that I find it hard to justify the prices, everything is a bit overpriced in my opinion. Also, I don't like that it's cash only, it's inconvenient. 

The crepe was decent (anything with Nutella is good, let's be real), but I wanted more fruit - there were a few pieces of banana and strawberry and maybe one piece of kiwi. It was smaller than I expected and difficult to split, but that's mostly due to the nature of a crepe itself...

The green tea gelato sundae was absolutely delicious but also way smaller than I expected. It was layers of green tea gelato, red bean paste and whipped cream - such a magical combination. It had really yummy flavors and a good balance, wasn't too sweet at all. This was pretty much devoured and preferred over the crepe.
author: Jessica S.

description: When I got here I was really confused with all the dessert stuff. I ended up getting the strawberry and nutella with green tea ice cream. No wait and just got my crepe. I remember being really good, but his time was not satisfied. I have been to other crepe places and I seemed to have been more satisfied, but seems to be the solid crepe place in japantown San Francisco. Needs more choices in what they offer, I felt it was missing creativity and I didn't feel like I wanted any of the choices on their board.
author: Royce L.

description:
Delicious! This place was packed! We were in Japantown during a ramen festival so it was extra busy. We got kiwi and Nutella plus vanilla ice cream to share, it was the perfect amount for two in my opinion. 
The crepe was yummy, 4 stars only because the wait was so long! The line looks short, but all the people hanging around are actually waiting for their crepe. They are really efficient in churning them out though I will say that. I'll definitely go back!
author: Brigette A.

description: One of best crepes I've ever had. It's Japanese style crepes, so it's a little different from the French ones. Try their Green Tea Gelato Crepe, it's so yummy! The maccha sauce compliments the green tea flavor very well. There's usually a long line, but it's definitely worth the wait.
author: Robert C.

description: I always see the long waiting line here...This's my first time to try the crepes.. It's amazing. I had sesame ice cream crepe. The best crepe I had!!!
author: C L.

description: Their crepes are very good.  Their service is quick. The crepes are well made. I like the California crepe.  It tastes like a California sushi roll. It has avocado and imitation crab in it. They sell gelato. They also have crepes with gelato in it. Their gelato is ok. I like the Japanese desert crepe.  It has sweet red beans, green tea gelato and matcha sauce in it.  They are cash only.
author: Hiroshi K.

description:
Wow! I give this place 5 stars! This is a must try place! I devoured my strawberry, banana, whipped cream with Nutella and Sesame Ice cream in seconds! Made me wished i had ordered 2! 
My mom ordered the Butter, Cinnamon and Sugar crepe extra crispy and I must say they were so good!  Fruits were fresh, Sesame Ice cream was so creamy! Not too sweet, just the way I like it. Gotta say this crepe is a tad bit better than Genki Living. If ever your in San Francisco, try out Sophie's Crepes. Would definitely recommend. Smiling so happy at the moment, with the taste of yummy crepe dessert.

(Just noticed this was never posted, this was about 2 years ago, but anyways I'll post it)

I just went to San Francisco a few months ago, I didn't get to get Sophie's Crepe =( 
I'll be sure to get some when I go back there again =D
author: Ivy L.

description:
A lot of people like Genki, but Sophie's will still remain my fav. I've been going here since I was in college (~8 years). The quality is so much better to me. You get a huge scoop of ice cream, nutella, lots of fruits. Better bang for your buck. I'm not really a fan of sweets, but often crave Sophie's crepes.

I also love the savory ones. The egg salad with cheddar cheese is one of my favs. So creamy & delicious!
author: Alysha K.

description:
Crepes! Crepes! Crepes!

Sophie's Crepes is located deep into the mall right near the bookstore (Kinokuya or something like that..) and right next to Tan Tan. Their crepes is like a small piece of heaven in a land of sushi joints. 

The shop itself is a good, decent size but if there's a lot of people then it can get crowded.The cash register is all the way inside and after you order you can just wait outside till they call out your number. They also have 3 2-seater tables inside. 

CASH ONLY. 

I must say, they are quite expensive. Even a plain crepe will cost you $2. And since I usually add a scoop of green tea gelato to mine, my total comes out to around $4.30. But it's okay to splurge once in a while right? Please say yes. 

Overall, yum. Can't go wrong with their crepes. They also have sundaes and drinks here!
author: Venus L.

description:
Sophie's Crepes was my first crepe experience, probably about 15 years ago. I've had many crepes since then from many different places, including in Japan, and this is still the best and my favorite.

My savory crepe of choice is the simple cheddar cheese. My desert crepe of choice is chocolate gelato with fresh strawberries. But I really don't think you can go wrong with any choice!
author: Rosemary R.

description: Made a mistake ordering ham and cheese when I wanted ham and cheese with veggies (didn't know they had both kind of crepe). They were extremely polite and helped give me mayo to make the already made crepe better. Customer service here is extremely great!!!
author: Alvin M.

description:
I loooooooove this place!
I came back here today because it's been two years since I've gotten something from Sophie's. I ordered a banana, nutella, and green tea gelato crepe. The total was $6.25. I thought it was kind of expensive for what it was, but it was DELICIOUS. The nutella was melted, there was maybe about 6 chopped up pieces of banana, and the green tea gelato was perfection. The crepe itself was crispy and thin, just the way I like it.
I got my bf a #2 (chocolate syrup and whipped cream) with vanilla icecream for $4.50. His looked sooo much tastier than mines. He isn't a fan of crepes but he thought it was tasty.
author: Julian Y.

description:
Sophie's isn't bad...but it isn't great either.  My review is based on the price to quality ratio.  My boyfriend and I frequent Genki crepes on clement since it is closer to my apartment.  Whenever we go to Genki we never spend over $7-8 on two crepes.  We came to Sophie's after having dinner and ended up spending over $13 on two crepes.  I think the reason is because all the crepes on the menu are pretty basic; they each come with about 1-3 ingredients.  Call me over indulgent but I like variety in my crepes. 

I'll give credit where credit is due...Sophie's is definitely more efficent then Genki.  There was a huge line and we didn't wait any longer than 3 minutes.
author: Angelica  C.

description:
I had Sophie's this past weekend for the first time in like four years & yes, sometimes things are just way better when you're younger...but then again I wasn't a foodie back then.  Three days prior I tried the crepes at Genki's for the first time so here's my comparison list.  My friend & I shared a mixed fruit crepe (banana, strawberries, & kiwi) with red bean ice cream.

1. Wait-time: Sophie's.  It only took a couple minutes for our crepe.  
2.  Amount of toppings: Sophie's.  They gave me more fruit, Genki's only gave me three pieces of kiwi & one little scoop of ice cream.
3.  Construction: Genki's is put together better.  I had ice cream/whip cream drip on my leggings!  =(  
4.  Taste: Pretty much the same (I did order different things though).  But we loved the red bean ice cream we added to the crepe ($1.75).
5.  Texture: Both are crispy.  I like chewier crepes.  My friend likes Genki's better though.  I don't think I'm meant to eat crepes in cone form!  
6.  Cleanliness: I guess this would be along the same lines as construction.  Genki's was less messy though!
7.  Price: Seemed like both were priced around the same.

I think if I had to go pick where to go for crepes in SF I'd stick to Genki's because I hate getting messy!  Sophie's is not a bad pick though if you're already in Japantown.
author: Cat C.

description: Get the green tea gelato crepe! It comes with red bean but since I was sharing with my daughter we had to omit the red bean since she didn't like it.  Definitely a must visit when you are in Japantown!
author: Chau D.

description:
I was in San Francisco last summer with my mom and grandma.  We seriously went here EVERY DAY.  I got the same thing too, because it was made for me - "The Japanese" - green tea ice cream, red bean paste, and matcha sauce.  OMG.  I love the idea of a hand held crepe.  It smells so good and tastes so delicate.  Every other creperie serves crepes on a plate covered in stuff.  This was so delicious that my mom had the urge to open a creperie in Texas (she is French so I can understand the urge)...she had nutella and bananas; my grandma had strawberries and cream.

Wish there was one in Vegas...Paris makes good crepes but again, they are on a plate and not Japanese-style!!
author: Lisa R.

description:
Yum! I have to say these Nutella Crepes are good and made with care. 
Service is friendly and fast too. But they charge $1 extra for whip cream and $1 for ice cream, which made my crepe out to $7.50 for reals? Yikes! But they are yummy and not messy! I will be back!
author: Marie P.

description:
I ALWAYS get a Sophie's crepe when I go to Japantown. I start at the West Mall and end upstairs in the East.

There's a line almost every time - definitely worth the wait. I love fresh fruits so that's my go-to crepe. I love the way it's in a cone so it's easy to carry. When I'm not having too big of a sweet tooth, I get a small scoop of green tea ice cream. Definitely the best green tea ice cream I've ever had! 

I've also had their red bean with green tea crepe which is something my mom would probably like. I must say it wasn't as sweet as I would have liked, even though it was still good. Everyone I bring here loves this place. 

You can't take pictures or video during the making process - I guess that makes it a little more special.
author: Mimi V.

description:
I ordered the crepe with whipped cream and strawberries. It was very disappointing.

Well, this is what I get for cheating on Genkis, but I paid 5-something for a crappy little crepe that had WAAAAAAAY too much whipped cream and like 4 strawberries. While I was eating my crepe, I had to crape away the whipped cream cause it was just too much. 

Disgusting, and over priced.

NEVER coming back. Beware!!!
author: Sophia G.

description:
One of the very few left Japanese Crepes. Well at least how many I've see in SF. We don't have any good ones in OC (no lie bro.)

Went to Sophie's Crepe on a Saturday evening and this place was... BUMPIN. Line went out the door and tourists shooting ninja shots to get workers making crepes. Little did they know.. the sign said.. "NO PHOTOS." I still took one anyways without the flash, but people were rebellious and decide to flash the workers in the face. Which I find pretty damn rude. 

Located in Japantown within a mall the shop is located next to the bookstore and next to this little okonomiyaki restaurant which.. doesn't really specialize in it. 

The crepe the three of us shared was the Kiwi and nutella crepe. The kiwi was sweet and slightly sour (which in return means its at its finest) and the crepe wrap itself was crispy (that means it can't necessarily hold ice cream as well as it should be). I've added a photo of what it looked like just for those who have trouble imagining it.

And.. for those new to ordering crepes... You can ask for a substitution. You don't necessarily have to go with what they have.

Some of my recommendations on what to get:
-Get a crepe with Nutella, green tea icecream with green tea sauce and red bean. If you want to add a fruit pick strawberry and ask them to slice it for you. Delicious? Hell yea. Unfortunately they didn't have any pudding to add on. Insert sad face. Least, when I went there there wasn't.
author: Monique N.

description: Crepes were super crispy! Get the matcha gelato. It was FANTASTIC, especially the texture and richness. Will definitely come back.
author: Grace L.

description:
CASH ONLY!
..and it is kind of expensive for the amount that you get where I have been to other crepe places that give you a lot more stuffed into your crepes for about the same price. But I guess people will keep coming here and shelling out more money because it is located in Japantown.

Ordered:
Vanilla Ice Cream with Nutella and Strawberries

The crepe was lined with nutella so you get it in every bite and the strawberries were glazed so that is a plus and the vanilla ice cream is just vanilla ice cream. Overall it was a pretty good crepe but I shared one with my boyfriend because we only had enough cash for one - I wish I could have gotten one on my own since the crepe was pretty small for the price that we paid for it!
author: Mona L.

description:
Let  me keep this snappy. 

First word that comes to mind... Over-rated. 

$5.25 to wait 20 minutes for a crepe that takes 75 cents to make at home?! 

Ok, I see why people are tempted... Crowds around a tiny shop usually calls out "eat me! I'm worth it!" (at least for Yelpers, young people, and tourists). We can watch them make the crepes from their demo window, and yeah, it looks like a pretty good snack on a hot day (until you realize it's not worth it, and that you can get an ice cream bar downstairs in the market for a dollar). 

But alright, I did go on a Saturday afternoon when it was 75 degrees outside in San Francisco... However, the quality still did not impress me. My green tea ice cream and red bean crepe was very lacking in red beans (it was barely a smear of red bean paste). The only redeeming qualify was the green tea ice cream. But I couldn't stop thinking that I would've rather just bought a bowl of ice cream for half the price!
author: Teresa T.

description:
There's not much to say about Sophie's Crepes other than the employees look like they want their lives to be over. Regardless, I'm glad they were available to make my crepe before that because it was quite delicious. The crepe maker wasn't happy with my crepe and threw it across the counter when it cracked (out of anger); this wasn't very professional.

Absolutely NO PHOTOGRAPHY OR VIDEOS.  I think this place takes itself too seriously.
author: Tommy C.

description: This place is awesome. We traveled from the other side of SF just to get crepes from here. There can be a bit of a wait, but it's totally worth it. I've tried so many other crepe places, but this is my favorite.
author: Q T.

description:
Love desserts and this place is great for it!  Gelato, crepes and savory food if you really want it.... 

*cash only, but there's an ATM inside.
*gelato:  yummy.  You're in Japantown so the green tea is worth getting.  Creamy, green tea flavor - wonderful.  
*sundaes:  they have sundae recipes for you to choose from and they're good.
*crepes:  they make them fresh and fill it with fruit, gelato, and sauce.

Great place to go if you're in the mood for dessert in j-town!
author: Dianne G.

description: My first and forever my favorite crepe place! My older siblings brought me here for the first time when I was in my early teens and I ordered the strawberry nutella ice cream crepe. From that moment on I never ordered anything else when I came here (I might've order something else in one of my visits, but I always go back to that!) I love how crispy the crepe itself is and there's no going wrong with strawberry, nutella, and vanilla ice cream. I know there's other crepe places around the area with cuter appearances and what not, but I just can't break away from this place!
author: Renee Y.

description:
Located in the Kinokuniya Mall of Japan Center by Kinokuniya Book Store, this is my favorite crepe place. There's always a wait (even worse if there's a festival or convention going on), so be prepared! They're really strict on photos as well so be weary if you're trying to take a picture inside. What's nice is that you can watch them make the crepes at the front window.

My usual orders:
Mixed Fruit w/Gelato
Mixed Fruit, Gelato, & Nutella
Strawberry, Banana & Nutella
Strawberry, Banana, Gelato & Nutella

Thin crispy crepe that smells absolutely divine. The fruit can be hit or miss sometimes though.

Cash only but they do have an ATM inside as well.
author: Kitty K.

description:
Seriously...this stuff is good! I'm not a huge crepe fan. But, their vanilla ice cream, whipped creme, strawberries topped with chocolate was just mouthwatering. Everything tasted like perfection. The crepe edges were crisp while the inner portions were still soft and chewy. 

Price: $6.02 for one crepe. May cost more depending what you get. 

Location: Inside the Japan Town Center Market area toward the waaay back left corner. Drop by if you're in town!
author: Wana L.

description:
I looove ice cream crepes. I concocted a walnut ice cream, banana, whipped cream and caramel crepe creation here.

Sophie's makes food and dessert crepes but I came here for the sweets. Their dessert crepes are made with gelato. Most are around $6, but if you customize your own crepe it adds up. I paid $8 for one crepe, which is kind of pricey. 

The gelato and fruit were fresh but the crepe itself was really tough. I couldn't cut it with my fork and the store didn't have plastic knives, so it was a messy eating experience. Their crepes are served in a paper cone, which makes eating them a bit of a challenge.
author: Mariela D.

description:
The Japanese Crepe really is delicious. If you're a fan of green tea and red bean, this will not disappoint. The texture of the crepe is great, too - slightly crispy exterior, not soggy. Make sure you have plenty of napkins on hand because melted ice cream will start dripping through the little hole at the bottom of the paper cone after a while. Folding the bottom of the cone helps.

Make sure you have cash because that's all they accept.
author: Janet P.

description:
yumm!

Had to stop here on our drive through SF. Located in Little Tokyo of SF, parking available on street or in any parking structure. 
This little shop is on the top floor of the an Asian mall.

Very thin crepes (a la asian style heheh).... thin and crispy
Got banana w nutella and a scoop of ice cream.
- one bad thing...a small part of the ice cream had ice crystals in it...   =(
author: Linda C.

description:
I LOVE SOPHIE'S.

Yummy in my Tummy:
- Create Your Own Ice Cream Crepe w/Green Tea Gelato and Macha sauce ($4.00 + $0.50)
- #17 Japanese Crepe ($5.25)

Unlike Katie Anne N.'s problem of being over charged for creating her own crepe they automatically charged me less when I asked for a Japanese Crepe without the red bean paste. I come to Sophie's often and I've never had a problem with them over charging me. 

The Green Tea Gelato here is AMAZING. I usually don't like green tea ice cream because it's too sweet and doesn't taste like green tea. The gelato here is not too sweet and it actually tastes like green tea! I love the macha sauce (green tea sauce) over the gelato. It is bitter, but I think it complements the gelato well. Also I love the crepe itself. It's always a great crispiness. If you're wanting those soft pancake like crepes Sophie's is not for you, so just be warned.
author: Eifeh S.

description:
Best crepes EVER... whenever I am in San Francisco I have to come here and have a Japanese crepe. It is heavenly... and really hits the spot. The crepe is light and crispy and the fillings are generous and delicious. 

Two thumbs up~
author: Josh V.

description:
CASH ONLY! but they have an ATM.

Omg this has been on my bookmarks for so long. I'm glad I finally got to try it. It's located in the Japanese mall upstairs. Parking sucks. 

I had the strawberries, whipped cream, nutella and vanilla bean ice cream. Wow, the best crepe I've ever had! Sweet and delicious. The only thing I didn't like was that it was super messy!

My boyfriend got the ham and cheese. It looked really really flat.. but he liked it. He said anymore meat then it would probably be greasy.

The people next to us got sundaes. It looked better than the crepes. Must try next time!
author: Linh V.

description:
I haven't tried the crepes from here but the last time I went, I got the caramel gelato!

It was so rich and creamy and so good! I was dying to get another cup!

The staff across the counter are very nice. I need to try the crepes next time I'm here!
author: Mabel Y.

description:
GREEDY!  REAL capitalists!  Ice cream is  heh... well... okay.  Nothing special to write mum at home about.  I went there and being cash only (as in Japan it is true that it is custom to use more cash than credit or debit cards in doing transactions) but these employees are NOT Japanese!  FAR from it!  Rude, and I was caught short EIGHT CENTS!  Do you think they would say okay that's fine?  NO!  They WASTED FOUR DOLLARS AND FIFTY CENTS worth of ice cream that someone could have enjoyed because they are TOO F***ing GREEDY that they can't let it go for eight cents short!  (By law they HAVE to throw out food that is not paid for if already served up).

I told them right there I shan't ever come back!  Yes, I realise they are in for money, but to throw out over four dollars of food because of eight cents is pure unadulterated GREED ...AND WASTE!   When they say that one cannot bargain in America, I guess they really MEAN it -- literally!

There are at least two other ice cream places in Nihonmachi that have better ice cream anyway, and are not so cotton picking greedy.  The Good Belly Food and Crepes just on east side of Webster Street bridge is MUCH better and treat customers far better! ..And the employees are indeed JAPANESE!  The cute little ice cream cups there have fanciful art of a smiling face unlike Sophie's. 

There is another place, Hana, that also sells ice cream -- and yes, credit cards (with minimum purchase of $5) are indeed welcome!

I hope that either this insatiable attitude of greed changes at Sophie's or that they had better just close shop forever!  I would boycott that place if I were you, as they are too much into money and not people!  Please while at Nihonmachi (Japantown) try either Hana or Good Belly Food & Crepes -- much better!

Thanks!
author: Tatsuhiro S.

description:
Thank you Sophie's Crepes for being located in Japantown. While my girlfriend is spending hours at Ichiban Kan or Kinokuniya Stationery and Gift, I head over to Sophie's for a afternoon crepe. So, which crepe should you get? Lucky, there is two of us so I can get a savory and sweet crepe. Eat some and then trade off. Best arrangement ever. Or eat sushi and then grab a dessert crepe. 

The biggest problems is waiting in the long line. It always goes out the door on a weekend afternoon. But you can mildly entertain yourself by watching them make the super thin crepe.

What I recommend: Try a different crepe off the menu each time you go. It will be hard to have a favorite.
author: Andrew W.

description:
A bit pricey for crepe, but so guuud... T ^ T it's like a ice cream burrito
wrapped in a light crispy cone shell ready to be devoured in literally 3 minutes!
author: Kim R.

description: Everytime I come to sf, I always stop by here to eat. They make the best crepes by far. It's so crispy, and their wide variety of ice cream that you can add to the crepe makes it extra tasty. I usually get Nutella with mixed fruits crepe and I add lychee gelato to it. I finish the thing in seconds. It's THAT good. It's always crowded when I come, but I don't mind waiting. It's so worth
author: Fiona N.

description: Often imitated.  Never duplicated.
author: Melinda Y.

description:
Yummy crepes! Gotta have this whenever I'm in Japantown. It's like it's calling to me. However the wait for this illustrious crepe can take over an hour, but worth the wait if you haven't had it in a while. The best time to go would be before lunch. 

It's really fun watching them make these crepes. Why are these crepes so good? Because they're bigger than the usual crepes I've gotten and they are pretty generous with the fillings. I like the banana nuttella crepe with some ice cream. Yum!
author: Cindy K.

description:
Everybody can make crepes, but not all places are as amazing as Sophie's! It is soft, crisp, delicious, and just perfection!! I tried a savory crepe and a dessert one! I forgot what the savory one was called... but it left me wanting another one so that's where the strawberry and ice cream crepe came in!

This place reminded me of authentic Japanese crepes like I had in Japan. So tasty and good!! Their no picture policy was similar too.

FIVE stars because these crepes taste just as good as they smell!!!!
author: Holly H.

description: Great place. Fast service, friendly workers, and overall my favorite place to get crepes!
author: Max S.

description:
The crepes here are AMAZING.

They are chewy AND crunchy in ALL the right places.

I've been thinking about the vanilla gelato, strawberries and nutella filled crepe since I last had it two months ago... I think it's about time I TREAT MASELf.

TREAT. YO. SELF.
author: Alexis P.

description:
Cash only.

Strawberry and Nutella for $5 (excluding tax).  Prepared quick; however, once I received my order, the strawberry is cold, so ultimately the whole crepe, when eaten, is already a cold dessert.
author: Ju D.

description: The crepes here are delicious thanks to their gelato. The sesame seed gelato is so good! Mmmmm
author: Elizabeth N.

description: Their Crepes are very delicious. :) I would totally come back. The only reason why I took off one star is because they don't accept credit cards, so I had to go to an ATM machine and withdraw money with a $3 fee. But besides that, I would totally come back, for Crepes.
author: Kev L.

description:
All these crepes places are pretty much the same. I've never been to one that totally sucked or one that was just exceptionally stellar (yet). Got a crepe with bananas and nutella with some vanilla ice cream and whipped cream (maybe could have passed on that one). It was a great end to my otherwise more salty meal next door. Cost 7 dollars. After I was eating, I thought I probably could have made this at home for 2 dollars but eh, what's the fun in doing that when I can have some goodness made for me? haha.

If anyone has a great stellar just out of this world crepe place, please let me know.
author: Julia P.

description:
I'm not sure if I like chewy or crispy crepes better, but at Sophie's you'll get served a perfectly crisp crepe with your choice of ice cream filling +. I always get a strawberry crepe with vanilla ice cream and chcolate+caramel syrup. Sometimes simple just does it. I always get extra whip cream on mine. I guess getting ice cream crepes really brings out the child in me. 
The crepes are fair priced and the wait CAN be long, but the crepes downstairs at Belly Good Crepes & Cafe has a shorter line if you arent willing to wait! They are very good as well. 
Anyways, I've been coming to this place occasionally for about 10 years now. 
Definitely recommend trying crepes at Japantown at least once!
author: Veronica L.

description:
This is actually a 3.5 stars for me. Reason being I had a savory crepe. 

I tried the chicken salad crepe for lunch today and it was just alright. The description is chicken salad in pesto sauce with lettuce. The chicken salad was good, but no pesto sauce. The chicken salad was actually in a salty mayonnaise/tartar sauce type dressing. But I have to say, the crepe itself was amazing.

I'll be trying a dessert crepe next time for sure.

As everyone said, Cash Only.
author: Terry C.

description:
BEST CREPES IN TOWN!!!!
(4.5 stars)

Have you ever taken a bite of something and said to yoursefl "WTF!!!" Definately multiple foodgasm moment. because that is what seems to be my response all the time. I had to delete my old review from 2008 because this deserved more than an update. i think i could write a novel about this place. 

- crepes: so delicious
- price: fair (depends what you order about around $6.50 for mine)
- service: fast
- ambiance: 3 steps and 3 steps out

Maybe it just me, being in my 30's, and i still love watching from the window how they make the crepes. So the location is in Japantown Center. Not really a place I go to often but i usually go there when i have a craving of crepes. Also, a perfect place to take my kaibigans from Seattle and LA there when they want to go around the city.

HEFFER-STYLE 411.
CREPES - i love ice cream crepes. usually i get the strawberries with nutella spread and vanilla icecream. i think i have multiple foodgasms after a visit here. It's one of those fresly made crepes in hand, warm and cold at the same time from the icecream, and the crepe is soft and crunchy. i LOVE crunchy crepes. my hearts pounding just thinking about how delicious this place is.

FYI, be ware it can get messy so come prepared.

Will i be back? oh goodness, no need to ask me that quesiton.

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
If you ever walked through the Kinokuniya Building in the J-Center on the way to the Kabuki Theaters, you can be sure of three things:

FACT #1 - You will get an electric shock when you touch the early-1970's-style faux-brass railing down those curvy stairs.
FACT #2 - You will snicker at the sign for "Fuku-Sushi" because admit it, you're as juvenile as I am.
FACT #3 - You will get a whiff of that powerful aroma coming from Sophie's Crepes.

Depending on how full your tank is, the smell will either draw you into the prospect of freshly made crepes or repel you to the restroom, which is luckily just down the hall. Ah, so many choices on the overhead menu. I tried the Nutella crepe with whipped cream for $3.45 and was a bit surprised it is a hand-held delicacy like an ice cream cone.

I do like the portability of it, and it is a darn tasty treat, too. I have to admit I threw caution to the wind and decided to eat it like an ice cream cone. However, the cream kept squirting out of it, and my shirt almost became a lactose-intolerant tragedy. The smarter ones use the plastic spoons to scoop out the filling. Definitely a sweet tooth alternative to that schizophrenic Cafe Hana in the next building.

CREPES - 4 stars...freshly made and generous with the filling
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...feels like an ice cream parlor. so I grabbed it and went
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...pretty quick, and they yell your number with a smile
TOTAL - 4 stars...nice respite after some J-Town tempura or shabu-shabu
author: Ed U.

description:
Their crepes are the best thing I have ever had! I got the strawberry nutella crepe and loved every bite. My boyfriend and I went two nights in a row because we loved it so much. 

Remember to bring cash because that's all they'll accept!
author: Shelby W.

description: I'm by no means a crepe expert but my friend says that Genki's is the best, and this place tastes just about the same to me.  They both have a really thin, crispy crepe and not a thick soggy one that you sometimes find.  I was starving for a snack so we stopped by here, but since I wasn't in the mood for anything sweet, we got a savory crepe.  I hardly ever order savory ones, but this one was pretty good (or maybe I was just THAT hungry).
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Only if I knew this place existed when I used to be in this area all the time. 

One of my best friends took me here and let me tell you the BEST crepes I've ever had. Not the typical crepe i've had since the crepe is actually more crispy versus the soft ones. 

This was the first time I have eaten a crepe wrapped up versus on a plate. But I had a nutella, strawberries and vanilla ice cream. Besides the fact my crepe was leaking the whole time I enjoyed every bite! 

Writing this review makes me want to drive 30 minutes to get one of these delicious crepes!
author: Kim L.

description: it looked a lot bigger on the pictures but looked really smaller than i expected when i got my order. nevertheless, it was so good. no wonder people come back to this place.
author: Mona F.

description:
This place holds so many memories for me. Memorable dates, fun with friends before shows at the Fillmore, spilling icecream down my pants when I eat my crepe too slow. This place is a classic in Japantown for my generation. 

I love that they have actual Japanese flavors in the mix, like green tea icecream and red bean filling (azuki). YumM! 

If you want a fun date, take her to purikura across the way (sticker picture-booths) then come here. 

It is cash only.
author: Andy M.

description:
I usually order my crepe with kiwis, strawberries, bananas, nutella, and vanilla ice cream. The most simplest  of ingredients but it keeps me coming back. 

Even though I love Sophie's Crepes and travel from the East Bay to indulge in it, they are filling my crepes with less and less ingredients.  I have noticed it over the last couple of years since I first started going there. The taste is still there but there's a definite void of what used to consist of a perfect crepe. 

I know they are busy but what about quality? Quality over quantity is a phrase I completely agree with but if you can have both why must I compromise.
author: April L.

description:
Best crepes in the Bay Area...maybe California. Love the mango ice cream with banana, nutella and whipped cream. Yummmy!!!

Feeling adventurous? Try their Japanese flavors. Best thing is you can mix and match to your preference. 

One word: Oishi! =)
author: John G.

description:
Came here today (Sat 27th) around 7pm to get some crepes.

I had the worst service I've ever had. When it's my turn to order, the girl at the cashier said nothing to me, no 'hi', no 'how can i help you' and she didnt even look at me. Ok, fine, it felt awkward but I ordered a strawberry crepe anyway. 

She asked me if i want ice cream with it, I said no, but after just a few secs, I said 'Actually can i get it with ice cream please'... and then she gave me this shitty look..... 

She also treated my other two friends very badly. We were really surprised and pissed. We came for get some crepes, not her bad attitude.

------------------

I gave it two stars because the crepes are good.
author: Sun W.

description: It's a must stop dessert place if you're eating at JapanTown. Long lines sometimes but the prices are very reasonable & the crepes are awesome! Just ignore the servers that left their personalities at home. Asked for a tiny squirt of chocolate syrup on my nieces ice cream and they wanted to charge 75 cents, WTH?!  Need to up the personality & friendliness training for any new hires, missed the 5 star because of it.
author: Ferdie L.

description:
Well, this place became a phenomenon. We really love Japanese style crepes, everyone enjoy the ice cream with fresh fruits(or chocolate if you like). The only downside is it's always crowd, and when you see it's not crowd, it probably means not open yet...

This is the place we must go every time when we go to the Japan Town, no exception.
author: Sheng Y.

description:
I came here because my friends and yelp said it was the best crepe.

I wasn't a fan of the cripsy crepe itself.  Usually I am use to soft ones.

The green tea gelato was good, but all in all, the crepe all together wasn't
I got the Japanese crepe with red bean.  a okay
author: Darlene T.

description: My favorite crepe place in the city!! They make Japanese style dessert crepes --- red bean mash with matcha ice cream....soooooo good!! I like this place better than genki crepes which is also popular. Genki crepe skin tends to be wetter (I like mine crisp) and they are less generous with the fillings. You just can't go wrong with this place. If you ever come to japantown, visit Sophie's! It's right next to second floor exit of the bookstore.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Crepes are yummy pockets full of love!

I was in Japan town taking my brother around.  He's a noob to Japanese crepes so we just had to stop in at Sophie's.  I went with my good old standard, Nutella and Bananas, he got the Nutella and Strawberries.  The place was jam-packed full of people, so we had to wait a while for the crepes.  But they were worth it for sure!

I don't think it was as good as my favorites place, Genki Crepes over on Clement, but this place does a darn good job.
author: Greg S.

description: Ordered the mixed fruit (strawberries, bananas and kiwi) and cream, and butter and cinnamon sugar.  The cream was fantastic and the crepe delightfully crunchy.  The fruit could have a been sweeter.  The other one tasted just like cinnamon toast.  It was a bit dry, so probably should have ordered it with cream.  The crepes were delicious.
author: Steven L.

description:
Long wait! Strike one.

Crepes are dry, brittle and tasteless. Strike two.

They forgot to make one item in my order and I had to ask them to look at the slip right in front of them. Strike three.
author: Peter F.

description: Friendly staff and delicious crepes for a great price- what more can you ask for? This was my first time having stuffed crepes and it definitely won't be my last! I created my own with whipped cream, vanilla ice cream, nutella, and strawberries. Can not wait to come back!
author: Debbie W.

description:
I like it here but I'm spoiled with Genki's down on Clement.

Cash only =(
They have savory and sweet selections. I always ONLY pick the sweet. Ranges from like $4-5.. it's kind of pricey. For mixed fruits + whipped cream it's $4.75 but it hits the spot. Add $1 for ice cream.

It's alrightttttttt. The crepes at Genki are more crepe-ish -- a bit more done and crispier. I wish it were like that here.
author: Emily C.

description: Ask for an ice cream other than vanilla to get the full flavor
author: Clinton C.

description: These crepes are ridiculously cheap and pretty satisfying. I had the #17 Japanese, and I quite enjoyed the green tea gelato. I kind of prefer my crepes to be soft rather than crispy, however, so I wasn't the biggest fan.
author: Kelly R.

description:
I came here only once....and that is already one time more than I need to go.

I got a simple green tea crepe. SIMPLE! That is the keyword in my review. I ordered my green tea crepe. It shouldn't take more than what.....five minutes? And that is where Sophie's automatically went on my "No Way" list. I had to wait much more than 10 minutes. I went to the crepe maker and they threw away my receipt stub! I'm glad I asked or I would never have gotten my crepe! I was so mad. 

Will not return.
author: Alex T.

description:
After reading Danny L's review... Maybe I was having an off night trying this spot ... last night!

Granted it was hot... just got out of a stuffy / no air restaurant for dinner... didn't or wasn't familiar with Mos Def music... see I was out of my element indeed!

Anyway, my bro really wanted to get crepes for dessert... thus we were suppose to go to the other crepe spot (but they closed at 8 PM) so we rushed to get to this spot...

Apparently, per the sis.in.law ~ this is the crispy crepe spot. The other, just regular. 

Again, being the attentive person that I am... no clue what bro and sis.in.law ordered but both came with ice cream... seemed messy to eat (for me!)

I opted to get the banana and nutella. No ice cream since I didn't feel like being messy.

The guy behind the counter... with every order, kept saying that it's an extra of $0.50 or $1.50 or what not. It's like reading the fine print on contracts but this one is verbal!

Crepe came... I wasn't blown away. It was just EH. Sorry! Like I said, maybe my element was off or maybe I really needed to add the ice cream? Who knows. My bro and sis.in.law devoured theirs... I didn't. 

**Note: they only accept cash. **

I'd try it again - maybe this time my element won't be off!
author: Cath M.

description: I love this crepe place verses the other that's in the same area. My kids enjoy their ice cream and a Nutella crepe. Can't go wrong here!
author: Cynthia L.

description:
OK maybe when I made that visit when I wrote my review things were all wrong, because now they are fantastic!

They are cash only, which is fine and it's always the same guy at the register.  He fully understand my requests and reads them back to me, *phew*.  One time there was a miss-communication error, and he got me a new one made right away.

I love getting mine with strawberries, bananas, and vanilla ice cream ... oh, and of course the whip cream.  I went back so many times, again and again.  They really stepped it up, not to mention that the quality is much better now as well.  From 2 stars to 5, bravo!
author: Pia V.

description:
Had my first crepes here! The staff is very kind and patient even when the place is packed. Try the turkey and avocado, it's delicious!
I will come back soon for more delicious food. :)
author: Lauren P.

description: This place was a merely disappointing! I walked to here from Alamo Square. That is how bad I wanted to try out this place. If anyone knows me they know that I am not a fan of walking too far of a distance. I don't know if it's because it was early in the morning or the worker here are just lousy but I will stay clear of this place if I'm ever in japantown again. First off they messed up my order and when I told the girl that I ordered a crepe not a sundae she made a face at me. I mean I'm not going to pay for something I didn't want. When she finally made us a new order she basically handed to us and gave a look like "please just go". That's rude. Anyways, the crepe was not good. The matcha ice cream was way too overpowering to the rest of the crepes. Not the mention how bland the crepe was. By that time I was already annoyed with the customer service and to top it off with a lousy crepe I threw it away and decided to go get some Starbucks. What a waste of time.
author: Nikki N.

description: One day, i was hungry(everyday) so i took a stroll down Japan Town. There i stumbled upon a place called "mall", and upon reading the sign i was astonished! i thought to myself "what is this building known as a mall?!?" and so i adventured in hoping that i wouldn't be attacked by the wild cougars that roam the plains. There i saw light brimming from a house like place called "Sophie's Crepe". I didnt know what to do when i saw the sign, i was too afraid!!! But my nose! my animal senses were tingling. My nose and all of my instincts told me "this is the place" and even though my insticts were telling me that, i still wasnt sure if i were to follow or to run. So i toom the daring move and approached the wild beast known as Sophie. There i was enchanted! i was greeted with the smell of carnage!
author: Benson M.

description: Love Sophie's crepe!  Actually I don't care too much about the crepe itself (made fresh, crunchy on the top, but it's somewhat tasteless).  But the combo of green tea ice cream, matcha sauce and red bean paste is soooo good.  #17 is the best!!!
author: Mag K.

description:
I have been going here for years, before crepe places started showing up everywhere. When walking up to Sophies, you may see a big crowd up front. Do not get discouraged, usually they're people that have ordered or just watching the crepes being made. Go all the way in to the cash register to place your order and it usually goes by pretty fast from there. They'll call  your number when your order is up. 

The crepes are flavorful with crispy edges, packed to go but ready to eat in it's cone shaped wrapping. I usually get Cinnamon Sugar or Nutella and bananas... without ice cream cause it's just easier to eat that way!
author: S Y.

description:
It's really good here. I prefer Belly Good Crepes but they have decent crepes here.

I ordered it and it went into a cone. I loved the taste and texture of it. I had a nutella and banana crepe with ice cream. It got a little messy but it was a pretty good size but a little pricey.
author: Natalie M.

description:
I'm a sucker for crepes, that's all I can say. 

And one of the things I'm actually willing to overpay for is dessert anyway. 

Green tea gelato + chocolate syrup + strawberries. That's all you need. Get it.
author: Christina V.

description:
I really can't understand the novelty with crepes?  Am I missing something?  I'd take a waffle, pancake, pie, or cake any day over a crepe.  With that said, I was told this was THE PLACE for crepes that I had to try.  

We got the Japanese with green tea gelato, red bean, and matcha sauce.  I enjoyed the crunchiness of the batter and the gelato combo and even liked the almost bitter sauce but what I liked most was the portability of the crepe.  Nearly everyone in this shopping center was walking around carrying one of these.  Monkey see, monkey do perhaps?
author: Allison T.

description: I ALWAYS HAVE TO COME HERE! Sorry for the caps but I LOVEEEE this place to death! After my shopping addiction at Daiso I have to come here to end the day and order the Tuna Melt Crepe and the Cookies & Cream gelato crepe. And yes, I eat them at the same time, gross maybe? But to me delicious!!
author: Emily R.

description:
Yummie savory and sweet crepes.  I got the nutella and strawberry one.  Make sure to ask for whipped cream, I thought it was just automatically given to you.  The crepe is crispy for the most part, not so much chewy n soft.  Packed into a good 'to go' package, I can see myself stopping by for a quick bite for the road.

What's up w/all their stingy signs about ..well, everything.. no photos, no changing orders, if you have to change please go to the back of the line, yadda yadda yadda.  makes the place less cute in my opinion.  There shouldn't be so many instructions for just ordered crepes
author: Cynthia A.

description:
Never, never, never will me, myself and I will ever eat here again.  

Worker who was making the crepe use a dirty towel to clean his hand and then touch the crepe onto a cooling tray.  Since the store was not too busy he used his dirty hand to put the crepe together.  I had the special....NO glove ....
author: Tommy P.

description: best crepes in SF. green tea and adsuki gelato crepes are oishiiiiiiii.
author: Vivienne K.

description:
This is my favorite crepe place in the city! I love it for a combination I haven't been able to find anywhere else: the green tea, red bean, matcha sauce crepe wrapped in a crunchy, yet tender crepe for a little over $5. yes, it's a bit pricier than other crepe places in town and the hours are horrible (how on earth do they get away with closing at 10) I still love love this combination at sophies. I can't really say much about the other flavors, but I think based on the texture of the crepe the rest will do well as well! 

A few things I don't get about this place: why no pictures allowed to be taken in the store? and why is adding whipped cream an extra dollar with a few squeezes of it?
author: Christine B.

description:
I really don't know why I'm not giving it 5 stars.

 It's not like I didn't devour my butter, cinnamon sugar and nutella crepe in less than five minutes.

 And it's not like I didn't start licking on my husband's green tea ice cream crepe with whipped cream. 

I even enjoyed watching the dude making the crepe cook on the heating pan. I loved how he was so artful in doing so, though he looked bored as hell.

My crepe was delicious. As I watched them prepare my crepe with such simple condiments, I almost wanted to tell them to put more butter, more sugar, more nutella. It goes to show that patience is a virtue because my crepe was more enjoyable than I anticipated. 

Lesson learned, less is more.
author: Sharon B.

description: Quality of the crepe has faded, it may be the guy who usually makes them has moved on. They are way too crunchy to the point the goodies inside leak. It's good but not like they used to be, oh well. Gotten spendy for #8 with a scoop too, almost 8 Ducats, piracy!
author: vic f.

description:
Nothing says yummy goodness like a Sophie's Crepe.  Have you tried?  If not, you'd best jump on over to J-town and get one.  I've been coming here since my early college days, which, shockingly, was actually a long time ago.  I most always end a long J-town trip with one of these treasures.

Half the fun is watching them make the crepes.  The action is all right up front and center here.  They not only have the dessert crepes, but savory ones too.  My sister's a fan of their tuna and avocado crepe.  I've never had, as I adore my vanilla ice cream crepes.  Yup, that's it.  No fancy ingredients (Heavens forbid a banana ever showed up in mine.  The horror!), no Nutella or whipped cream toppings to smother.  Just plain ol' vanilla ice cream fer me.  (Hey, there's no double meaning here.  Stop looking at me like that.)

Seriously, you've gotta go.  'Nuff said.

Sophie's, totemo aishiteru de!  Hontou ni!  d-(^_^)-b
author: Lorrayne L.

description:
BEST FREAKIN' CREPES I'VE EVER HAD. 

The crepes are super thin, chewy in the middle, and crispy around the edges. The toppings are always fresh and the gelato is to DIE FOR. You can't go wrong with any of their menu items. 

This place is super popular and busy but they have worked out an efficient system that makes it possible to order and get your crepe within 15 minutes. Amazing. 

If you're in SF and near Japantown you NEED to try this place out. You won't be disappointed!
author: Chantelle T.

description: Green tea gelato red bean paste, and matcha green tea sauce in a chewy warm crepe is the way to go! Delicious!  nothing much to say, but one of the best crepe place I know.
author: Linda T.

description:
They keep making their crepes crispy like a freaking waffle wrap. I asked them to make them soft but still give them to me crispy. GAH. 

Go to Belly Good Crepes and Cafe (in the same plaza) instead if you're into soft, fluffy crepes instead of this crispy crap. Belly good crepes gives you more ingredients for the same price too.
author: Yoko K.

description:
This is such a wonderful find in Japantown. Get the Japanese crepe #17 with extra matcha. 

But first what a Japanese crepe is:
Imagine a waffle cone shape. Okay. Then imagine no thick waffle and instead, a crepe in it's place filled with ice cream, syrup and fruit. Get the idea? 

The prices are so super low and the selection is huge like a Quickly is for bubble tea. You get to watch the people make your crepe and the ice cream and gelato selection is awesome and unlike any Baskin-Robbins. 
The only reason I'm gonna take a star out because the coffee wasn't available and and I want nothing more than coffee and crepes together. (But then again, I want coffee with everything.)
They have Japanese style crepes too that are rolled up like a maki-so good! Don't forget to bring cash though 'cause they only accept cash and they do have an ATM.  Crazy people lurk around though and try to talk about "spiritual b.s. in the bookstore nearby. It's my first time here and I'll be back for those Nutella crepes. Far better than that place by Barney's.
author: Jessica K.

description:
