During our stay in SF, my family and I would visit the japan center on a daily basis and Sophie's became a quick favorite! Their crepes are DELICIOUS and well priced. The texture of the crepe is crunchier, which I like a lot because it goes really well with the fillings (and because it doesn't get soggy). 

They also have a variety of gelato that you can eat separately or with your crepe. The hazelnut gelato and lychee gelato are SO good - my mom and dad finished them before I could get a taste so I had to order again -.-

The place is often crowded so expect to wait a little bit before you can order. It is definitely worth it though!!!
author: Fatima K.

description: Hand down my one of the best crepes, I've ever had. My friend bought me the strawberry nutella crepes and it was just delicious. I normally like my crepes to be filled with whipped and ice cream but Sophie's crepes is just amazing that I didn't mind at all. I've had crepes before but what makes Sophie's crepes so different is the fact that it is quite crunchy. I never thought I would like crunchy crepes until now. What made me like Sophie's crepes even more was the fact that I placed my crepe in the fridge because I was quite full already. So I ended up having crepes for breakfast the next day and let me tell you it taste exactly this same as the night before. Definitely looking forward to grabbing more when I stop by Japantown again.
author: Julie C.

description:
"Woohoo! As good as it gets!" describes Sophie's Crepes perfectly. School field trips for my Japanese class almost always ended in crepes from Sophie's, so it's no surprise I had to return four years later on my first trip to Japantown since high school Japanese.

I got the Japanese: green tea ice cream, matcha sauce, and red bean paste ($5.25). My brother made his own: chocolate sauce, vanilla ice cream, and whipped cream (~$4.75). Prices were on par with other crepe places I've been to.

They run an efficient service here, with each crepe being made in less than 5 minutes. Admittedly, your wait will likely be much longer (we waited 20-25 minutes), but that's simply because the cashier can ring up customers faster than the crepe-ers can make crepes! My Japanese was everything I could have asked for; the crepe had a crisp consistency; the red beans were perfectly sweetened; the matcha sauce added a dense, bitter flavor that complemented the green tea ice cream perfectly. I loved that the crepe didn't get soggy/slimy even after it had been sitting with the ice cream for a bit (maybe the ice cream was extra frozen?).

TL;DR: must go for visitors and Jtown veterans alike!
author: Catherine J.

description: I guess it's just a personal preference but as happy as crepes normally make me, I wouldn't go back to Sophie's.  I was pretty shocked at HOW CROWDED it was but we waited for a Nutella crepe. Perhaps I don't know what a "Japanese" crepe is but as some have said, it was super thin and crunchy.  Not only that but I barely could taste the Nutella as it was so thin.   NOT what I like in a crepe experience.
author: Heidi D.

description: What a find! Great little dessert mecca hidden upstairs in a shopping center in Japantown. So many choices and all delicious. Everyone in our party was loved their choice, especially those that chose something with ice cream! I went with a simple jelly crepe, I was stuffed from dinner, and it was fantastic. Of course the young lady taking our order looked at me like I was crazy for avoiding something larger... maybe next time!
author: David P.

description:
Go here, don't pass go.

Had a friend's recommendation to stop by and this was a great idea. Most anything you get you will enjoy!
author: Clinton G.

description: If I want a hearty, thin, sort of crispy crepe, I come to Sophie's.  This place has been my mainstay since high school, and I've tried everything from the plain gelato crepes, to all of the fruit combos, to the savory tuna melt.  The crepes are always crisp at the edges but soft once you get past the paper, and you just can't help but love the heartiness of all of it.  It may not be cutesy, but it's good, fresh, and filling!  By far, the most solid fruit option has to be either J, with the bananas, or the one with strawberries.  Go without the whip and ask for nutella.  It is SO good.
author: Tracey L.

description: I absolutely love walking through the Japantown mall. There are so many places to eat - many of them offer delicious sweets. I really can't say no to a fluffy crepe filled with green tea ice cream and whipped cream. Yummm~~~
author: Sherry L.

description:
What I love most about this place is the unique crepe - green tea ice cream, red bean, nutella!  What more can a girl ask for? And where else can you get this spectacular combination? I mean those 3 things are literally my favorite foods in the world.

Crepes are made fresh upon ordering but no pictures are allowed.  I always wondered why.

It's located on the 2nd floor of the Kinokuniya Building in the heart of Japantown.
author: Shannon L.

description:
If you don't think a crepe is fantastic (savory or sweet)...then there's something wrong with you. Sophie's at Japantown offers goodness in a crepe. As for the savory side...they have ham/cheese, tuna and turkey. Now my personal favorite...their sweet selections include fresh fruit, jams, nutella, whipped cream and you can add ice cream or sorbet. All of this wrapped into a warm crepe...sign me up! 

Note - cash only and they tend to get pretty busy (especially on the weekends). 

Overall...YUM!
author: Dru M.

description:
I come here every time I pay a visit to Japantown. It's kind of a must really. Their crepes are so light and crispy, plus you can watch the cooks make your crepe as you wait so you can see the entire process! I always get their dessert crepes, especially their amazing Japanese Special Crepe which comes with red bean, green tea ice cream, whipped cream! Their customer service is lacking a little though...at least a friendly "hello" or "thank you!" from the cashier could help here. Having worked in customer service before, I can understand that sometimes slip ups can happen but making one's own customers feel welcome should take on more of a priority here. 

Another drawback is the lines can get long, especially on weekends so you may have to wait a bit to get your crepe. Another slight inconvenience is that they also don't do credit cards, so be sure to bring some cash on hand.
author: Amery Z.

description:
Sophie's is a small and cute cafe decked out with yellow walls that fits perfectly in the ambience of Japantown. 

My friend took me here on our lovely date in SF. 
I had Black Sesame and Green Tea gelato. I was surprised Sophie's offered Black Sesame flavored gelato! I lovelovelove black sesame and haven't seen it anywhere else before. 
My friend had the fruit and gelato crepe with vanilla gelato. They also offer savory crepes which ties this whole cafe together.
Since I've been to Sophie's, I've never found a creamier or richer gelato place... and I've been to Paris! Maybe it's because I fell in-love with the Asian flavors and texture :B

If you have a chance to come here, I definitely recommend getting gelato with ANYTHING on the menu!
author: Connie C.

description: Chocolate sundae:  Very rich and very smooth ice cream.  They serve it in a small cup with enough ice cream and toppings for two.  If you're waiting for your table at a nearby restaurant, come here and grab a sweet appetizer while you wait.
author: Garrett M.

description: Too small. Bland. Stingy on the bananas.
author: Betty T.

description:
after having alright ramen for dinner, i needed something sweet that was close by

ordered:
-japanese special crepe: green tea gelato, red bean paste, matcha sauce, whipped cream.. i don't like whipped cream but my friend does so i was vetoed.. the crepe was ok but it could be crispier

-black sesame gelato: loved this! i would come back for this every time

they use fiorello's gelato here.. i'd come back to try flavors in addition to another scoop of black sesame

if you're looking for crepes, just go to genki.. love them there
author: Raquel T.

description:
Just a crepe.  No rum flavored crepes, no funny names.  You have a few choices of Asian ice cream flavors.  It's expensive for what it is, and I think that sums up J-Town.

However, it's just one of those places I've been to repeatedly over time, so I have a soft spot for it.  I suspect other rave reviews can be attributed to the same factor.  

My go-to crepe spot is Genki... they don't do anything special either, but they have the best tasting crispy crepe. All about the batter.
author: Erika C.

description: Whenever I'm in japantown and I have a sweet tooth, crepe always satisfies me. Fruits, green tea ice cream in a crunchy crepe, how can you go wrong with that? I like their green tea ice cream and their fresh fruit so I come here whenever I'm in japantown. I recommend F because I like the strawberries and kiwi, and green tea ice cream ^_^
author: Amanda C.

description:
This place has a very big reputation for serving the best crepes in Japantown! It is located in the Kinokuniya mall by the bookstore.

There is usually a line during lunch time, throughout afternoon, & dinnertime. I have even seen people who work in the stores come out to buy crepes from this stand for a quick meal! I realize the best time to go to Sophie's is before lunchtime, and mid afternoon to avoid the crowds. 

I had an opportunity to buy the most light, flaky, crunchiest crepes in either savory, or sweet!

The only savory crepes I have tried from this shop include both the egg salad crepe, and the ham & cheese crepe. The egg salad crepe is served with 1 heaping scope of egg salad with lettuce. The egg salad itself can be on the heavy side from the mayo if eaten all at once. It's a good thing I chose to walk it off that day while visiting the city with friends from Sac. The ham & cheese crepe has the right amount of crunch with an equal amount of ham & cheese together. 

The dessert crepes I had from this shop include the gelato crepe, the fruit with gelato crepe, the fruit crepe covered with nutella, and the fruit crepe with gelato covered with nutella. The more items added into the crepe, the larger the crepe will be. A dessert crepe with different items in it can be large enough to feed two people at a cost around $6. People who visit Kinokuniya mall usually order dessert crepes.

Other dessert items on the menu besides crepes include gelato sundaes. After coming to the Sunshine State, I have yet to find a place that sells green tea frozen treats besides Starbucks. When I come back again, I will be ordering the green tea red bean sundae!
author: Maryann K.

description:
I am not sure what the hype is about with Sophie's Crepes! The crepes here isn't that impressive. Sorry, but Belly Good is better than Sophie's... I feel like I get my money's worth there.

I came here a couple of times to see what the hype is about. But nothing here impressed me. They don't even give you enough fruits and toppings to fill the crepe up. Mine always came pretty flat and pretty sad looking. I mean I order, strawberry, banana, nutella and a scoop of ice cream... and it still didn't look like it was stuff with anything.  It is not really worth it if there is a long line in front of this place.
author: Erica T.

description:
Came in after dinner for a dessert crepe and ordered the Mixed Fruit Nutella crepe- CREPE FAIL!!

FOR $6, you think you'd be able to taste the nutella in your crepe. nope. just a tiny smear and then when i asked if they could add a little more, the cashier girl said ya that's another $2.00 to give you a little spoon of it. 

Are you kidding me? I know how much nutella costs and you cannot charge me $4.00 for a smear of nutella. 

The 2 stars are for the fresh fruits- which were fresh.

Overall, super disappointed and will not be coming back. Go to other crepe places for a better, cheaper tastier crepe!
author: Sangita A.

description: Located inside of Japantown's shopping plaza. Hands down the best crepes i have ever tried!! The only bad thing about it is that it can get a little expensive. But it is so worth it! Every time I am in San Francisco I make a stop at Sophie's crepes. I'm a big fan of green tea ice cream/gelato so I always ask them to put that instead of whatever flavor of ice cream they put. Their crepes makes me so happy because it is very yummy! They take cash only, so bring some cash! Also, gets really crowded and busy since it is so popular This place is my first love of crepes and will forever be!
author: Aarize D.

description:
Nutella & banana crepe with vanilla bean gelato $6.25 - mine
Crepe with black sesame seed gelato $3.5 - the sis
Strawberries and creme crepe $4.5 - the bf

We each took one bite of our crepes and we were like holy crap. This place is freakin good! Crepes are crispy versus soft and doughy and comes in a portable cone. A nice light crunch factor mixed with your filling choice, very delish. The gelato looked sketchy like frostbite but man it was good! Creamy like ice cream. My sis liked her sesame flavor choice a lot. 

It looks big and a lot for dessert after dinner but the bf and I were glad we didn't share. You'll find space in your tummy to eat it all to yourself. I'll be sure to plan more than one trip here next time I'm in town visiting.
author: Vicki N.

description: dont come here often, and im wondering why that is the case. the crepes are amazing, for just over 7 bucks, you get a soft and crispy crepe filled with ice cream, fruits and nutella. The wait isnt all that bad either
author: Long C.

description:
Overview:
5-stars for an elegantly textured crepe and a perfect balance of ingredients 

Details: 
My date today swore that Sophie's Crepes would change my life. It didn't exactly change my life, but I think the look of excitement on his face as I took my first bite was enough to convince me that what I was biting into was no less than a work of crepe art (or was good enough to give at least one person that sort of impression). 
Preface aside, we got the strawberry crepe (I think it was #5) and it really was delicious! The crepe itself is really what I'm sold on. It was thin and not overbearing in relation to the rest of the ingredients (simple: strawberries, vanilla ice cream, and whipped cream), had a crispy outer layer that felt good to bite into, and it wasn't too sweet. I've always appreciated the Japanese's commitment to quality, attention to detail, and elegant design - Sophie's Crepes are all of the above. 

Recommendation: 
Great place to go if you're hanging out in Japan Town! Whether you're in the mood for a snack/dessert, have time to kill, or just want something to do - go get a crepe and you won't be disappointed. It seems to get pretty busy on the weekends though, so either be prepared to wait awhile (there are plenty of shops in the mall to entertain you) or come on a weekday.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
San Diego is seriously lacking in the crepe awesome so when I had a chance to try Sophie's on a recent jaunt to SF, I was all about it. 

I made the biggest mistake on trying to score during the Cherry Blossom Festival and the joint was butts to nutz. The line was long, the wait even longer and while the crepe was good, it was not worth waiting *that* long for. I won't hold it against them though, I should have known better. 

However, there was much redemption to be had the following day as we were close by visiting the local spa. No line, little wait and it was oh so tasty. I got a ham & cheese with avocado crepe and although it looked ridiculously huge, it was the perfect portion of food. 

The biggest dilemma herein is do you go sweet or savory? You got some serious decisions to make son.
author: Ivonne C.

description:
What happened to you, Sophie's?

You used to provide me with ginormous, fluffy, filling (enough for two!) crepes. Now you have turned into all the other crepe shops that are nothing special. The Japanese crepe I had recently (green tea ice cream, red bean paste, and maccha syrup) was mediocre. Before you could use your spoon to eat a lot of the ice cream and stuff inside, but now you just bite it since it's gotten.. thinner and then stuff comes out easily and it leaks.

Disappointed.
author: M C.

description: Best crepes! we stopped by after walking the mall in Japantown cuz of the crowd that was gathered around the storefront. My daughter ordered the typical Nutella and ice cream crepe and it was great. The crepe was crispy and very light. Loved it!
author: Aline D.

description: The gelato here is 1000000x better than the crepes.  I had the sesame seed gelato and it was creamy but not too sweet.  I was disappointed with the crepe because it wasn't eggy like most other crepes I've had it was more crunchy like a crappy cone at mcdonalds.
author: Sara H.

description:
Visited here recently, which who doesn't like Crepes, right? Most everyone I know, loves Crepes!!

I ordered #3 Nutella Crepe along with #10 Nutella with Banana Crepes with no ice cream, whipped cream or chocolate syrup.

When I went, there was a line so Sophie's Crepes must be good!! 

I know how to make Crepes at home, but once in a while, it's a real treat to actually buy one at places such as Sophie's Crepes to be able to spoil yourself.
author: Risa S.

description:
Went to Sophies today for lunch , then decided I'd make a Yelp. 
Sophies is probably my favorite Crepe place in the Bay Area, it's pretty far from where I live , but it's still worth the drive/bart ride to get it . I LOVE crepes, and It's hard to find a decent place where it always tastes the same so I always go to Sophies for crepes when I'm back in the bay. They have a lot of options , I usually just get the vanilla ice cream with strawberry simple and yummy. All my friends could probably say the same thing about this place, that is yummy without a doubt. We all come here.
author: Jessica C.

description:
3.5 stars. 

Located in Japantown. This place always seems to get such high raves from people. This is my second time having it and I dont think much of it. I still like Crepes A Go Go in Berkeley. I ordered the Banana + Nutella + French Vanilla Ice Cream Crepe for $6.30. The Nutella is a little lacking and I just didn't get that satisfied taste out of it.
author: Kathy W.

description:
Never had a bad experience at Sophies!

I always get the Japanese crepe (Green Tea ice cream, red bean paste, green tea sauce), which I feel like I can't get at other creperies because of that sauce.

What I like best is that its pretty much one of the later opened shops compared to everything else in JapanTown. 

CASH ONLY
author: Charmaine P.

description:
I stopped by after the cherry blossom festival nearby, and it was super busy!! My initial thought was that it had to be good, with all the customers. I was really impressed to see that they offer gelato. Whatt?? Gelato in my crepe?! Yum!  A standard crepe with ice cream, chocolate syrup and strawberries will cost you about $7. Red bean gelato was an additonal $1.25. Nutella was an additional $1-something. The cost for my crepe turned out to be about $9. Call me cheap, but that's just wayy too much for a crepe.

Maybe we just came on a bad day when it was unbelievably packed, but I wasn't impressed with Sophie's Crepes at all. For such an expensive crepe, it was a huge disappointment! The crepe itself was soft and mushy. There was only one tiny scoop of gelato, and for that extra $1.25, I expected for there to be at least enough to last me until the bottom of the crepe! BOO!!
author: Vi-Ann L.

description:
No trip to Japantown is complete without a visit to Sophie's Crepes. This place makes damn good crepes! My favorite is "E" which is strawberries, whipped cream, chocolate, and vanilla ice cream. At $5.50, it's not cheap, but it's a perfect snack. I love to watch the crepe-maker do his stuff through the window. They have some pretty strict rules (no pictures or video inside the shop, no changing your order once placed, preferred $1 or $5 bills, purchase drinks before opening the fridge), but people don't seem to mind. There is always a crowd of people, mostly kids, sitting and standing inside the shop, as well as bouncing around the benches conveniently placed outside. 

I once asked the owner if she had ever considered franchising Sophie's Crepe, but she said she wasn't interested in expanding the business. I have to say, Sophie's seems to be doing pretty darn well with its present location.
author: Leslie H.

description: I just ate the crepe with fruits，the kiwi's color looks not right and inside tasted like rotting meat:C
author: Jenn B.

description: Most ridiculous customer service I have ever experienced in my life. I came here and ordered a savory crepe and when they called our order number, they gave us a dessert crepe. So we let them know we got the wrong crepe and they started to make the new one. In the meantime as we waited, we started eating the dessert crepe because we didn't want it to go to waste. While we were halfway done eating it, the teenage Asian American boy working at the cash register demanded we give it back to them. WHO DOES THAT??? We were already halfway done eating it and it was THEIR fault for messing up our order in the first place. Absolutely absurd. This is no way to treat a customer under any circumstances. Never setting foot in this establishment again.
author: Priya V.

description:
Best crepe I have ever had. To me, one of the most important things about a crepe is the batter/outside. When it's soggy, it sucks. Sophie's has just enough crisp and it's perfection! Also, the way the toppings(fruit/ice cream/etc) are arranged inside are made so you could bite it all together! ..And the toppings are there throughout the whole crepe. Some places put the toppings so that it's only on the top which I don't like because later you'd just be eating batter!

Go to sophies!
author: Tammy N.

description:
Amazing. Had the japanese crepe. AMAZING ...definitely want to go back here! service was pretty quick but the place is really small and barely any place to sit.

CASH ONLY
author: Phuong N.

description:
Nom: The sound made when eating something tasty. Can be used as a verb i.e. "nomming", and is often found in the form of "om nom nom".  This is definitely the place to nom!

Haven't been here in a while, but stopped by again during Cherry Blossom Festival and was reminded how good it is.  With over 1000 reviews, there isn't much to say that hasn't been said already.  Just make sure you check it out if you are hanging out in Japantown.  

Like San Francisco, it's a little quirky.  There is usually a long line, the only place to sit is in the center seating area, and they only take cash.  Don't whine, it's just the way it is.  If you don't like it feel free to go somewhere else, it will shorten my line.
author: Aaron L.

description:
Whenever there's a good place to eat, the wait for food would always take a while as well as the long lines for ordering. I've been here so many times with friends and family and it's just delicious. Whenever I'm in Japantown, I would always have to stop by this place even if I'm really full after a big meal. It's a must.
Their fruits are so fresh and delicious and their thin pancake is always crispy, crunchy and soft. I just can't explain how delicious this place is. I tried a different crepe place around here and I didn't like it as much. I think this will be the only crepe place I will keep coming back for.
The only complaint I have is that it's always crowded and the place is small, so there's no room to sit inside or outside that area. There's always a lot of people walking around and sitting, so there's really no where to sit anywhere, unless you walk while you eat or just wait for someone to leave. Other than that, you guys have to try this place and get order F, which is strawberries, kiwi, bananas and vanilla ice cream crepe. You can always ask for a different flavor, but the only 2 ice cream flavors I've tried (and liked) with this order is vanilla and green tea.
author: Vicky L.

description:
My Ratings:
Quantity: 4 - Good portions!
Quality: 5 - Yummy!
Price: 3 - Not bad!
Location: 3 - Small
Parking: 3 - Street parking or garage
Service: 4 - Friendly
Speed: 3 - Good

Overall: Really tasty crepes! I crave for it all the time.

My Opinion/Story:
Tasty, crunchy, simple yet flavorful crepes!  The presentation is nice but I don't get why we can't take pictures.. it's not like there's any secret ingredients to it.  But I must say, I love their crepes here.  Okay, one thing I don't get is why is it so warm in this mall?  You go anywhere else and the temperature is good but once you go to this area.. it's super hot.  Melts my ice-cream right away and I don't like the mess.
author: Cherryl D.

description:
My go to dessert crepe place in SF. 

A good stroll in J-town for this lovely thang.  You will usually see a little crowd around this store because customers' stare are the workers making the crepes. It usually takes 10 mins or less for busy days. =)

I usually get their #8 Strawberry/ NUTELLA ($5.00), but I feel extra adventurous that day I get it with whipped cream and ICE CREAM (or gelato)

This is totally a sinful treat. 


As full as your are, I PROMISE you , you will make room for this crepe.
author: kent c.

description: Still. Freaking. Awesome. Make sure to get gelato in your (nutella) crepe. Especially the cookies and cream gelato - sooo creamy and delicious!
author: Priscilla T.

description: Went when it was packed. The crepe itself wasn't crispy enough, making it hard to eat and messy with the gelato inside. Still good but I prefer Genki's.
author: Miffy Y.

description:
Been here four times but never had a Sophies Crepe.

However, this day I would enjoy one.

Ordered a mixed fruit #13, comes with a fresh made crepe, stuffed with fresh fruit and whipped cream.

Forget your diet, just indulge :)
author: Bert K.

description:
Everytime I come to Japantown, I have to come here to get the Japanese Crepe. I always crave it and never get bored of it.

The crepe itself is thin, fresh and crispy. They don't skimp on the stuff they put inside. The green tea gelato is the high quality- a ton of green tea flavor and very rich. The green tea sauce adds more matcha flavor. And the red bean paste is a nice sweet compliment. The mouthwatering delicious! Every bite is a piece of heaven! I recommend this place!

The crepes are a little pricey. Around $5-7, but you'll forget about it once you take your first bite. 

Service is fast and plus, it's entertaining to watch them make it in front of you.
author: Tes Y.

description:
After my grocery shopping at J-Town Safeway, I had enough time to check out the mall at Japantown Center.

Located on the top floor of the mall, this crepe place is the hottest ticket and a great place to complete your meal from one of many neighboring restaurants. For some of you, per se.

I had one of the popular crepes, #13. For $5.25, I get chopped Mixed fruits, Nutella Spread and for $1.00 extra I got a cloud of Whipped Cream all filled in a pancake batter blanket the shop accepts. I paid my treat in cash and that is the only payment. With many young kids loitering and enjoying their crepes from here, I got mine pretty quick. 

There weren't too many tables in the little shop or any available benches in the lobby for me to eat my treat. So I managed to walk around the mall with my crepe in my hand. Though quite messy with the whipped cream and the ooze of the Nutella spread, the specialty crepe was thinner than Genki's and Crepe Temptation. In fair assessment and lack of size, the crepes did tasted ok.

My fifth ever crepe and I was hoping a crepe would be the same size of a super burrito. But as a high-volume eater, I'm asking too much.

There is a Yelp-sticker on the glass door where inside, the crepe-makers performing there act in front of the admirers outside.
author: Matt G.

description:
A small little place located in Japantown. 

Service:
Service is usually friendly, but there were some times that I had a grumpy server/cashier. 

Food:
The crepes here are delicious! It's crispy, but yet soft. I love getting my crepes with nutella, ice cream, and strawberries. But I loved every dessert place that I've gotten. I haven't tried the savory crepes yet so I can't give any input on in. 

Overall:
I would definitely recommend coming here if your in Japantown. It's a great dessert or snack place!
author: Christina L.

description:
This is the best crepes I've ever had. I always get the one with all the fruit (Strawberries, bananas, kiwi, etc) with nutella and add green tea gelato. Noms. The crepe man was near the window so it is entertaining just to watch while waiting in line or waiting for your order. The crepes run for ~$6-7 I think which is a bit steep for dessert but it is worth it! (Also because I added the gelato scoop haha)

Tip: Cash only!
author: Elaine L.

description: These crepes are my favorite - they are unlike the typical, soggy crepe - they are crispy on the outside and you can hold them with your hands. Excellent dessert! Hardly any seating in the store but seating in the mall.
author: Alias ..

description:
There is something to be said about making the crepe fresh. They always come up crispy and warm!

There is always a line out the door but they always so calmly handled the order. The line moves rather quickly.

The cash only tends to get me as I seems to just spend them like water whenever I have any on hand. I have asked friends for money or ended up with offers of sharing from a paying friend.
author: Cindy B.

description: My favorite crepe place! But be sure you understand that these crepes are different from the French crepes. Not moist, more crunchy texture. I really like it. They have great sweet crepes but I always really enjoy the savory ones as well.
author: Shirley W.

description:
The green tea gelato crepe is so good. I always get the green tea gelato here. The green tea flavor is very intense. I like how the cold gelato goes well with the warm crepe. 

This place can get very busy during big events in Japantown.
author: Alexander L.

description:
There's a sign clear as day saying no pictures allowed.  I clearly disregarded it.

Take a look for yourself: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cegatrLOnlyeSgDpYOua2g?select=TXroQ3OqOzr7W69sGO3D9A

I can see why they wouldn't want anyone to take a picture.  Why would you want anyone to know that Yelp loves them.  Or that they are currently hiring.  Or that they have more bananas on their metal shelf than all of Costa Rica has left within its borders.

This goes out to any CIA agents reading this, if you need someone to take recon/intelligence/surveillance photographs for you, look no further.  You can see how easily I circumvented any and all security measures Sophies Crepes took.  Holla-atcha-boy.

Oh yeah and the Nutella and banana crepe was...well....it was bananas.
author: Eugine Y.

description:
Banana Nutella crepe w/ Vanilla Ice cream and whip cream.

Is a awesome desert, and they make it with great quality with a delicious appeal. It is busy for that reason, it is good!
author: BJ A.

description:
Definitely check out Sophie's!

After having cupcakes from Cako bakery downstairs, my boyfriend and I wanted to take pikapika pictures.. well, actually I was the only one who wanted to take pikapika pictures lol. Little did I know that we would stumble upon Sophie's! I told my boyfriend that we NEEDED to try Sophie's and he agreed. 

Surprisingly, on a Friday afternoon, we were the only people there. The store itself is small, but clean. The workers are friendly and they have a variety of crepes/ice cream to choose from. I settled on a nutella crepe, and I forgot what my boyfriend got, but all I remember was that it was good! The crepe batter is sweet and not too thick which to me, is perfect! The crepes were a bit pricy for the size, but other than that, everything was good!
author: Joyce E.

description:
I ordered the chocolate crepe.. I think I should have ordered another one.. the only thing chocolate was the syrup.. I wish the girl heard me when I said I wanted chocolate gelato.. I paid extra instead of ice cream. 

The place is pretty popular.. they have savory crepes but the girl said they are known for their sweet crepes.. 

Ice cream.. gelato.. savory crepes.. sweet crepes.. you get to look at them while they make your crepes!! 

Cash only....
author: Tram N.

description: I've been coming to this joint since high school and although I do enjoy the crepes/dessert they provide, I realize that it's not something that spectacular anymore. Don't get me wrong, the crepe itself is still cooked well, and the ice cream is of decent quality, but for a dessert crepe that's costing you nearly $7 on average, I think you can do a little better than this place. I got a green tea ice cream, nutella, with banana crepe and that cost me $8.50. I like my dessert, but with that money, I could have gotten a bowl of ramen. Nothing really against the quality of the food or the service they staff have, but dollar for dollar, there are other crepe places that will serve you the same thing with you keeping a dollar or two in your pocket. I would recommend this place for a once in a while go at it, or if you've never been before.
author: Maurice C.

description: Worst service EVER. Lost my receipt but I literally just ordered 2 minutes before getting my crepe. I needed to show my receipt to get it. And I told the guy that I didn't have it on me. And he just shrugs his shoulders. Who does that. And they finally gave it to me after watching me helplessly looking for it. Poor service, rude workers. Never coming here again. Next time, give me a heads up if I need to keep my receipt.
author: Paula X.

description:
Have a good variety of different crepes and always a good show. 
It's kind of pricy, but you're in the heart of Japantown...
Gree tea ice cream is always good... in a crepe, even better.
author: M J.

description: I'm not a big crepe person but I thought "Ehhhhh what the hell why not" while we were in Japantown and I got a pretty simple one, chocolate sauce and coconut sorbet. It was a good size for the price and the gelato was DELICIOUS. Granted it wasn't made in house but I thank them for introducing me to a good brand. I might jut get gelato ext time though. Can't say I'll be a crepe person yet.
author: Raven P.

description:
The long lines are telling! Sophie's Crepes is delicious! So many to choose from but my favorite is the Japanese Special with azuki bean, green tea gelato, matcha sauce and whip cream. It also come sans crepe as the Japantown Sundae. It's kinda tiny for almost $6 in a small cup but it's soooo good. Never thought I'd like the combination of red bean and green tea but there's a reason the Japanese love it!  Yum!

Make sure you bring cash otherwise they have an ATM in-store. Place your order, take your number and wait to be called for some yummy goodness.
author: Anna R.

description: Go for the #17: it's like  Starbucks ice cold Matcha meets red bean cake meets green tea ice cream wrapped in a crepe instead of a waffle cone.
author: Simon T.

description:
My friend and I were walking around the shopping center and this place stuck out because of the HUGE amount of people waiting in front!

That settled it, we had to check it out.

We ordered a dessert crepe to share, which contained strawberries, kiwi, banana, and delicious whipped cream. It was fun watching them make our crepe :) That mexican guy had skills, yo!

The service is a bit slow and it is cash only, but you come out with a really great crepe that tastes amazing! Overall, 4/5 stars.
author: Jenni I.

description:
Sophie's crepes is my favorite crepe place. The place makes delicious crepes. There ice cream is to die for and the crepe wrap itself is sweet but not to sweet, soft in the middle and crunchy on the outside. I usually get the mixed fruit with ice cream for the sweet crepes. I would recommend anyone to come here who loves crepes or just wants a snack! They also have savory crepes! 

Also remember to bring cash cause they don't except credit.
author: Connie Y.

description:
I came across this place when we went to Japantown. Mannnnn.... this place is legit! There was a line forming right when i got there so you know this place gotta be good!

They had a wide selection of different types of crepes to choose from. I made my own and got a Nutella, banana and vanilla ice cream crepe. The most delicious crepe I had so far! The Ice cream did not melt to much so I actually enjoyed eating it rather than drinking it haha

I will definitely come back here to grab another scrumptious crepe!!
author: Randy P.

description:
Honestly I don't see why people would line up the door to buy their crepes. Their crepes are just like the rest of other crepes places in the city. Aren't they all fresh and sweet? This place is no special than others. 

3 stars for giving me only a small scoop of ice cream. Argh!
author: Sam W.

description:
This review is not about their crepe - just to be fair. 

Their crepe is alright, maybe a 3 stars. There are better crepes out there.

When we were ordering, we wanted to add an ice cream to the crepe, when we asked what flavors they have, the server/cashier simply pointed his finger to the freezer, no single words said. Then, we realized they have a special menu put on the side of the register, while their main menu was hanging on the wall - about $2 different for something similar that we ordered - $2, big deal, I can careless. But when we inquired about it, his reaction was liked:"well, but u ordered something else". Everything done with a poker face, no facial expression, while I don't need u to treat me as a king, I think I deserved to feel welcomed.

I am used to what the yelpers sometimes refer to as "Chinese restaurant service" but still this one pissed me off.
author: Iris H.

description:
It was my first time having a crepe ever in my life and everyone raves over Sophie's Crepes, so here I was! AND I L-O-V-E CREPES NOW!
 
I ordered banana, nutella, vanilla ice cream,  fresh strawberries and kiwi. Ah it was indeed delicious. The shop was very clean and the staff were very friendly. It couldn't have gotten any better! If you love crepes, I highly recommend Sophie's. And if you've never had a crepe, Sophie's is a nice way to extend your pallet. I would give them a 5/5, but I haven't tried all of their crepes and I haven't been here yet on other days at different times. I'll definitely be returning!

P.S. Bring cash so you won't have to use their ATM machine since they do not accept credit/debit.
author: Sarah M.

description: Stopped in for a dessert crepe and it was delicious.  I ordered a fruit and nutella crepe and shared it with my husband. It was just the right amount of sweet and tasty.  Wish I had a crepe place closer to home cause this was a very nice treat.
author: Nicole B.

description:
If you still haven't try this place...
I don't know where you been..
Every time i visit japan town i will come here for a crepes!
My favorite is the Mix Fruit with ice cream Crepe.
Their is also a display window you get to watch how they make it.
author: TeaBoy A.

description:
I WILL ALWAYS LOVE SOPHIE'S CREPES!

I literally tell everyone I know about it when the crepe subject comes up, or take them there myself if I'm in the Bay Area visiting home.

there's just nothing like an amazing battered crepe to perfection, fresh fruits, drizzled nutella, vanilla ice cream...i'm literally sad I am 500 miles away to not have it right now!

I live across the bay bridge and my family and I literally drive all the way to japan town just to have sophie's crepes! My favorite part about it is they are OPEN LATE! lol

although they only take cash which is inconvenient...i know by now where my bank is before we hit up sophie's!

5 stars allllll the way!
author: Andrea P.

description:
Pricing: Good. The pre-fixed ones are the best valued.
Quality: Excellent. Still the best Japanese style crepe!
Turnaround: Good. I love watching them make the crepe right in front of you.
Service: Good. Nothing to complain about.

The crepes at Sophie's are always thin and crispy with just the right amount sweetness. Hence, the title of the best Japanese crepe~ Unlike the traditional French crepe, the Japanese style ones at Sophie are thinner and ends up with a nice crunch near the edge. Mixed with the ice cream and fresh fruits, this makes a cool delightable and portable dessert. Personally I like the ice cream to melt a little first so that it runs down the crepe and since the crepe is a little crispy, the ice cream does not make the crepe soggy at all. Moreover, probably due to the thinner crepe, the chef makes them super fast, but this is negated by the usual long line that seems to always be present. The service is fine as I really only interact with the cashier who took my money in an orderly fashion I suppose. I do advise against the savory crepes as those are obviously not their forte. The ingredients sounds like a good match and all, but I have yet to try a savory crepe that actually tasted fulfilling in any sense.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Everytime I come to Japantown, this place always ends up being the last stop of the day. You know a place is good if you can visit it more than 10 times and still enjoy every bite of the crepe.

First off, I love how you can watch the workers make the crepes. Its almost hypnotic watching them pour the crepe batter, then swirl it around the pan creating a perfect circle. The watching them flip it over with just a metal stick and all of a sudden, its done. All in less than a minutes time.

The crepes are really the best part though. I normally get a mandarin orange and nutella crepe with a scoop of vanilla ice cream in it. The ice cream adds more cost but omg it makes it 10 times better. And thank god for this place introducing me to nutella. I never knew what it was until I had it on a crepe, and now it's become a staple of my pantry at home. All the other dessert crepes are pretty good also, although I've never tried one of their actual meal crepes. 

Few gripes about the place though, although not enough to knock off a star. The line gets really long sometimes, which isn't really the restaurants fault since it's in a busy location to begin with AND they serve crepes so good everyone wants one. Also, the price is a bit much for what you're actually getting. 

Sophie's Crepes provided me with my first ever crepe experience. I think I started with the best.
author: Sean H.

description:
I honestly have not found another crepe place that tastes as fresh, crispy, and delicious as Sophie's Crepes! I half-wish this place were in a location more accessible (not inside a plaza and in a more open location), but at the same time, I'm glad i can always go to this place when I want a bite after wandering around Japantown. This is the first place that has introduced me to crepes as a food item, and since the first time I've one from here more than 5 years ago, I've always gone here ever since. It's always fun to watch the employees make a plethora of different crepes behind a low glass pane. I almost always never leave Japantown without having had a crepe from here. 

Lucky for my boyfriend and me, he enjoys the sweet dessert crepes and I enjoy the savory crepes, so we always get a little bit of both when we come here. My favorite savory crepe is the turkey and cheese--thinly sliced turkey meat with melted cheddar cheese on a moist, chewy crepe lightly crisped at the edges is just heavenly! I don't know if my boyfriend has been able to pick a favorite, but his common orders are banana+whipped cream+vanilla bean gelato crepe (for when we share) and nutella+banana+gelato+whipped cream crepe (for himself when he eats it on his own). We have never left this place dissatisfied and I hope this place never goes out of business! I don't know I'd do without it when I'm at Japantown.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I had to make a very difficult decision today. 

I had to choose between strawberry-nutella vs. banana-nutella crepe. I wanted to have both, but was saving room in my stomach for some alcohol at a Yelp party!  (teehee)

I went for the classic banana-nutella combo. The crepe itself could've been more softer, this was a little bit too done.  But my bananas were fresh and the nutella was the perfect coating on it!  topped off with whipped cream (why do they have to charge an extra dollar for this?) and packaged in a neat little cone makes it convenient for you to eat on the go. 

BTW, cash only.
author: Janice C.

description: A little pricy but tastes so good as a dessert after eating a bunch of food in Japantown. I get their crêpes every time im nearby- try them you wont regret it ^^ their amount of crepe fillings have decreased :( from what i remember. Plus, service isnt as great anymore. An average crêpe place now.
author: Quincy M.

description:
No complaints here - this place makes all the other crepes I've tried pale in comparison. 
I really like how they make their crepes crisp, unlike all the other shops I've tried where it seems to just flop over the toppings. 
I had the green tea/red bean crepe: SOOO GOOD. It was my first time eating a handheld crepe too (definitely the way to go). 
I was so tempted to get extra ice cream on the side because of all the great flavors they had. 
Definitely will come back.
author: Ashley N.

description: Best crepe I ever had. There can be a long wait but they are generally pretty quick with the orders. I ordered the mix fruit and vanilla ice cream crepe. Had fresh fruit and rich ice cream. Definitely really good.
author: Mike T.

description:
OMG. The crepes there are DELICIOUS. They have sweet and savory kinds. You can pick your own fillings, AS MUCH AS YOU WANT to make your OWN COMBINATION. Obviously, more stuffing more expensive. Most unique thing about this store is that you can have gelato or sorbet in it. The crepes are crispy and thin, but the size is pretty BIG. 

The one I got included Banana, Nutella & Green Tea Ice cream - $7. 
My friend's contained Banana, Nutella & Raspberry Sorbet. -$7
Friend: "The raspberry sorbet is really good. like really good."

UGH. I just wanna go back and get some more while typing this review. Just imagine biting into the crepe with refreshing ice cream and crispy crepe with all those amazing flavours in your mouth. It's TOTALLY WORTH IT after going all that way to JapanTown.
author: Jenny D.

description: Love Sophie's crepes!  Came here on several occasions, and they are very consistent.  We shared 2 crepes between my wife and kids: the strawberry, nutella, vanilla gelato, and whipped cream, and also another one with strawberry, chocolate sauce, and vanilla gelato.  Yumm!  Love biting into the combination of flavors all wrapped up in a crepe (held like an ice cream cone).  Definitely a fan of this place.
author: Lawrence L.

description:
I got the Japanese Crepe (green tea gelato, red bean paste, matcha sauce) which was $5.25. Decent prices compared to other places. A lovely combination for a crepe that other places usually wouldn't have. Wasn't too sweet so it was perfect. I definitely recommend it! 

The only downside is waiting for the crepe. It was about a 30 minute wait for it, but you can pass the time was simply walking around and checking out the stores around.

I recommend trying this place out!
author: Kevin T.

description:
I LOVE CREPES!

This place has never failed me, NEVER. The only complaint I have is that, when it gets really busy, the customers tend to just stand where ever they can, so they block you from the register. But their crepes are super delicious. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
author: Cindy L.

description:
This place is always packed, and obviously for good reason.  Be prepared to wait at least 10-15 minutes after you place your order.  

My personal favorite - banana and nutella with green tea gelato crepe!  Try it and you won't be disappointed.
author: Saweena K.

description:
Green tea ice cream with red bean paste and whipped cream in a crispy crepe... what's not to like?

Cute little shop with lots of other different types of crepes as well.
author: Vivian H.

description:
I haven't been to Sophie's since the good ol' high school days, so stepping inside the store was like a trip down memory lane.

I was with my friend and it was his birthday and all he wanted from J-town was a crepe from Sophie's.  Who am I to stop him?

We stared at the menu intensely for a minute.  I knew it was going to be a difficult choice.  But I broke down and got the works: strawberries, banana, kiwi, nutella and a scoop of ice cream.

I was probably expecting a mouthgasm for $7, but did not receive.  It's still a good treat, albeit a bit pricey for what you get.
author: Jenny L.

description: Best crepe place on earth!  I haven't found one place that has better crepes than this place.  I guess that's mostly because I LOVE their very thin style crepe.  It's actually so thin that it's crunchy!  They often have a long line but it moves very fast.  So don't be discouraged.
author: Cory K.

description: I have been starved for GOOD gelato ever since leaving Italy. AMAZING. The pistachio was so full of flavor, and the banana-walnut was spectacular. I couldn't put my finger on the reason for the latter flavor being so special; I think there might be some enhancing flavor/spice at play... mMmm made my strawberry-nutella crepe AND my day!
author: Awesomeness S.

description:
There is a reason why the line for Sophie's Crepes flows outside the shop doors into the Japan Town shopping center. They are simply that good. Take gelato, freshly made crepes and fill with your favorite sweet or savory filling. I love that they have unique flavors such as black sesame and red bean in addition to the standard green tea, chocolate, straw/vanilla flavors. There is a fish bowl view where you can watch or anxiously await for the cook to assemble your order.

My Order: Hazelnut crepe with stawberries/bananas, chocolate and whipped creme. 

A complete sugar coma- I think next time I will skip the whipped creme, it really doesn't need it, but even so, it was absolutely delicious. Perfect for the city's rare sunny weather
author: Audrey L.

description:
We were in town for the Avicii concert and our friends wanted to drop by Japan Town because she never been there (my jaw dropped).  After shopping around, we decided to check out Sophie's Crepes.

I didn't order the crepes because I was so full from lunch, but I did get the gelato.  I ordered the red bean gelato, OMG, it was freaking amazing.  Gelato is gelato for me, once you taste one, you taste them all.  The red bean gelato had that flavor that was consistent with any Vietnamese dessert I've ever ate.  The creamy and icy texture made it a gelato that I will always come back for.

My buddies ordered the crepes and it was pretty damn good.

4 stars.

Enjoy!
author: Tony N.

description:
Sophie's crepes is a small place in a small shopping center in japantown. It was super hot inside and over crowded... good thing I was there with a couple people so I definitely took every opportunity to step outside for some air. The wait was longer then I had expected for a single crepe filled with fruit and ice cream. 

I personally feel that it's over-hyped. I admit it's convenient to have it wrapped up and all ready to go, but I guess deep down I'm a "crepe on a plate" kinda gal...lol plus it was a little too much on the crunchy side, making it more of a flat waffle cone-like kind of texture. Not a fan but if it's in front of me I'd probably eat it any way.
author: Beanne N.

description: I love this place, I hate the line but the crepes are great and handmade in front of you. I have only had sweet crepes from here so I can't speak for their savory options. I got a mixed fruit crepe here last week and the cashier informed that the bananas were not as ripe so they would not be as sweet, and offered to replace the fruit with another:):) love this! So many other places would just serve the less worthy banana but these folks put it right out there to make sure you are satisfied. Go here, parking lot is easy and the mall in general in fun:)
author: Kellie S.

description:
I have tried their gelato AND their crepe here, and both are sooo delicious!!!

Their sesame gelato is to DIE for. For those of you who know what I'm talking about, it tastes like the sesame glutinous balls, but a cold ice cream version of the sesame inside it. It's so good! But a lot of people who aren't Asian will be doubtful and not try this because it kind of looks like gravel. :( But looks can be deceiving! It's really really good. 

The next time I went, I ordered the Japanese Crepe. It has green tea gelato, red bean paste, and matcha sauce all inside the crispy crepe! It tastes really good, and is very portable. I ate it on the way to the bus stop! And the crepe itself is so crispy and doesn't get soggy at ALL, which really surprised me. :) 

My favorite crepe place, by FAR!
author: Jeanette S.

description:
Sophie's Crepes is pretty much a hit-or-miss place. So I can say the place or the servers can be really nice or unenthusiastic. Again I've noticed when it's slow you'll get great customer service. When it's crowded (with loud overly obnoxious kids - teenagers) be prepared to receive lackluster and maybe rude service.

Either way, you can NOT go wrong with the crepes here. It's pretty expensive depending on what flavors you get and how many ingredients you want on it. I like how you can see how the crepes are being made. Really fast. Small store, limited seating but the quality of the food is great. (+1 star for the fresh tasting strawberry) 

I recommend this place than the other creperie in the other building.
author: David C.

description:
The crepes were A-OK.  We ordered 2: nutella, strawberries & banana w/ french vanilla ice cream and the other crepe was similar, but with pieces of mandarin.  They started off by giving our order to someone else.  Just because the other couple was standing there, you just don't blindly hand stuff out.  We started off enjoying it because we haven't had it in awhile, but not even half way, it started falling apart =(

I'll be coming back to try the other stuff since its in cute lil Japan-town

Oh: CASH ONLY!!  So bring about $7/person
author: Thuy V.

description: Overpriced and barely any Nutella. Extra $1 charge if we has wanted it to actually have any Nutella taste. Will not be returning.
author: Asha R.

description:
Crepes are nice and thin, yums if you select the right stuffing.  Would recommend some fruit and chocolate...avoid the whipped cream...too heavy.
Am rating around 2.75 since it was just a regular crepe...
author: Jeong K.

description:
Good place for Japanese style crepes. The line is always really long as it seems that this place is in every tourist guide book ever printed.

The actual crepes here are really nice and crispy. On their own, without toppings,  they're still quite delicious. The prices are, however, a little high for what you get and the crepe place downstairs is a better deal.
author: Will S.

description: Hands down an amazing food spot! The service was great and you most definitely get what you pay for! I had a great experience here and would recommend it to anyone! Can't wait to go back and have another one of their delicious crepes!
author: Shaniah M.

description: These are sooo good! The crepes are specifically made for each person so they're super fresh. My personal favorite is the Japanese special (a crepe with green tea ice cream, matcha sauce, red bean paste, and whipped creme), but there's tons of choices on the menu including crepes with fruits and savory crepes. If you don't like any of the menu options, you can also build your own crepe from individual menu items!
author: Audrey Z.

description:
I like to eat my emotions.  When I'm happy, I eat.  When I'm sad, I eat. 

Actually, I'm not really like that.  I starve myself when I'm sad.

Just kidding!  Because with a place like Sophie's Crepes, it's impossible to even be sad.  Especially when there's a wonderful concoction that includes green tea gelato (mmm), red bean paste and matcha sauce.  All inside a thin, chewy crepe.

1 star off for not allowing cameras (?!) and cash only.
author: Tori S.

description:
You haven't had REAL crepes until you try Sophie's Crepes. Located in the Japantown mall, right across from Pika Pika, it's a small place that can easily be missed if it wasn't for the line that was going out the door. 

I've been here twice already, and I highly recommend trying the Japanese crepe, which has green tea gelato, red bean paste, and matcha sauce. It cost $5.25 ($5.70 with the tax), which may sound pricey, but it'll all make sense to you after you take a bite of it! The crepe is crispy and thin, so it doesn't distract from the complementary flavors of the creamy green tea gelato and the red bean. I seriously wanted to run back into the store to get another one after finishing it haha! 

They also have the make-your-own crepe, where you can start out with the crepe at $2, and then add as many toppings as you desire, with prices ranging from $0.25 to $0.75 per topping. Their gelato selection also looks fantastically delicious; they have enticing flavors like lychee, pistachio, plum, and banana walnut which I would like to try one day! 

One setback is that it only took cash! They have an ATM right in front of the place, just in case you did forget to bring some cash, but it charges $2 for withdrawing. Also on the particular day I went, the lady who was taking my order was a bit rude while waiting for me to decide on my order, but it didn't really bother me too much. 

Overall, definitely a place I will come back to every time I'm in SF!
author: Kristi L.

description: I've never had a crepe before, but this one was alright. It didn't give me that craze that everyone else seems to have for crepes. Customer service kinda sucks and they only take cash. But it's cool I guess if you just want something sweet.
author: Leanna D.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE.

Pistachio gelato crepe is "the way life should be". Period.
author: HP L.

description:
The mexican man behind the counter sure knows how to make crepes! Why does Sophie get all the credit? That is unacceptable!... unless he's Sophie... but then that would be quite disturbing.

The crepes here are the best I've had anywhere. While every other place offers bland soggy carb wraps masquerading as crepes, this place gives you light and flaky goodness that taste just like how you would imagine a fresh baked, uncooled sugar cone to taste. 

I really hope he's getting paid well.
author: Spring L.

description:
Well I've been coming here since I was in 1st grade and I'm a sophomore in college now but I will always be an avid fan of this place!

Whenever I come here, I have either two options: either satisfy my sweet tooth and get the E, which should simply stand for Ecstasy because that's what the crepe feels like but really is a combination of strawberries, chocolate sauce, whipped cream, and ice cream, or get something savory and order an Egg Salad crepe (which is an easy way to get m to take my clothes off).

This place is really interesting as there is a glass window where you can see the chefs make the crepes. All the other materials are already made, so the only real interesting part is to see how crepes are made. Think of it as if the crepes are European strippers and the only way to get your hands on one of them is to purchase them. But if not, you're only going to be able to satisfy your eyes visually and not orally. I suppose the smell will also entice you but I wouldn't advice smelling a European stripper (they'd probably smell sticky)

When they make the crepes, they cook them until they're crispy so that when you bite into it, you get the warm, flaky crisp along with all the yummies on the inside. Be sure to use a spoon as well as it makes things a lot cleaner! Don't be a dirty hoe making a mess. Be a little refined please.

I suppose to be fair, there's another creperie in the same center that I would prefer ONLY if I wanted to be more visually enticed and if in the rare situation that I would want to get my hands on a softer version than a crispy hard one. But most of the time I'd rather have that crispy and hard sensation in my mouth so I more-often-than-not opt for Sophie's.

If you're going to Japantown, this is definitely one place that YOU MUST stop by. Forget the cupcakes and the ice cream that you'll see along the way (and no offense, especially forget Andersen bakery. It's delicious but seriously,  you can get that anywhere..). Go straight to Sophie's after dinner (or before like I did.. i don't judge), and get it. Your insides will not be disappointed.
author: Johnny C.

description:
SOPHIE'S CREPES

Every time I go to Japan Town, San Francisco, there is always one place I need to go to before I leave: Sophie's Crepes. It is a small gelato shop that specializes in making ice cream crepes. Simple concept: ice cream and crepes. The beauty is putting it together! Choose any gelato flavor and it will be put into a crepe!!! Add toppings and you have yourself a wonderful dessert treat! My personal favorite: black sesame gelato crepe! Mmmmmmmmmmmm!!! Treat yourself to something sweet!
author: Stanley C.

description:
YUM YUM YUM

effing amazing. nutella. strawberries. ice cream. i die. 

that is all there is to say about it
author: Erica I.

description:
delicious delicious crepe! The crepe isn't too sweet or too salty, and it has a consistent crisp.  Choices of your toppings are your typical crepe places, fruits, nutella, and they offer savory choices. Haven't tried the savory flavors. Love the crepe itself so much, don't want too many salty flavors distracting me from enjoying the crepe hah.

The only thing I don't like, but I see this often with all the other crepe places, is the tip of the crepe gets wayyyyy too sweet (too many toppings squished in one areas without enough crepe).  Don't know if there's a way to change this.  Also, the green tea ice cream flavor is too sweet and not enough tea flavor to my liking.

Line can get long and very much out the door. But they are fast and efficient.  

TIP: The specials aren't advertised well. It's not on the menu board so you won't see it while standing in line. The specials is on the counter next to the register....I forget this, and get in a numbing indecision when I get to the counter, oops. 

Cash only!
author: Connie H.

description:
Good crepes, good ice cream, but incredibly overpriced.  For what you pay you would expect to at least get your craving's worth.  The pictures all make the crepes and sundae cups look so big, but when you actually get it in hand you will be sorely disappointed.  Why so stingy?

Worth a try, but I can think of much better dessert places if I'm going to dish out $6.  Will try the other place "Belly Good Crepes" next time I'm in the area.
author: David H.

description:
Sophie's crepes are good, a great dessert spot to go to when I go to Japantown. There are only a few tables in there so more times than most we sit out on a bench and just people watch or really sit there and watch the people as they stare at the workers make crepes through the window. 

I usually get a strawberry, nutella with vanilla ice cream. My niece loooves chocolate so she got a banana with chocolate ice cream and whipped cream. I know she enjoyed it. I personally like Genki for my dessert crepes because I think its a bit crispier, but Sophie's comes in a close second.
author: Heather P.

description: This is my absolute favorite crepe place to go. Crepe is nice, thin, and crispy, filled with ice cream and fruits.  It satisfies your sweet cravings without being overly sweet and it's actually pretty filling. There's a few occasions that I had to share.
author: kevin c.

description: I loved the crepes!  My husband daughter and I shared a crepe with strawberries,  chocolate and bananas  they really pack the crepe with fillings im so glad we shared 1 or we would have wasted alot.  I am definitely going to be coming back when I am in japan town!
author: Taylor C.

description:
I really like their savory crepes: ham+cheese with veges, tuna melt with veges. The only main thing that differs their crepes from other Japanese styled crepes is their addition of tomato! Tomato is gooddd

My boyfriend used to work here and would get me their desert crepes after work. =) I would stock them up for later in the fridge. Swear, their whip cream tastes better after doing time in my freezer.
author: Alisa M.

description: The Japanese dessert crepe is delicious! Green tea gelato, red bean paste, and matcha sauce meld together perfectly inside the soft yet crispy crepe.  Too bad there's always a line when I'm here.
author: Renee L.

description:
This place is my favorite crepes place in San Francisco. I always get their green tea gelato crepes - green tea gelato/ice cream actually tastes like green TEA and not green SUGAR, and the crepes are always made crunchy and never burnt or super-soft/limpy. They also tape up the ends of the crepe paper holder so that your gelato wouldn't melt and drip onto your clothes and everywhere else. :)

Service is kinda slow, but hey, these are all made to order so at least you come out with a freshly made, HOT, and tasty crepe! I generally try to come here at non-peak hours, i.e. in the afternoons, weekdays, etc. so I wouldn't have to stand in line for... Well... Forever... The lines and the waiting get pretty long during weekend nights and festivals like the Cherry Blossom Festival.

Cash only!
author: Charmian W.

description:
As I am a huge fan of crepes, I had to stop by Sophie's Crepes after having dinner near by. There is ALWAYS room for dessert!  
 
Come here on a Saturday night, the establishment was late. There was a line, but the wait was only 5 minutes for us.  My boyfriend and I shared the banana and nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream for a dollar more. It was yummy, I actually would have liked for them to put more stuffing in the crepe. Other than that, I was satisfied.
author: Becky Q.

description: Food is a bit overpriced for me, but it's pretty good! The crepes are crispy and not soggy at all. Their whipped cream is a bit creamier and thicker than the whipped cream you buy from the grocery store, so that is a plus. Very cute store and adorable crepe presentation in a cone. You can add a scoop of vanilla ice cream for only a dollar, or a scoop of their various flavors of gelato for two. They have banana, strawberry, kiwi, and mixed fruits. They have nutella, fruit jams, chocolate syrup, etc. And that is only their dessert crepes!
author: Prima S.

description:
It's slow, popular, but well worth the wait! The most recent crepe I've tried is Green Tea Gelato one and that was delicious! It's relatively cheap for the size. Looking forward to trying one with Nutella next time. 

They're cash only (handed them my card and they looked at me awkwardly) and they have a strict no-camera policy.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I am writing this minutes after devouring my food. Crispy, delicious, and thin crepes! Yum. 

Every time I come here I order the same thing: strawberry and nutella crepe with green tea ice cream and azuki red bean. So good! 

Beware: They are very slow and the wait is long, especially during the busy hours, but in my opinion, it is well worth the wait. If you plan on coming on a weekend day, I suggest planning ahead, it can take at least twenty minutes sometimes.

Overall, a great crepe place. Well worth a try if you have some time to spare!
author: Nastasia G.

description:
They have black sesame gelato!! I've had better but it's OK since it's hard to find here. The flavour could be more intense but I liked the grains of sesame that you can see/taste (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cegatrLOnlyeSgDpYOua2g?select=s-aPpqpdgyLFx2r0J9s9MA). They also have red bean gelato. Haven't tried it here yet but I loved red bean popsicles as a kid so it's on my list.

I was jonesing for something simple when I came so I just ordered the nutella crepe (#3) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cegatrLOnlyeSgDpYOua2g?select=NJzJdc3Q2hU-aknn6xscEQ). The crepe batter was good - not too sweet or salty - but there was little too much nutella for my liking. I have no doubt their other crepes would be tasty, but I wouldn't wait 20 minutes for one on a Saturday afternoon.
author: Steph L.

description:
Today I had the pleasure of tasting Sophie's Crepes which I heard so much good things about it.  I had the mix fruit crepe.  It took awhile for my order because it is a Sunday and busy given the fact it was just right after lunch.  I shared with a special someone and I wasn't impressed.  It was alright.  Wouldn't think to drive all the way down to Japantown for these crepes.  Had better.

Besides the interesting crepes' selections, you see a lot of interesting people passing by.  That made the crepe experience such a treat.
author: Angela L.

description: LOVEEE this place! This place is a must stop place for me whenever I am in SF. It gets pretty busy during the weekends so expect a wait. I went here during the cherry blossom festival last year and me and the bf had to wait for over an hour for 3 crepe. Same thing happen this sunday when we went to the cherry blossom festival again. I would recommend coming here on a weekday because there isn't really a wait. I always get the strawberry crepe or just the plain gelato crepe. The crepe here are one of the best that I've had..it's just really crunchy with the right texture unlike the ones that I've had in San Jose at barcode and quickly where the crepe was just really hard and thick. This is the place to go to when you want some crepe in SF!
author: Ngoc L.

description:
You cannot visit Japantown without grabbing this portable, yummy goodness in a cone!!!

PS. Crepes in a cone are better than flat/folded crepes. They're not as soggy AND there's more crunch to the crepe.
author: May D.

description:
The best crepes you'll find by far.
Be prepared for a long wait most days, out of my last 10 visits my shortest wait was 5-10 minutes with only 1 order ahead of us. This place is crazy popular and well deserves to be.
I always make a habit of stopping by here especially for the banana and Nutella crepe. They're always deliciously crunchy with delicious fillings, both savory and sweet (which includes different flavored gelato's). Your average crepe will set you back around $4.50-$5.00 with plenty add on options.
Only downside is that they only take cash which can be annoying. They do have an ATM machine which charges and you'll be hard pressed to get near it when the usual crowds start forming.
author: Lindsey V.

description: Make sure you bring cash cause that's all they take but it's sooooo good!  Had the Nutella, banana, strawberry with vanilla!
author: Chad H.

description:
I came here for breakfast! I ordered a Japanese crepe that had green tea ice cream and red bean in it. Mm dessert crepe. This is my friend's favorite spot to come to whenever she is visiting SF. I can see why.

Wish I had one right now...
author: Richard S.

description:
The woman at the cashier was just stingy! I asked for a sample of the pistachio gelato and she seriously gave me a sample the size of a tiny chocolate chip. It tasted nothing like pistachios. 

We ordered a kiwi and nutella crepe which was delicious, but there was nothing special about it. They're also stingy with the nutella. The only thing about the crepe that I enjoyed was the cute little paper cone it came in. Nothing beats Cafe Grillades's crepes. If you're ever in San Bruno, you HAVE to try one!
author: Juliette R.

description: I love this place. A wide variety of tasty crepes to choose from and they are huge to boot! Always share if you know you don't have a completely empty stomach to fit this thing.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Cash only.  Sooo good with ice cream....

We were walking through the strip mall in Japantown when I spotted a couple little girls licking away at what looked like an ice cream cone from the distance.  So of course I had to stop and ask what they were eating.... "Sophie's Crepes, get it with ice cream"

There is a variety of gelato and ice cream flavors with toppings to choose from.  You don't have to get ice cream in your crepe, but I think this is what sets it apart from other crepe places. It's sooo delish.  The crepe itself is not the typical soft texture I've had at say the creperie at the Paris hotel in Vegas, but more of a firm texture.  But it still meshed well with my caramel gelato and nutella.   I wouldn't say they're super cheap but they won't break your wallet. 

A recommended must if you're ever in the area!
author: Bernadette M.

description:
Tucked away in the Japantown mall is a destination-worthy crepe shop. The crepe itself is papery thin, not too heavy and despite being loaded with sweet goodies, it's not too sweet. 

The strawberry nutella crepe is a must try.
author: Lee H.

description: Very friendly staff and delicious crepes!  What is there not to like about this place?  Nice photo art for sale on the walls too!
author: Emi N.

description:
We've been going here for years. My fav is the nutella with mandarin oranges and whipped cream. I get the same thing every single time. Seriously. 

Question: Why is this the only place that can serve up crepes that you can readily hold in your hand? Just wondering...

Anyways, best (and only?) handheld crepes ever.
author: Randy C.

description:
I love Sophie's Crepes.  I've been a big fan for years.  I can't believe it's taken me so long to write a review.  The prices have steadily gone up though.  Boo.  Oh and seating is limited, so you'll see a bunch of people eating crepes right outside in the common seating area.

I usually get banana, nutella, and vanilla ice cream (which is extra $).  Soooo good!  I love that their crepes are a little crispy, I don't like soggy or overly soft crepes.  I prefer the cone way of eating crepes over using a fork and knife.  It's faster and just better, in my opinion.

Whenever I come back home, I always make room for Sophie's Crepes!
author: Sandy J.

description: Decent crepes and gelato but way overpriced. This is a stingy business with no regard for customer service. The spoons are so cheap that they bend completely backwards when trying to scoop ice cream. Come on, spend a couple more cents for your overcharged customers! My friend wanted to get a scoop of gelato the other night so I reluctantly escorted her. We got there at 8:55 and stood in line for 5 minutes when they cut off service and said they were closed. The workers are clearly undercompensated and have no motivation to provide good customer service. There are plenty other good crepe stores out there that are focused on running a good customer focused business. I'll pass on Sophie's. You should too.
author: B. C.

description: Went to the new location on King Street.  This review is for that location since I can't find it on YELP.  It's called Crepecone by Sophie.  It was excellent.  Hidden on the part of King Street that is on the west side of the caltrain tracks.  We definitely needed a place like this on this side of town.  This location accepts credit cards.
author: Ahmed B.

description: Crispy crepes should be illegal. When you bite into a crepe and can hear a "CRUNCH," something has gone awry. These bad boys were WAY overcooked, and I knew they'd be bad just from watching the long cooking process. Crepes should be light and fluffy and soft, but these had the consistency of crispy tortillas. Hate to say it, but Yelp steered me wrong on this one. It's cash only, which is an epic pain in the ass, and adding insult to injury, they skimped out on the Nutella, giving me only a measly smear that was overpowered by the 2lbs of sweetened strawberries. #unforgivable
author: Parvonay D.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a kid and even though Belly Good has nicer designs, Sophie's has better taste.

For starters their Crepes has a nice crisp texture, that just works better as a contrast to the ingredients held within. The ingredients themselves are always delicious though I prefer just plain gelato as a filling. 

The crepe makers themselves don't seem that friendly but the cashier is always nice. She's always cheery and quick to help out. 

A staple from my child that I hope will never go away, Sophie's is my favorite crepe place in SF. I've been here over a hundred times through the years and haven't once been disappointed.
author: James D.

description: As always the line is long, but it is worth the wait. We always get the mixed fruit or strawberries with Nutella. It really depends on who is making the crepes. Sometimes you'll have a huge portion of fruit and ice cream, but then sometimes you'll have a very flat crepe filled with the minimum essentials for your taste buds. Out of all the times I have been here, I was probably served a flat and skinny crepe twice.
author: Toua H.

description: Sophie's Crepes is a nice cozy shop that seemed like an ordinary crepe place located in the shopping center in Japantown. But once you try their tasty, fluffy crepes, you realize its something special. They are light, airy, and have the right balance of sweetness.
author: Al S.

description:
My love for ice cream never withers, as I continue to scrounge the streets of San Francisco for new flavors and ice cream deserts.  My quests are similar to that of Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom where he embarks on a journey to search for that mystical stone with only a hat and a whip.  

I have heard of the ice cream crepes, but for some reason I never bothered to get some, though living only a few blocks away.  My girlfriend, knowing the way to my heart, took me to get some one night.  We ordered and ice cream crepe with vanilla ice cream, strawberries, bananas and chocolate.  It's as good as it gets
author: Shad B.

description:
yowza!

This place is SO good.
The people who work there are very nice and clean.
The preparation of the crepes are very pro.
The prices are reasonable .
The selections are wide.
And most importantly the nutella banana crepe gave me a orgasm.
I never had nutella before in my life.
And I'm happy to lost my nutella virginity here.
author: Justin W.

description:
How can you refuse your stomach crepe served in a cone?! My classmates and I sometimes swing by this place after lunch.

I always get the chocolate banana crepe with nutella and a scoop of chocolate gelato. Or just a scoop of the black sesame gelato,

I like this place but its not mind blowing or anything. You can never go wrong with nutella.
author: Ha N.

description: this a GO TO place when you are in japantown! great place to go on a nice day so you can sit out by the trees and enjoy it. be prepared, cash only and there is usually a long wait . . . but, its so worth the wait!
author: Marissa P.

description:
If you're into crepes, this place is going to win you over. I usually get disappointed with other crepe spots because they are pretty frugal with what you get inside.
