Sophie's packs them full of wonderful things (cute things too), and you won't be complaining over a vanilla ice cream and strawberry crepe. 

Like the rest of Japantown, this place is very cute and sure to put a smile on your face. Go take some cute photos at PikaPika, then grab a tasty dessert on your way out.
author: Taylor S.

description:
This is my "Go-To" place when I want a sweet crepe because this is the only place that has Lychee flavored gelato.

YUMMMMMM.....EEEEEEE 

I always order the mixed fruits with nutella with a scoop of Lychee gelato... DAMN ITS GOOD...

I just hope they don't run out of Lychee gelato next time I go, now that I've told you the best combo.. ;P
author: V N.

description: I've had crepes from this place many times and they never let me down. I always order the same crepe now but i've tried out most of their crepes and i just end up liking to customize my own better. Their crepe is thin and delicious. It's not too chewy or doughy like some other places. Their gelato is absolutely delicious too. One thing i  like the most about this place is that you can customize your own crepe and that i've never seen another crepe place with their own homemade gelato. Quick service, cheap, delicious.
author: Leme K.

description:
So I've lived in SF for about 3 years now and I had never tried Sophie's crepes before.  SHOCK.  GASP.  yeah, yeah, I know.

I just never understood crepes.  Crepes just seem like a limp wimpy version of a waffle cone.  I could see how I might enjoy it in a hearty crepe...it'd be like a wrap of sorts.  But could it really substitute for the crunchy sweetness that my beloved waffle cone could deliver?

Why yes.  yes it can.

Truth be told, I first tried sophie's about a month ago...splitting a green tea gelato, strawberry topped filled crepe with a friend.  Dissapointing and hard to eat (at least with a friend).  Of course when I told this to some other friends later on, the incredulous looks of you-should-be-locked-up-in-a-psych-hospital made me rethink my previous opinion (hey they were convincing looks) and vow to give Sophie another chance.

This time I ordered a red bean gelato nutella crepe and seeing that I was alone, I could now easily eat the damn thing in gigantic bites.  I realize now that this is key.  But I think the main diff was that the red bean gelato was delicious whereas the green tea was just EH.  

Anyway, I give this place 3.5 stars.  It's good, but it'll all depend on what you order.  Also, they are not open all the time, so make sure you look at their hours.
author: C A.

description:
was in japan town with some friends and they were checking out a picture place right across the way, anyway i haven't had a crepe in a while so i wanted to give it a try

i got the nutella and banana crepe and it hit the spot, nothing really out of the ordinary because it wasn't that different. anyway its worth it if your in j town and you can gobble one up while your walking around.
author: Richard H.

description:
I came here because I was in Japantown seeking dessert and Yelp reviews raved so much about it. Finding it was a bit tricky, I walked around the plaza until I came across a huge crowded and yelled to my bf "I found it!"

The crepe itself was very crispy unlike others I'm used to. Besides that, I don't think it's all that phenomenal. Again, great place for a late night sweet tooth!
author: Karen T.

description: This place makes the best crepes in town! I always get their raspberry sorbet with nutella. This in a crispy crepe is just heaven! I gobble mine so fast that I am craving to get a second helping. Go go!
author: Ron M.

description: Nutella, strawberry, banana with vanilla ice cream is really good. I really like watching them prepare it. They have so many things to chose from!!
author: Jill C.

description:
The first crepes I've ever had were in France and Switzerland, so naturally I compare all my crepes to ones I've had there. However, Sophie's crepes are unlike any crepes I've had before, but that's what makes them so uniquely good!! Their crepes don't fall apart as easily as others do; they have more of a crisp structure to them. They sort of remind me of what a sugar cone would taste like in crepe form.

Any flavors/toppings you get will be good here. They also have black sesame gelato, which I like putting in my crepe. I've only had their dessert crepes, so I can't say anything about their savory ones.

Remember, this place is cash only!
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Mmmm ice cream in a crepe! I like making my own Ice Cream Crepe, basically anything with Gnutella is golden. Their crepes are always made perfectly and consistently, offering a soft exterior and crunchy interior. 

Their savory crepes are also pretty good, not very filling, in my opinion but they taste good, the turkey avocado is my favorite or ones with cheese ang eggs. 

Its a small place, but their crepes comes in a cone so you can take it anywhere!
author: Chris C.

description:
The Crepes are so overrated.  My butter and cinnamon sugar for $2.70 really sucked.  Super flaky, very hard and thin... it was crap.  What happened to that slight chewy pancake-like consistency crepes are known for??

You'd think the place could do crepes well when it's in the name of the establishment...  I ended up throwing most of it away.  Ugh.

The only saving grace?  BLACK SESAME GELATO.  Holy crap.  I could eat a bucket full of that stuff!  $3 for a SMALL size... really really small... and rather pricey... but it was delicious!  TRY IT.  5 stars for this amazing concoction alone.

Minus 2 stars for that stupid crepe.
author: Ruth C.

description:
Every time I plan to go it isn't busy, must be my luck. 

I get Letter E. Chocolate sauce, vanilla ice cream, strawberries and whipped cream to top it off. I like getting a letter (which they hide on their counter, different from the chalkboard menu) It's cheaper too!

The crepe is soft, not hard and flaky like Genki Crepes. The tastes of course go well with each other and you're satisfied in the end.
author: Leanne K.

description:
Having a quirky crepe place in Japantown and then putting up a sign that says "NO PICTURES PLEASE" is simply preposterous and disrespectful to human beings.

It's like placing a huge disclaimer banner on www.cuteoverload.com that says "NO OOHING AND AWWING PLEASE".

Or laying out sample station carts all over Costco with signs emblazoned on the foreheads of the Sampling Employees saying "PLEASE DO NOT EAT SAMPLES"

Or closing down all the kiddie rides at Disneyland during the Make-A-Wish Foundation sponsored Cancer Kids day.

It's just cruel and unrealistic.

It's probably because they don't want patrons to realize how much they are overcharging for a bunch of simple crepes filled with cheap ingredients.

Unacceptable!
author: Joshua L.

description: OMG. Quality is horrible and skimping big time with ingredients. I'm not a huge fan of crepes but have tried a few that are a lot better. Just presentation wise and freshness. I will not come here again. Mixed fruit forget it. Ice cream tasted like its been in the freezer for 10 months.. Not sure why the reviews are so high.
author: Larry L.

description: I'm always slightly annoyed with places that are cash only. That being said, this place has great service and the crepes are quite tasty.
author: Robert H.

description:
One of my top two dessert crepe places I've even been to.  it's nice and crispy and I usually like to watch them make it  because it looks pretty cool. 

There's really not much else to say, except the lines may be long on one of those weird days that j-town is suddenly packed with people.
author: Harriet W.

description:
What is up with all these Euro-phile dessert places in Japantown?  You don't see North Beach churning out mochi and bean cake at every bakery!  There was only one Asian-themed crêpe at Sophie's.  Being well versed in crêpe cuisine, I had no interest in sampling any of the pedestrian flavors that all seemed to be permutations with nutella.  The crêpe just didn't compare to true European counterparts and there weren't enough Japanese-customizations to justify this as a true fusion food instead of simply a mediocre knock-off.

Japanese Crêpe: Not served like a traditional French crêpe, but folded like an ice cream cone with the filling in the center.  This was many times better than other ice cream cone I've had, but doesn't stack up to traditional crêpe texture.  The top of the cone is light and airy, but the bottom has so many layers I felt like I was eating a flaky cookie and felt dry mouthed at the end.  The green tea ice cream and red bean paste were nice fillings, but nothing unfamiliar as they appear in most non-fruit-slice desserts at Asian restaurants.  I did enjoy the maccha syrup (green tea) since it added a good bitterness to mellow out the sweet ice cream.
author: Adam B.

description:
This is a must-go-to place whenever I'm in J-town. 
Even before seeing the shop, I can detect the delicious smell of crepes in the air. I usually order "Japanese"; the crepe with green tea gelato, red-bean paste and mochi (I think it's number seven on the menu). I love how they make the crepes just right, it's not too thick, but not too thin so that the gelato starts melting through. It's also always fun to watch them make the crepes through the glass window. Admittedly, I'm usually accompanied by seven year olds on either side, eagerly eyeing their delicious treat being made. 
There are several tables as well for customers to sit and enjoy their crepe. Definitely a cute place for a casual date, or to bring a few friends to hangout.
author: Helen Y.

description: I have no idea why so many people like this place so much. I've only been there twice, and paid way too much money for a thin piece of waffle spread topped with nutella and a few pieces of kiwi in it. Does it taste good? Yea sure of course it does! However the people who make the food never wash their hands, and last time when I paid 4 dollars to get a gelato crepe I was expecting more than 1 scoop and a wrap. If they lowered the price or put more stuff in them I would give them a higher review. But next time I crave gelato, I'm going to Costco or I can make it myself.
author: David Z.

description:
After eating sushi at Isobune, my friend and I were looking for something sweet to satisfy our sweet teeth. The other crepe place I've had that is supposedly 'the best crepes ever,' was at Genki's Crepes. It was pretty good, until I saw a cockroach climbing up somewhere...

But anyway, I liked this place because the crepes are served with gelato rather than ice cream. It's healthier, and more friendly for those who are lactose intolerant. The place is small, but at least you can wait indoors wandering around the mall (especially if it's raining!!!) You can also inhale the delicious aroma of the crepes being made.. waiting for your number to be called...

I was a bit bummed when the green tea #17 crepe was unavailable :( they ran out of green tea gelato so I just randomly picked flavors: coffee gelato, strawberries, and banana... which did NOT taste bad at all!! It actually was a surprisingly good combo =)

I also love the crepe texture! It's crispy and soft after every bite :) I NEED to come here again and try #17!
author: Jamie Y.

description:
The crepes themselves aren't very good here. 

They're dry, papery, and taste re-heated.

But anyplace that can serve you mandarins swimming in nutella, pocketed perfectly in a light crepe is doing something right.

My partners in nutella crime, couldn't help but roll their eyes, as I complained about the quality of the crepe, while taking two or three huge bites at a time, of THEIR juicy chocolatey dessert.

A three star for now, but I'm sure that with more visits to Japantown - and more fruit filled crepes - this review will easily waddle up to a four.
author: Jessica T.

description: One of my favorite crepe places! They are very generous with their fruits and ice cream.
author: Cindy A.

description:
After a delicious dinner at SPQR, we decided to skip dessert at the restaurant and try another place. I found Sophie's Crepes on Yelp and after a brief adventure to find it (it's not a standalone storefront, but a part of an indoor shopping strip in Japantown), we arrived at Sophie's looking forward to some good tasting crepes.

They were just ok. We got a crepe with bananas, strawberries and Nutella with some chocolate ice cream/ mango sorbet on a side. When I got the crepe, it was cold... which was strange since I saw them make crepes fresh. The crepe itself was rather thick and chewy; I'm used to soft and fluffy crepes and it wasn't that. It reminded me more of an ice cream cone, when it's freshly baked. Ice cream was ok and sorbet was too sweet to my liking.

This place is located on the 2nd floor and is CASH ONLY.
author: Olga C.

description:
Anything with nutella is sure to be good, but Sophie's Crepes makes it magical. I love things simple so I usually just get the strawberry with nutella crepe and it never fails to make my day. 

I've tried other crepe places and they just can't get the soft and crispy right like they do here. Most people I know love adding gelato, but its a bit much for me. The only things I hate are that it's cash only and it can get really really busy. But if you do happen to come on a busy day, just be patient because it is SO worth the wait!
author: V L.

description: Not as good as the crepe place in the other building that enhances the aesthetic appeal of their desserts by making faces or animals out of them using toppings. Still good though. I had Nutella & banana w/strawberry gelato. Hit the spot after the habanero ramen burn from Ramen Underground.
author: Rosavida C.

description: Awesome crepes! got chocolate and strawberry. delicious, portable, neat, sweet!
author: Annie C.

description:
Sophie's Crepes.  Ah.  I've been going here ever since high school!  I am deeply impressed by how simple yet satisfying their treats are.  The one I usually get is the one with maccha (the green sauce), green tea ice cream, red bean paste and I add on nutella to that!  Their combos are very unique, and I'm very happy this place is still here!  

One counter about this place is that parking is probably one of the worst in the world.  Be careful if you park on the South side of geary as an officer warned me to not leave anything out in my car.  Apparently I parked alongside several projects.  Nonetheless I said, "officer, I'd be sad if they took my tupperware" and continued on with my trek to sophie's crepe.  

Oh! they also had the blossom festival, which I thought was wonderful here.  Several vendors came out in Japantown, and I really enjoyed my time here.

One thing I do have to say I feel a bit bad for is nextdoor there is a nice tea bar.  It appears not many people go to this fanciful place, though they should try it out.

Anyways, Maccha. Red Bean Paste. Nutella. = WIN
author: Morris C.

description:
Strawberry and Nutella crepe: MMMmmmmm!
Caramel gelato and Lychee gelato: MMMmmmmm!

Cash only!
author: Barbara T.

description: I love them, they can do me no harm. Long lines on Cherry Blossom Festival Weekend... BUT! Worth the wait! We got that red bean/green ice cream dessert one plus I got a turkey cheese avocado one. DELICIOUS. The crepe batter is perfect! I need to learn how to make it myself. They're so efficient and talented. The crepe was so perfectly crisp.
author: Jenna L.

description:
It's okay.

Overrated.  And prices are typical for this shopping area.  

Plus, I am not sure I like their service.  The owner is surly and rude.
author: Fannie S.

description: After lunch and walking around the mall, my friend wanted to have dessert. So, we stopped at Sophie Crepes. Yelp sticker was on the window. No pictures and videos! Enough yelpers did it already!  LOL! I opted for the chocolate, whip cream and ice cream crepe. Yum. We took the crepe outside the mall and sat on the bench near the statues and structures in the sun, taking in the J-town ambiance. :)
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description:
I usually come here for the dessert crepes,  haven't try any of the savory crepes yet.

PROS: 
-consistent everytime
-crispy, but not to the pt of flaking off
-average pricing
-good service
-put ample amt of fruits, unlike the one on clement (I believed it was Genki).  Genki literally put two pieces of strawberry in my strawberry vanilla ice cream crepe.
-they finally did something about the leaky cone, by putting masking tape at the tip! no more dripping ice cream 5mins into eating it!

CONS:
- Wait can be anywhere from 5 to 40 mins, but they do tell you if the wait is going to be long
-Closed early, 9pm
-It's in a mall where most of the business closes by 8pm, so the place can be eerily empty if you get there after 8:30pm.
-parking in the neighborhood is iffy; it is near Western Addition. heard there's been a lot more crimes going on. A friend's car got broken into last time he was in jtown, ~2months ago, and he parked across from the kabuki hotel, on Laguna between Geary and Wesbter.
author: lisa m.

description:
I used to not like crepes, but Sophie's Crepes changed my whole perspective. JAPANESE CREPES FTW!

Being from NYC, the only ones I can find there are mostly the soggy, over-priced kind at street-fairs that you need to eat fork & knife, and aren't that great. On a trip to SF, my friend took me here and basically...my life changed. Crepes wrapped in a cone with ice cream? It's amazing how just two simple changes can make all the difference. 

Now, every time I go to SF, my trip is not complete unless I come here. I get the Mixed Fruit Crepe with Vanilla Ice Cream. I don't get the special flavored ice creams because it costs a bit more, and vanilla tastes great with all the other things anyway. They have savory flavors as well, but I feel like that's not as fun as the sweet ones :)

I think what makes Sophie's so special is that the crepe itself is so crisp. I've had Japanese crepes in New York and London but it just wasn't the same because the crepes got really soggy quickly. 

I usually pay about $6 for my crepe. I think that's a really fair price considering that regular crepes costs about $8 (at least in NYC). I always recommend this place to anyone I know who's going to SF, it's so delicious and not something you will find on the East Coast. YUM!
author: Melissa C.

description:
yummy! love how they make a show of it, cash only and slow lines during peak hours, prefer genki :/

This seems like the go-to place in Japantown! The lines can get REALLY LONG sometimes, but the crepes are indeed delicious. It's cash only and I'm pretty sure the ATM there charges some ridiculous fee, so make sure to come prepared! I usually get strawberries, ice cream, and nutella--delicious! They come in cute little crepe sleeves, and I personally think the best part of all is watching your own personal crepe being made by the staff! It's nice to know that the ingredients are freshly prepared, esp the fruit! It's a little on the pricey side, but the gelato is amazing and you can walk off some calories by exploring more of Japantown after your snack! Be sure to checkout the stationary store & bookstore as well!
author: Christine L.

description:
I decided to get my lovely nutella craving satisfied while here. A couple days before, I decided to get a whole big jar of nutella for finals. 

Anyways, we came here after a little walking and dinner. Japantown is nicely decorated at this time with Christmas lights in the Peace Plaza. It's a nice little restaurant with very little seating inside, but a couple of benches right outside. 

There's a nice little window to watch the production of crepes - they are actually really efficient about it. It's super cool to watch other people's getting made and your own as well. 

Food:
Strawberry and Nutella Crepe: Oh my. I love nutella and strawberries together. This was a great combination. 
Mandarin Oranges and Ice Cream Crepe: I loved the ice cream part of it. Mandarin Oranges were not the best part I think. 

Parking sucks around here, but sometimes you can get lucky and find street parking. There are some parking lots, but be careful some can be expensive!
author: Nina Y.

description: Banana and Nutella crepe!!! Yummy!!! But it's a little bit pricey... And I wanted an extra scoop of ice cream but the cashier wouldn't let me even if I payed extra which as kinda weird.
author: Jacqueline J.

description:
Absolutely delicious!  Mind you this is my first experience with crepes (and yes, I am ashamed) so there's nothing I can really compare it to.  

I got the mixed fruit crepe and it came with bananas, strawberries, kiwi, vanilla ice cream and whipped cream.  The fruit made excellent partners with the cream and the crepe was crispy thin.

Ooh...and the cream was so incredibly soft and light.
author: Jun H.

description:
Best crepes in San Fran, I love hows its in the Jtown plaza too since they got neat stores. The place gets crowded fast so be prepared to squeeze in tight when ordering. If you speak spanish or look Mexican; you can ask the cooks to hook you up with extra toppings.

I recommend the regular crepe with nutella, bananas and strawberries; thats all you need. If you put ice cream in it then be prepared to have a mess on your hands as the warm crepe prematurely melts the ice cream and then it drips through the little hole on the bottom.
author: Brian U.

description:
GAH!!!!!  My most favoritistitistitistitist gelato ever:  Black Sesame.  I will pay a pretty dollar for this damn flavor.  Mmmmmm I could smell it/taste it now.  Everytime I'm in J-town I always have to stop by Sophie's to get a scoop- I don't care if its the coldest day on earth.

BLACKSESAMEBLACKSESAMEBLACKSESAMEBUYASCOOPNOWSAYSMEBLACKSESAMEBLACKSESAMEBLACKSESAME

Unfortunately, I don't get the crepes here so my rating (all 5 glorious stars) go to the Black Sesame gelato. Try it!
author: Rho T.

description: They say you have to pay with cash and than don't even have enough change when you try to pay. They don't accept credit cards but have an ATM machine that charges you to use it. Mad.
author: Jia G.

description: Great crepes and gelato. Annoying rules and staff. They only accept cash and they won't let you mix flavors if you want two scoops of different flavors. Once in awhile they will rip you off and not put enough gelato in your crepe. In spite of all that, I still recommend it because of the decent price and the deliciousness.
author: Nathan H.

description:
Who the hell is Sophie?
I need to kick her ass! Every time I am in Japantown, I cannot leave without having one of her damn crepes.

I wish my friend still worked here. Delicious yummy crepes are good. Delicious yummy FREE Sophie's Crepes were even better =( 

BUT DAMN YOU SOPHIE! I NEED YOUR CREPES!!
author: Susy C.

description:
Sophie's crepes are super delicious. Tried the banana and nutella and it was the perfect amount of both and was sweet without being overpoweringly so. Unless you really like whipped cream, I would suggest you opt of that because they give you a lot and it's a little too much sweetness for my tastes. The crepe itself is also delicious, crispy on the edges, soft, and thin without being too thin. Love that they give it to you a paper holder as well. Makes it nice for eating your crepe on the go.

Wish their savory menu was a little more extensive, but will definitely come back for their dessert crepes.
author: Kim J.

description: Their service is just TOOOOOOOO SLOW!!! Super super slow!!! I was late for my Korean BBQ dinner just because I waited so long for just 1 crepe!! Ridiculous! I don't think I will ever come here again cause their service is just extremely slow....
author: Bobby C.

description: It is after 9pm now and I just finished my dinner; I wanted something sweet to end the night with and Sophie's Crepes was the only place that was still open inside Japantown.  I wasn't sure what the Japanese Special for $6.50  will taste like but I'm so glad I got it.  It was delicious that I inhaled it all down, now that was a dessert!!!  Crispy crepe w/ red bean spread, green tea ice cream, matcha sauce and whip cream.  There was a crowd as usual but the wait wasn't so bad and in the end it was all worth it.  I will definitely be back!
author: Anni N.

description: Sophie's is my favorite dessert stop in Japantown.   I can't get strawberry or kiwi, so my new go to crepe is mandarin oranges with nutella and ice cream.  I was skeptical because that didn't sound appealing... it turned out to be differently delicious!!  Unfortunately, it's always been crowded but I love the quality of the crepes here!!
author: Lyn C.

description:
mm I've been wanting some crepes, and decided to try this place
out. Crepe wrapped in the form of a cone? that's something different.
Anyways the varieties seems like they tend to have a lot of creamy filling,
for example, ice cream, whipped cream, nutella. My friend and I split a mixed fruit crepe w/whipped cream. The whipped cream was a bit overwhelming much so we scraped off half of it, it was okay not the best,
and not what I was hoping for. I'm still on the look out for some good crepes, any suggestions?
author: Shirley G.

description:
Maybe I just wasn't in the mood for crepes.
Maybe it just wasn't a day for ice cream and strawberries and chocolate sauce.
Maybe I should have replaced the chocolate sauce with nutella or heck, told them to leave on the whipped cream.
Whatever it was, it just didn't wholeheartedly impress. And maybe, you guys, I was just looking for too much in that one crepe that day. I was putting too much faith in a flat pancake, but nevertheless, it was just okay. And I know compared to other places, Sophie's is the bomb.com, so maybe I'll just go on over to another place, have a crappier crepe, then go worship all that is good at Sophies. 
On the upside, barely a line this time and it looked like they had more gelato flavors. 
Maybe I should have just gotten gelato?
author: jeddie k.

description:
I've been to France and the crepes in America are waay better!  You can smell the sweet deliciousness of these crepes wafting through the air, beckoning you to take a bite into its tantalizing outer layer.  

You can watch them make the crepes right in front of you and you can choose whatever ice cream and topping you want in your crepe.  The crispiness of the thin crepe complements the texture of the creamy ice cream really well!  They wrap it into a circular cone-like shape for you.
author: Angela C.

description:
I've never had a crepe from Sophie's before.

So I go in there, order a crepe with cookies n' cream ice cream, eat it, and leave.

I walk back in about fifteen minutes later and greet the sweet looking young man behind the counter.

"Is everything all right?" he asks, concern on his face.

"Uh...yeah." I rub the back of my head awkwardly. "Um...can I get another crepe with ice cream, please?"
author: Cara B.

description: I've heard that this was a really great crepe place. I then gave it a shot. However, I was disappointed. I waited 50 minutes to get my crepe. The price wasn't really worth it. And the crepe turned out to be burnt, meh, and little filling and stuff inside. This crepe place sucks to be honest, and I'd rather have crepe at the store over the bridge near the Sanrio store. Their crepes are more honest there with a straightforward price and fast service
author: Jane S.

description:
Pretty good, but I still prefer Ginko.  They have a good size menu of with sweet and savory crepes.  What did they do best? the crepe wrapper, it makes the entire dessert so if you ruin that you ruin the whole thing. 

Downside- they need more seating for people to sit out rather than loitering outside in the mall.  They also have a ton of signs that says no pictures, a little obnoxious aren't we?  It's not like you are doing some secret move or recipe- it's a crepe.
author: Krystal C.

description: Typical crepe in my book. Strawberries, kiwis and bananas all rolled up in one with vanilla ice cream. Delicious indeed because I had a sweet tooth but all the deliciousness disappeared before we were even half way down to the bottom. Sad life. There was nothing left aside from whip cream and wrap so I was pretty sad by the end of it. Not thoroughly enjoyable so three stars it is. Maybe next time o can give their savory crepes a try
author: Tammy T.

description:
Service - Two stars. The individual crepe makers might be pretty quick and dedicated to what they do, but two specific things pissed me off. The first issue is how the cashier handled the situation between a friend and me regarding whom was going to pay for our Crepes. I placed a $20 bill on the counter next to the cashiers hand and told him I was going to pay for our Crepes and the cashier acknowledged. My friend snuck his cash payment that consisted of a $5 and $1 bills and the cashier said, "Oh, I can use the change" as he handed the $20 back to me. What the fcuk was that about? I'll bet the cashier thought I was kidding when I told him they were losing a star off my yelp review for how he handled the situation. The second issue was, their inability to get two Crepes finished on the same order, in a consecutive manner. Basically, they finished one crepe and set it aside, then another few Crepes for other orders, before finishing the second crepe, while the first cooled off and lost its crisp.

Quality - Four stars. As with any crepe, they are much better when they are hot off the skillet. I don't enjoy many Crepes in the city (Genki is one).
author: Ray C.

description: A must stop place for sure if you're in Japantown.  Luckily, there wasn't a line when the family and I came.  Each crepe is made fresh as you order.  Adding ice cream in any of the sweet crepes makes it taste even more amazing!  My family and I loved every bite.
author: Sheila M.

description:
The last time a friend tried to take me here they had literally closed 5 minutes before we arrived. In Soup Nazi voice, "No Crepes for You!"

After having and amazing dinner over at Ino Sushi where I had no idea what was going to show up in front me  I decided to let dessert be chosen for me as well. So my dessert arbiter chose a simple crepe of vanilla ice cream and nutella. After letting her have her way with her share, I commenced to dispose of the remainder. Crepe was nicely thin, slighlty crisp, with the ice cream and nutella being just sweet enough to contrast. I then realized this was very similar to something I had over at Ti Couz a while back with that style of crepe being being denser and slightly chewier. A refreshing , light dessert  place, with a surprising amount of ingredients, and good "feel like a kid" treat factor.
author: Kim N.

description:
Excellent tasting gelatos that can be wrapped inside a crepe instead of a cone.  Try the hazelnut flavored ice cream.  It's excellent.

There's a youthful, friendly vibe about this place in Japantown Center.  Be sure to get there before 8:55 or they will close the entrance on you and you do not want to miss it.

The ice cream in a crepe costs $4.00.  Very much worth the investment.  I saw others who had fruits and strawberries and all sorts of craziness on their crepe.  Mine was just ice cream and crepe :(.  If anyone can give me a tip on how to decorate my crepe and ice cream please drop me a line.

A perfect  after dinner dessert place to go to.
author: Tony U.

description: worth the wait.this place is good..i had strawberry nutella with black sesame ice cream..o man..this is good..the crepe was really crunchy unlike other places i.e. in Richmond area..it's good..will come back again!
author: Minerva L.

description:
I miss crepes so much from Japan.  When I really get a craving, I always come to this place.  It's not the only crepe place around, but it's definitely my favorite. 

Banana Nutella crepe.  Always.  It's better with ice cream, believe me :)
author: Jenna L.

description: Best crepe ever with best green tea gelato :) must get at jptown
author: Jessica H.

description: Very delicious indeed, and very nice staff. I had the number 13, it tasted as good as it looked. The crepe to me is a little too thin, so very hard to savoir the taste, for me the crepe is the most important part. Overall all great little place, and will come back again the next time I'm in town! I love crepes, just can't seem to have enough of them.
author: Simon W.

description:
All crepes taste the same to me. But that's not saying much because I've only had crepes from 3 places: The Sweet House in Inner Richmond, Genki's on Clement, and here. There is always a line at Sophie's, so it must be worth it right? It gives me plenty of time to think about what I wanna order because there are more than 10 options on the menu, and I'm sure they allow customizations. They also do "savory" crepes here, which are the un-dessert crepes. I've always wondered why they use the word "savory"...do they not consider dessert crepes as savory? But I digress, this is the only legit crepe place in Japantown, and the line speaks for itself. Strawberries, whipped cream and nutella...YUM. There are some benches in front of the space so you can watch other people stuffing their face with the same Sophie's goodness.

I apologize if this review doesn't actually focus on the quality of the crepes, but just know that if you are a fan of crepes, then Sophie's is a must-try. Parking is a hassle so you might as well pay for it, $1.75 for 3 hours isn't too shabby.
author: Olivia V.

description:
They have really good crepes here!!! This place is small, but its always packed with customers. And i can see why! Japanese combo crepe that includes green tea ice cream, red bean and fruits. yum yummmmmm must try!!! :D

Prices are reasonable, and you get to pretty much customize your crepes! and watch it being made while you wait! awesome!
author: Lisa W.

description:
Love sophie's crepes. Love the crunchy chewey texture of their crepe. however, some of the flavors where bland and very simple.
What happened to the amount of ingredients they put in? :( they put less stuff now (whipped cream,fruits,etc..) 
i don't know if i would go back again (for the 3rd time)
author: Cryszilla G.

description:
Little gem of Japanese crepes in Japan town. 

We were out of town and my friend had a craving for crepes. After looking up the Yelp guide, we drove to Japan town to find Sophie's crepes. It was tucked upstairs in a little corner and as it was during a weekday, relatively deserted. Alarm bells start to ring for me as it always does when I see a deserted restaurant, I nevertheless decided to try it because of the 4 stars review.

Ordered the strawberry with cream and it was delicious. Crispy skin, light cream and fresh strawberries. Piping hot in your hands. Love it. The other varieties on the menu look good too.

Gave it a 3 stars since it's a good Japanese crepe, but sorry, I'm a huge fan of the original french crepes and the light taste of this Japanese one just doesn't quite cut it for me.
author: Christina Y.

description: Best handheld crepe I've ever tasted!!!!! Nutella and strawberries are my favorite!!
author: Len L.

description:
The perfect ending to an evening filled with good conversation and steaming bowls of ramen or kitsune udon.

Banana and nutella is my fave, but I also know a certain someone who can't resist the combination of butter, sugar, cinnamon and vanilla ice cream.
author: Miriam W.

description: When in San Francisco leave some time to check out the shop on 1581 Webster St. Always a line for fresh crepes. So many choices. It is a popular place in J town.
author: rock t.

description:
This is probably the only place in the mall with decent air conditioning.

It's a tiny place and luckily, we beat the rush.  I ordered the strawberry and chocolate crepe.  It was delicious, although the strawberries were too sour.  I should have known it was no longer strawberry season.  Wishful thinking.

I love their lychee ice cream.  Will definitely come back to try more!
author: Annie N.

description: My gf loved this place so i gave it a try and it was amazingly good , love the mix fruit ice cream one. They are delicious ! Will back for more :)
author: Tsz Chung W.

description:
The Background:
The other japanese crepery in J-town, the place is pretty good on its own.  However, given belly good just down the mall, I'm not sure this is as worth it.

The Positives:
The cool part about this place is that it is an actual store so it's a tad nicer.  In addition, you get to watch them make the crepe which is nice.  The crepes are really good and are definitely worth the price.

The Negatives:
The place is not as good as Belly Good.  In addition, the lines here tend to be longer so it takes longer to get your food.
author: Henry C.

description: I ordered the Green Tea Gelato with Red Bean and Matcha Sauce and it was DELICIOUS! Very thin crepe with delicious filling! Not too sweet but sweet enough to satisfy a sweet tooth craving! I can see why there was a GIANT line outside this place! It's totally worth it and they are pretty fast and friendly too! I think one of the best crepes I've had! Way to go Sophie's Crepes!
author: Amiee H.

description:
CREPES SERVED IN A CONE?

As soon as you see it, you think, why doesn't every one serve it this way? It makes so much more sense and makes it so much more snackable!

This place is a visual as well as taste treat. You get to watch the crepes being made in the front window, which takes the sting out of the longish wait.  Then the crepe themselves are so yummy! 

You'll go nuts trying to decide which one to get. Nutella and banana? But then the green tea ice cream with red bean paste sounds awesome also?  Just resign yourself to the fact that you'll need to come here several times just to get it out of your system.
author: Rita S.

description: Definitely the best crepe I've ever had.  Nice and crispy, not soft or doughy like other places.  Also had a lot of toppings.
author: Bruce G.

description:
Sophie's Crepes is one of my absolute faves. Its just a tiny shop with 3-4 tiny tables inside. I've never seen this place empty & I've gone here for YEARS now. Sometimes theres a line but it never takes long to order or get your food. Its nicely placed in a mall so theres a lot of distractions to help from being bored while waiting. 

I'm more of a savory crepe person. its like one out of ten for me to ever get a sweet/dessert crepe. I always get the Hawaiian crepe: ham, cheese, pineapple all wrapped up in a crispy crepe. The pineapples are always sweet, the ham never too salty, & the cheese...cheesy of course. They never skimp out on any ingredient. I love it. I love the way its served in a paper cone, very convenient to carry around while scoping out other shops in the mall. But be careful, some places don't allow food or drinks in their stores.
author: Kris B.

description:
Oh oh, I think I've actually had better crepes elsewhere, but when in Japantown, do as the rest of the bots do and stand in a line along the huge long window to watch them create those thin pancakes.

I ordered a crepe filled with fruit, ice cream, and whipped topping strewn across the opening.  My first bite left me with a cool whip mustache.  Second bite got me some fruit, and towards the end, since the ice cream melted, more of it landed on my clothes than in my mouth.  The crepes are different in that they are not of the slight spongy French kind, but thin and wafery, like paper mache.

In the end, not too bad, but for the price?  No thanks.  Plus, the cafe to the left of it, shooed us off of their tables/chairs just because we were not purchasing any of their $6 cakes the size of a Ritz cracker.
author: Miika M.

description:
I don't understand what is all the hype about this place!!! The crepe is disgusting! Nasty! Crunchy, stale taste of nothingless! like cardboard!!!!

Ahhh! I am not coming back here again. They attract a million customers because the crepes SMELL good. But , they taste like.. crunchy paper...

Two stars because the Nutella and fruit in the crepe was decent.
author: Veronica S.

description: Good tasting crepes, but messy with paper holder and melting ice cream. Poor service when crowded.
author: Benny A.

description:
This is by far the most scrumptious crepes I've ever had! This is my favorite place to go to whenever I am in Japan town. Introduced to me in 2000, I had often missed this place when I moved out to LA in 2003 and had often dreamed of coming back to get my Sophie's crepe fix. Now that I am back in the bay, I make it a point to stop by whenever I am in the area. 

My Rating: SUPER OUTSTANDING!
author: Lala D.

description: I LOVE CREPES and sophies crepes is my ultimate go to place. I always order the same thing: cookies and cream gelato (the champ), with bananas in a crepe. The downside of this place is a bit pricey and cash only (what???). on top of that, i live around the area so i can always make excuses just to get the crepe (like.. oh its tuesday, its crepes day wohoo!) Regardless,what i love about this place is the gelato (no basic ice cream please). i recommend everyone to try.
author: Alisha K.

description:
Black sesame ice cream.

Don't care that it leaves little black speckles on your teeth. Or that the sweet deliciousness will probably send you into premature diabetes. It sends me back to my Chinese childhood of tangyuan... yum.
author: Catherine C.

description: Ham and veggie is surprisingly good. Dessert crepes are of course yum. Good for a light meal/snack. Cash only.
author: Heather R.

description: Nothing spectacular about this place. I had better. Genki's is the one by far.
author: E F.

description:
I had the strawberry nutella crepe to see what all the commotion is for. It takes a while for them to make the crepe so be patient. The crepe is served in a paper triangle thing kinda like a flat snow cone. The crepe is surprisingly filled with a good amount of strawberries. The crepe cake is very thin and crispy cake that tastes similar to a fortune cookie. Don't expect a heavier crepe that French places serve. It's a nice snack but nothing substantial to fill you up. It wouldn't be a bad idea to try and bring this in the movie theater nearby. I'm not sure if I'd get it again. $5 for a light crepe? Where are my donuts at?

Note: There's another crepe place on the same level. I've never tried it but you might want to compare. I feel bad for them because Sophie's has the best location.
author: Michael H.

description:
Crepes themselves are good, fillings not so much.
I'm not a gelato fan, so I wasn't going to go for that. I like ice cream. Also, the Japanese crepe was a little intimidating.

I got my old stand-by, Nutella & banana. I liked the crepe itself. Still, maybe my tastes are too low-class, but I didn't think it's as good as everyone raved.
author: Apple C.

description:
Waste of calories injested. I like chewier crepes, and that just ain't Sophie's style.  Hence, two stars because 1) crepe was as crunchy as a wafer and left a trail of crumbs on the floor as I ate it (total fail if we were in France!) and 2) stawberries were frozen!  Thus, I was surprised at the huge crowd/line (about a 10-12 minute wait on a Sat evening).

How crunchy was the crepe?  Well, my friend's crepe was so overcooked/crunchy that it couldn't be folded up-- it totally split and cracked when the girl making it tried to stuff it into the paper.  (Kinda like when you're way too fat for a pair of pants and say wtf, then end up splitting the butt seam in shame.)  The girl working there even had a guilty "oops" face, (you have glass windows, I can see!) and obliged when my friend asked her to make a new one.   And the strawberries...were frozen and not thawed all the way, so that was a brainfreeze surprise.  Kiwis, however, are fresh not frozen.

So, in short-- smells better than it tasted.
author: Caroline I.

description: I like to tell myself that I'm a connoisseur when it comes to ice cream because I've had a lot of ice cream in my lifetime, and hot damn, Sophie's Crepes is one of the best crepes that I've been to. You know, crepes are good just plain, but it's the ice cream that gets to me and the breaking point on debating if I should order an extra one. If you decide to come here, you're probably going to spend at most $10 for a crepe, and don't be discourage about the price but keep in mind that Japan Town is a  tourist spot, so of course whenever you go to a hot area, it will be jacked up a few dollars. Every time I go to Japan Town mall, it's just for the crepes.
author: Raymond A.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE

I cannot even begin to express how much I love Sophie's crepes. Upon entering San Francisco, this will be the first thing on my mind. I must somehow kidnap one of the workers and force them to show me how to make it because the crepe itself is PERFECT, thin with a light crisp!

I don't care much for the Kinokuniya mall. It has always been the same thing for years but I always make a trip there just for my usual of strawberry, nutella and whipped cream crepe. On a hot day I like to add vanilla ice cream. 

Oh, I also suggest purchasing one to eat while you walk around then return for another because personally I always regret not getting two lol

The place itself is small and can get pretty packed on a busy day, so just be prepared to wait. 

Sophie's crepes, please expand? The distance is breaking my heart and I don't know how much longer I can last :(
author: Cherry C.

description:
The people who make the crepes are PERFECTIONISTS!

Even if the crepe has a tiny little tear in it, they throw it out and start over again. The crepes are super delicious and I love watching them make it! Sometimes the wait gets pretty long because a lot of people come here.

REMEMBER!! Keep your receipt number thing.. That's how you're going to get your crepe when they're done!
author: Erica A.

description:
Who's Sophie?  I want to meet her and ask her for franchising information.  On second thought, it would probably be a bad idea because I would just end up eating all the crepes myself and never make any profit.  Every time I drive by Japantown, I park on the street, enter the mall, walk the long corridor into the mall, go downstairs, and grumble about my impatience to reach this place of crepes and gelato nirvana.  The crepe with green tea gelato and the crepe with lychee gelato and fruit are my favorites.  There are not too many tables to sit at to enjoy the crepes, so many people end up finding another bench in the mall.  It's sometimes kind of cute to see old Asian people eating gelato crepes while being camped under a tree.  Seriously, this place gets more action than all the other restaurants and those Hello Kitty warehouses in the mall.

1 star off: no place to sit
author: Ally W.

description:
I got this fruity strawberry thing. I'm not even sure what I ordered, but the line behind me was so long, I just read off something that might have sounded appetizing.

I love dessert crepes, and this place definitely knows how to serve it up. The shell of my crepe was fresh and warm, lovingly hugging the cool vanilla ice cream, strawberries, and nuttela that lay inside.

I find it a bit expensive though - hence the minus one star.
author: Colleen M.

description:
This place is voted one of the 5 best places to have ice cream in the bay area---i agree!  

Very busy inside.  We got a crepe with red bean ice cream inside (i wanted an asian ice cream since we were in japan town).  It was so interesting to look at.  It looked like a very big long cone.  We ended up eating it like an ICE CREAM BURRITO and it was just to dieeeeeeeeee for.  The red bean ice cream was PERFECT and the crepe was soft and warm.  Very novel combo, i loved it!

The minute we were finished we wanted another one.  I'm sad because japan town is kind of inaccessible in the city.  I would loooooooooove to go back.
author: Nancy H.

description:
I never knew crepes could be this good!  The Japanese style crepe ($5.25) won my heart:  azuki bean paste, GREEN TEA GELATO (yum), and matcha sauce rolled into a crispy, thin crepe that surprisingly did not get soggy!

They have a window so you can watch their little crepe assembly line production system, which was fun to watch!  But goodness, I was salivating.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
To be honest I just got a crepe because it looked cool! I was sad I couldn't take pictures of the lady actually doing the
crepe! :(

I got a ice cream, whipped cream, and hot fudge. It was REALLY sweet. I wanted a gallon of water after I was done. It
left me in a slight coma, but I'm not complaining. My bf on the other hand LOVED IT! I could tell by his ice cream mustache. :)
author: Yessenia O.

description: Cute little crepe place in Japan town. They have savory crepes and dessert crepes. You can choose from mixed fruit to banana &OR strawberry with whipped cream, ice cream, and chocolate drizzle(what I got). The crepes are made in front of you too and they also sell gelato. The downside is that they're expensive(what place in japan town isn't). Their drinks are expensive and their bottled water is expensive too "/ but the crepes are pretty tasty. I'd definitely come here again(if I have money to spend lol).
author: Vicky L.

description: Their crepes are bomb, as well as their ice cream!! The only downside is cash only... Other than that this place is amazing.
author: Nadine A.

description: Dessert and savory crepes. I personally prefer their green tea ice cream crepe. Conveniently next to Kabuki. Expect to shell out about $4-$8.
author: Thomas C.

description:
The only reason this place has business is because of it's prime location an no competition. It is in an uncrowded part of Japantown with no other place around that makes crepes. The other shops are either restaurants, bread or cupcake shops. 

The crepes are OK. Not that great but decent. The gelato and ice cream  is really bad.
author: M C.

description:
I am Sophie's Crapes hater.
I hate her.
I hate the fat round thing, Fxxxin' JiveAssCrepe.
Looks disguising too.
Fat round thing.

There are 4 places that I hate in Japantown.
Sophie's Crapes
Benihana
Juban
Iso-Bune

Sophie's Fat ugly jiveass Crapes, Piece of Shit.
She is bitch with big fat jiveass.
author: Nobu K.

description:
MMMMM, NOMNOMNOM. I had my first crepe here with my sister, and it was one of the best I ever had. (hahahaa)

I really like that they let you see how they're making your crepe right in front of their open kitchen. It's clean, friendly, fast, and delicious. 

Although when there is a line, it's really slowwww, I think one time i waited for my crepe for 25-30  mins. It was horrid. But in the end I got my crepe and I was a happy camper. 

whooo, happy eating! :)
author: Liberty C.

description:
I LOVE THEM. 

but wtf. i came here a few weeks ago in broad daylight and they were closed! whats up with that?!
author: Lisa N.

description:
all about the green tea gelato here! 

I seriously finished my crepe in 20 seconds and then moved onto trying to steal away the rest of my husband's crepe (pretty pleases did not work on him)

I probably wouldn't rate this place so high if it weren't for the gelato - the crepe itself is just average but that gelato is gold!
author: Nancy K.

description:
Not like crepes I'm used to. These are really crispy and kind of hard. They are basically fresh ice cream cones that are still warm and a bit soft.

It's still good though, if you don't go expecting a normal crepe.

I like the nutella with vanilla bean gelato. 

Cash only, and the employees aren't friendly.

I wouldn't go out of my way for it, but if I'm in Japantown, I'll get one, because vanilla bean gelato and nutella are good no matter what.
author: Brittany P.

description: They have long lines (and pricey items) for a reason!  Because they are worth it and delicious.  I had the nutella banana crepe and tried my friends Green Tea Gelato Crepe with Matcha Green Tea and Red Bean Sauce, which is supposed to be a customer favorite.  The latter was not my style, but the flavors worked nicely together, and I can understand why people wait in long lines to get their hands on one of these amazing crepes!
author: Pb J.

description:
OMG, everytime I think about their crepes my mouth waters. 

Sesame&Green Tea Gelato Crepe with Whip Creaaaam in a Crispy Shell. 
Mmmmm.
author: Samantha K.

description:
Whenever in the Japantown area, I MUST stop by Sophie's for a crepe.

I have not tried their savory crepes, but requesting a banana nutella crepe (add coffee ice cream) is absolutely the best ice cream treat!

I think I haven't tried anything but this!
author: JJAMZ C.

description: Even though I've been here a countless number of times, I swear it seems to get even better each time. They manage to make the crepes with the perfect combination of crispiness and softness to provide you with the best possible crepe experience. Add to that a scoop of your favorite ice cream and some fruit and nutella, and you've got yourself quite a special treat. Yuuuuuum. Though there's always a short wait, don't be too intimidated by the huge crowd that might be surrounding the shop! Half the people are probably just there to look through the window and see how they make the crepes anyway...haha. Make sure to bring some cash (they don't take credit) and an appetite! Whether it's for dessert after dinner or just a mid-afternoon snack, Sophie's is the perfect treat for anyone, anytime.
author: Aaron W.

description:
THE BEST CREPE I HAVE EVER HAD. 

I've been coming here for at least 8 years now. Every time I come, I get the same thing: E with no chocolate. This crepe comes with a scoop of creamy french vanilla ice cream, fresh strawberries, and homemade whipped cream. However, the crepe is what really makes the dish. I actually base every other crepe I eat on Sophie's Crepes. The crepe is so crisp, but soft, yet still crunchy. It is literally cooked to perfection. 

My only complaint is that the scoop of ice cream has become significantly smaller over the years. 

Still, Sophie's Crepes is a must-go. Don't let the thought of crepes from Japan Town deter you.
author: Mia B.

description:
This is quite possibly my favorite crepe establishment in all of CA. I'm not ashamed to admit that a friend of mine and I actually drove the 2 hours just to enjoy Sophie's crepes. Thank you, Sophie, for making our day. 

You have the option of ordering sweet or savory crepes. I personally prefer the dessert ones with their delicious ice cream. Beware, however! You have to eat the ice cream quick or else it will start leaking from the bottom of the crepe. They're handed to you in a cone shape wrapped with paper.

It's also entertaining to watch how the crepes are made through the little glass window. This place is pretty much packed during all hours of the day, and I've been here more than 6 times already throughout the years. Since I don't live in SF, it's always a treat to stop by Sophie's while I'm shopping in the Japantown mall. Great place for crepes, highly recommended!
author: Jenny B.

description:
A visit to J-town involves a pit stop for dessert crepes with fresh fruits, Nutella, and ice cream.  If you stare at the window display long enough, you'll be tempted to snack on a crepe with a variety of options or appreciate the art of making the crepe skin so flat, smooth, and crispy on the outside.  Try the green tea flavor to treat your Asian taste buds to instant joy.

There used to be one near Washington Square and North Beach, but it might be closed for renovation.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Yes, I go all the way to J-town for crepes. 

They're not the best crepes I have ever had, but I'm not really into Japanese food so this is the place to go when I am in Japantown. 

I usually get the sweet crepe with whipped cream, bananas and nutella. I keep it basic.
author: Carlos A.

description: This place is ok, but its REALLY crowded, and I prefer Belly Good Cafe & Crepes, which is on the other side of the japan center.
author: Michael E.

description: That Japanese crepe with green tea gelato and matcha paste is pretty freaking tasty - and you'll make a mess.  Pro-tip: choke up the crepe 1" in the little cone when you get it and fold the bottom - melted gelato won't drip out the bottom anymore.  You'll still make a mess but you'll save your shirt.
author: David S.

description:
No, no, no. "Sophie's crepes" has crêpes all wrong.

The texture of the crepe for a start. Theirs is evenly dense whereas a good crepe must be alternatively light and crackly. I get that they tweaked the recipe to make it easier to eat on the go but frankly the end result is not only not an authentic crepe but not very good on its own right. Too chewy and dense. 
And what about the taste? I managed to bite into the filling-less tail end and the crepe has a nice sweetness to it but it is not nearly flavorful enough. I wouldn't call it bland but very very clearly they have not managed to recreate even a tenth of the goodness of a crepe done right.
And then there is the filling. Now I ordered a strawberry whipped cream crepe which seemed classic enough. Well, they filled the crepe with whipped cream as if it was a cream puff. Whipped cream inside. Then some more. Then on top. Whipped cream whipped cream whipped cream everywhere. All you taste is the whipped cream and worse yet all you feel under the tongue is the whipped cream. I don't need to tell you that it quickly becomes sickening to eat. Completely marred the whole experience and I couldn't finish the crepe. It didn't taste bad exactly (and I will give them credit that, in sync with their slogan, the strawberries did taste fresh and not watery) but just unpleasant to eat.
Overall I just can't recommend Sophie's Crepes. Those clearly aren't proper crepes for one and, whatever they are, they are not even very good on their own right.
author: Dorian S.

description:
YUMMY CREPES!
i was in japan town after some sushi, and my friend asked if we wanted crepes after. Good thing we had some! cause it was good! i got the strawberry and nutella crepe. I liked how the crepe was crispy. Another plus about this place was that it made my order pretty fast. 

The only down side would be how expensive it was. 5 dollars for a okay sized crepe. but it was good. If im ever in the city, i would definitely come again
author: Jeanette L.

description: THE CREPES HERE ARE SO GOODDDDDDD!!!! I rarely come to Japantown b/c the parking is so difficult but when I do get a chance, I come here for crepes. I ususally order something w/ chocolate or Nutella and the crepes are super good. Not too overly crunchy and not soggy, perfectly soft. SO YUM!
author: Lily W.

description: The sweet aroma drew me into Sophie's Crepes. It didn't disappoint. Had strawberries, nutella and whip. The crepe stayed crispy the whole time and the strawberries and whip were so fresh and delicious!
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
Sophie's Crepe is legendary. Tucked behind the bamboo bushel's of Japan Town's most sacred building is Sophie's Crepe. Who is sophie? and what is a crepe? you may ask. Well a crepe is a desert plate made of batter, and Sophie, I can only assume, to be some sort of taste god. Similar to that of a very thin pancake, it is freshly made in front of your eyes with a creamy blend of batter. Within seconds, the batter solidifies into a circular crepe. Ingredients that are prepared for each unique desert are wrapped within the crepe before it is ready for finish. You can either pick a savory crepe or a sweet crepe. A savory crepe is more like a breakfast/brunch/lunch kind of entree whereby one can get salty ingredients on their crepe such as ham or other meets. Desert crepes on the other hand will have ingredients such as sweet fruits, sugar, ice cream, whipped cream, etc. 

For me, the first and only thing I ever get from here is the Butter and sugar desert crepe with a scoop of whatever icecream I am feeling for at the time. I usually pick vanilla, but recently I have chosen cookies and creme. Anyways, this crepe is the bomb. It is the ultimate best choice for desert crepes, and I have yet to find a crepe that can beat the quality, texture, crunch, and sweetness of the perfectly made crepe. I have been to tons of crepe shops around the bay area and middle california, but have continually failed when it came to finding good, quality crepe that one can simply taste. The only alternative to Sophie's Crepes would be Genki Crepes on 4th and clement. That would be the only place that could possibly rival this place but it doesnt even have the butter sugar crepe.

Anyways, if you like crunchy on the outside, soft and sweet on the inside, ice cream, and a perfectly well balanced, well-made crepe for around 5 dollars..... come here and get the butter and sugar + scoop of ice cream desert crepe!
author: simon k.

description:
Strawberry, nutella, and vanilla ice cream crepes!  Mmm.... It's just so freakin good!

The guys are so talented at making these things....  I sat there staring and talking to these guys as they made it look so easy.  If I was pouring the batter on the circular grill and using that little spatula thing to spread the batter, I would end up making a crepe salad or something with bits and pieces of crepe batter rather than the perfect cone shaped concoction they happily serve.  

This is definitely a popular spot to grab dessert after a meal.
author: Danny L.

description:
i LOVE the Japanese crepe. The red bean paste and green tea gelato with the light crepe is amazing! It's a bit pricey for a crepe, but aren't all crepes pricey like that? Anyway, I love Japanese desserts and everyone should try this place at least once.

FYI cash only
author: Vera W.

description:
I've been coming here for years!! Everytime we used to come to Jtown to walk or shop around we'd always treat ourselvse to sophie's crepes.  I always order the same thing!

Green Tea Ice Cream with Nutella Crepe. My favorite!

After so many years, it still gives me the same satisfaction!
author: Sarah F.

description: I went here with a couple of friends because one of them had told me they were heavenly.  I got a crepe with vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, strawberries, and some chocolate sauce. Nothing too confusing. It was really good! I'm not a huge desserts person, but this was pretty darn awesome.  I'm docking it a star though because they screwed up my friends order.  They gave chocolate icecream instead of vanilla, but I guess it's fine because they were really busy at the time.
author: Stefanie T.

description:
Already full from Tanpopo ramen, several non-Yelpers and I decided to drop by Sophie's Crepes for dessert.  These were the selections:

Strawberry Nutella crepe $5
Coconut sorbet (my pick, very creamy for non-dairy)
Red Bean gelato (nothing special)
Mocha chocolate crunch gelato (coffee flavor is definitely in there)

Crepes $2.50-5, extra for gelato.
Gelato: one scoop for $3.50, gelato crepe for $4, two scoops for $4.50.
Cash only.  No changing order after paying.
author: Pam L.

description:
Not too crazy about crepes, but I have to say they are so good. 

I always want to try their Japanese Green Tea Crepes but at the end 
I chose the "Chicken Salad" crepes, just because I thought I was not ready for Ice Cream Crepes :).
My husband always had his 2 favorites crepes  "California" with imitation crabs and avocado inside and "Nutella", just the nutella. 
and we love their Nutella crepes.

The last time I went there I had "Ham and Avocado" with lettuce and I asked them to put cheese also, and it was so good. I ordered Nutela Crepes too and I ate them together. It was so yummy!  I could not finish them all though,  too full with their crepes' size.

The price was a bit expensive for crepes, but since I am not going there everyday it becomes reasonable.
and hopefully next time I will choose the Green Tea Crepes ^_^
author: Joice K.

description: What's there not to like about fresh crispy crepes?  Sophie's has a nice selection of both sweet and savory crepes.  Since it's always busy, you know their ingredients are going to be fresh, which is awesome.  Love their crepes...nom, nom, nom, nom, nom.
author: Katelynn L.

description: Got green tea gelato crepe, strawberry and vanilla ice cream crepe, and nutella crepe. Nutella crepe is ok, green tea gelato is the best. Rich and intense flavor!!
author: Niqo E.

description: The crepe itself it very crispy and I love the way they are wrapped for easy eating.  We had the banana, nutella and whip cream filling, sweet tooth combination.  Nothing bad to say about the filling, nothing outstanding about what we ordered but if you want a quick crepe with some entertainment value (view the crepe makers do their thing in the viewing window) stop by here.
author: Kevin W.

description: I LOVE CREPES!  It was my first time here and boy was it a small journey to find this place!  I ordered the strawberry nutella with vanilla ice cream.  It was delicious!  The crepe was perfectly crispy just the way I like it.  I have to try their other crepes and gelato when I come back.
author: Susan P.

description:
Sophie's Crepes epitomizes what Japanese-style crepes are all about...delicately crispy- like a thin waffle cone, and filled with different choices of perfectly sliced fruit, nutella, azuki paste, and even ice cream...way too many fillings to list!  This type of crepe is different than your French crepe which is softer throughout and doesn't have crispy edges.  

Sophie's also makes savory crepes for you to enjoy as a light meal.  If you are in Japantown, this is a wonderful place to stop in for a deliciously different dessert.  Go see why there has been a crepe craze in Japan for over ten years!
author: Nich T.

description:
The star of these hand-carried, cone-shaped crepes isn't the savory or fruit fillings. In my opinion, it's the crepe itself. Crispy in some parts, but with a hint of soft and chewiness, I found myself munching on the crepe and wishing that the "other" ingredients would just go away. I had the mixed fruit with whipped cream, which depending on your preferences, it's basically a mouthful of whipped heavy cream.

As for the fruit part, there was probably 2 small slices of banana, 1 slice of a kiwi, and maybe 2 slices of strawberries. For $5 plus, I'd expected more fruit, and less whipped cream. Nonetheless, they made up for it with the tasty crepe. Next time, all I need is the crepe and a slather of Nutella, and I'm golden.
author: Dru C.

description:
A great place for enjoying crêpes !
Sophie's Crêpes is definitely a place to go if you are looking for some sweet dessert. It's located in the heart of Japantown and it's becoming a ritual whenever I am in the area. I usually have dinner and will have my dessert there.
The crêpes are done the traditional way and they offer a good selection of add-ons. The only negative side -because the crêpes are good- is that you may have to wait a few minutes... The place is really well know and you will always find folks ordering.
author: S D.

description:
First time I attempted to try Sophie's Crepes was during the annual Cherry Blossom Festival and that was calling for a two-hour wait for crepes. So I came back a few weeks later and luckily...the wait was only 5 minutes.

Fascinated at how they made the crepes, I attempted to take some pictures but was immediately turned down by the staff who pointed to the signs of "No Picture Taking." I admit that I was a little pissed off but rules are rules...but I still broke them.

On to the crepes...Strawberry + Nutella + Ice Cream Crepe! That's the way to go...the Strawberry + Nutella Crepe is about $5 alone but you HAVE TO ADD ICE CREAM (or it's not a crepe) for a buck. After the first few delicate and analytical bites...I actually wasn't all that amazed. The pancake wasn't crunchy at all and was actually only lukewarm...the amount of nutella in the crepes was miniscule...and the best part of the crepes was the ice cream. But all in all...I love my crepes. It was good but I prefer Genki Crepes (more + better + cheaper = OH YES!).

And this place is cash only FYI.
author: David W.

description: I love their sweet crepes here, it's very crispy. I love the ice cream as well. My friend and I both had the savory crepes here before and it was a long time ago. I would come back here if I was in Japan town.
author: Serena Z.

description:
My first west coast crepe experience was at Genki, so Genki will always supersede in sentimental value. But Sophie's has everything going right for them... condensed menu with perfected items at reasonable prices... Except $2.99 for a rootbeer float. Forreal??

When a couple of friends and I walked up, there was a huge line that went out the door. That's always a good sign. I ordered a make-your-own crepe with vanilla ice cream and raspberry jam. Needless to say, it tasted exactly the way I hoped: crispy, thin crepe that was still a little warm, holding a cold, creamy vanilla scoop with tangy and slightly tart raspberry jam. The guy at the register was very chipper and nice, which is always a nice thing.

Like I'm sure many people stated before, it's cash only! And they don't allow photography inside the joint. Odd.
author: Becky K.

description:
I thought I ordered a crepe with strawberries and bananas in it?  - I thought to myself as I dugg through my crepe filled with heavy creme.

I found about 4 slices of strawberries and 6 pieces of bananas in my whole crepe. It became a little disgusting after I realized I'm eating straight up creme! I can't even call it whipped creme because it felt really heavy! The crepe itself was also very crispy, almost like a thin gridless waffle ( I was getting crumbs everywhere while eating it). Perhaps some people like it this way, but I really enjoy my crepe with some moisture left in it

I love dessert crepes and usually enjoy them all, I mean how can you go wrong making a crepe but this place did not impress me at all. I'm not sure if it was just my crepe that they went cheap on with the fruit and over cooked or do people just like it this way?
author: Anna T.

description: Amazing crepes get the fruits and whipped cream combination with green tea ice cream. I went back again just to have dessert right after having ramen and okonoyaki next door (just simple banana, strawberry, and nutella). Love it and want definite going back again on my visit to SF. Whipped cream is never too sweet and you definitely don't feel guilty after eating it. Cash only place.
author: Ting W.

description:
my favorite place in japan town!
love the warm crispy crepes, usually I go for banana strawberry nutella.. add in a scoop of ice cream if im feeling like a fatty.

you can watch as they make your order.
this place is a must every time im in the area!
author: Yelper S.

description:
I think the portions for ice cream is very small for
What I pay but it tastes good. Usually a line and a wait for the food.
author: Veranna N.

description:
I'm not sure why, but I keep forgetting this place is here whenever I'm starving after work (or maybe had a little too much sake after work).  When I do remember though, oh happy day...

I've only had their savory crepes thus far, which I think are excellent - the cheese and avocado is generally my go-to crepe, though sometimes I'll live a little and get ham or turkey in there too (ooh, exciting).  One of these days I'll stop ogling the sweet crepes and get one of those too - nutella seems to be calling my name.  I also appreciate the fact that it doesn't bother my stomach, as I've noticed that crepes in general don't always agree with me. 

Ice cream and gelato are also available, either on their own or inside a crepe.  Bummer that it's cash only, but the fact that it's open until 11pm (unlike most of the other semi-fast food options in the mall) makes up for it.  Nothing but love for Genki on Clement, but I think this place is better.  4.5 stars.
author: Sus... B.

description: A chocolatey desert crepe should be WARM. Especially on a freezing cold winter night!
author: C. L.

description: I compare all crepes to this crepe. Banana Nutella with Ice cream. There's just no other way.
author: Julie T.

description:
I love this place!!!!! 3rd time here and I'm still drooling for more. Lovely service; it's a family-owned business here and I totally respect that. Not that expensive either; it's just so tasty with the fresh fruits and he variety of ice creams. They even have green tea gelato! 

Thank you; will be back here on my next trip to Japantown!
author: Wayne C.

description:
Walked here after dinner. We past by the other crepe place and saw their sad faces. It was even more weird riding in the elevator with them while holding on to our Sophie's Crepe. Can you say...Awkward....!

Anyways...there was a small line but it went quick. I ordered my banana and nutella. Fiance got the mixed fruit with ice cream. Mmmm I could have devoured both if my tummy wasn't full of Bushi-Tei
author: Judie H.

description:
Holy crepe!

Pretend you haven't heard that one before.  Now laugh.

After a great meal at Kiss Seafood, my friend and I walked into JTown mall looking for something sweet.  Our prayers were answered at Sophie's Crepes.  After some deliberation, I decided on a banana and whipped creme crepe, while my friend got a banana and nutella crepe.

I've only been to a few crepe places (pancake houses don't count) in the past decade: Crepes-a-Go-Go, Crepevine, and Ti Couz.  This place was probably better than them all, and I happen to like the other two (except for Crepevine, it should be called Crapvine, again with the pun!).

The crepes were light.  I'm not sure if it was the older batter, the regular style of crepes here, or because we got sweet (not savory) crepes, but they were actually a bit crispy, which was actually welcome.  We sat down in the mall to eat, and soon after the gate came down; we had just beat the closing time.

I finished the crepe with relish.  It was the end to a very very good meal.  Unfortunately, I live so far away from SF now, I won't have much opportunity to come here.  But I'll definitely remember to if I'm in the area.
author: Dave K.

description:
I've been coming here for years and this was the first place that I was introduced to crepes by a few friends. No where else has come close to making crepes the way they make it. Not Crepevine, not Genki Crepes, and not that crepe place in Berkeley holds a candle to Sophie's crepes. Its not so much the crepe itself that makes their version taste so good but the proportion of other ingredients that they use to complete the taste. I only eat dessert crepes, and I always get the same item ("E" w/ nutella) yet they always manage to balance out the fine chocolate sweetness with the smooch rich creamy ice cream and the tartness of the strawberries. 

And for you amateur crepe eaters, you DO NOT eat crepes with a spoon. The crepes can be a little pricey and it's a meal in itself but it's a perfect place to take a date after dinner and people watch being that it's in the J-town mall.
author: Eric L.

description:
We were in Japantown and noticed people with crepes so we had to try it.  After being in line to order for about 15 minutes and another 10 minutes for the order to come out.  We were finally enjoying the Mixed fruit with whipped cream crepe.  It was yummy and worth the wait.

FYI cash only.  BOO!

"Walked in craving ramen...walked out with a crepe.  Muy Bueno!!"
author: Junho S.

description:
I love crepes, and I've been coming here for years, I love to get the savory crepes with ham and cheese, and the Japanese (green tea icecream with red bean) is my staple too.

However, is it just me or has the ice cream gone smaller? and the red bean paste got thinner? or was it because it was late at night and they are trying to conserve the material they have left...?
author: Mika J.

description: Love this place!! I've  been coming here for years. Next best thing to an original Crepe from France. Letters E & F--- No Kiwi Sub with Bananas are my Fav's if you ever in Japan town you need to stop here. I minus 1 star because on Nice days the line can get a little long
author: kimiko l.

description:
This place is pretty good. There's always a line when I go here which is most likely a Saturday night if I have  room for dessert. Sometimes I have to make room. I like the banana with vanilla ice cream smothered in nutella and topped with whip cream. I think it's the crepe mixture that's really good. It has a hint of sweetness and is thin and flakey so you can really taste your choice of filling.

Must try stop by if you are looking for dessert.
author: Steve C.

description: When it comes to sweet vs. savory in battle of the crepes, sweet will always reign victorious in my tumbly. The inability to shake off my current craving for cupcakes stirred me towards the opposite. Sophie's got both options down to a science. Have you seen them make these things? After ordering, wait outside and look through their window. You'll be mesmerized by how seamlessly they pour and smooth out the batter, then flip over the crepe without even breaking a sweat. Although I'd prefer this put together as a sandwich,  the simple pairing of turkey, avocado, lettuce and mayo surrounded by the slightly crisp crepe was pretty darn good. That said, I've come to the conclusion that I'll forever be a sucker for sweetness when it comes to crepes. The end.
author: Rhia R.

description:
I wasn't hungry but I killed my crepe anyways.

I had one with strawberries, whip cream, chocolate sauce with a scoop of gelato.

Presentation, taste, service are PERFECT!

I wouldn't consider it an authentic "french" crepe but they definitely bring their own flavor to the crepe world!
author: Christian P.

description:
Love this place!   I usually order the strawberry, banana, nutella and Cookies and creme gelato. It's soo good!  This time I ordered just the banana without strawberry because you can never go wrong with just banana's. Strawberry comes in season so it can be sour at times. If your looking for desserts after your lunch or dinner this is the place to go. It's reasonable price of $7.40 per crepe depending on what you want to add in it.  I would recommend anyone to comes here..

Enjoy
author: Lisa K.

description:
You can't really go wrong with anything that you put Nutella on.  I love crepes!  My usual is Nutella, Strawberry, and whipped cream.  Perfect combo!  
I also tried the green tea gelato which was good as well.  I would prefer this place to be a bit cheaper but eh still worth the money.  There is always tons of people outside waiting for their crepes.  The crepe isn't as flaky and crispy as I think it but still pretty darn good.  
The thing I love best about Sophie's Crepes is the way they fill the crepes.  Most places you'll get no fruit at the bottom or too much whipped cream on top or you just don't get enough fruit at all.  Sophie's is a good portion.  You have enough fruit all throughout where you get fruit in every bite.  There is also a good amount of nutella and whipped cream.  It's just perfectly proportioned.  My kind of crepe!
author: Yvonne W.

description: Try out the Flavors it's worth it. I do wish that the ice cream that they serve was available in Boston.
author: Juan S.

description:
When I went to Japantown, I had  a goal of having a Japanese style crepe after watching too many animes.
