We found Sophie's and dove in.  

I had the strawberry, nutella crepe.  So delicious.
Then we tried some of their savory crepes.  We had the egg salad.  Also very delicious.

The next time we traveled to SF, we brought friends with us to try Sophie's
They loved it.  

Living in SoCal prevents me from going here everyday.  If I lived in SF, I would be at Sophie's nearly everyday it is that tasty.  

Super high recommend for those that have a sweet tooth, those who like crepes, and Japan-lovers like myself.

Check out the rest of the mall while you are here.  You will find some major gems like the restaurant right next door, the sweets shop under the stairs on the first floor and of course Kinokunya.
author: sallie n.

description:
One of the best crepe shops in SF. Going to Jtown without going to sophie's is like going to disneyland without going on any rides. 

Green tea gelato with mix fruits crepe is delicious. The crepe is soft and warm, the ice cream isn't melting over, and the fruits are fruits.
author: Steven B.

description: I think it is just okay. I have no idea why people are lining for it.
author: Apple L.

description: Good crepes but the people assembling and cooking crepes are not wearing gloves. We saw that after we placed our order!!!!! What a turn off.
author: martha h.

description: simple dessert after dinner...fresh warm crepe...scoop of vanilla gelato...banana peeled and chopped....fanned across crepe and gelato...folded to a cone...$four.sixty-one total...drier and harder crepes...probably made for holding...but, rather have an ice cream cone....
author: Hen A.

description: I wanted to like the crepes here since my friends have been wanting to try this place for a while... so I guess it just got built up in my head. Its not bad here... but there's nothing really that interesting that makes this place stand out from any other crepe place. Tried the banana ice cream crepe one.. I thought there would be fruits but I guess you have to tell them to add that on. The crepe was okay... I like it a lot more at other establishments. The banana ice cream was good.. but nothing really spectacular about it. Worth giving it a try I guess if you're in the mall and looking for a dessert.
author: Johnson S.

description: Rude staff.  I politely asked them if they could cut a crepe in half for two kids, and they said it's against company policy to cut a crepe in half.  Even though they had a knife and cutting board in active use, they would not  accommodate this simple request.     It's a shame this crepe place hired four employees completely void of customer service qualifications.  And if they are so careless on their hiring practices, I'd not trust the quality and sourcing of their ingredients.
author: E R.

description: First crepe and it was soooo good! I had the Hawaiian crepe and the moment I was finished I wished I had it still.  Even when the day was over (got mine at 11:00 when they opened) I was still thinking about it and wanting another.  Definitely comes with a high recommendation!!
author: Samantha S.

description:
best crepes in town! better than genki in my opinion, but i think it's a little bit more expensive. 

the crepe here is just a little bit softer and it's just the right portion where i wont spill everywhere when i nearer to the bottom of the cone. 

mixed fruits + nutella + whipped cream + vanilla ice cream = BOMBFREAKINGDIGGTY.
author: Christine L.

description: I definitely will be back. I loved a " Nutella and mixed fruit crepe" and my boyfriend enjoyed his coconut gelato. Good job guys !
author: Yulia M.

description:
Over-hyped?  Or did I just order the wrong thing?

I got their special: banana creme vanilla bean crepe

It tasted like... any other crepe that I had.  Pretty pricey too.

Customer service was great tho, 3.5 stars!
author: Mike K.

description:
Not a huge fan of crepes but I actually enjoyed the Japanese crepe a lot. There was a long line, but it went quick. 

Would love to come back.
author: Richard H.

description:
My favorite way to eat gelato/ice cream is not with a traditional cone anymore. I love the crepes that they stuff the gelato in. It's just a perfect combination and my taste buds love it. I always want to get two or three more after my first one.

The line is bothersome sometimes but its worth the wait. You get to see how they make the crepes and you're just jumping with joy until you get yours.

This place is wonderful. If you're ever in the area, take your time to go through the mall and enjoy yourself with gelato inside of crepes.

-SN
author: Nha D.

description: Really, really, really long wait after placing your order. The crepes here are pretty good, and you have to get some flavor of gelato in there! But for how much it cost and how long the wait was, I wouldn't really say it was worth it. Overall, pretty good crepes but not the best I've ever had.
author: Sylvester N.

description:
THE BEST crepes ever.  They cook them on BOTH sides and make sure they are done and not doughy.  The crepe is typical... light and airy.  BUT... they are CRISP and delish!!   My favorite ever!!   

Yes, I will DRIVE to San Francisco and pay for the bridge just to get one of these crepes.  No kidding.  

Be SURE to know what you are ordering... NO changes in your order once you pay.  Even if you want to add something etc.  

My fave:  nutella, banana, whip cream (vanilla gelato too sometimes).

Thanks Loretta for introducing me to this place!!
author: Heidi T.

description: What better way to end a sushi meal?? With crepes, of course!!! We always gets fresh strawberry w/ Nutella and fresh banana w/ Nutella. So frickin' good! *licks lips*
author: Jamie C.

description:
I love Sophies crepes. Been here a couple times, both for the cherry blossom festival. Being a southbay girl, I rarely go up to Japantown, but when I'm there I'm always tempted to get a crepe. My favorite part about the crepe is how you can select what type of ice cream or gelato you want to put in the crepe. At most crepe places they only have regular vanilla ice cream, or like strawberry or mango. But this place has a huge selection of gelato as well, and I always love the black sesame gelato. Only thing is that it's pretty expensive if u make ur own crepe like me and get the STRAWBERRIES, BANANA, NUTELLA, and BLACK SESAME GELATO. but it is YUM YUM good!

One piece of advice, do NOT come here during the cherry blossom festival because it is SOOOOOOOO PACKED. Last weekend my friend and I waited AN HOUR for our crepe. NOT COOL. =__= or else, I'm a fan~
author: Louisa L.

description: For $6, the "Japanese" is one of the best desserts ever. Real green tea matcha with green tea ice cream and red bean really hits the spot after a savory meal like ramen or sushi. I haven't tried anyting else here as I don't feel the need to, so I can only speak to one menu item.
author: Calvin W.

description:
Everything is great!

The only reason I didn't give it five stars was because it's shitty that it's extra for other toppings or exchanging ice cream flavors
author: Krystal B.

description:
How can you not love crepes?  They are hand held, customizable and cheap.  Everytime I go to get crepes, I recount the story of how I was going to buy a crepe maker from Williams Sonoma.  But my friend reminded me that I'd buy it, make crepes everyday for 2 weeks, invite all my friends over for crepes and then pack it away in the corner never to be used again.  I hate being a forgone conclusion.    

So when I came here, I got the nutella strawberry crepes here and it was yummy.  The crepes themselves were paper thin ... probably the thinnest that I've ever had.  

Only giving 3 stars though because the strawberries they used were the frozen kind ... the overly frozen and then semi thawed strawberries which are a bit too cold during some bites and a bit too soggy during others.   If I'd gotten that crepe maker, I'd have never use frozen strawberries ....
author: Kathleen W.

description:
This place is so good that I will brave the hour drive into the city just to have their Japanese crepe. Organic gelato green tea ice cream, macha sauce, and azuki paste...it doesn't get any better than that. 

I have only had the Japanese crepe here but it is AMAZING. If you're a fan of green tea then it is an absolute must-have. 

One of my all-time favorite desserts ever.
author: Ted W.

description:
Mmmm these crepes were sooo gooooood.  So crispy...mmmm.  Not to mention their cute cone shape.  Pretty affordable too...at least compared to some crepe stands in San Diego.

I had the chicken pesto salad and my boyfriend had the cheddar and avocado...both equally delicious and satisfying.  I would be interested to try their sweet ones too!

Now I'm inspired to try all the crepe places in San Diego to see if one compares.  Look out for a new list!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
The crepes here are SO good! You have a really good selection of what you want in them and the crepe itself is great. It holds up pretty well and the edges are crispy. I love the batter. I have a hard time deciding between sweet or savory crepe, as both sound so good. I wish I had room in my tummy to eat two. 

It's a popular place, but they keep the line moving and the crepes cooking fast. Oh how I miss nutella! Woe is me.
author: Grace Y.

description:
If you get gelato in your crepe, you better eat it fast! The gelato melts fast and then starts pooling at the bottom of your paper cone. Be careful cuz they use Scotch tape to seal the bottom of the paper cone. You're gonna get sticky melted gelato all over you if that tape gives way!

Also, the red bean gelato wasn't very strong in flavor. The green tea and vanilla bean were much better.
author: Char L.

description:
With such long lines, you would expect something spectacular...meh, not so much. 

I had the strawberry with whipped cream crepe and I wasn't blown away.  It did its job but in no way was I thinking to myself that this is a place that I would definitely come back to.  

There are plenty of other crepe places that are just awesome, this is not so much.  On the positive side, they do have a good selection on their menu and I am always a sucker for a place that serves green tea ice-cream!
author: Meshell C.

description:
It's a tradition for me, every time I go to Japantown I always have to drop by there to get my ice cream! They will cook the crepes in front of the window so you can see them make your orders and make sure they don't spit of drop your order... LOL... Sometimes, if I get hungry, I order the Hawaiian crepe for snacks (Pineapple & ham)
Just a reminder - CASH ONLY and NO REFUND once you order and pay.
author: Nokie N.

description: Their ingredients are always fresh and the prices are really good. The only downside to this shop is if you are there during peak hours or when there is some sort of convention or festival in town, you will be waiting a very long time for your food. I have waited up to 45 minutes before!
author: Tiana M.

description:
I'm not a crepe connoisseur, but I'd have to say this place is fantastic. Their sweet (dessert) crepes are so good that I don't think I've ever tried their savory crepes before. What makes it worse is that I find myself pulling into Japantown because of my urges for their treats. 

I'm supposed to prepare for a meeting for tomorrow, but why am I driving out? Just to get some fresh air I say. 30 minutes later, why am I crossing the bridge in the rain? Why am I walking through Kinokuniya in the first place? Why am I here in the middle of the week? Why's this place crowded at ALL hours, on a Wednesday? It all goes back to the fact that Sophie is a beautiful model that men couldn't resist seeing. Oh, I meant it goes back to the wonderfully made crepes with gooey Nutella goodness. 

Face it guys, have you EVER had a bad crepe here? Ignore the long lines and infinitesimal slots for parking and you know you have to give Sophie's 4 stars. Let's go Sophie! You're a cornerstone of Japantown.
author: William H.

description:
My friends took us here- it was scrumptious! You get to see them preparing it too. It might sound funny, but it's kinda like Coldstone, in that way. There were lots of customers/spectators. So many yummy different combinations/choices. We all had our own. I wanted the green tea, it's probably an Asian thing, because my (non-Asian) husband doesn't like green tea quite like I do. My husband had chocolate, of course- the chocoholic. It's pretty big, but then again it was my first crepes experience- it could be standard, I don't know. I thought the concoction sounded funny at first, kind of hard to picture/imagine if you've never had it before, right? Well, I really liked it. We will definitely be back, but since I am not familiar with the area, will leave it to my friends to take us back, ha-ha, hee-hee. Friends: If you are reading this right now, I'm being serious- T H A N K  Y O U. I'm glad that they introduced this sweet treat to us, because we had no idea. A must! I'm getting a craving as I finish this sentence. I might need to find a place here locally. Hmm...

BTW, it was only my second time to Japantown- so it was nice to walk around, though all the stores were closed (after 6 pm on a weekend), except for one sushi restaurant.
author: Margret C.

description:
When it comes to crepes-- no place compares to Sophie's in Japantown.

It's always super crowded, and the wait can be long-- but it's definitely worth it.

The have sweet or savory choices.  I go for the savory-- either turkey avocado, or chicken salad.  I've been to other places that serve flat, soggy crepes with a little bit of filling spread inside.  These on the other hand, are STUFFED and crepe itself-- light, thin & crispy.

THE BEST!
author: Joanne N.

description: The best & only place i will ever go to get my full share of crepe's loaded with nutella, kiwi, strawberry, banana, and whip cream.  Their hours are always all over the place because whenever i go there , it's closed
author: Nika E.

description: Savory crepe was horrible.  I got the California and couldn't even finish it. In reality, I have no idea how it even made it on to the menu.  I have no doubt that the sweet crepes could possibly be good, but my awful experience with the savory side will not be leading me back to Sophie's.
author: Isaac R.

description: This place is popular. It's good. The green tea ice cream is especially good. I wish somehow that the crepe was warmer. Also, it takes a bit longer than you would expect.
author: Andrew K.

description: Two words. Japanese crepe. Red bean paste + green tea gelato + matcha = effin' party in my mouth!
author: Raymond Y.

description:
It isn't my first time in Japan Town, but it's absolutely my first time at Sophie's Crepes! My goodness, this place is YummY! It's the only place in Japan town with a line of customers and a crowd surrounding the area! 

My bf and I had the Savory chicken salad crepe with pesto sauce!! My goodness! Just Yelping about it makes me want some more! :p We also had the Japanese Banana Cream Crepe which consists of green tea ice cream, red bean paste, bananas, and whip cream! It Couldn't taste any more delicious! 

I can already tell that everything off of the menu can please me easily! I will absolutely be back to have a taste of the other items. Very happy Tummy today! Lucky me!
author: Sweet P.

description: It's certainly no Genki, but Sophie's Crepes will do in a pinch. I ordered my standard Genki crepe to compare: lychee ice cream crepe. The crepe was good, but I prefer the crisp, toothsome texture of Genki to the softer crepe texture at Sophie's.
author: Monelle A.

description:
Always crowded and long line. cash only.

The lady who takes order is very nice. There are a few tables in the store but very hard to find an available seat. Usually people just order and sit outside the store in the public seating area.

The Japanese Crepe is the best one. It comes with green tea ice cream and red bean paste. Indeed a very nice combination. 

There are both sweet or savory crepes on the menu. All run anywhere between $4 - $6. Very reasonable priced.
author: Chun L.

description: Ordered a crepe with mixed berries, nutella, & green tea gelato & a Belgian waffle with mixed berries and nutella gelato to share. Flavors combined were perfect; not too sweet, nothing overpowers, and perfectly portioned. The texture of the crepe wasn't the best I've ever had, but still good. I'd recommend the Belgian waffle for sure. It was my first time having it and omg the softness/slight crispiness and warmness mixed with the cooled whip & gelato = heaven in my mouth. Best dessert spot in SF so far :) highly recommended.
author: Amy K.

description:
It was an amazingly scrumptious desert that was fast and portable!

I ordered a Crepe with bananas, nutella, and vanilla ice cream, again, it was absolutely delicious!
So the crepe was extra thin and crispy (as far as crepes go) but it had to be that way in order to handle the liquid on the inside without getting soggy. The flavor combination of bananas and nutella is good, with ice cream butter, but you can put those things together by yourself. So why would you need to come here? For the crepe, the final ingredient in this assembly, the key to unlocking the perfect blend of the flavors. The starchiness of the crepe was an excellent compliment to the crepe, and this style you can only get here. Just order and you get all you need, easy, fast, and portable. 

The price is really reasonable for $3 you can get a basic crepe and for no more than $6 you can get it totally decked out with anything and everything you might want. It is also extremely portable and so convenient.

Fellow yelpers go here! Bring cash or you won't get anything :( 
(it's cash only but there's an ATM machine right there)


The GF got the "Japanese crepe" and she adds:
"The green tea gelato was good. It had the flavor and texture. The maccha sauce complimented the green tea. The red bean paste was very delicious and also complimented the green tea gelato. And the thin crepe made everything taste betterm, it was like a waffle cone with crepe flavor and thinner and crispy. It was really a Japanese crepe.
author: Christopher D.

description:
Lol, almost exactly one year since my last visit, I showed up at Sophies Crepes because, once again, my friend who swears by this place insisted that we fit it in our San Francisco getaway trip schedule.

And again, I attempted to order just a scoop of lychee ice cream but was charged for and given a scoop of lychee ice cream in a crepe.  Last time, I was a bit annoyed about the miscommunication when ordering but this time I couldn't help but giggle.  Fool me twice, shame on me.

I'm bumping this place up one star because we stopped here before heading to SFO to catch our flight home and this place was packed the minute it was open (a sign that it is well loved).  Already knowing what to expect from the crepe (not overly sweet, crispy but soft and chewy) I was pleasantly surprised with the combination of the crepe and the creaminess and sweetness of the lychee ice cream.  It has inspired me to attempt making lychee ice cream this weekend because it was so refreshing.

Maybe next year, I'll order a crepe and finally get just a cup of ice cream?!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
I have a very selective sweet tooth. Maybe i'm not a fan of sweet crepes, but this place looks to be overhyped. However, everytime I'm in Japantown the lines for Sophie is always long. 

I ordered the banana and nutella crepe without ice cream. The crepes were folded to be portable unlike some other crepes made elsewhere. They did a good job at making the crepe itself crispy. All the flavors are very much expected and nothing really to wow me.

It's okay....... what can I say. 2.5 Stars!
author: James N.

description: My favorite creperie! Crepes are amazingly perfect in both taste and texture- soft and slightly sweet with crisp edges. Add their delicious gelato, and you have yourself a little piece of heaven. Their red bean and green tea gelato are superb.
author: Sophia B.

description:
whenever I go to the Japanese Town in SF, Sophie Crepes is always my first place to visit. I'm so in love with the ice cream here as if I can smell it from far away. Additionally, I love how they make the wrap for ice cream. That's so delicious! 

My Recommendation is letter F ice-cream. It's a mix of 3 banana, strawberry ... and the ice-cream was so awesome though!!!
author: Sara N.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night around 9pm. Line wasn't too long, but wasn't short. 
Got myself a Strawberry & Whipped Cream crepe with Ice Cream. Older sister got herself a Strawberry & Nutella crepe with ice cream. Total came out to $12.59. Err.. Pricey? Yes. 50cents more for Nutella since mine was 4.50 and hers was $5. 
Ehhhh. I believe extra charge for Ice cream too? Errr... Waited about 12 minutes. No lie, the crepe was yummy, but compared with other places... 
I wouldn't come here again.. Or not for a long time. It's expensive for my standards.
author: Susan Y.

description:
I remember this place very well.  My friends and I walked all the way from the financial district to check this place out a month ago: IT WAS CLOSED!!!!   I remember angrily walking back to our cars from the financial district getting madd at everything that started with "S."  San Francisco, Sophies, Stephanie (friend who made us walk)....So Stupid....=)

But today, I walked back to my car only ONE BLOCK AWAY with this amazing nutella, green tea ice cream with strawberries and banana.  $7.50 is kinda expensive for my crepe but that all went away when I took my first bite of this light, thin and crunch/fluffy crepe!  I'm gonna say it.  It's the best crepe i've had so far.  My friend who had crepes in France confirmed this as well.

If you wanna take guests or even significant other to a nice dessert place and you are not in the mood for some lame starbucks, fro yos, bubble tea and ice cream....this is it.  Again, it's in Japantown mall so you get to walk around and visit some cute shops with this amazing treat.  How can you not go to Sophie's?
author: Jang David K.

description:
Always happy when I get my crepe fix whenever I visit Japantown.  Luckily, I've never had to wait too long to get a really good tasting crepe.  The price value and portion size is great!  Can't complain.  

Great place to take the children, especially if they are being grumpy.
author: Reeni P.

description: Yum!  Had a nutella-banana-strawberry-vanilla ice cream crepe.  It was totally tasty, and loved the cone they put the crepe in that made it easy to carry, however, I think $7 bucks is a little too much for a crepe.  Otherwise, it was good!
author: Nadiyah S.

description: I love how this place lets you watch them make the crepes. There was a lot of variety and the crepes are pretty big portions. The bf and I got a nutella and banana crepe to share. However,  I went into a store real quick after getting it. I came out like about 5 minutes later and he ate the ENTIRE thing by himself. He said that it hit the spot and was really good. The bananas with the nutella was a great touch. We were thinking about gettng another one but I was pretty stuffed from having sushi just before.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Excellent crepes, only reason they don't get 5 stars is for not serving coffee past 6 pm!
author: Angela S.

description:
Service = atrocious and they are pricey for average crepes. 

I ordered a crepe with a honey add on (75 cents). Instead I got whip cream, which cost more ($1). I didn't want to wait in line and wait for them to re make the crepe and I figured I could suck it up and just deal with it. So, I scooped all of that the whip off the top and took a bite to find more whip inside. My first error - accepting something that was not what I ordered.  Ugh!! 

Then I realized that I wouldn't eat it with that much whip, so I decided to get it done right, which I should have done from the get-go. We went to the counter and explained the situation and the people are SC wouldn't have any of it! They insisted that we ordered whip cream.  WTF, since when does whip cream and honey sound alike? And they commented that I ate the crepe (yes two whole bites). I explained to one person that I scooped off the whip only to find more inside, but I guess they could only focus on the fact that the crepe looked eaten. 

 It's annoying to be accused of ordering something that you really didn't and how much does it really cost them to make a banana nutella crepe?  Having to hear the staff insist that we ordered whip cream to the manager/owner was frustrating, so I left without getting a new crepe and basically wasting $5. 

What a waste of time. 

Never again.
author: Natalie S.

description:
These recent two experience at Sophie were really disappointing...  I felt like they put much less stuff (ice-cream, whipped cream, etc) in the crepes compared to back then....
Sigh, I don't know where I can go now when I crave for crepes..... TT
Sad....
author: RB B.

description: Is it just me or did their crepes get smaller? Where are my mixed fruits that I ordered??? And don't get me started with the nutella and the vanilla ice cream. Skimpy much?
author: Uyen L.

description:
Crepes are always a nice end to a sub-par meal in Jtown. Maybe I've just chosen the wrong dishes to order, but whenever I decide to eat a meal there, I leave with regret, lighter wallet, and half-filled stomach. But SC never has disappointed me yet. For some reason, I thought it was more pricier than around $5-6, but they do only accept cash so be mindful of that. They do have an ATM there though if your stripped for cash. 

I'm not a crepes connoisseur, but my well-exercised taste buds are satisfied with the juxtaposition of warm crepe with cold ice cream and fruit. I find their regular menu items good choices, since I'm a whimp when it comes to adding things extra on a manufactured culinary piece. It's a little random to find this pseudo-euro dessert place in japantown, but it's a nice quick stop if you're looking for something sweet after a meal.
author: Dale C.

description: Love the crepes here. They're thin and crispy and yummy. Unfortunately, they're cash only, but they also have an ATM in the store so it's not that much of an inconvenience.
author: Nhathy N.

description:
Even though they are cash only, which a real pain in the buttocks, I love Sophie's. The other ones in the same mall just do not compare. 

The one with the ice cream and strawberries and chocolate is amazing. I love that their crepes don't get all soft and soggy by the time you get to the middle of it and fall apart. It's a lot less messy than other places, which is huge for me. 

The only crepe place for me.
author: Jeanette P.

description:
My wife insisted we go here. We paid $5, waited 20 min, for a crepe that was so dry it's almost like eating sawdust. 
The store management was terrible. The workers are the slowest I have ever seen. They would never pay me to go back there.
author: Adam C.

description:
Been going to Sophie's since it opened years ago. It is very popular for the young crowd after the movies or dinner at Japantown. I stop by over here whenever I visit SF for some dessert crepes there.  So far the crepes are the best I have tasted so far.

Main reason is the crispness of the crepe. I am guessing it is the batter.  

I usually order the fresh fruits(bananas, kiwi, and strawberry) with ice cream(green tea or vanilla). 

The last time we went, it was on a Friday and in the early afternoon. place was relatively dead with maybe a few parties there ordering stuff. My wife and I ordered fairly quickly at the register and the girl took our order. It took us at least 10 minutes to get our crepe(we just ordered one). I was a little bummed having to wait longer than expected to get our order.

Price is the same. definitely on the high end for crepes. about 6-8 dollars for a crepe.

When we got our crepe, I noticed there was significantly less ice cream in the crepe then in the past. I figure maybe this was a fluke and I needed more of a sample size to say, okay, Sophie's is reduced the amount of ice cream(skimpin'?) in their crepes?

Overall quality of crepe especially the taste of the crepe is good as usual.
I will be back again since this still is the bst place for crepes. hopefully I'll add more stars next time!
author: Milton C.

description:
Theres nothing better than crepes...and theres nothing better than having crepes with not ice cream but...gelato!
I went here today with my friends and was in heaven while I ate my delicious and sweet cookies and cream gelato with whipped cream. Now the whipped cream was $1 extra, however it did not taste like your typical whipped cream. It was soft yet smooth and somewhat thick!
The crepe was only about $5 but was well worth it for its taste and sweetness. 
Sophie's will probably never have any trouble getting business since they have such a wide variety of gelato flavors and menu options (including fresh fruit crepes with nutella!)
author: Miss H K.

description: BEST CREPES in the city. Period. Whenever I have cravings for crepes I would always resort to Sophies. Although it is on the pricier side, its worth it. They have fresh ingredients and many different options for you to choose from. I normally add gelato in mine. YUMMY. Thinking about it just makes me want one now. Too bad Im in L.A. currently. Boo.
author: Tommy L.

description: Quality isn't the same as it use to be, crepe skin cold since they make it first and wait for orders. Not as crispy either. Sweet over savory. Green tea crepe still had the best green tea ice cream. The chicken salad was creamy but def needed more flavoring n it could use some lettuce
author: wolfie g.

description:
i remember when this place first opened...the crepe idea was still new in the area...and the lines were going out the door.  now that the crepe idea has been trampled on and found all over the place, i'm surprised that sophie's crepes still have lines going out the door.  

i used to get the more savory crepes...the ham and cheese used to be my fave.  i'd throw in a mixed fruit gelato crepe once in awhile.  now, that i've moved back to the city...i was in the mood for something sweet after our meal so we headed over to sophie's.  this was my first time going here in years...and everything is still the same.  the place is clean  everything is fresh.  the prices went up a bit but that was expected.  they have become really anal with calling out your numbers though. the person behind the counter will stare at your number for a good few uncomfortable seconds or so before they hand you the crepe.  i guess a lot of scamming has been going on.  

good crepes, great location...my choice when i'm craving a crepe...until another place can prove me wrong!
author: Jen W.

description:
Everytime I've seen this place, its always packed.  But this time, It wasnt, so I decided to try them.

Service was quick and the people there are friendly. I got a strawberry and nutella crepe and it was $6.

Not what I was expecting, but the taste was great... they had strawberries throughout.
author: Roger A.

description:
Given some of the wonderful creperies in the Bay Area, I'm amazed at the high reviews this place has gotten.

The prices of their crepes compare averagely to other places, but the product is the sort of cheap fare I'd expect to see in tourist hot-spots.

The crepe itself is thin and brittle, usually splintering as you try to eat it.

The contents are cheap and processed; mashed chicken salad or cheap chocolate syrup.

The ordering line is also arranged oddly, leading to a lot of standing people crowding what few tables there are while they queue to order and then wait around for their orders.
author: Darrien A.

description: This place is so awesome! Every time I come to Japan Town, I HAVE to come here. I love Japanese-style crepes, they make them so darn cute it's hard to resist getting one. The only thing they need to do to make this place perfect is accept credit cards.
author: Genevie Lei L.

description: Not enough Nutella in the only Nutella crepe I had last night. It tasted like a tortilla, a very chewy hard one. I don't think they know how to make good soft fluffy crepes because the one I had was awful. I've had much much better, I'm disappointed.
author: Kelly P.

description:
This is a great place for breakfast, lunch or a small snack. 

Their crepes are fantastic offering a wide variety of different flavors and combinations that make Sophie's Crepes very unique.

I highly suggest getting gelato or ice cream in your crep, it really adds a distinct and unique tates to the crepes.

Highly recommended.
author: Chris C.

description:
Finally tried Sophie's Crepes after all this time.

For a first time experience, i have to say that I was pretty pleased. I decided not to go with a sweet crepe and instead ordered their tuna crepe. I was a little hesitant about ordering it, since I've never tried it but decided to be adventurous. The crepe itself was pretty good, cooked  with the right amount of crispness. However,  t could have had a bit more flavor to it. The tuna itself was a mix (tuna salad) and was flavorful and not too rich. Overall a pretty good crepe.

I was also lucky when I went in the evening and the place was empty. My crepe was prepared pretty quickly and the wait time was great. The customer service was also excellent as well. The employees were all very friendly and hospitable. I'll definitely be going back here to try some more crepes.
author: Ajay K.

description:
I'm sorry, but I just don't understand the love for these crepes! 

I came during the Cherry Blossom Festival, and the line was extraordinary. I took this to mean that the crepes were insanely good. My friends' praise reinforced this expectation.

However, when I finally got my crepe many many moons later, I was confused. I still am, sort of. What am I missing? To be fair, I did not get the crepe that most of my friends got because I don't care for red bean. But I found my crepe too be weirdly chewy; I really had to put some effort into eating this. I was also stressed out by the scoop of ice cream. I love ice cream, but not when it's melting in a hot crepe and threatening to create a huge dripping mess any moment.
author: Ada T.

description:
i know it is a chain but the smell you cannot escape when reaching the back end of the japantown mall

for folks that like nutella, crepes, with bananas, strawberrys, whip cream you really cant go wrong here, crepes here are large filled well for a snack or a full meal, several choices of what to fill your crepe with again it is a chain i think they have another at pier 39 i think but this one is better and not as busy 

3 solid stars

food *** made ok for a snack, fresh fruits and topping yum
service *** ok service they are always smiling
price $ inexpensive but they do charge for everything extra haha
author: Clarence A.

description: I ordered a banana and nutella crepe and pretty much just got a banana crepe. A detectable amount of nutella costs an extra $1.50!  Extremely disappointing.
author: Marianne L.

description:
You know when your having a great night, as my sis and I were and almost anything you eat will seems great 'cause your in such a good mood.  Well, this was one of those occasions.  
My sis and I accidentally stumbled upon this place while walking around waiting to go see The Ghost Writer last night (which was great).  
Our night was filled with spontaneity and getting dessert crepes was part of that. I had no intentions of indulging last , but nevertheless it seemed like the thing to do since the line was outrageous & everyone was doing it. ;-)

Anyhow, lemme get to the point.  We got the banana, whipped cream crepe with black sesame gelato.  And, it was $5.25 plus a $1.50 more for gelato which I felt was a little steep, especially since it was a tiny scoop.  The gelato was great and I wish there was more!  The crepe on the other hand was almost like paper and a little dry.  

Overall, the crepe was just mediocre and a little overpriced, however sis and I were having such a great night together that it didn't matter.
author: Molly M.

description:
Green tea ice cream + nutella = delicious!!!

I also get the turkey savory crepe and add cheese :)
author: Maggie L.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Stw Ban Nutella Van Whip = zomg yes best crepe place ever! Everyone's rave is true! Can't believe I used to ever settle for anything less! Perfectly thin, sweet skin, delicate crisp to each bite complemented with soft ice cream and taste of sweet strawberries..yumm

SERVICE:
Order pickup counter. Cash only boo.

ATMOSPHERE:
Kinda like an ice cream shop. It's cool how there's a big window to watch them make the crepes. No where to sit, just order and enjoy. Well, you can sit on the benches in the Jtown mall... wipe the drippy mess off your hands then go into kinokonuya and browse Japanese books ... *bliss
author: Angela L.

description: Order off the main board. DO NOT "design your own crepe". It turns out to be way more expensive. I paid $6 for a strawberry and banana crepe, when I could have paid $4.50 for a strawberry, banana, and kiwi crepe. I got jipped by not adding 1 more fruit combo. It was totally worth it though.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
This place is pretty good.  I ordered a create your own crepe.  
Plain Crepe $2
Ice Cream $1
Nutella $1.50

They smother the nutella over the crepe which makes it super awesome!  Plus the Ice Cream in the crepe makes it my favorite type of crepe!  It is definitely a bonus when you can create your own crepe as opposed to other places that only have fixed menu items.  The only downside is the Ice Cream scoop isn't big enough for Ice Cream whores like myself.

Btw, this place is cash only, so make sure you bring enough cash for yourself or whoever you plan to treat!
author: Albert H.

description: Got the red bean green tea crepe. The red beans were too sweet and the crepe was too salty...
author: J J.

description: Came to Sophie's for afternoon snack this past Saturday. Got green tea gelato crepe for $4! It was a walk down memory lane. I have had a soft spot for Sophie's Crepes in Japantown since 1990! That's right, since 1990! I still remember when I was a kid and watching the staff create magic with the crepe stones. Sophie's Crepes has true staying power, which is great for the new generation of kids to mesmerize. Try the asian flavors like green tea or red bean.
author: Rich M.

description: I love crepes from this place! I live closeby and come here almost every other week.  I always get the "Japanese"  crepe, which has green tea gelato ice cream, read bean paste and macha sauce. This tastes much better than even the French crepes I had in Paris. There is always a line. Shows how popular they are. The wait is not ridiculous either. One thing to remember, it's cash only.
author: Fang R.

description:
came here after dinner one night and ordered two crepes. we were about 4th or 5th in line... and our two crepes took 50 minutes. that's right... 50!!! what the hell?! it took as long as our dinner. what a waste of time! when we asked why it took so long, they said some person in front of us ordered 8 crepes. ummm ok. does that take ONE HOUR?! when we got our crepes, almost an hour later, i almost threw it in the cashier's extremely stupid face. 

overrated, wasn't even that good. not worth the wait. took a bite and threw it in the garbage.. where it belonged.
author: Bobbie L.

description:
I make sure to make a stop here even if I'm super full since I do not come to SF Japantown often. Their crepes are perfect, crispy on the corners, soft inside. They use gelato instead of ice cream. I've been coming here for more than a decade and been getting their Japantown special with whipped cream. 

For people that are complaining about the crepe's texture, and want an all around soft crepe, GO TO IHOP! However, IHOP charges more for a smaller portion. Don't get me wrong, I like IHOP also. 

Back to the point, this has been my number 1 favorite crepe place to go to and I've had a number of crepes from all over the bay area.
author: Amy C.

description:
This place is pretty fantastic. After stuffing my face with Japanese food, I love coming here for dessert. My favorite is the cookies and cream ice cream with whipped cream crepe... I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. My wife loves their nutella and strawberry crepe as well.

Fairly cheap and very tasty... how can you go wrong?
author: Chad H.

description: I may say it's the best crepes you can find in SF!!! Love the crepes, love the place, plus, you can hang around at the japanese bookstore nearby and it's amazing. I've tried the nutella crepe and lots of flavoured ice cream crepes and it's so delicious, and not that expensive!!!
author: Helen P.

description:
Definitely my favorite crepe shop in the city.

Sophie's makes the perfect dessert crepes. I've tried most of the specials but not I always stick to letter E which consists of vanilla ice cream, chocolate syrup, whip cream and strawberries. I usually request to add gnutella spread for an extra buck but it is well worth it. Sophie's crepes cost a bit more than other crepe places in the city but is worth every dollar and cent. They also make savory crepes if you're not looking for anything sweet.

If you are in Japantown be sure to drop by Sophie's and treat yourself to something sweet!
author: David W.

description:
Great place , Whenever we get the chance to stop by in Japantown we always hit up Sophie's Crepes for the banana nutella crepes. 

Pretty small, but i mean what store isn't in japantown? haha
author: Maddie O.

description:
I love the displays for Sophie's Crepes!  I got the fruit combo which came with ice cream and various types of fruit, but when I bit into my kiwi it was still frozen!  I guess they don't use fresh fruit here =( the rest of the crepe was enjoyable but messy as the ice cream started to melt.  I wanted whipped cream but you get charged extra for that (big minus!); that probably would have made everything even messier than it was, though. 

My friend managed to spill some of his fruit and ice cream from his crepe onto the floor of the shop and what did he do?  Run of course!  And I followed =\

This is a great simple treat for the summer.  I'm tempted to try and make this myself...
author: Jenny W.

description: Just delicious. I always get cookies and cream gelato in the strawberry and Nutella crepe. Everything here is just good and great service
author: M L.

description: It's been a while since I've been to Sophie's and that makes me sad. However, the few times that I did get to Sophie's, I absolutely kept my initial belief that they have the best crepes in town! Nutella is a definite must - it just makes the crepe experience better. I also like how the crepes are served warm and crisp. So good!!!
author: Junel S.

description: I love crepes and this was the first crepe place i've ever had. i love how it's very affordable and cannot leave Japantown without getting one.  It's cash only also.
author: Janice V.

description:
Oh my God! Ice cream in a crepe! Gelato in a crepe!

I never knew that you could make a crepe any more delicious. I am so glad that I was proved wrong. This place is wonderful and a perfect companion to my new toys from the Kinokuniya book and stationary stores.
author: Brandy S.

description:
Yum green tea gelato and red bean crepes!  My friend told me this place was a must-try and I'm glad I saved room after dinner for this sweet treat.  

Other options include the standard nutella, bananas, other fruits.  I have to say I really like mine with a scoop of creamy ice cream on top, though.  

Make your own for prices starting at $3, or get one of the fancy menu board options topping out at $6.25 (for the dessert ones, at least.  I was too busy plowing through my crepe to read the savoury board too closely).

Definitely will be back!!
author: Alison S.

description: I would drive here from across the country just for their turkey & cheese savory crepes. 10 Stars, easy.
author: Jay B.

description:
Date: May 16, 2009 @ 9 PM
Occasion: After-Dinner Dessert during Date Night W/ Boyfriend
Venue:  Little Crepe Shop inside J-Town Mall

This place is so COOL because:
1. It has become a tradition for me and BF to get crepes whenever we are at J-Town usually after dinner and browsing the little shops.
2. It's fun to watch the thin crepes being skillfully made by staff.
3. You can get either sweet dessert or savory crepe at Sophie's.
4. My fave is the nutella with a scoop of strawberry ice cream with slices of fresh strawberries.
5. It's a fun food to eat with your sweetheart.
6. If you're solo, it's still fun. Just eat it while people watching at J-Town. If you're lucky you might see people in COOL ANIME COSTUMES or 55 year old Asian women DRESSED LIKE SCHOOL GIRLS.
7. They're open really late (until 10 PM on Fri and Sat), and it's a fun way to end your date on a SWEET note!

For 2 ice cream crepes with extra toppings: $13.00
author: Leah E.

description:
The Red Bean Gelato + Nutella + Bananas + Whip Cream = Delicious Heaven!!!

I would never consider ordering anything else from there ever again.
author: Rachelle G.

description: dece crepes, but the wait is way too long (~40 minutes).  you can get a fruit mix with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream in a cute little cone though if that's what you're into.
author: Reyana F.

description:
The line is always long for a reason. The crepe skin is just right! The staff is SUPER friendly and always listens to what you say when you make special requests. I really like their dessert crepes :)

I'm not a big fan of their savory crepes but my mom liked it  :)
author: Van C.

description:
I love the Japan Town Sundae! It comes with green tea gelato, red beans, whip cream, topped with a green tea sauce. The combination of flavors is amazing and it tastes just right. It's not too sweet nor is it bland. 

I guess they're known for their crepes. I haven't tried them yet but I always see a long wait for them.
author: Jeanette N.

description: The crepes themselves are both super thin and flaky (that's good). I've had several dessert crepes and all were pretty good but the "Japanese" one with red bean paste and green tea ice cream was DELICIOUS. Perfect combination of texture and flavor. Price is also super low and service is not bad (they get swamped often so wait time can be moderate but never annoyingly long). Definitely making this a regular stop when I visit Jtown.
author: John N.

description:
Peer pressure at its finest. "Everyone's having one". 

Diet? What diet? 

I feel guilty.

My nutella/banana crepe was good but not great and not worth the guilt and long line and long wait. The crepe was crispier than I expected and I ran out of ice cream pretty quickly! Get it out of your system and go once just to feel cool cause "everyone's having one".
author: Valerie A.

description:
Sophie's Crepe is SO YUMMY! 
Went there today with a few of my friends and got the Japanese Crepe with Green Tea Gelato, Red Bean Paste, and Matcha Sauce. It was definitely worth it. The crepe has a nice soft and crispy texture to it and the ice cream blended really well with the crepe. 
However, my friend Connie C. got the ULTIMATE crepe combination that's worth a 5 stars at Sophie's - Crepe with whipped cream, icea cream, mixed fruits, and NUTELLA. This is the best that you'll probably ever get. The everything blended perfectly inside the crepe and the NUTELLA makes it taste like a piece of heave. Definitely recommend it if it's your first time. 
I also tried its variety of gelatos. They had Black Sesame Gelato, which was really yummy! The lychee one was awesome as well. 
I would come back here for more!
author: Joyce B.

description: I've been going here for...oh geez, about 10 years. (Now I feel old!) Every time I'm in Japantown I have to get a crepe. Pretty much anything you get here will taste amazing, but my personal favorite is the mixed fruit with Nutella. You just can't go wrong. :)
author: Lauren H.

description:
i gotta dock them a star because i have this sinking feeling that the nutella to crepe ratio is getting smaller and smaller each time i go.  i mean i can barely taste the nutella.  

-1 for the stingy owner who won't give me a little more nutella on my crepe without charging me a $1.50
author: Josie M.

description: There is always a long line, but well worth the wait. Whenever I eat around the area, I have to stop here for dessert. I always add some flavor of ice cream or gelato to my crepe. The portion here is not as big as Genki's in Inner Richmond so sharing may not be ideal. I suggest you get your own and play with the different combinations of fruit, ice cream/gelato, etc. This always hits the spot!
author: Caroline L.

description:
Delicious desserts!

We've been fans since they first opened. You can't go wrong with ice cream & fruit in a fresh crepe.

Staff is always polite.
author: Masurui M.

description: Good crepes since i lived in Japan! I would definitely drive here from Sac just for this!
author: Kristel V.

description:
Sophie's crepes has got it goin' on
They're all I want and I always wait so long
Sophie can't you see you're just the crepe for me
I know I can't be wrong, I'm in love with Sophie's Crepes
author: Kim O.

description: This place is located inside Japantown mall so it closes pretty early if youre eating dinner and want dessert afterwards. They have the same crepes that every where else has to offer so its nothing special (but still good, dont get me wrong, since you cant really mess up a crepe). They dont take card every time I go there, not sure if they do on a regular basis or if they just broke their card machine but I dont want to pay $3-4 to withdraw money from the ATM.
author: Tim M.

description:
Yummy. Like the thin crepes. 
Long lines but moves pretty fast.

Cons:  pricey
author: Bayarea K.

description:
Sophies Crepes is a rare treat for me, it's almost like the planets have to line up just right before I get to go here. 

First off I'm only in Japan town maybe six times a year. Next I don't feel like eating something sweet that often. If I'm in Japan town, and I feel like something sweet, and whoever I'm hanging out with feels like a crepe as well, then I get a crepe.

Once you get close to Sophies you'll notice a big crowd of people hanging around. There's a definite procedure so get it right. Do not get behind the people waiting for their crepes, you have to get in the order line first. While you wait your turn in line you'll see a board behind the counter with most of what they offer. Take a good look at the menu but reserve final judgement until you've seen "Sophies specials" on a laminated sheet by the register, IMO the specials are the best choices. After you order and pay they give you a ticket with a number. That's when you go to the other group of people and wait for them to call your number.

I had a hand made crepe with fruit, whipped cream, and ice cream for $4.95 and loved every bite.
author: Manny F.

description:
These crepes are TO DIE FOR. 
I've been coming here since I was in middle school or high school. The most amazing crepes in the world. When you get it it's still warm.
The crepe itself is still crispy and never gets soggy or limp like most places. 
The strawberry w/ nutella, whip cream, and strawberry gelato is the best. 
Sometimes there is a bit of a wait since there are so many people and they only have two crepe hot plates. I think I've waited about 30 minutes for a crepe before. But it's definitely worth the wait.

Try it out whenever you're in Japan town.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
My bf brought me here on our first date, and I always make it a point to come here whenever we're in the city.  We always get the gelato crepe- with black sesame gelato.  SO good!!

The crepes are very thin and fresh.  The place gets crowded and they close at 10pm! So make sure you get their before closing, cause they're pretty strict on closing on time.
author: Connie C.

description: Tried 3 types of their crepes and it was not good at ALL. The one on Clement was so much better. Plus did not like the way they ask you if you want additional toppings in a way that makes you think it's free.
author: Scott Y.

description: Strawberries, ice cream, whip cream with a chocolate drizzle -- one of their top 3 popular crepes.  I along with 2 others just had sushi for a late lunch so we shared 1 crepe but honestly I could've easily stuffed the whole thing in my mouth because it was that good.
author: Sharlene M.

description: This crepe shop gets really busy. It's probably because it's one of the few places in Japan Center that stays open relatively late. It's a no frills crepe and gelato place. We split a nutella and banana crepe. Even though it was packed to the gills, we managed to make it to our movie with a few minutes to spare. That's quite a feat considering we only got there fifteen minutes before it was about to start. I'll have to try the gelato next time.
author: Amy J.

description: Yum! I saw the crowd and looked at YELP. I had to try! If I remember correctly they only do cash. I had a vanilla crepe with red bean spread/sauce. It was delicious! Oh my :) i highly recommend this. It was crowd but the line moved quickly and you can watch them make the crepes right in front of you. My total was around 5 bucks and I won't mind paying this again for their crepes. Good price for good food, love it.
author: Jamielynn L.

description:
SO GOOD!

My fave so far is the Nutella and Banana with Ice Cream!  YUM!  Just make sure you're eating that crepe fast (or at least the ice cream part) on a warm day.  It can start to melt down fast and you're left with drippings down your clothes.  Trust me, I learned the hard way.   I had the same crepe on a cool night and no drippings.  Walked from Sophie's to Kabuki and my clothes were stain free. =)  The crepes are really filling so make sure you have room for it.  The size is long (from my elbow to my hand).  They have sweet and savory crepes to choose from, so this could actually be a complete and satisfying meal if you're going the savory route.
author: Heizel M.

description: The strawberries in the mixed fruit and nutella crepe were not fresh.  Otherwise, we would have given Sophe's 5 stars.  The ham and cheese crepe was good.  We saw them making a ham and cheese with veggies that looked delicious.  The veggies looked really fresh.
author: Marisa I.

description:
Again, a stop to JTown is not complete without a stop to Sophie's crepes. Since we were right next door, we HAD to stop in. A crepe w/ gelato and canned pineapple (I avoided the pineapple) to share. The kids got Italian sodas -- pomegranate and orange, respectively. 

We stopped here JUST in time.  There was no one in line when we went to order, but as we were enjoying our treats, two separate parties of 8+ crepe orders came through. This place must make BANK!
author: Patty W.

description:
Generally I'm not much of a sweets person. I like ice cream and cake and cookies and such, I just don't really get cravings for them. Most of the time I'd rather fill up on something deliciously savory than save room for dessert. Sophie's crepes is the one exception. I will always eat a crepe from Sophies, even when I'm not hungry, even when I'm completely stuffed from a bowl of noodles from downstairs, even when there's a huge line and it takes 20+ minutes to even order! I don't know what it is. I like that the crepe is crispy rather than fluffy, I like nutella, I love the vanilla bean gelato, fresh strawberries and whipped cream! I mean come on! what's not to like?!?
The BF is totally a dessert person and he knows that I'm not, so he totally gets a kick out of watching me stuff myself with crepe.
author: Melanie V.

description:
WOWZA. I am really digging this place. I went here on two occasions:

#1 Sophie Crepe Experience: Sweet
Sweet crepes without nutella should be a sin! I ordered nutella, strawberries, whip cream, and ice cream. Heaven all in a paper sleeve! The crepe itself had the right about of crunch to it. I don't like soggy soft crepes. The way the ice cream melted with the nutella.. it's like and explosion of cold creamy chocolately hazel goodness. 

#2 Sophie Crepe Experience: Savory 
They offer different choices and all sounded so good. The different ingrediants they use: avocado, cheese, turkey, ham, egg salad, mayo, and more! I never heard of egg salad in a crepe so I decided to be adventurous and I ordered the egg salad and avocado. Good choice! However, the crepe this time was a bit crunchier than expected. Not sure if it was intentional for the egg salad but it worked!! 

Overall, service was good. Nothing spectacular. But the CREPES: Super spectacular!
author: Cheryl P.

description:
Oh Sophie's, how I miss you every night when I crave a dessert.  =/

Damn this place is hella good!!  If I am ever NEAR (within 15 mile radius) the area, then you can find me drooling on the window watching them make my Strawberry and Nutella with Vanilla ice cream.  *Hold on, let me wipe my drool off*  I would get other crepes, like the mandarin orange with whipped cream and ice cream, but I have to stick with my fave!

One gripe which holds it back from a 5 star review is the small amount of strawberries they give me.  If they were to pile in more strawberries rather than the 6 pieces they give you, they would have my ultimate Yelp blessing.  Also, the last two times I have gotten sourish strawberries.  You might say, "strawberries aren't in season son!".  Well my reply is "give me more ice cream to offset the sourness!".  =)  Ok, that might be asking too much, but hey it doesn't hurt to beg for more goodness!!
author: chester c.

description:
Get the Japanese crepe! Green tea gelato, red bean paste, and green tea matcha sauce. It's SO heavenly.

The crepe itself is thin, soft and chewy, and I love how they have gelato. It's different than Genki's thin and crispy crepe, so depends on what you're feeling. Or just go to both!
author: Miriam K.

description: The next time you're in SF Japantown, and have a craving for crepes, (I know, sounds strange, but you will, trust me.) Hit up Sophie's Crepes for limitless combinations of crepes, ice cream, fruit & toppings. One quick tip: this place is cash only.
author: Carla D.

description: I truly love the green tea gelato here. I always get the green tea gelato crepe (add Nutella, whipped cream, choco syrup). The crepe itself is always perfect and not too crunchy. I really hate crunchy crepes that crack when you bite into it. I've always ordered the strawberry sundae (w/ less syrup). Both are really good. Actually, I think it's likely that all the gelato flavors are good, making everything on the menu good.
author: Rosanna T.

description: First time coming here with my friends and I have to say it was quite delicious.  I ordered the Chicken Salad Savory crepe and the pesto sauce that coated the chicken was exceptionally yummy. The crepe itself was not as satisfying because it was a bit cold and soggy. :/ Although the flavors of the toppings were great, the quality of the crepe just lost 1 star .
author: Dustin W.

description:
Maybe my expectations were set a little too high, OR maybe I was just stuffed too full from all of the eating I was doing on Valentine's day weekend that I did not appreciate my dessert crepe from Sophie's. 

Came here on a rainy Sunday with the boyfriend's family and it was PACKED! It's a pretty small restaurant (restaurant isn't even the right word for Sophie's), so the line was out the door and around the corner. Very clean, very cute, very Japan town. I was looking at the menu, and I could not decide what I wanted. Not because I wanted everything, but because I did not feel like gelato (Yes, my name is Maureen Buenaflor and an alien did not invade my body. I just did not feel like gelato because I was stuffed to the brim with food all weekend.) Don't get me wrong, I LOVE gelato. But I really wanted my crepe with ice cream and was surprised they only had one flavor of ice cream--vanilla (that's what we got). 

So the group got six crepes all together--it took like 10-15 minutes, which makes sense since there's only one guy making the crepes. I shared mine with the boyfriend (who said he was only going to take a couple bites, but took like 10...but I still love him). We got strawberries, banana, and vanilla ice cream--minus the Nutella. It was delicious!

Sophie's is a must for everyone...expect a wait though, so keep yourself entertained...
author: Maureen B.

description: Love their crepes! I don't get to go very often, but when I do, I usually get a custom-made one with red bean, strawberries & bananas, & gelato on top. Their gelato is really good and goes perfectly with the crepe! I especially like their black sesame, green tea, pistachio, & adzuki red bean gelatos.
author: C K.

description:
BLACK SESAME GELATO! so good! try it!!!

we ordered crepe with strawberry, chocolate, and black sesame gelato.  it was pretty pricey,...totaled to over $7.

a regular crepe with fruit, chocolate, and ice cream however is $5.50, but if you want it with gelato they charge an extra $1.50.

these are the kind of crepes that are made into a cone shape and you hold it with your hand and rip off the yummy flaky pieces, and as a crepe fanatic i give it 5 stars mainly for the fast service and the black sesame gelato.  

 if you don't wanna spend that much money on dessert, i would say just order the black sesame gelato alone (one scoop = $3.50, two scoops $4.50) or just get an ice cream crepe ($4). hehe
author: Patty O.

description: I love their crepes!. I ordered a crepe with strawberry, whipped cream and nutella. It was heavenly. The strawberries had been soaked in a sugary concoction so therefore every bite of crepe was full of sugary goodness. It was not too sweet or bland, it was just right. None of the ingredients overpowered the taste of the other. The crepe was flaky and kind of crunchy (which I loved). I am practically salivating as I am writing this.
author: Lisa L.

description: Definitely a great crepe place, with lots of variety in ingredients and gelato. The mixed fruits are cut, peeled and prepared on the spot. The crepe turns out very fresh. The service is pretty good too.
author: Eric L.

description:
This is my favorite place to get crepes! I've been going here for years. Whenever I'm at Japantown, I go to Sophie's to get crepes.

I always get my favorite, The Mixed Fruit with whipped cream& vanilla ice cream. It has fresh strawberries, banana, &kiwis. It's so good. When I get my crepe, there's a BIG scoop of ice cream&enough fruits. It's very filling. Makes me full&happy when I finish. They don't just serve crepes, they offer ice cream/gelato/sundaes. My friend always gets the Very Berry Sundae. He loves it! 

When there isn't a lot of people, the wait isn't long so you just get it&go.Even if there's a long line, I wouldn't mind waiting (it's worth the wait!) &another plus, the workers are nice too. I enjoy watching them make the crepes.

OH! &the price is not bad :D
author: Presh G.

description:
This is a true gem, I got the California Savory Crepe and it was just really solid. How csn you say no to handheld crepes?

Make sure to bring cash.
author: Eric A.

description:
From the rave reviews on Yelp and for the price, I expected more. I ordered a strawberry, nutella and vanilla gelato crepe. Service staff was prompt and courteous. Portion size was good as well. 
However, there's really nothing special about it - overall just not impressed, especially after shelling about $6+.
author: Ji K.

description:
The smell of this place can lure any Bandersnatch out of hiding. I managed to coerce the boyfriend into trying a mandarin orange, whipped cream, and ice cream crepe. It was beyond packed and cash only, but things were flowing out.

The crepe itself was nice and crispy and the toppings, or fillings in this case, were yummy together. We polished that thing off like it was nothing. 

The only negative thing I saw was that the employees don't wear gloves. So, who knows if they always wash their hands. I try not to think about it.
author: squishy b.

description:
God bless the baby-faced wizards who work here and make me cry like a little pink princess for strawberry nutella banana wrapped in crepetasmic delushessness.

Without a doubt I didn't know what life, or dessert was about until my ice berry cream was in your crepe and your nutella was in my banana.

I can polish one off in under 2 mins and care waaayyy more about the delicate crisp crepe crunch followed by sweet soft creme, than my oft impending brain freeze. 

It's the perfect food - especially when paired with a complimentary glass of water.
author: Brady K.

description:
What's better than a normal crepe? A crepe used as a cone! No way! I love foods in cones because it makes it so much easier to eat said food in said cone. No utensils necessary. Sophie's Crepes: brilliant, convenient, and tasty.

I always get a mixed fruit with ice cream crepe ( I think its combo F) when I'm here. It has strawberries, kiwis, banana, whipped cream, and vanilla ice cream. They leave the crepe on to cook a bit longer, so it ends up being crispier and staying crispy instead of getting soggy. 5 stars for that because there's nothing I dislike more than a soggy crepe.
author: April L.

description:
this is the BEST crepe place ever. Ever since they opened way back when and I used to hang in J-town all the time, I would frequent Sophie's for all types of crepes: savory and sweet. 

They seriously make the best crepes because the actually crepe part is perfectly made. The guys working that crepe making machine are experts at what they do. I've been to other places to have crepes and nothing is like this hand held treat you get from Sophies. 

I more often than not always get the mixed fruit with ice cream. I had this treat over the weekend and it was still as good as I remember from years ago. Most other places make their crepes too thick and therefore not crisp enough on the outside. They become soggy and don't taste good. 

Whats worse is that some places will pre make their crepes. Um, who's ever heard of pre-making crepes? No thanks. I want mine made to order with freshly cut fruit and yummy ice cream. This is exactly what sophie's is. 

I think I need a crepe after work now... Savory one for dinner and a sweet one for dessert. YUM!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Fast and yummy crepes plus gelato and ice cream with fresh fruit. You really can't go wrong. 

We had a cup of banana walnut gelato with whipped cream, chocolate syrup and fresh bananas to just get my ice cream fix. 

The crepe was filled with strawberry, kiwi, banana, whipped cream, and ice cream. All the fruit was very tasty and fresh. The crepe, maybe it is because I'm from LA was very crispy. I think crepes should be soft and fluffy with a little crisp at the edges. 

The shop though is fast, they have a good little motor running to make many different items for many different people. Although the line was long they finished in a few minutes... and so did the crepes.
author: Evey L.

description:
Anytime I'm within two blocks of this place I feel the need to go get a dessert crepe. I can be full after a big dinner but I'll STILL go eat a crepe. I'll eat the entire thing too. It's to the point that after I eat it I want to burst and/or cry from how ridiculously full I am.

But I just can't help myself. All the ingredients are good pretty much anywhere you get them, but their ice cream seems slightly better. Most of all though, there is something about their whipped cream gets me every time...

I think maybe they put crack in the whipped cream. It keeps me hooked.
author: Crystal C.

description:
I love crepes. I love gelato. I love sophie's because of their gelato crepes. 

I had the Japanese crepe minus the maccha sauce because the cashier said he didn't like it. Good call because the green tea gelato and red bean paste crepe was deeelicious. My sister and cousin had lychee gelato crepes which were also good but they tasted like they were missing one more element of flavor. 

Crepe was yum. gelato was yum. gelato crepe was yumyum.

The place is CASH ONLY and located on the second floor of the japanese center. The address on here says 1531 Webber, but entering through 1501 or 1581 Webber is fine, just go up the stairs to the second store and the first thing you'll see is Sophie's.
author: Charlene S.

description:
I will forgo a dinner in any of Japantown's yummy restaurants to eat a Sophie's crepe. In fact, I think I've lied about not being able to make it to dinner in Jtown and gone over to Sophie's for a crepe instead. Hee hee. This joint is the best place for a crispy crepe. That's right - CRISPY, not soft and fluffy like the crepes you're used to eating. Sophie's makes a thin crepe filled with savory or sweet goodness and rolls it up like a waffle cone for your consuming pleasure.

Expect a LONG LINE (at least 25 minute total for queuing, ordering and waiting) to get your crepe on. Don't expect any nice tables and chairs or serving ware for you to sit down and gingerly cut into your crepe. Your dining experience choices are comprised of three sets of plastic tables and chairs you'd find fraternity guys sitting on while barbecuing in the backyard of their fraternity house and a sad, over-painted and worn out "courtyard" area for the three dozen other crepe-mongers to huddle together and eat their crepes. Sophie's crepes were designed for eating on the go so get your ass up and out of the store!

My fave crepes are the banana and nutella, the California (think of a Cali roll wrapped in a luscious crepe) and the avocado turkey. The sweet crepes are my fave. Or if you think you're hot crepe stuff, you can pick your ingredients to build your own franken-crepe.

Sophie's doesn't offer validation for parking so grab a street spot if you can. Take some time to wander around the mall or if it's nighttime, hit one of the karaoke joints. Either way, remember to save room your tummy for Sophie's.
author: Dawn L.

description:
I wasn't very satisfied.  That and was partially grossed out by the lady that wiped her nose and continued to make crepes.  OK so you GOT a big window where people watch you make the food they will consume in a few minutes.  DON'T TOUCH YOUR FACE or any other thing that could be dirty.  *shakes head*  note they use bare hands to make the crepes... (see photos)

ok so after that gross viewing, I got my turkey and cheese crepe and it was SOOOOOOO tiny.  Turkey lunch meat with some cheese sprinkled on it.   yeah... ummm tiny little thing was basically all crepe skin. I must say the desert crepes faired better here.  I'd skip the Savory crepes.  I'd come back here only to have a desert crepe with ice cream, but really.. watch out for the "hand to face" and back to crepe move they do.
author: Allan T.

description: Their crepe is awesome! Got strawberry and banana walnut ice cream in my crepe and it's a perfect dessert to go after grabbing a meal at japan town. The employees there are nice and really hard-workers. The only drawback of crepe itself, not the restaurant, is it can make you look messy ( at least in my case lol). Other than that yummy place to try out and their interior decoration is cute!
author: Monica C.

description:
Accidentally happened upon Japantown during an urban nhike and called a friend to tell me what was good here. She told me to go to Sophie's Crepes and order a crepe with red bean and green tea gelato.

I heard about the lines, but Friday at 1 PM, there was no wait whatsoever.

Anyways, the crepe was absolutely amazing. I thought I was gonna get something small, especially after paying 5 bucks. But when I saw it, it was definitely well worth it. Red bean paste and Green tea gelato complement each other really well.
author: Amar T.

description: Some of the best dessert Crepes i've had. I'd go to Genki for Savory crepes though.
author: amit s.

description:
Decent crepes but this place gets PACKED!  Lines out the door and a crowd 30 people deep packed.. Then again what do you expect on a weekend in Japantown.

I say go if you're in the area and want to browse the Kinokuniya bookstore and/or have time on your hands. Unless you're here during the week (why?!).

The crepes are decent but none better than I've had at other spots in the city. The ice cream is the better point here. At times my crepe has been a little dry. Possibly a fluke due to the busy time slot but how hard is it to NOT overcook a crepe? That's your job crepe-maker. To not overcook.
author: Tay R.

description:
Likes: the crepes of course!

Dislikes: it's in a Japantown mall so a bit on the pricer side. and sometimes there's a line.
author: Karen M.

description: Best crepes ever. A must go if you're in japantown. My favorites are the kiwi crepe and the japanese crepe which has green tea gelato, red bean paste and green tea sauce. The crepe itself is crispy and soft. Best place for crepes.
author: Mandy Y.

description:
I LOVE YOU EVEN WHEN YOUR CASHIER'S A BITCH. 

The two mexican guys making the stuff are amazing and they got their jobs down. I got the ice cream crepe, (and even when the lady said that the matcha sauce with matcha gelato makes a difference, it really doesnt. Its just a ploy!) 

But I think the winner here is how thin and awesome the crepes are and how awesome the gelato is. The consistency of the gelato is so good and solid. 

After I had a bad ice cream crepe experience at genki crepe, I just had to go here an hour later to rectify this injustice in my taste buds.
author: Candice A.

description: Mmmm, mmmm, mmmm. I've been frequenting Sophie's since I was an awkward 8th grader obsessed with anime and speaking Japanese. I finally got to bring the hubs there recently and we chowed down on a strawberry, banana, and Nutella crepe with ice cream. There can be a long wait but the reward is a warm, yummy crepe.
author: Lau B.

description:
Sophie's Crepe is a must when visiting Japantown. Can't say too much about their savory crepes since I've never ordered one before but their dessert crepes are delicious. The "Mixed Fruit" crepe is my favorite. Line could get long but the the service is fast.

The Good: Crepes!!
The Bad: The crowd
author: Yan W.

description: The crepes here are very refreshing and always hits the spot after a bowl of ramen. I usually get the strawberry, nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream. The kids really enjoy eating here for dessert, although it can get pricey. The staff is very friendly and there is usually a line out the door. Try this place if you are in or near Japantown.
author: Marty M.

description: Delicious, fresh, and cheap! My favorite is the Japanese crepe: red bean spread, green tea gelato, green tea sauce drizzled on top. Can't go wrong.
author: Helen W.

description:
I'd like to believe that Sophie's Crepes is still the best crepery in the city: even over Genki's, but I also would like to notify yelp of my last experience.  

Sophie's Crepes cannot handle the same quality under pressure.

I came here on Valentine's day and felt extremely disappointed in the quality of my Strawberry+Nutella crepe.  Usually, I'm left in harmonious bliss after biting into their crepes.  This time I was not.  For one, the crepe was made with much less strawberries than they usually provide.  

Bottom line: seems like you might be better off maybe going back to Genki's for a crepe on a busy day.
author: Leslie Y.

description: this might be a bias review but it looks like I like this place as much as everyone else. I have heard these are the best crepes outside of Paris, I will, of course, let you know when I test that theory. So we went and I ordered the nutella and fruit with ice cream and the turkey crape. DELICIOUS! I have only had true crepes once before at the farmers market in LA and those were good just not and light and crisp as Sophie's. I wonder if they would serve a nutella crepe with jelly? YUMMY!
author: Sarah D.

description:
Try the Japanese.
Green tea ice cream with anko (red bean paste), an inseparable flavor combination that, while not unique, plays extremely well texturally with the crispy-warm crepe.

This place is a bit pricey, even over-hyped, but remains consistently one of the best creperies in SF.

Only thing keeping it from 5-stars: never open when I'm craving it.  Happened 6/7 times.  Murphy's Law, much?
author: Chase C.

description: The crepes here are very good, but I think the ones at Genki Crepes on Clement is just a bit better. The crepes are close to $5 here and when you start adding extras like whipped cream and a scoop of ice cream, the cost can get out of hand!
author: John H.

description:
I think the great thing about this place is the fact that it's a decent dessert locale. Oh, and it was a hot day, so their ice cream selection drew us closer assuming there was air conditioning.  But there wasn't.  I was sorely disappointed.

The crepes don't really stand out as anything special, but I did find eating them enjoyable after an unsatisfying run with a sushi restaurant.  The fruits (strawberry, banana, kiwi) didn't taste fresh nor does the ice cream (not gelato) that I added tasted like it was special either.  The gnutella didn't taste very nuttery either.

On a busy day, it took almost 25 minutes from the time we ordered to get our crepes.  Which we proceeded to finish within 5 minutes.  I'm not sure if it was worth the wait.  I'll come back and I'll add another star if I can find a savory crepe or combination crepe that I can nom.

Call me a spoiled ass, but I think if you add air conditioning for the workers and customers, higher capacity to serve more fat Americans, fresher fruit, and bigger portions; I think you'd have a five star recipe.
author: Alfred Y.

description: Good crepe.  Our family usually stop here if we are in japantown.  We only tried the sweet crepes.  They are all good.  The ice-cream is good also.
author: Mike Y.

description:
1 star for the nice display in their window
2nd star for the HELLA BOMB crepes
3rd star for HELLA BOMB sorbet
4th star for being close by the restaurants so that i can have some after eating my lunch or dinner

I LOVE sophie's!!! I usually get their strawberry & nutella crepe with vanilla bean GELATO. Yeah, it's a bit pricey, but it's SO WORTH IT! The mango & raspberry sorbet is pretty freak'n YUMMY as well.
author: T t.

description:
I think Sophie's Crepes is one of best you can get in the US. It is not up to par with the Japanese ones of course, but it is good enough. My favorite one is the Japanese crepe. I have also try the red bean ice cream crepe with other fruits and that is great too.

The price is not cheap. If you are looking for something almost of the same caliber, go try Belly Good Cafe & Crepes. You can go there by walking over the bridge to the other side of the mall.

This is definitely a close substitute to what ice cream with fruit crepes can taste like and I recommend this for anyone who loves crepes!
author: Samantha T.

description: excellent crepes that aren't completly soggy which i like. definitely worth a try if you're in the area
author: Eugene H.

description:
