Sohpie's Crepes is one reason I envy the San Franciscans. Why can't they get it right in the South Bay?! Guess you can't have it all. 

Anyhow I visited here for the first time with the boyfriend after a long day of museums and food. Without Yelping (no way!) we wandered in like mosquitos getting pulled in by the glow of the bug zappers only we were reeled in by the crispy sweet smell of their perfectly cooked crepe skin. AMAZING. We both got nutella, whip cream and ice cream- he got it with strawberries and i got my with tangerines. OMG the most sensational crepe I had ever had! The girl recommended it to me and it changed my life. I mean it was THAT GOOD! 

There weren't too many people so service was fast and friendly. They all laughed when my eyes got the size of the moon and I started mumblig about how delicious it was to my boyfriend.

Though I would normally take one star off for the following episode... the crepes are too good to let this place be anything less than a perfect rating. So the girl cashier (an excellent up seller; the girl will sell you an extra chicken filling for your fruit crepe I swear!) suggested chocolate syrup to a man who was buying a crepe for his daughter. He got it and gave it to his daughter, then his daughter said she didn't want chocolate syrup so he stood back in line right and away and got another one (the other had to be thrown away because everyone else in his family already had one), and the girl did not even offer a discount. I honestly would have expected a replacement crepe. But oh well.

Anyway this place is GREAT! We're going back next weekend!
author: Christina L.

description:
End your day the right way. 

I've always shared a #17.  It was my first love in a crepe wrap.


But i just discovered not two blinks ago that there is a black sesame gelato crepe?  


Might there be a love triangle?!
author: Anita L.

description:
Sophie's has the greatest japanese style crepes I have ever tasted! Key point being - these are japanese style crepes. If you are looking for hearty stuffed crepes with a thicker texture, this is not the place to go. That's probably pretty obvious considering Sophie's is located directly inside the J-town mall. 

Their crepes are the exact consistency and texture of what you would ever want in a crepe holding ice cream and fruit. I found out that it's not so easy to get this perfect texture when I visited another crepe shop down in San Diego and it was entirely too crispy. This made me adore Sophie's even more!

My personal favorite is the mixed fruit crepe (has strawberries and kiwis) with Vanilla ice cream. They fold it just in way that the crepe acts as a "cone" for the ice cream. Ingenious! 

Recently, I went with a friend and she suggested the Banana walnut ice cream. That was phenomenal. And considering that I don't even care for banana's that much...that's sayin' a lot! 

My suggestion is go eat some nice Japanese food in J-Town, then head over to Sophie's for dessert. Ahhh perfection!
author: Esther J.

description:
One of my favorite dessert spots in Japantwon. Always a crowd but it moves fast. Plus there's an awesome bookstore right next door. I always get a basic crepe: nutella & strawberry. My girl gets the sundae and says the chocolate gelato is outstanding. 

Been here many times, will be back for more!
author: Nelson C.

description: This place makes FLAWLESS crepes (although I concede, I've never been to France).  My favorite is the red bean with green tea gelato and macha sauce.  You can never go wrong with nutella either.  I've yet to try their savory crepes, though I'm sure they're good as well (but I prefer to go to Crepevine if I'm feeling salty).  In any case, yeah, it may be more expensive than that other crepe/dessert shop in J-town, but trust me, it's worth every cent!
author: Tiffany H.

description: After coming back again and ordering the same thing--California--and witnessing consistently awesome quality I must say that this place deserves a 5star review. I mean if I dream of Sophie's while eating a crepe from another place that means that this place is the best right? :)
author: Idk A.

description:
Not much to say except that this place is a gem. Im from LA and I liked this place so much. Its about how they make the crepes, the quality and the style is just unique and sooo good. 

Of course you cant go wrong with anything with Nutella. I mean its always the bomb. The crispiness of the outside part of the thin crepes make you salivate. its just addicting. 

Yes 5 stars! No doubt!
author: t b.

description: Stingy on the ice cream and strawberries! Overall it was good, but not the best I've had. I would rather drive a little further down Geary and get some Genki crepes. I've noticed this place is always packed on the weekends, but if you're ever around during weekdays, this place is dead. Good place to get a crepe fixing if you're too lazy to go to Genki.
author: Thanh N.

description:
Memo: Sophie.

Re: Your crepes.

I'd like to inform you that your dessert crepes are too delicious for their own damn good. Once a shining champion of sharing, I have been reduced to prison-style hoarding. Observe my shifty eyes while I eat without a spoon. You've given me yet another reason to be glad I'm single, although complications arise when my folks visit. Allow me to illustrate:

Me: What crepe would you prefer, dearest mother? I shall request one for your bemusement, as your maternal kindness is sweeter than any available confection.

Mom: Why don't we just share one?

Me: *eyes widen* BITCH, get yo own damn crepe!! What... choo ain't got no job?!

See what I mean?
author: Keane L.

description: Green Tea Gelato Crepe with Matcha Green Tea and Red Bean Sauces. Definite favorite from this crepe place. Also. my favorite Japanese crepe place since Crepe House Uni in Davis closed down. This crepe would be 294823094380423x better if they added piece of white dango to the crepe. I love me some dango! Nevertheless, this was still yummy and much better than the one from Genki.
author: Constance C.

description:
this place sucks.  eat at belly good instead.  sophie's crepes are made of thin cardboard paper and cream out of a can made of hydrogenated oil.  this mean speaks the troof.

belly good is in the same mall:
http://www.yelp.com/biz/belly-good-cafe-and-crepes-san-francisco#query:belly%20good
author: Ryo I.

description:
I don't really have a reason to go to Japantown but I still make the effort to go when I'm in the city and my one and only motivation for going is Sophie's Crepes.  

I usually try to leave room in my stomach after lunch for a crepe but even if I stuff myself beforehand, I manage to shove a crepe down.  They have a good menu but I always personalize mine and pick out my flavors (gelato + nutella + assorted fruits = love).  They charge a flat price and then add on to it based on what you put inside.  I once dragged my two friends who were skeptical about my obsession with Sophie's all the way to Japantown and while we were eating they admitted that this was absolutely worth the trip.  

I took off a star because the store is pretty small (very sanitary though!) so the line is almost always out the door and it takes quite a while for them to make the crepe.  Service is good; for some reason, the same guy is always working there when I go.  They also sell just pure gelato which is also really good and come in so many flavors.  Fruits are fresh, crepe wrap is made perfectly... what more can I ask for?  Just make sure to stock up on napkins because it can get messy!
author: Veronica L.

description:
We were going to give this place a two... but it deserves more than that, and really we had just been spoiled by the awesome Genki's that set our standards out of wack for dessert crepes.

Anyway, we came here before hitting up Viz Cinemas for a quick bite to eat. We had a hankering for a sweet bite to eat, so ended up going for one with nutella and bananas. We were impressed as we saw the crepe literally made fresh before our eyes, as the batter was poured and cooked while the bananas were freshly cut.

Sadly, and from here on out its impossible not to directly compare it to Genki's, the crepe itself wasn't as thick as we would have liked while the nutella was also used too sparingly.

Overall, we were happy with what we got... although were graving something better by the time we finished. Not bad, though, and if one is in the area this would make for a good place to get a crepe if one is in the mood. Still, its not very likely we will be trying them again.
author: Sami R.

description: Love this place!!! It's like me and my hunnies secret spot!! :) Seriously we ALWAYS come here, and just thinking about it now makes me want to go tonight! It's delicious, yummy, tantalizing, how else can I describe it. I love crepes and I love the selection. I usually go with the dessert crepes...nutella, whip cream (UH-MAZING), banana or strawberries. My bf usually gets it with vanilla ice cream, and it's freakin delish. Highly recommend it! Plus there is ample amount of parking around Japan town, & that's always a good thing :)
author: B B.

description: I haven't been here for so many years but I decided to check it out when my friends came to town and wanted crepes. We went on early Saturday morning and was happy that the line wasn't long. My friends decided we should try the crepe with green tea ice cream and red bean paste because it sounded yummy! When I took the first couple bites, it didn't disappoint me at all! I was in crepe heaven. The prices seemed decent.  The customer service was pretty good too. I will definitely come back!
author: Rain L.

description:
The best crepes I've ever tasted, hands down! I go for the dessert crepes because the savory ones do not appeal to me. I usually get it with nutella, mixed fruits & green tea gelato with whipped cream. Even without the mixed fruits or whipped cream, it is THE BOMB. 

The crepe is very thin and flaky. It isn't salty, nor is it sweet, it has the taste of how a crepe should taste like!
author: Kim N.

description:
It is really the best crepe place! 

Love the red bean ice cream
Love the sesame ice cream
Love the nutella (good with anything!)
Love the crepe itself 
Love the fruits 

BUT
not the green tea sauce
not the whip creme 

and then you will feel like you are in LA-LA-Land as you bite into it!
author: Irene C.

description:
Looking to get fatter? Head here.

I made a lactose free crepe: raspberry sorbet, strawberries, strawberry jam. This was a very berry crepe. It was pretty damn good. 

I was surprised they close at 10pm, I would imagine there would be plenty of demand for this place till at least 11-11:30.
author: Michael S.

description:
This is HEAVENLY and scrumptously good.

There is always a long line but it's well worth it. The crepes are made fresh in front of your eyes and you choose your topping.

I love the whipped cream, bananas and nutella.

Oh my gawd.
author: Genevieve S.

description:
I am addicted. i use to run up here on my dayoffs just to get my gelato with strawberry nutella crepes! I love the crisp  of the crepe! their sandwich is good too, my favorite is the mocha gelato! Another interesting taste to the palate is the sesame seed gelato!
My favorite dessert place, hands down!
author: Doris U.

description:
I can't believe I haven't written a review about this place! Ok, let's get to it...

After watching Vicky Cristina Barcelona at the Kabuki (good movie, by the way) we decided to cap off the evening with dessert. They have all kinds of sweet and savory crepes. Fill it with fruit, ice cream, whipped cream, nutella, egg salad, ham, cheese, etc...But not all at once. That would be gross. 

I had chocolate sauce, strawberry and whipped cream in mine. Very rich and filling. I think I should have ordered the plain butter with cinnamon instead! 

Cute place. Good service, very efficient. You can watch them make your crepe. I like!
author: Caroline C.

description: I tried the banana + chocolate + ice cream and it was delicious.
author: J L.

description: Although it is called sophie's crepe, the best thing about this place is its awesome ice-cream!! I love the green tea ice-cream and I had been to different places just to come back to sophie and think: "Yah... This is still the best." It's really creamy! N green tea-ish (if you can actually find the word in dictionary). Besides, I also love the mango ice cream which is super sweet and taste like a real mango surprisingly. But if I have to choose, I'll rather go with the green tea and go get mango mousse at schubert's... Yay
author: Cliff T.

description:
Dear Sophie,

Thanks for the crepe.  I had your cheapass one with plain vanilla ice cream.  Why won't you lower the price or have a weekly special instead so folks like me can afford it.  But anyways, vanilla is underrated and it was just as delicious as the expensive ones so I say who needs creme brulee flavored gelato?

PS: An old sock would taste good in your crepe, it's that good.
author: Gil S.

description:
Imagine being on a boat going out on a rescue in the cold freezing rain... 

Me: They got all sorts of crepes.. you got ice cream crepes.. gelato crepes... strawberry crepes.. kiwi crepes.. .nutella crepes...

*Waves crashes over us* 

Me: Ham and Cheese crepes, egg salad crepes

*winds howls and blows us backwards*

Me: banana crepes.. ham sandwich crepes... red bean crepes.. green tea crepes.. . 

Yeah I might not be the smart man..but I know what good crepes is. 

Sophie's is the best crepes I've had. They are pricey but they are bigger than some other crepe places. Every time I'm in the area I'm hitting them up for more. I can't stop and I don't care. 

Hey wait... 

LT Dan... ICE CREAM!!!!!!
author: Dan T.

description:
These are hands down the best crepes I have had since France. Of course I have only ever had the Nutella and strawberry here (classic) but if I love something that much, why try something new? I love the fact that the crepes are slightly crispy because there is nothing I detest more than a soggy, smushy crepe (hmmmm actually I can think of a few other things...). 
The size is perfect, sometimes even a bit too much. Even if I don't finish it right away, it's still good hours later. Now that is a perfect crepe!
author: Kelley D.

description:
How could I forget to add my stars to this obviously perfect place?

Sophie's really is as heavenly and spectacular as everyone says. 

There's a reason why it's always a long wait in their tiny little shop with fat little kids plastering their faces against the glass watching the crepe magic happen.

The Green Tea crepe is a perfect wrap, I can never not get Strawberries and Nutella. I often come out of there with 2-3 different crepes.

Total fatty, I know. But being enlarged with Sophie's Crepes in my stomach is nothing to be sad about :)
author: Christina L.

description:
You will be surprised at what I'm about to say. I may be a San Jose native, but...San Francisco makes the best crepes for me. At a time when I had a brain freeze moment, I asked one of my friends who lives in San Diego these days what's the best place in the south Bay Area to get a crepe and she asked me "Why would you go anywhere else besides Sophie's?" right there. (It was for some bet by the way.) I go to various places in San Jose, Milpitas, and the south and while the crepes there are cute, they don't overwhelm me in regards of amazement. I'm not saying that they're not great because they are. It's that San Francisco crepes do a lot for me.

Sophie's, which happens to be one of my San Francisco friend's crepe place of choice, is one of those places why San Francisco makes the best crepes for me. So many choices to choose from and you'll want to eat them slowly to get as much savory moments as you can. Yes, it is slow when there are a lot of people and you need to pay with cash only, but other than that there isn't much else for me to worry about.

+: The crepes are oh so satisfactory and the staff members are nice.

-: If there are a lot of customers, and believe me, there are a lot often, it will be slow.
author: Don U.

description:
After a bad lunch i came to Sophie's crepe for a better enjoyment. I hate how crepe places doesn't have a knife, plate and fork so that i can cut up my crepe instead of biting them because i'm sharing this with someone, geees!

I got the fruit combo, didn't come with Nutella (lame, shouldn't it come with it) but it came with strawberry, kiwi, and bananas plus we get an ice cream, and whipped cream. if you wanted gelato you would have to pay extra, lame.

overall the ice cream made it even better. it was refreshing =)
author: Alyssa K.

description:
Best crepe place ever! Recently went with some friends on a Saturday afternoon. While the crepe was very good, the wait for it was RIDICULOUS. As we were not in a rush, we decided to wait it out. I don't mind waiting for good food, but this wait was horrific in the mall. The line barely moves, it's packed with tons of people, and it was soooo stuffy you can hardly breathe. Do they not believe in fans or air circulation?

Anyways, the crepe was amazing. Definite 5 stars for the crepes. I had the strawberry with nutella with ice cream. The crepe was thin, crispy, and perfectly lightly sweet. I also love the fact that it's portable in a wrapper so you can walk around with it and eat. 

The wait sucked, but the crepe was amazing. My boyfriend's crepe got very messy as the ice cream started to leak out the bottom of the paper wrapper. My friend's crepe was made wrong: she ordered hers with nutella that they forgot and gave her cream instead. She said it was still good though.

5 stars for the crepes, 4 stars overall for the whole experience.
author: Ha T.

description:
Best crepe I've ever had. They've got their crepe making down. They know how to do it right. I love how you can eat & walk with it, unlike all the other places where you have to sit down & eat it. 

The only downside is that sometimes there will a long wait. But it's worth the wait
author: Eric B.

description:
It my not be the most authentic creperie around for a Frenchman, but its exactly like the crepe stands i remember from Tokyo's Harajuku neighborhood: just perfect for eating while walking around. 

My personal favorite is Nutela, bananas and whipped cream. I get one every time I'm in Japantown. 

Totemo yummy desu yo!
author: David P.

description:
My niece wants to dress in a kimono for Halloween.  A Japanese girl wanting to dress like a Japanese girl for Halloween, hmmm interesting. 

We go to Japantown to look for a kimono.

After an arduous 45 minutes of shopping, I took the kids here.  I heard all the rave reviews about this place.  The kids got chocolate syrup/whipped cream/ice cream and whip cream/strawberries/ice cream.  The strawberries surprisingly weren't even fresh... although as I'm sitting here writing this review eating strawberries on sale from Safeway, I now know it must not be strawberry season anymore because these are lousy.

I got the egg salad crepe and my bro got the tuna salad crepe.  Word to the wise, don't be a fool and get these kind of crepes -- stick to the dessert ones.

Anyway I tasted the kids' ones and I still didn't see the allure.  I mean it was okay, but not the greatest thing since sliced bread.  I'd give this place maybe 2.5 stars.

Although after a full day of shopping for kimonos, watching SC beat Arizona, playing football on the road, going bike riding, and having a nice dinner with fresh crab and fish, when I asked the kids, "What's the best part of the day?"  They said eating ice cream.

Hmmmm, +1 star for the kids' votes.  Obviously Uncle Bryan has no clue what goes on in the minds of kids these days.
author: Bryan K.

description:
4.5 stars for the delicious "Japanese" crepe with green tea ice cream, red bean paste, and macha sauce.  The crepes here are a work of art- they're cooked to a point where there's a delightful crunchiness on the outer edges but the crepe itself is still soft and flexible enough to be folded around its filling.

We decided to order the "Japanese" crepe because it was different from the usual Nutella/fruit crepe I usually order at other creperies.  The contrast in texture and temperature between the cold, creamy ice cream and the warm, slightly crisp crepe made for a great dessert.  The green tea ice cream and red bean paste combo is delicious- that filling itself is worth the wait time in line.

I'd definitely be back if I were in Japantown again- Sophie's fresh crepes are always going to be on my hit list.
author: Angela H.

description:
Great place to satisfy a craving for a crepe filled with cheese, ham, and pineapple. Otherwise, their crepes are sometimes a little bland for me--tastiness notwithstanding.

Oh, and I thought it was cool to note that they got 100 pts (out of 100) on their last health inspection. Immaculate!!!
author: Richie K.

description: highly recommend the japanese crepe: green tea gelato, red bean paste, matcha sauce. don't get the whipped cream...makes it way too sweet.
author: Fawn L.

description: There's one thing I've always loved at Japantown, and thats Sophie's Crepes. Oh boy they are tasty. Prices are reasonable and there's a vast selection of crepes to choose from. My favorites are the Banana & Nutella and the Cinnamon & Sugar. One thing that does suck is the line. I swear I waited 20 minutes for my crepe last time.
author: Michael W.

description:
The first place I had ever had a crepe was here.  I used to come to jtown a lot when i was a teen. 

since this was my first crepe place, i expect them to be hot and crunchy you know? not like crepevine, where it comes on a plate all soggy..blah.

*REMEMBER: the line is INSIDE.  if you stand behind the people outside that look like theyre in a line, youll be waiting for hours.  Theyre just watching the crepe chef make crepes.  I can watch him for forever.  Perfect every time.  

yelp is starting to feel like my daily diary of where i went.
author: kim w.

description:
Hm, I think they have the perfect formula to making crepes here.

1) Have a super kawaii, Asian girl up at the cash register with a warm smile to take down your customized order

2) Friendly and fast pace Latino servers, who make your order with a sweet touch to their smile, after a hard earned job.

3) Make sure to be able to offer to your customers custom options (did I mention that already)?

When all is said and done, you get Sophie's Crepes in the picture. We came from this place right after Mifune. I ordered my custom treat that consisted of: nutella, vanilla bean ice cream, and chocolate. It was delicious, which perfectly made up for the mediocre dinner. But why 3 stars, instead of the intended 4 after giving such a spectacular view.

One sign that said (I'm typing this down from memory) something along the lines of : "All cameras are banned during the process of Crepe making..." Now correct me if I'm wrong, but I see the guys handling my food and there's usually plenty of customers to see them handling the ingredients as well. But why no cameras? Are the employees camera shy? You don't want your crepe recipe to be exploited? O_o? 

Kind of weird but other than that a great place to go to enjoy good crepes, if dessert is your thing.
author: Ryan M.

description: mmmmm the strawberry nutella crepe with green tea ice cream is to die for! Wanted to share with my husband but he insisted we get our own, and he couldn't have been more correct (For the first time in our marriage) even though these servings may look like enough to share, they will leave you wanting more!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Sophie, you're a naughty, naughty girl. And it takes one to know one if you catch my drift...I want to lick gelato off of you, Sophie. I want to smother you in chocolate syrup, wrap you up in crepey goodness, and go at it. Put some strawberries on that while you're at it, too, girl. Mmm-mmm-mmm. That's what I call a good time. 

Sophie's is hot and cheap (in the good way) but she's not naughty enough to let you take pics. Seriously- there's a sign specifically stating that no pictures can be taken. Now that's what I call class.

**Not just for dessert lovers, Sophie'll make you a sinful savory snack too!
author: Autumn K.

description:
The crepe is decent but waiting 40 minutes for it is not.

I also got the strawberry + ice cream + chocolate syrup crepe. Tasty but rather normal. I do, however, appreciate the chewy texture with crispy edges.

Perhaps part of the reason why so many reviews give so many stars is that this is THE date place in SF. Couples galore!
author: Sabrina L.

description: mmm.... Desserts! Very affordable and only takes cash. Crepes are made fresh right before your eyes. Choose your fillings and then take a number. This place is always buzzing, but a short wait is a price to pay for a made to order dessert crepe.
author: Charlene K.

description: Oh me oh my! What could be better than a crepe filled with strawberries, chocolate and ice cream. Strawberries and nutella! Nothing rekindled childhood memories like nutella and whip cream!
author: Kristina L.

description:
I LOVE this place. 
Whenever I'm in SF, I try to hit this place up. I always get the Green Tea crepe which is always epic but I have gone with family and friends who've tried other kinds and it always gave great results. Place is a bit small and hard to find since it's inside a mall but once you know where you're going, you're in for some great crepes.
author: amy n.

description: Ahhhhhh . . . YES. Delicious, genuinely Japanese-style crepes!!! I love this place!!!! I tend to get the savory crepes such as turkey with cheese and vegetables (complete with Kewpie mayo), but the sweet crepes are a hit, too. Love Japan Town, and this is one of my favorite spots there. Only three little tables here; this is mostly a takeout or stand-up place. There are some benches etc just outside the shop, in the interior courtyard of the mall, outside Kinokuniya bookstore (also worth a stop!).
author: Kate S.

description: I came here for my cousin to enjoy japantown since she's from LA. This gave me the opportunity to try out Sophie's crepes since they were as good as Genkis. I ordered the nutella with fruits. I waited about 10minutes for my crepes since the place gets packed. When I was called to pick up my crepe, my impression was that  it was smaller and flat than expected. The taste was pretty good but with the size I expected better. But at least it's worth trying and knowing what the hype is about in these kinds of places. I wish they had more selection and diversity to their crepes but it is still pretty good to try. =)
author: Sharjah M.

description: Yum! This is one of my favorite places to get crepes.  I usually stick to the strawberries and bananas one with the nutella and vanilla gelato because that one has been good to me.  The savory crepes are not bad either.  The only bad thing is the gelato will melt and get all over you through the bottom, if you are not careful... (that's knowledge from experience, haha) so be sure to get lots of napkins.
author: Kymberli C.

description:
Smells. Like. Heaven. Up. In. Here.

Generally, I'm not a huge fan of crepes, so I might not be the right girl to dish on this spot. But I'm gonna anyway... They've got an impressive selection of ice cream and their dessert crepes are really yummy. The savory crepes, which I feel like aren't their specialty anyway, are definitely worth skipping. I had the "california crepe", which was crab, avocado, and veggies with "oriental dressing" on it. But... duh duh duhhh... the oriental dressing was actually a TON of miso mayo-y stuff and it made me feel gross, but I ate it because it was starving. Miso misunderstanding? I hate mayo.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
This is my favorite place to get crepes.  I haven't found another place that does it quite like Sophie's.

The crepes are expertly made in front of you and they do not skimp on the fillings.
author: Christy P.

description:
YUM TO THE MAX!

haven't been here in a while, but i loved their crepes every single time i had one.

both their dessert and ..i guess "salty"(forgot what they were called) crepes are delicious.
i recommend getting something with nutella.

avocado turkey crepe is my favorite and to die for. if you LOVE avocado like me :D
i usually had that for lunch. but for dessert i tried a couple things and i just recommend everything.. even though i didn't try everything yet :P

it's cool how you can watch how they make it through the windows. they're so good at it too. there's usually a line, but be patient, because once you get your order and bite into that thing, you'll think it was all worth it.
author: Sachiko K.

description: I've been to Jtown hundreds of times but today was my first time having a crepe at Sophie's. I always see a line outside so I didn't think it'd disappoint and it didn't. I got a crepe with strawberries, whipped cream and vanilla ice cream, it was delicious! The strawberries were really fresh and sweet tasting. The long lines are kinda annoying, but if you're with someone it's not as bad. It's easy to order too since they have a picture menu at the counter so you can just point to the one you want.
author: Queena T.

description:
I like the fact that they roll these up like a burrito so that it's easy to eat on the go... But if you come here, stick to the sweet crepes... The savory crepes are not good... 

I got the turkey, cheese, avocado and veggie crepe... Everything was good except the turkey. They use the really poor quality fake sliced sandwich meat, which is mostly rib meat. It's disgusting to say the least. 

The sweet crepes look decent... But that's it...
author: Jen D.

description: Only giving 3 because I can't go any higher or lower until I try the crepes. I had the mango gelato and that was good. Located in Japantown with a bunch of neighboring establishments- perfect if you want to go for a good stroll around the area. Friendly staff.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Sophie's makes crepes better than Crepes-a-go-go but not the best crepes in the world. The edges of the crepe were crispy but I like my crepe chewy. I got the Japanese crepe (#17) which had green tea ice cream, red bean, and green tea sauce inside. It was pretty good and I thought they put a lot of ice cream inside for $4.70. A lil bit pricey. 

In Tokyo, for 500 yen you get a bigger crepe with cheese cake, ice cream, whipped cream, and fruit. This is not Tokyo but it would be nice if Sophie's would pick up some new recipes from Tokyo crepe shops.
author: becky s.

description:
Most delicious place in Japantown.

There's usually a line on Fri and Sat night, but it's worth the wait. There's something about the batter and technique that makes these the perfect ice-cream cone.

Highly recommend the "Japanese" dessert crepe (green tea gelato and red bean), but other combinations are just as tasty.
author: Mike L.

description: I usually go to Genki's Crepes when I'm in the city near Japantown, but a friend brought us here for a late night dessert. It's pretty busy around night time and the place only takes cash, which was a bummer, but the crepes are delish! I ordered the Japanese crepe which has green tea ice cream, azuki red bean paste, and sauce. I love green tea and anything flavored green tea, so obviously this crepe was perfect to my taste! The best part was that it wasn't too sweet and the crepe literally tasted of matcha green tea from top to bottom. Mmmm Mmmm Mmmm. My kind of dessert.
author: Hannah L.

description:
Sweet, yummy, luscious crepes before your very eyes! Always a treat (and a temptation!) when in Japantown, it's a great deal with fast and friendly service. If you end up in line, you get to watch them pour the batter and work their magic as they create the ultimate savory or sweet crepe. Filled with gelato or with ham/cheese, a sure treat!
A little on the pricey side, but a wonderful dessert treat. I prefer it over Genki Crepes on Clement, just because their Gelato is better...
author: M'ia K.

description: I wanted something sweet while dilly dallying in Japantown and as a result, my friend suggested Sophie's Crepes. I was still full from lunch and couldn't bear the idea of stuffing a whole crepe into my body so I opted for the gelato. I had the pistachio gelato and was a little disappointed. The creaminess that is expected from gelato wasn't truly there. However, there were pieces of pistachio in it which made it tasty. The next time I'm in Japantown I'll probably try a crepe but I won't order another gelato. I rather go elsewhere for ice creams/gelatos. There's so much better places around the city for that.
author: Anna K.

description: Crispy crepe in a cone! I definitely prefer these to the soft crepes on a plate and these are much easier to eat.  I always get nutella with banana.
author: Annie c.

description: This is by far the best crepe making place in the area. The crepes are always warm and soft and everything just tastes soooo good. I tried Genki's the other night and it didn't compare to this. Even as I'm writing this review right now...my mouth is watering for a strawberry, banana, nutella and whipped cream crepe. Sophie's is definitely the best.
author: Tina T.

description:
No matter how full I am after dinner, I can always make room for a strawberry and nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream from Sophie's.  

And I love that smell of crepe batter that you get a big whiff of once you enter the Kinokuniya building.  How can you resist not eating a crepe from Sophie's when you smell that??  Mmmmmm...
author: Diane L.

description:
Sophie's Crepes reminds me of the "ke li bings" I would get in Taiwan. Crisp with savory OR sweet fillings, unlike the Bretagne versions you get at Ti Couz. 

I've brought many a friend to Sophies, and hands down, you have to get #17, the Japanese crepe with red bean, green tea gelato, and maacha sauce. It is EXCELLENT! You're in Japantown for goodness sakes. Gotta try what is 'authentic'. I've tried the tuna (got a terrible tummy ache after that one), and kiwi mixed fruit w/ vanilla. They pale in comparison to #17. Seriously, it's that good.
author: Cindy W.

description:
There are two crepe places inside J-town mall, and this is the better one.  I agree --  Ino sushi, then here for a sweet crepe (only).  Won't blow you away but good stuff nonetheless.  How can you go wrong with nutella + fruit #14?
mixed fruit -- banana strawberry kimi 5.25 or +1 for ice cream
author: Rob C.

description: This place is awesome! All of the crepes are tasty and the staff is polite. It is also nice because it is still open even when most if the Japantown mall is closed. I know that the strawberry and whipped cream, the japanese, Nutella and vanilla ice cream, and the chocolate and whipped cream crepes are delicious. I highly recommend trying the Japanese crepe if you enjoy Japanese-style desserts. Every time I am in SF I make sure to stop by!
author: T B.

description:
I must have waited in line to get my food for 30+ minutes! I thought I was waiting in line to get on a ride at Disneyland or something. My friend was literally falling asleep waiting for me to get his crepe. They really need more than one worker putting the ingredients onto the crepe.

Other than the long wait, the crepe was pretty good. I'm not that big of a fan of dessert crepes. I'm more of a savory crepe person and I think this place is only good for their dessert crepes. (I'm not sure, I've only tried the strawberry, vanilla gelato with chocolate).

I did enjoy my crepe but I guess the long wait kind of anticipated the crepe to taste SUPER DUPER good when it was just above average.
author: Peter N.

description:
I haven't ate their wonderful crepes in a while.
Now that I work in SF, I've had a few attempts on going, but they were all unsuccessful. I don't get why they're not open at 2 PM! 

Other than my unsuccessful journey to get the crepes, the delicious and cavity assuring sweetness is definitely an soothing taste to enjoy. 

Guess I'll keep my mouth watering till my mission is complete!
author: R T.

description: Favorite crepe place! :) I've been coming here since I was little because my parents used to always bring me and my brother here when we visited the city. Their crepes are by far the BIGGEST I've ever had. It comes in a cone shape so it's easy to eat while roaming around the shopping plaza. Crepe places in Fremont just can't compare. I always order the strawberries and ice cream crepe. Just thinking about it makes me drool!
author: Monica L.

description: Although we waited about an hour I would say it's worth the wait. I ordered the mix fruit with nutella and added vanilla ice cream. I think this was the best crepe I have eaten yet. The crepe was the perfect texture and flavoring : Not too soft, not too hard and not too sweet. They are very organized there and have a very efficient system in taking orders and preparing the crepes. Keep up the great team work guys. It definitely shows and your crepes are just wonderful!
author: akemi a.

description:
I haven't been to the Japan plaza since I was in High School, which has been more than 8 or 9 years and this place has aged since I was last here. This place seemed cooler when I was a little asian boy from Arizona and visiting and learning about Asian culture, but now that I moved here this place just seems old and the place smelled like bleach. After some dinner in SOMA we ended up here for some dessert.  If you come to a place named "Sophie's Crepes" you might want to order a crepe, but I was so full from dinner I didn't want to order more carbs. 

So instead I ordered the Japan Town Sundae which was green tea gelato and some red beans with whip cream. It was decadent and delicious and it almost made me forget how full I was. I almost wanted to order another one but my abs wouldn't appreciate that very much. 

One more thing - cash only.
author: James T.

description: #17 Japanese crepe is my favorite.  The red bean paste and green tea ice cream blend together very well.  The store pays a lot of attention to hygiene - 98 /100 on the city restaurant inspection score card.
author: Alan P.

description: Yummy crepes in Japantown center on the second floor by Kinokuniya. Usually a little bit of a wait but I got in on Saturday for a quick bite before my hair cut appointment. The have both sweet and savory crepes. Nutella is always amazing on sweet end. I had the savory with crab last time, that was a bit too cold and mayo-y but I think that might have been selection error. Great stop if you want crepes or bite.
author: Aki N.

description:
I discovered this place when I saw a line of people wrapped around the doors outside of this place. I figured it must be good, so I got in line. I'm so glad I did because after waiting in line my crepe ended up being the best crepe I've ever had!

They make the crepe sort of like an ice cream cone & you can add ice cream if you like. I had the strawberry, banana & nutella crepe with ice cream. It's sooo yummy!
author: Krystel M.

description:
Nice place to visit after a meal not only from somewhere in J-Town but anywhere really! Who doesn't like nutella, fruit, ice cream and whipped cream in their crepes?? Sophie's crepes are made with a sweet batter, yay!

You can sit inside the small restaurant or, like I and many other patrons do, take a seat outside, inside the mall on a wooden bench, enjoy your crepe and people watch.
author: Christine C.

description:
Dessert crepes at Sophie's Crepes. - YUMMY !! 
I have the strawberry with whipped cream and the crepe is perfect. The ordering line is fast, but the serve is really slow. We wait for almost 30 mins for our crepe. I realize that there are only one person making the crepes, It will be nice if there are more than one person making it, so the customers don't have to wait for so long.

Next time I want to try the green tea ice-cream with crepe. it sounds good. !!!
author: Isabelle L.

description:
My favorite is the "Japanese" crepe. Green tea ice cream, red bean, and green tea matcha. 

You must get the ice cream in your crepe--it's the best part!

About $6 a crepe... kinda pricey, but worth it if you get it once in a while :)
author: Joyce L.

description:
I adore Japanese crepes and this place does a pretty decent job.  It's not gourmet stuff, but it definitely hits the spot when you want a hearty snack while wandering Japantown.

My top two favorite crepes at Sophies: the California Crepe (I always ask for extra sauce because I love creamy) and the Japanese Crepe (the sauces they put on the green tea ice cream contribute so much to the crepe).  There are a couple other places in Japan Center that sell crepes, but I think Sophie's uses the best batter and the freshest ingredients.
author: Diana Y.

description:
Oh my god delicious. I wish the one in North Beach would have never closed or I would be there every night!

and weigh 300 lbs!

Best crepes EVER!
author: Derek B.

description:
Sophie is the Mr. Wizard of scientific crepe construction.  The green tea and red bean crepe keeps bringing me back to Japantown despite my loathing of anime, sailor suits, and pocari sweat.

I've tried ordering green tea/red bean (GTRB alliance?) crepes elsewhere and they end up a soggy mess with clumps of red bean floating in melted ice cream.  Sophie's GTRB crepe is perfectly constructed:
- hot outer leathery crepe
- an insulating layer of red bean paste
- an inner scoop of green tea ice cream which remains cold
- followed by a drizzle of green tea syrup which remains frozen and crunchy.

So, in biting down on a GTRB crepe you get four textures and temperatures, which manage to remain distinct thanks to some crepe Samurai who perished in the Edo period.
author: Dave S.

description:
Seriously, anyone want to explain why is crepes so expensive? Other than it's profitable and people are willing to pay for it. And it taste good! Decent selection on the menu and expect to wait a little since the place usually has a line. I guess its great that you can walk around the mall while snacking on it. 

Forgot to mention, this isnt a sit down and eat w/ fork and knife place. Also cash only.
author: Derrick L.

description: Great crepes - love the nutella.  I can't comment on the ice cream because I always get the crepes.  There is always a line and a crowd - relatively clear signs it's good.
author: B. Y.

description: came during cherry blossom festival so of course the line was out the door! waited about an hour or so. was entertained by the dumb coworkers and the people in line. there was this one coworker who would just stand there and look. clean the already clean counter top, scoop ice cream back into the ice cream container. real useless man, i swear. there were two other guys and one girl and the girl was doing all the work. guys useless! then in front of me there were these two little middle school girls, complaining how long they waited and that their parents gonna get mad how long its taking them. and how they could have done homework instead. haha. and since this is a real small place, they werent getting enough oxygen, all the carbon dioxide. so they squat and got low to breathe all our farts. hahaha! i admit i farted in their face. anyways, after an hour of waiting, got the crepe with nutella strawberry vanilla ice cream and whip cream. mm it was good. also had the lychee gelato crepe. the lychee tasted pretty darn lychee-y. it was good. i dunno what the craze is about. i thought it was whatever. maybe i dont see the crepey goodness out of it. who knows. its pretty pricey too. dunno if worth the wait though. maybe come back on a nonbusy japanese day.
author: Matthew G.

description: So simple, yet so good.  The green tea gelatto with red bean paste was pretty unique and tasty (#17)!  The turkey and avocado crepe was pretty good too.
author: Tim G.

description:
Sophie's has a good selection of combinations and fillings, with large portions, but management expects quantity to make up for a lack in general quality.  The crepes themselves are always overcooked; so much so, that they 're brittle.   

I had put up with it because the Japantown store used to be the only place in the city that served Japanese style crepes, so when I was feeling very "natsukashii," this is the place I would hit up.  But with all of the crepe joints popping up everywhere, I don't see the point.
author: l s.

description: I love this place! I always get the banana nutella with whip cream crepe and it is delish! I also tried adding the hazelnut gelato and boy, it added a nice kick. Even when they get crazy busy, the wait is not as bad. I get cravings sometimes for crepes and would drive there 8:00 at night just to get my fix. :)
author: Kim V.

description: Sophie's has a really good chicken salad crepe.. egg salad was gross.  Genki on Clement definitely has the BEST DESSERT CREPES, with ice cream included, unlike at Sophie's.  Sophie's dessert crepes suck.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Good ice creams! If you are into Asian flavor ice creams, you have come to the right place. They have green tea ice cream, black sesame ice cream. all very good. 

My personal favorite is the red bean paste green tea ice cream wrapped in crepe. 

Although their crepe is that unique, they do have good quality ice creams and that's what makes me go back again and again, despite their lousy service.
author: Niu N.

description:
What is it about Japanese crepe shops being run by eccentric bordering on Soup Nazi like personalities?  (See Crepe-To-Go in West Los Angeles).

Found myself in Japan center over the weekend and the 3 deep crowd outside this creperie told me that I definitely needed to check this out.  Walked in and just like my favorite joint in LA, signs abound.  "NO PHOTOGRAPHY".  "NO TICKET NO CREPE".  "NO SUBSTITUTIONS".  You'd think the proprietors grew up doing business only with a leper colony or something.

Taking a glance around, the place offered your standard variety of sweet and savory crepes with toppings ranging from hams, mixed berries, and of course, nutella.  The twist however was that the crepes could also be served a little bit crisper than normal, rolled up into an approximation of a waffle cone, and stuffed with ice cream or sorbet, along with a wide mixture of fruits and other toppings.

Got myself a crepe cone with nutella, fresh strawberries, and vanilla ice cream.  Damn. Freaking.  Good.  Totally worth the chocolate stains on my shirt.  And Jeans.  And um, my face.  Whatevers, one must sacrifice for good food at times.

Wouldn't hesitate to recommend to a friend.  However, leave the cameras outside.  I hear if you try to snap a picture ninjas descend from the ceiling and eviscerate you.
author: James N.

description:
This place makes crepes the way that they are supposed to be made. 
I've been here several times for several years. This is my "go to" crepe place.
Everything that you order is delicious, and huge for the price.
The lines can get a little crazy, but they are worth the wait!
author: Rosie M.

description: Sophie Crepes MUST be GOOD because everyone loves staring outside of the store's window with their mouth drooling!
author: Carol Y.

description: Lines, they have them. More lines, they have them. Long waits, they have them too. 30 - 60 minute wait, they have them too. Sophie's crepes is a Japantown famous institution located in the heart of the mall next to Izumiya. If you are looking for a great dessert crepe, this is the place to get them. Warning, if there are 20 numbers ahead of you, the wait can be almost an hour! So be aware, but if you are patient, go for it. They use the freshest fruits and their ice cream and gelato are a great addition to these perfected crepes. Each crepe is nicely crafted and great price too. By the way, there is a special Sophie's crepe special menu which is next to the cashier which highlights the best crepes that is not even listed on the menu above. Go for these specials because they are gooood. One star knocked off for the extremely slow service and long lines. Everything else is nice and worth your dollars.
author: Danster L.

description: I've never tried any of the savory varieties on the menu, but I often have their dessert crepes with whipped cream, fruit and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  The ice cream pulls apart like a good gelato.  Simply yummy!  The crepes are thin and chewy but crispy on the edges.  Good Italian soda floats and root beer floats too.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
I don't care that it cost me $6 for a crepe. It was a good crepe.

If you sit away from the shop, people will walk by and stare at your delicious treat. Or ask you where they can get one. How's that for first impressions? 

I always get a #E when I come here. Scoop of ice-cream with strawberries and chocolate. It's an adventure just to try and find the strawberries, but you also get to enjoy munching on the crepe while trying to do it.

We've tried the other crepe place in the Japantown Malls but it just wasn't as good.
author: Cynthia A.

description:
1 star for serving yummy dessert crepes.
1 star for serving savory crepes as well!
1 star for having gelato.
1 star for being close to my apartment.

Still this place is overpriced! 7+ dollars for one desert crepe to go?! Are you kidding me.  Genki or The Sweet House [on Balboa in the Outer Richmond] serves desert crepes for much cheaper, much much cheaper! So if you are looking for a reasonable price look try my other recommendations! You won't be disappointed!
author: Kat R.

description: Yum their crepes are so good here.  They come out slightly crispy and when you order one of their sweet crepes that come with the warm outer crepe and cold ice cream in the middle it's so damn good.  I think my favorite is getting the crepe with nutella, banana and lychee ice cream.  YUM!
author: V J.

description:
This is where I first discovered Japanese crepes. Much more fun than the French ones since I can hold it with my hands.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
Dear Sophie,

Your crepes are amazing. I love the soft but crispy crepe with nutella and strawberries. Your Japanese special with green tea gelato and red bean paste is simply divine and I would have it every day of my life if I can. While I usually frown upon cash-only establishments, for you dear Sophie, I've turned a blind eye. Your crepes are so fantastic that "me on crack" is an understatement of how I feel after snarfing one down. I would gladly dropkick, headbutt and karate someone down if they prevent me from having one. One little suggestion though, perhaps you can consider hiring more help since the line gets so busy on weekends? 

Hugs and Kisses,
Erika I.
author: Erika I.

description:
DE RI SHUZ 
delicious.
if ur a tourist, this is a must

i always get the crepe with bananas strawberry green tea ice cream and nutella. 

legit.
author: Cindy L.

description:
What can I say... crepes have never been so cool.

I'm always sure to get a strawberry/nutella crepe with ice cream. The crepe itself is light, crispy, and delightful. It'll definitely out do any waffle cone. They make it fresh in front of you near this big window and is a great crowd pleaser. 

The only downside is that the service is a little off sometimes. They can get backed up so bad, that you might have to wait 20-30mins for your crepe order. This can totally deter some people, but i find its worth the wait. That and the menu is a little all over the place. There are these blackboards above the counters, some picture menu sheets on the counter, and plastic food displays in the window, but nothing is really well organized and in one place. 

But it doesn't bother me much and only means people should take a closer look at their surroundings. Chill out and enjoy the culture with a French classic... how much more Japanese can you get?
author: Danielle D.

description:
I'm going to learn just enough Japanese to confirm my suspicions that "red bean paste" sounds much more lyrical and appetizing in the original, cos there's no way anything that delicious and sweet in a sundae should have a name that sickly-sounding. 

Tasty as hell. But sounds like something I would use as a homemade replacement for spackle.

Now if they start serving red bean spackle, then I'm changing my five-star rating...
author: Brock D.

description:
I'm not an expert when it comes to crepes, but I must say, I'll have to base all other crepes against Sophie's. The crepe I ate (hey that rhymed!) was the mixed fruit crepe. It was deliciously stuffed with kiwi fruit, strawberries, bananas, and topped off with whipped cream. While I'd like to have more fruit in my crepe, there seemed to be a good balance between the tangy kiwi and strawberry with the sweeter bananas and whipped cream.

If you're looking for a light snack, try their crepes. While they can be a little pricey for the amount of "stuff" you get in them, I went away satisfied and not too full.
author: K. F.

description:
This is the only reason I go to Japantown! I brought 2 groups of friends here while they were visiting in the city. Very cute place to grab dessert. A bit overpriced (a small strip of whipped cream was another dollar more) but Im a fan of #17 the Japanese dessert. 

I havent tried any of the salty crepes, only the sweet ones, the gelato is really good. 

It does drip if you dont eat it fast enough. So minus a star for that because im a fast eater. And it does get crowded so hurry up and order first!
author: Amy S.

description: Another crepe place in this mall was closed already, so we came here instead. I suppose I'm being a bit picky, but I really didn't see how their crepes are all that. The crepe itself was tough and crunchy, and almost tasted like whole wheat?? Weird, but it was still alright. The 3 stars are for their gelato. They had red bean, sesame, and a bunch of other uncommon flavors. I love pistachio ice cream, so I got their pistachio gelato instead of a crepe. Well, I tried to share my boyfriends crepe and my gelato, but he ended up eating more than half of mine. I guess I found his new favorite flavor, haha. If I ever come back, I'll be sure to try some nutella and fruit inside my crepe, or even the gelato itself inside.
author: Katie P.

description: A very good crepe place in Japantown near Kinokuniya book store.  Only issue is that I usually eat a full meal at J-town and don't have room for a crepe.
author: トモ T.

description:
its crispy
its tasty
so many choices
deep inside jtown mall
the japanese kids
they kinda freak me out
but i'll be back for more
author: Henry W.

description:
After grabbing dinner, Sophie's Crepes is a must.  It's the perfect topping to a night in Japantown.

Hook me up with something as simple as the ice cream & whip cream crepe and I'm good to go.
author: Ruben P.

description: I've tried other crepe places in Japan Town, but it's just not the same. The mandarin orange crepe with vanilla ice cream hits the spot every time.
author: Tina C.

description:
I'll sum up all 200+ reviews in three words: BEST CREPES YUM!

My recommendation: mixed fruit crepe with vanilla ice cream

Other tips: they don't take cash, don't take pictures of the store or they get mad at you, and all the surrounding stores are keen on not letting you in until you finish your crepe
author: Reid Y.

description: A year ago I would've given Sophies 5 stars, but after visiting today I was really disappointed. Their crepes used to be crunchy, the fillings generous, and quality of ingredients excellent. but I guess the capitalist mindset has taken over, and Sophie's decided to compromise the product to make more money. Obviously this was a good business move, because they're still making bank, but unfortunate for the consumers like me. Today I spent $13 and waited half an hour for two crepes with half a scoop of ice cream in each of them, no strawberries in a mixed fruit crepe, and stale red bean paste in the japanese crepe. Sorry Sophie's, you're just not worth the wait or the price anymore.
author: Kortney E.

description:
If you haven't had a crepe at Sophie's Crepe yet, you haven't had the full Jtown experience. 

My newest craving is their Japanese crepe. What the hell is that? Green Tea gelato with red bean paste, and Macho, which is a solid chocolate sauce.

Total yum.  Get a crepe, and eat it outside the store like everyone else so you can be a groupie!
author: Wilson L.

description:
This place is good for a quick dinner if you need to hop over to the Fillmore for a show. I had the ham, cheese, and veggie crepe, without mayo. For some reason mayo seemed weird to me in a crepe.

I needed more when I was done, so I shared a butter and cinnamon sugar crepe with my dining companion. It was tasty, but it could have used a lot more butter. Other crepe places usually make their crepes more juicy and it was pretty dry. Oh well, I enjoyed it and it hit the spot.
author: Emily M.

description:
Oh right, this place is cash only and I just spent all my cash at Kino.

But they have an ATM!  So thoughtful to all us spoiled credit card holders.

Oh dear god, a $2.50 surcharge?!  Shit.  I forgot about that!  I don't want to pay two fifty.  But, but...the smell of crepes, wafting through the air...  Goddamn it, that was almost two bus rides I just wasted right there!  But oh daaaaaamn is this a good ice creme crepe!

I come here almost every time I take a trip to Kino.  It's a ritual now, but for some reason I always forget about that damn surcharge until it's too late.  Ah, well.  You'll notice it still gets five stars.
author: Kelly V.

description:
Edit 12/30/07: I'm demoting Sophie's from 4 to 2 stars because, after a tasting last night, it's clear that they're not using the cream that they used to in their crepes.  Whatever they are putting in now tastes like Cool Whip.

*****************

Ok, these aren't authentic French crepes -- they're better!  Well, better than your average French crepe, bought here or in France.

Whenever I've been here, they're always making the crepes fresh.  Never seen them reheat anything, unlike some places.  (I'm looking at you, Crepes-A-Go-Go.)

The crepes are somehow made to be a little lighter and crispier than a normal crepe.  It's not orthodox, but who cares?  The crispy crepe is an excellent complement to the fresh ingredients and sweetened creme.

Asian crepes at their finest!
author: Daniel S.

description:
I am not much into sweet, but Sophie's Screpes still have something to offer--  The "California"   Basically it's like eating a california roll wrapped from crepe instead of rice, (Fake Crabs with Japanese Mayo, Avacado, Veggie) and it is tastes sooo good with the fresh avacado and veggie!  Some places really overcook their crepes, but not here, Sophie's crepes are always cripsy, creamy, yet thin enough to taste what's inside.

I know the Gelato ice cream is great, but nothing stands out as much as the "California".

If sweet icecream crepe isn't your thing, give "California" crepe a try, I been craving for it ever since.
author: Wei H.

description:
This place is really close to a 5 star place if it had better crowd control, but with the quality of their dessert crepes and fast service, it gets the full 4 stars!

I love fresh fruits with healthier tasting ice creams, so this is a definite treat whenever I visit Japantown.  The crepes are absolutely delicious with it's crispy and smooth texture.  You can already smell chocolate and vanilla coming from the shop as you're walking in.  Other smells such as fresh fruits and Nutella would excite anyone's senses.  If you plan to spoil yourself or a friend, this would be a great place to visit.

Not too pricey and I would recommend any of the dessert crepes.  They come in paper cones on the outside to prevent any messes.  I'd love to try the savory (meal-type) crepes when I get the chance.  Stop by and try Sophie's Crepes!
author: Anne N.

description: For me, the crepes were pretty typical of any other place. There's another crepe place downstairs from this, that makes cute animal designs with your crepe toppings, but anyways, Sophie's doesn't disappoint. Fresh stuff all the time, and friendly, quick service.
author: Janice W.

description:
We took a break from shopping around J-town at Sophie's Crepes.  It was packed so went to see what the fuzz was about.  

We ended up ordering a "Japanese" crepe (really!  that was the name of the crepe!) which was filled with Green Tea gelato (I think it was just regular ice cream, but still yum!), red bean paste and a green tea matcha sauce.  

The crepe was a great snack and quite filling for two.  dunno the cost, but it seemed that both sweet and salty crepes were popular as customers seemed to be munching down on both types.
author: Ella B.

description:
I've had some bad crepes in my life. Enough to turn me away from them altogether, but then I met this boy who promised me that he would change my perspective on them. 

*YUP i fell for a boy and his words of this oh em gee worthy crepe*

He takes me all the way to Japantown and introduces me to Sophie's Crepes, at first I was thinking wow this is kinda steep for just one crepe but for being pricey it has to be good right?
Yeah I was right.
One bite into my strawberry and banana crepe I went into a straight foodgasm. Bite after bite, smile after smile, moan after moan ---haha there was no moaning here :) . But everything in that crepe was delicious. The crepe itself it was crisp full of flavor not soggy and was HUGE. The filling had fresh tasty fruits my all time favorite WHIP CREAM...and to top it off I get a lil surprise in there...I GET ICE CREAM! (now if you all have read my recent yelps i'm a total fan of ice cream) 

Sophie's made my day.
but it also is the only crepe I will ever eat...and it's in japantown.
author: Cristelle J.

description:
I visited sophie's crepes when it first opened.  A month ago, I came back again and let's say they have improved with age.  Their fruits are fresher, service faster and friendlier and I HEART NUTELLA!!  Put that together with strawberries and YUUUUUUMMMM... Whenever I'm in Japantown, I consciously eat less so that I leave the restaurant not full so that I can cram down a Sophie's crepe.. hm... 

The crepe is warm, the ice cream cold, the strawberries sweet, and when you bite into them, it's all gooey and warm and cold at the same time.  Just too good to say no to.
author: AhLin C.

description:
Standard procedure = Ino Sushi and a Japanese style crepe in the next door mall.

A bit on the pricey side but always a good palate cleaner.  Sophie's is located by the Kinokunya book store.  Always a decent line.  I usually like another place in the mall who does all the work himself, but he was closed.  Sophie's is more of a "business" but it had to do last night.
author: Laurence H.

description:
These are my all-time favorite crepes ever. They are the BEST!  After wandering around Japantown and eating some yummy sushi or ramen, a stop by Sophie's Crepes is a requirement. 

Their crepes are just the perfect mix of crunchy and soft wrapped around delectable treats. (I've never had savory crepes from them). My favorite is banana, nutella, and whipped cream. Oh so good! 

Don't bother with putting ice cream in it. Ice cream is too cold and overpowers the delicate flavor of the crepe itself, in my opinion. I only did it once and I'll never do it again.
author: Angela C.

description:
Having witnessed on many occasions the long lines pouring out this crepe joint, I finally had to try it out.  Ordered the crepe with sesame seed gelato.  The crepe itself was a bit disappointment - overcooked and crunchy, more like a waffle cone but lacking much flavor.  The gelato, however, saved it - airy, not too sweet, and just the right gooey consistency.  Tasted even better mixed with flakes of the crepe, though I nevertheless would have preferred a softer crepe overall - perhaps nearby Belly Good Crepes? 

Service was expedient and down to a science, but seemed a bit rushed.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
Half the fun of going here is watching them make the crepe. You'd think from watching them that it would be the easiest thing on earth to do... and its not.

Bonus points for making the crepes folded in a way that you can take them to go.... a crepe ice cream cone almost. My boyfriend and I ordered a crepe with mixed fruit (strawberry, kiwi and banana) with whipped cream. Minus points for having more whipped cream than fruit or crepe. I love some whipped cream, but WAY too much was on my crepe that we scraped some off.

Overall it was fine, but I would only go here if I was already at the mall... definitely not for a special trip.
author: Sarah M.

description:
I am not from San Francisco, but when I'm in town, Japan Town is a MUST! I have been going to J-Town for over 10 years now whenever I'm in town, and never once tried a crepe. As a matter of fact, during my last visit just a few days ago, my husband, kids, and in-laws wanted to go here for desert after having dinner at Takara. I, of course, wanted frozen yogurt, cuz thats just how I roll. 

 So everyone orders a crepe, and I go over to MoYo's for my froyo! We eat, I finish my froyo, but one of my son's couldn't finish his crepe, so I did, just so I can finally taste this desert, and WOW! Nutella, banana, gelato crepe melted in my mouth! It was so delicious! I couldn't believe I passed this up just to get my everyday froyo!

This will definitely be my #1 desert stop while I'm in San Francisco's Japan Town.

Customer service was good too. I don't understand the "cash only" thing though.
author: C C.

description: Scrumptious!!! Great place to get crepe w/ ice cream. A must try! I enjoy watching them make the crepes...
author: linh d.

description:
Yum!  Strawberry and whipped cream... mmm.... mmmm...... 

I wish this were a restaurant where we could sit down and order.  Then I would have gotten a savory crepe and then a sweet crepe for dessert... that would have been fabulous!  

But still, very gooooood.
author: Vitamin C.

description:
OK, I thought I knew the Kintetsu Mall and the adjacent Kinokuniya Bldg. by heart now, given that I reside within walking distance and visit often. And I MUST have seen or at least passed by Sophie's Crepes a jillion times, given that it's right next door to the Kinokuniya Bookstore, and Froggy + books  = love (or some such equally sappy equation). Anyway, the crepe place just didn't register on my brain radar until I started noticing it in Yelp reviews. Man, people are going positively ga-ga over the place, I thought. Have to check it out!

First off, the address given is HELLA confusing. I've been to the corner of Post and Webster and there's not a trace nor smell of a crepe shop anywhere. I double-checked on Yelp - says Post and Webster. Finally it dawns on me that it must be somewhere INSIDE the mall. So today I finally found it. And my reaction is - what's the big deal?

I walk into what seems to be an ice cream shop, only they also have crepes. Or a crepe shop with ice cream? I order the banana-and-Nutella variety and prepare to wait, anticipating some kind of heavenliness. They give you a little slip of paper with a number on it, and I hear my number called in like two seconds. WTF? Did they just grab a ready-to-consume crepe out of a box? It came in a little triangular cardboard sleeve, and it was... a crepe with sliced banana and Nutella inside. The crepe itself was dry and tasted like paper.

In short - I came. I ate a crepe. I walked away uninspired and wondering what all the fuss was about. And fondly remembering the crepes I bought from a little street corner kiosk when I went to Paris.
author: Froggy V.

description:
4 words: HEAVEN in my mouth! lol

I LOVE THIS PLACE!! EVERY singllllle time I go to JapanTown SF, I HAVE to make a stop here or else I would not be satisfied with my visit. :) I've been going here for the longest time now and every visit always puts a smile to my face. I get mine with strawberries, bananas, whip cream and fudge. There is always a SUPER long line, but you know what that means, if the business is flowing like a fast stream, the products sold there must be BOMB. It definitely is. Make a stop here next time you're in the area!! You won't regret it. Writing this review is making me want some now =)

YUM!!
author: Soumary A.

description:
Dessert crepes don't get any better than this! I always order  #17 (green tea gelato with red bean paste). It's so good I actually haven't ventured to try anything else on the menu. 
Also very quick service even if there's a line out the door!
author: Marina S.

description:
i love you sophie. 
fresh strawberries+vanilla bean gelato+crepe = pure heaven.
author: Helen Y.

description: How can you not leave Japantown without hitting up Sophie's Crepes?  My nutella, strawberry, kiwi & whipped cream crepe always completes my visit.  Watch out because customizing can get pricey & get ridiculous.  They definitely get away with this since its a unique option in this center. Upon this recent visit as I waited in line I noticed that there seems to be a lot of rules posted throughout the shop from the drink cooler to the register to the preparation window.  Funny but somewhat strange to see.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Only have had desert crepes.  

Good:  This place is in the Japan Town Mall so if you are watching a movie or just walking around, it is a nice stop to take, get some ice cream in a crepe.  Also, I tend to run into people here which so far has been good but might be a bad thing for some of you.  Very much a date thing to do.  For your dates who have never had it before, they might think you are sophisticated or what not, but this might all be nonsense I make up to make me feel better about paying $5 for ice cream (which a part of me still translates into 10 jack in the box tacos -- and for those that don't know, those tacos are meatless, they use some soy or tofu meat like substance, but that doesn't mean they are good for you)  

Bad:  I think that Genki in the Richmond (on Clement and like 3rd or 4th Ave) is much better.  Why you ask?  Because their crepes are flakier.  The crepes here tend to be a little too mushy.  But know that I am an not French and have no idea what crepes are suppose to be like.  Also, they put more stuff in them at Gengki, but yes, even at Gengki they could put a little more ice cream/fruit in it.
author: Mark C.

description:
yes! they did it again!!
they put the P in Perfect!
its obvious that there is much hype to this place and if you are in the area do please stop by and try it!
delicious, fresh, fast, friendly. its gotta be sophie's crepe!

the chicken pesto crepe and the strawberry w/ nuetella is always a favorite! i absolutely adore this place!
author: Vicky H.

description:
Banana, fresh strawberry, Nutella and whipped cream crepe, please.

YUUUUUUUUUUUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM.

Crepes are made to order and even when there's a line, it moves pretty quickly.  I never want to share it, but I know I shouldn't be that much of a piggy... I could eat the whole thing without sharing, though.

*OINK*
author: Amy T.

description: we went here late, around 9 or 10 pm on may 25, 2012.  this place is always packed so we tried it finally.  and nope we didn't like it.  the crepes was not good.  it was overcooked.  maybe it just happened that one time, maybe we were just unlucky?  but we will not go back.
author: R F.

description:
Husband mentioned sidewalk crepe vendors when he went to Japan.  Not wanting to make myself ill from ice cream when we had a big dinner tonight I just got a crepe with nutella and bananas, husband got a crepe with whipped cream, bananas, gelato and chocolate.  

WOW.  Just WOW.  They make SOOO much $$ off of these crepes, you know it cost less than $0.50 each but we spent almost $10 on just two.  What an enterprise!  They had the longest line and only could make 2 crepes at a time.  Still tasty, and amazing and I wish there were one of these close to my home.
author: Lily P.

description:
This store is located on the second or third floor of this mall. When you walk in, you see them making the Crepes. It looks soo good, and they have a nice variety of items that you can put into it. Watching them make it is awesomeness! 

This was technically my first time eating Crepes. I really liked it, especially with nuetella and ice cream. Yum Yum!
author: Jimmy H.

description:
I love crepes. I want to be wrapped up in a crepe and covered in Nutrella and strawberries and eat my way out. I don't know why I love them so much. It's just thin little pancakes but it's so delicious. 

I'm a fan of Sophie's in San Fran. I seriously considered the drive from Sacramento to San Fran just to get a Sophie's crepe. 

The gelato crepe was good especially the green tea gelato. But my favorite will also be strawberries with nutrella. 

But I was sad when I went a few weeks ago and it was closed for some reason. :(

Cash only.
author: Linda S.

description:
Yummy & crispy crepes, but a bit expensive if you stray from their pre-selected menu.
This is a fun place to go after a dinner date in Japantown, but I wouldn't drive out of the way for it.

I prefer the mom & pop shop, Belly Good Crepes in the same mall around the corner!
author: Melisser E.

description:
SIMPLY AMAZING AND SINFUL. it's always busy but oh so worth the wait. you can either have a crepe for lunch or for dessert. you can mix and match the fruit(s) of your choice with gelato. treat yourself and have the nutella, hazelnut gelato with strawberries and bananas - all topped off with whipped cream. mmmmmm

unfortunately, it's cash only.
author: marlene m.

description:
I have only been here once, and maybe it was a fluke, but someone else also had a similar experience on a different occasion so i'm going to stick with it. 

After eating countless crepes in japan, I have been on the hunt for a good japanese crepe place here in the states. 

I ordered the strawberry with green tea gelato crepe after hearing about how good this place is. Just like almost all other places i've been to in the bay area, the crepes come out too thick and crunchy. I haaate crunchy crepes. Maybe they're supposed to be crunchy? I dunno, but all the ones i've had in japan were moist and thin so that's what i've been looking for. If anyone knows of a place that has this kind, PLEASE let me know. 

anyhow, the crepe shell was too thick and crunchy and there was just too much stuff inside. It seems like most people like that they are 'generous' with what's inside, but it was hard to eat. The q-cup in dublin made better crepes than the one I got here. 

Like I said, maybe the person who made my crepe was in-training, but reading other reviews, the crepes seem to be crunchy on purpose.
author: Seri T.

description:
A friend of mine has been raving about this place, so we stopped yesterday during a trip to the city.

I was bewildered by all the choices on the menu... My friend chose the Japanese, which she swears by, and I ended up choosing the strawberry and Nutella, two of my favorite things to eat. Watching the guy make the crepe was like watching an artist at work... Very impressed by his skills.

And then I sat down and bit into the crepe... and nearly swooned as the sweet mix of strawberry and chocolate (did I mention that I love chocolate-covered strawberries?) exploded against my taste buds. Not quite orgasmic and not as good as sex, but it's pretty close. Will definitely come again.
author: Albert C.

description:
this place is pretty good...i thikn it is pretty typical, but better than most places that sell crepes.

The only thing i dislike about this place is mainly because it is so far from where i live.  however, i tend to go here whenever i have a break from class at sf state.

the reason why i give 4 stars and not a full 5 is because i think it is a bit expensive.  for the same crepe i can get for about 3 dollars cheaper elsewhere.  but overall it is probably the best crepe place ive been to up in northern california.  better than genki imo.
author: Tony L.

description:
The first time I went to Japantown was, also, the first time I went to Sophie's Crepes.

Their crepes were delicious and well made. The crepe was light and crispy on the edges just like a good crepe should be. I got the mixed fruit which had strawberries, kiwi, bananas, and whipped cream. My friend had the japanese which had green tea gelato, azuki bean paste, and matcha sauce which she seemed to really enjoy.

...After I finished my fruit crepe I was lured in for another one. I was like, this may be the only time I come here so, might as well try a savory one too. The chicken pesto crepe was just calling my name, but sadly it wasn't as good as the sweet. I wasn't a big fan of how there was lots of mayo mixed in with the pesto and the use of butter-like lettuce which I'm not that big a fan of cuz I really like my veggies to have that crunch factor.

Overall, it was really good and hopefully if I ever come back to this part of SF, I'd like to come back to Sophie's for a second visit.
author: Nancy K.

description:
We must've gotten a bad batch cuz the crepe we got tasted and looked just a bit better than cardboard.  Others around us seem to be enjoying their dessert, and most looked better. The mixed fruit and nutella inside mine was fresh and good, but the crepe itself ruined the experience.  

I know we must have gotten a fluke crepe so i'll be back and will update this review appropriately (hopefully)
author: Geoff L.

description:
I only come here if I've run late and Belly Good, in the other end of the mall, is closed. Sophie's is open later, but their service is lackluster and they won't do custom orders (you get what's on the menu or nothing). I'm not sure where they get their ice cream, either, but when Belly Good has Double Rainbow, they win. Plus they've usually got a TV blaring, which annoys me (admittedly there's sometimes a TV in the cafe-courtyard outside Belly Good, but it's usually not loud). 

Wheelchair folks will find it a pain to shove past the lines of people only to not be able to see over the counter, and then you may have trouble finding a table and have to eat out in the courtyard by a bench. (Folks say these crepes are edible as a hand-held food, but this usually leads to ice cream dripping in my lap.)

For great Japanese-style crepes, go to Belly  Good or Genki instead. Sophie's is okay for a late-night sugar fix sometimes, but I'm not impressed.
author: Anne K.

description:
I've gone here three times, and each time, I've found their sweet crepes to be disgusting. There's nothing special they use here, pretty much ingredients you can buy at Safeway: nutella, whip cream, and whatever fruits you desire. Yeah there's the crust, but I thought their crust was just too thin and flaky. It becomes somewhat of a mess if you're eating over your lap.

I know it's affordable and it's not like I expected some fancy crepe for the price, but come on, was it really necessary to fill half my crepe with whip cream? It's like when you order a cold drink and find half the cup is filled with ice. Stingy, maybe? Don't be surprised if the fruits are sour or far from ripe because I doubt they care what color the fruits are before they cut them up. And be warned if you want the fruits that are canned, like mandarin oranges, because you may end up with a lot of juice from the can.
