If you're feeling daring, add a scoop of gelato to your crepe.  The flavors vary from normal ones like vanilla and cookies and cream to more non conventional options like green tea! The wait can be a bit long for them to make the crepes but in my opinion, is well worth it. It's 9am here and this review is making me crave one yet again - except I'm on the other side of the country now :(
author: Nancy S.

description: The Crepes here were good. I love Banana and Nutella as much as the next girl. but they also had added fun like kiwi and mandarins. YUM. The little paper sleeve they put them in is convenient too. I wish more places did that. The prices are a little high for the quality of the crepe itself. They aren't as big as some of the other places I have tried and like most places in this city, they don't take credit cards.
author: Jena D.

description: I work about 2 minutes away from japantown, and i LOVE going to Sophie's to get rid of my sweets craving. It's like an orgasm in your mouth ;D haha.
author: Sara L.

description: i would say its delicious to get an crepe there! i enjoyed mines and there are pretty cute girls there too and the worker (: im down to get another one! (:
author: Johnny L.

description: A crepe-rie. Its okay, and not as good as the other crepe place around the corner. They charge too much for a mediocre crepe.  However if you are hungry and don't really feel like waiting a bit at the other crepe place, then by all means just go here. When you are super hungry, i'm sure you can't tell the difference.
author: Kalvin C.

description: great for breakfast, lunch, dinner and dessert!  Fun, clean and delicious!  Get a "J" it's just a crepe, vanilla ice cream, bananas, chocolate and whipped cream...I think it's their cheapest savory crepe at $4.75 and it's well worth it!
author: Kat D.

description:
Not the best gelato in SF. (That's over in the mission). But the combination of warm crepes and gelato makes this place special. I like the banana, chocolate sauce, gelato thing. I've never had bad service here, but things do look a bit confused at times.  The crepe maestro is twirling the batter, grabbing scoops of gelato to put in orders. People are reaching over and around each other. Maybe that's why there's a window: so you can watch the fun. 

After you eat your crepe you can get your manga fix in the Japanese bookstore next door.
author: Neena S.

description:
I love Sophie's Crepes!

Well, actually, I just love dessert crepes.  HOWEVER, I love watching them make the crepes.  The menu is hard to see and the prices are a LITTLE bit pricey, but food is expensive anyway!

I am a big fan of traditional fruit and chocolate and ice cream in the crepe and that's something Sophie's Crepes is good at.  I love the strawberries in there and I love how you can share one with a friend.  And it's conveniently located in Japantown, where you can grab a crepe right after a meal.

AND, best of all, I love that it's to-go and pick-upable.
author: Connie Z.

description:
so crispy, so fresh and so delish! 

mixed fruit with nutella and vanilla ice cream, hold the kiwi.
author: Stef H.

description: Sophie's Crepes is reason why I even bother walking all the way to Japan  Town. This has to be the best crepes I've ever eaten. While in Japan Town, the whole environment just makes you feel Japanese, so you MIGHT AS WELL GET the most delicious and scrumptious $5.25 Japanese crepe.  Oh baby, this is the perfect mix of deliciousness, packed with green tea gelato, red bean paste, and maccha sauce. OOHHHHH... yes, very yummy. The only thing that bothers me and (no racist) but they don't have legit Japanese people working... in Japan Town. They have Mexicans and Chinese people! I know crepes aren't Japanese, but bleehhh... I guess it's alright since I should judge primarily on the food.
author: Lindsey M.

description:
I love crepes and this is by far the best crepes I have ever had. Whenever I am in San Francisco, I have to stop by here to get a crepe. I love watching them work and getting the fresh crunchy crepe in my hands. 

Favorite savory crepe is the chicken salad and favorite sweet crepe is the strawberry nutella with a scoop of ice cream.  Too bad there is not a place like this in the east or south bay.
author: F. L. C.

description: Japantown Sundae is the BEST. It has all my favorite Asian desserts: green tea ice cream, red bean paste, and macha syrup, in a cup rather than crepe (there's an equivalent crepe if you want that).
author: Joy X.

description: I could have skipped the crepe part and just gone with the ice cream,banana and chocolate syrup.....I just don't like this style of crepe.  The french style crepe, well, that's another story.  My ideal crepe would be the crepe itself, made in the french style, and Sophie's fillings.
author: Bleep S.

description: Best crepes ever!! I love how it's folded so you can carry it around and eat it! I always get the mixed fruit one or the strawberries with nutella and ice cream! The only down side is that they don't accept debit/credit and you have to use the ATM they have if you're not carrying around cash... :(
author: Ami H.

description:
I always get a crepe whenever i go the japantown, but lately ive been so busy that i havent been back for almost a year. So last weekend i decided that it was time to get a crepe, man i couldnt wait! 
I remember the last time i went the owner was making the crepes herself and they were delicious
BUT this time i went and there was this guy who was making it. He broke more than 5 crepes and had to throw them all away. I was so mad because there was a ton of people in line and waiting for the crepes and he just kept messing crepe after crepe. I knew immediately that his problem was that he tried to be all quick and flip the crepe over, when he just poured the batter on, so the crepe was STILL STICKING ONTO THE GRIDDLE! oh cmon dont you understand that you are doing something wrong when 5 crepes in a row  have holes in them?! its because you need to wait for them to harden!
so as he was messing up the crepes, the person who was supposed to fill the crepes obviously had nothing to do and basically the whole store was stalled except for the people who only wanted to get ice cream.
Well i finally got my Mixed fruit and nutella crepe after a good 25 min. The outer edges were crunchy but the middle was still very soft. I think that says that he needs to keep it on the griddle for a little while longer.
I dont know if that day the owner had an appointment or if they actually hired this guy to make crepes long term (HE CAN"T MAKE CREPES!)
i gave sophi'es a three just because i remembered how it used to be before i went there last weekend (or else it would have been a two)
i definitely enjoyed it before but i was really disappointed at how my crepes turned out that day.
author: Lesley T.

description: Definitely one of the many highlights of visiting Japantown was munching on a banana and Nutella crepe. The crepes can be customized and filled with anything your heart desires. Do expect a line at all times, but it is well worth the wait. Better yet, this eatery is inside a mall so you can shop and snack at the same time.
author: Alicia O.

description: Everybody already knows about Sophie and her delicious crepes.  Her tasty pastry folds filled with sweet or savory treats bring all the boys to the yard.  Especially this one.  The only thing with the fruit selection is you need to know when certain fruits are in season or else a bad selection can ruin the whole experience.  You can't go wrong with ice cream, gelato, or any of the various spreads.  So if you are a fatty like me stop by, grab yourself a crepe, and tell your company to buy their own.
author: Luis M.

description: Yay, very good crepes! It's thin, which makes it flakey and light when you start, and not too thick towards the end when it bunches up. The combo w/ whipped cream, bananas, kiwis, strawberries and ice cream was amazingly good for a total of $7! I live across the street, and if it weren't for the fact that eating this everyday would be the first train to obesity, I would!  they're sooo busy but the people there are pros. Quick in their delivery, they have their process on point. Very impressed!
author: Camille T.

description: Best japanese style crepe in the bay area
author: Nat W.

description: I dont usually eat crepes but this place had me wanting to go back.  I had a mixed fruit and vanilla ice cream crepe.  Really good.  There was a line when I went but it couldve been avoided as I ended up standing aimlessly behind people already ordered and were waiting.  Doh!  Definitely interested in trying other combo's here.
author: Jason S.

description: The mixed fruit crepe is the best crepe ever. I love the vanilla ice cream at sophie's. Usually I'm not a fan of vanilla ice cream but the their ice crean is really good. The red bean and green tea gelato was good also.
author: Polly W.

description: *sigh* Looks like Sophie's Crepes are no more....stopped by 7/14/08 and it appeared they were dismantling the joint.
author: MTeresa W.

description:
well, that teaches me a lesson that if some place is on yelp (with major awesome reviews to-boot) then it must be a restaurant or similar sit-down type of food establishment.  um, NO!  

this place is basically a food stand in a mall!!! hello... 

i was looking for dessert shops nearbye tanpopo and this spot came up.  i was pretty sure that i didn't know any crepe restaurant on the corner of webster and post so i figured it was new.  upon walking over there though, i realized that Sophie's was the name of the crepe stand/shop in the japantown mall !!!!  aha!  i remember now.  well, we were already standing at the corner of webster/post right in front of the mall and really wanting a hot nutella / fruit crepe by then anyway, so we just walked upstairs and HOLY COW!  was everybody within the Bay Area waiting in line for a crepe?

there were sooo many people waiting for a crepe that i had to ask the guy how long the wait was.  for a crepe!  geez.  after perusing the 15-odd orders that were in-process, he said about 10-15 minutes which gave us time to make our movie so i said Hit me up with one of those fruit/whipped cream jobbies.  that place is a machine.  pumping those savory and sweet crepes like nobody's business.  amazing.  

made the movie.  got my fill of sweet crepe and fruit and whipped cream.  not bad at all.  mad house to deal with those.  wished i could have ducked into the japanese bookstore next to it while waiting and caught up on my japanese porn but no dice.  bookstore closes at 8pm! :(
author: dan h.

description: Sharing is caring, except when it comes to Sophie's crepes (if you care about me, or for your life, get your own). Don't even THINK about asking me for a bite of the Japantown crepe (filled with green tea gelato and their special matcha sauce which I swear has crack in it - I get it without the red bean or whipped cream). So damn good.
author: Deb I.

description: Another 5 star review. Nutella. Strawberry. Vanilla gelato crepe. This is heaven. Will they franchise some more because I live in the 650 and it's kind of hard to get here. One of the best no-fuss dessert places in the city that leave you thinking, "I need to get another one!"  even after you finished your first crepe. Vanilla gelato doesn't really get better than this.
author: Jessica C.

description:
i like crepes. 

in fact, i had one for breakfast this morning,  but not from sophie's. 

sophie's crepes are tasty, and the only reason i can't give them more stars is because they're always too thick. crepes are supposed to be thin and light, and i don't understand why more places can't get their shit together and get that straight.

sigh.
author: Irene S.

description: This place is always packed.  When I use to live 2 blocks from Jtown I ate one of these everyday.  Today I have 50 strawberry kiwi with ice cream crepes on my back as fat.  Excellent.  I think this place is better than that crepe place on the lower level in jtown.  I forgot the name.  I need to look it up.  This place broke my crepe cherry.  Damn you.  I hope my cherry was sweet.
author: Fatty A.

description: Yeah! Cant lie I've had almost all the crepes on the menu! Love this place. Bring your CASH fool. They dont take Cc. My fave is the ham and cheese crepe! Ummmm I dont know about all the people standing outside with their cameras...... but  definately a great place!
author: Lovecandy G.

description:
it was decent.
inside the japanese peace plaza, so if you happen to be there, and you happen to want crepes, i guess this place is alright.

i prefer Genki's. ten times better. maybe 20.
author: Sharon O.

description:
the crepes are constructed really well. love the gelato - they have black sesame and green tea! wish they were a little more generous with the toppings.

no parking validation here :(
author: B Y.

description:
im not a desert person at all. my idea of desert is a sambvca in a heated snifter. however, IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII,  cant even refuse a nutella and strawberry crepe with vanilla ice cream. 

i swear i was hopping along, down the stairs saying, 'you dont got no ice cream. you dont got no ice cream.'
author: Euge L.

description: This review is long overdue.  I've been going to Sophie's for years--every time I'm in San Francisco.  They have the best crepes I have ever had.  The crepe wrapper is crispy and hot, and the ice cream they use is creamy and flavorful.  They have pretty fast service too, considering that they are usually very busy.  I've been to many crepe places and this is probably one of the cheapest I've found.  Don't be hesitant to try the lunch crepes, because they are delicious too!
author: nancy t.

description: I've been here gazillion times and I can't believe I forgot to write a review for it! Anyhow...I love the gelato crepes here!  I ususally like their Green Tea/Vanilla Beans/Hazelnut crepes! The crepes are pretty big and perfect for after dinner desserts!  I've never tried their "sandwich" crepes before but I'm sure they're all pretty good :)
author: JenJen W.

description: I don't get the acclaim, maybe I got the wrong combination (mandarin orange lychee gelato) but I've definitely had better crepes.
author: C F.

description:
New workers only gave me, like, a teensy bite of caramel gelato in my crepe... Not very happy about that. Still good, but needs more gelato. 

:(
author: Dana F.

description: I LOVE this place.  Nutella, strawberry, and gelato chillin in a crepe.  Life is good!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Whenever I go to japantown, this is the number store I would go to. There is no line and crepes are made fresh and right away! Prices are reasonable and they are very fulling as far as deserts go.
author: Lisa B.

description:
if you go during the weekdays, there won't be that busy.

i normally get the egg salad crepe, and it is delicious~~maybe because i'm a big fun of eggs.
author: Carol X.

description: The lychee and green tea ice creams were also good for my hangover. You can sit here and watch the otaku come over in groups from Kinokuniya.
author: Sandy B.

description:
its probably not common knowledge, but in certain pockets of tokyo, crepes abound in droves and sticky hands. harajuku, point one.

it totally made sense to me that jtown would have a crepe place, but not so to some of my doubting friends. a bite of a crepe with strawberries, whipped cream and nutella would make believers of all. pretty long line and wait for a crepe, but i think its worth it. right next to kinokuniya, so its not like you're bored out of your mind. for me, i liked standing in front of the window eagerly awaiting my order. it may look as though they're not fully filling the crepe, but this is deceiving. It makes it so much easier to eat when the filling slowly drops down as you eat down your crepe. you don't want your crepe to explode all over you when you take a bite. 

far more delicious when shared. i recommend highly.
author: Jade L.

description:
2 words: nutella + strawberries....YUM. add some ice cream and i'm in total food coma

The smell always comes down the stairs while we're waiting to eat ramen at Suzu. I love watching them make the crepes, and although they are a lot to eat at once, it does make a perfect end to a meal in Japantown.
author: Cynthia C.

description: The crepe itself has a nice soft texture and is pretty tasty. The kiwi with nutella was really tasty. The one with strawberry was also tasty. I I wish they just took the credit card instead of having that atm right in their shop. Who likes to get charged for withdrawals?
author: Wesley C.

description:
I recently visited Sophie's for the first time in some five years plus and was surprised that in such a huge time gap that Sophie's had been able to maintain a consistent quality in their food. The skin was still excellent, so crispy, and slightly sweet; ultra thin and pleasantly chewy where the filling had slightly softened the crepes texture; the filling was surprisingly tasty (the California crepe with imitation crab, a mayo-based dressing, avocado and lettuce), as this was my first savory crepe at Sophie's and had only remembered coming to Sophie's for banana or strawberry crepes when I was younger.
However, the years have definitely taken a toll to Sophie's itself--it doesn't look or feel as clean, bright or cheery as it did when it first opened (a sad reflection on my age), and it seems that most people prefer to eat in the courtyard even with indoor seating available.
Prices are still what they used to be, though I've become accustomed to the slightly expensive price tag associated to crepes. I do wish the filling had not been as cold as it turned out to be, but still very good and customer service was above average.
Would come again while in Japantown, though there are a hundred good things to eat in this mall and Sophie's is just the tip of the iceberg.
author: Jessica L.

description: This place rocks.  The crepe-master working back there must have spent 11 years on top of a mountain learning his art.
author: Matthew R.

description: Delicious to-go crepes made fresh for your hungry eyes to see. I'm not a huge fan of crepes, but the dessert ones are the shizznit. I love nutella (even though it totally constipates me at the end of the day. too much information?) No offense, but there aren't a ton of great reasons to hit up J-town, but Sophie's is a good one.
author: Jen Y.

description: I love this place. Genki is the more convenient crepe place for me but I favor Sophie's crepes over Genki any day. The crepes are not as crunchy as Genki so when I  bite into it the crepe isn't crumbling all over the place. Also the staff is very friendly at Sophie's. Ever since I can remember my family has made it a point to snag some crepes at Sophie's after our dinner outings in J-Town. Now that I don't live with them anymore I always save space for Sophie's Crepes when I'm in the area for dinner as well. Sophie's crepes is just a great way to end a night out in the area. My favorite dessert crepe is the mixed fruits with Nutella. MMmmMm
author: Tanyamarie A.

description: Months past before the mere aroma no longer satisfied. Additional treats -- the art and anticipation of the crepe and the live, one-sided break-up of a crepe-less couple on an opposite bench. Ordered the green tea ice cream crepe. You basically can't mess up ice cream.
author: Pax, Formerly Known As Rufus D.

description: I was underwhelmed by Sophie's. The crepes were rather cardboardy, and the soda I ordered tasted like the water they dip the ice cream scooper in (or what I imagine that would taste like). I asked the girl at the register three times to add honey to the crepe, and after the third time of receiving a vacuous look, gave up...it wasn't a language barrier, more like a nervous teenager who was new to the job. Possibly I have high standards for the genre; I've been lucky enough to eat a memorable crepe while visiting Harajuku in Tokyo...I went to Sophie's with the hope of something just as a tasty. Oh well. Next time, I will try Belly Good, which is just down the hallway.
author: Angela B.

description: i did not know that the place i was ravenously eating crepes was the same place everyone was talking about. i love the crepes here! i dont like to eat things with my hands because i hate getting messy, id rather get a plate/fork/knife and a proper table but i always want to eat the crepe immediately and there is no time to be proper. i just have to gobble it up while the nutella is warm & ice cream is still cold. YUM!!!
author: Stella C.

description: The display outside is reminiscent of the Harajuku crepes.  Folded triangles with sweet whipped cream.  I think the taste here is better.  The crepes come rolled in a paper cone.  You can choose ice cream crepes or fruit.  There are many pre determined combinations or make your own.  The ice cream crepes are delicious, but eat them fast so they don't melt.
author: apple r.

description: Sophie's Crepes in Japantown's Kinokuniya Building is a winner.  Especially in the evenings, crowds converge to watch the simple yet mesmerizing wonders of their paper-thin crepe being made through the storefront window.  They have lots of savory and dessert varieties.  My kids love the one filled with vanilla ice cream, strawberries and whipped cream, both with and without chocolate sauce drizzled on top.  Sophie's Crepes, 1581 Webster Street.  415.929.7732.  Tuesday - Thursday  and Sunday 11:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m., Friday - Saturday 11:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  Closed Mondays.
author: Dina B.

description: It's amazing how a little crepe place in Japantown, San Francisco, serves MUCH better crepes than the original country, France. When I went to France, I ordered crepes everywhere I went, but was never satisfied, though I couldn't quite put my finger to what exactly was wrong with the Parisian crepes. French people really should learn from Japanese people on how to make proper crepes. Yum...
author: Karen K.

description: I like Sophie's mainly for their location: Having a light dinner, browsing some of the Japantown shops, then finishing it off with something from Sophie's makes for a great time. Their crepes seem excellent to me, though I am no crepe fiend. Gelatos are aplenty here, too!
author: Patrick G.

description: This place is always packed.  But I say it is worth the wait.  You can always stare through the window and watch how your crepe is made.  The great anticipation makes me feel like a kid in a candy store.  My fav is Japanese crepe with green tea ice-cream and red bean.
author: Lisa L.

description:
This is by far the best place to go to if you're craving for a crepe. I found this little shop when I was browsing the stores of Japan Center with some of my friends. 

I really like how they fold the crepe (cone-style) so you can hold it and carry it around rather than eating it on a plate. My crepe had strawberries, bananas, kiwis. whipped cream, and nutella. YUM!
author: Bruce L.

description: Yumm! I love crepes and this place definitely hits the spot. I love the crepes with gelato (especially the green tea), it's guaranteed to make you happy =D. You can customize your crepe pretty much anyway you like. The crepes themselves could use a bit more sweetness but then again not everyone would like that. It's always pretty crowded but they have a good system going on so props to them for that. Definitely try it out if you're in Japantown!
author: Chrys U.

description:
Every time I visit Japantown I HAVE to have a crepe at Sophie's Crepes!  I order a customized crepe all the time and the best one I've had was black sesame gelato with nutella.  MMMmmmm... the best!  

Although I absolutely think their crepes are delicious, I had to knock off a star because they don't accept cards!  Yeah, there's an ATM machine in the store but it charges you a fee to use it.  :(  Also their menu on the wall can use a little organization.  It makes my eyes cross over when I try to read it.
author: Dong Q.

description: Their green tea gelato beats any other green tea ice cream/gelato in town! I never stray from the Japanese crepe, absolutely love their macha sauce. Though they are kind of weird about giving that to you if you don't order a crepe, even if you offer to pay for it. Not the nicest people who work there, but ah for ice cream, who cares!
author: Faffy L.

description: It's fun to watch them make the crepes and they're pretty tasty too. Reminds me of studying abroad in Taiwan, good times...a small cup of gelato (or two) makes a great post-jtown ramen treat. Say yes to the banana walnut and double yes to my favorite: black sesame. Dark, nutty, almost chocolatey/smoky tasting and healthy. The perfect dessert, especially to share with a friend!
author: Yiming R.

description:
another crappy meal at isobune - i don't know why i keep going back there.  kind of like an urban hunt for food.  huuuh, hungry, see cheap food, grab cheap food, pay for cheap food.  

so i head here to quiet the rumbling in my tum-tum.

i think they still have my little nose prints on their window as i watch them make their crispy crepes.  i personally like the nutella, strawberries and whip cream.  yum, slurp.

i usually grab a cup of lychee icecream on the side to take home for another day since that would be a dangerous overload on my lactose breaking enzyme deficient bod.
author: Anh V.

description: Great selection of crepes to go! Mmmmm, I got the vegetarian and the dressing they used was tasty and the produce was very fresh. Also, the girl that served us was wearing a KISS shirt. How can anyone resist.
author: Xelyn x.

description: I didn't actually buy a crepe here, I was actually waiting outside a my sister bought a crepe and shared it with me. We had just come from a super full lunch and saw them making crepes from an open widow. Yum. Too tempting to pass up.  I did like the crepe, but it did get messy because  it was a hand held crepe and not a plate one. Not the best method when you're sharing with other people. As far as price, I do remember a complaint from my sister and another friend about the extra charges to add whipped cream and ice cream, so it made an already expensive crepe more expensive.
author: Thuy P.

description: I love sophie's crepes! I don't like soggy crepes and this place makes the best crispy crepe. It's hot and crunchy on the outside and it's filled with cold yummy goodness inside. The wait can get crazy sometimes which sucks but it's all worth it.
author: Flora W.

description: great crepes! perfect dessert after sushi or ramen in j-town. as simple as butter and cinnamon sugar or ice cream and strawberries. good eating!
author: Jeff W.

description: Some of the sundaes looks really tasty but I paid almost 7 dollars for a strawberry, nutella and whipped cream crepe. It just seems a bit ridiculous when I can get the same thing at genki for about 3 dollars cheaper and with real whipped cream versus the piped cool whip that they serve you here.
author: Nadia P.

description: i always get the butter and cinnamon sugar, but it's a sure thing every time. The perfect thinness and crunchiness and for under $4 its great to walk around with. I have never had a complaint, even when the line is insane, because I know what is in store for me and because its so darned entertaining to watch them all be made.
author: Sydel S.

description: The crepes are good (although I don't feel that they are as yummy as Genki). I usually love green tea ice cream, so when I saw the green tea sundae with red beans, I couldn't resist the temptation and got it. Big mistake. That thing was gross. First time that I didn't enjoy green tea ice cream.
author: Susan H.

description: I've had crepes in the Bay Area, New York City, Vancouver CA, and Europe.  This one is my favorite, hands down.
author: Rachel d.

description: Every time I'm in Japantown, I try to save a room for green tea ice cream crepe with red bean.  It is sublime.  When I am too full to eat my usual, I go for the cinnamon butter sugar crepe which is equally delicious.
author: Su K.

description:
OK.  I'm not even going to attempt to sugarcoat *(no pun intended)* this review just because of the average of four-star rating that this place gets.  Sorry guys - the crepes are three stars.  The 40-minute wait while watching the staff moving in slow motion is negative one.  

Simply put - the No# 17 (Japanese crepe with red bean paste, green tea ice cream and matcha) was tasty, but not blow-my-socks-off phenomenal.  I couldn't have told the difference between Sophie's and Genki if I were to do a blind-tasting, and frankly, I prefer the limited edition Haagen-Dazs green tea ice cream (3 one-pint containers for $10 at your nearest Safeway, get them before they take them off the shelf...) over the one here.  

Watching the process of making the crepes can only be entertaining for 5 minutes.  At 5 minutes and 1 second, the novelty started going down almost exponentially and you are, frankly, left with no option but to twiddle your thumb waiting for your number to be called.  Another 35 minutes later, the process of consuming the highly anticipated crepe took place in less than 2 minutes. 

I've never had to work this hard for a dessert.
author: Ange L.

description: Nice flavor mixes.  Though I do have to say that the crepe itself was a little overcooked and dry.
author: Venus Z.

description: I have a lot of love for Sophie's Crepes. A well-lit place to stuff one's face. The crepes are crispy, the gelato is AMAHZING and the ingredients tasty and the staff friendly. I prefer the dessert crepes to the savory, but to each their own. Japanese crepe, anyone? Yes please! It's got it's hooks in me and I'll never let go!!!! Unless I don't have cash, but then I run, not walk, to a ATM.
author: Meghan R.

description:
yummy. 

despite the prices it's freakin' good! 

i'm boring and just get the crepe with whipped cream and strawberries.

personal fave: great after sushi snack
author: Mei N.

description:
i haven't had a crepe from sophie's in a while.  i ordered the mixed fruit with ice cream.  the crepe was just like i remembered... warm, cool, crispy, delicious!

the mother sitting at the next table with her her two daughters kept saying how good their crepes tasted and how they all made great choices.  the younger daughter enjoyed her crepe sooo much, she even licked the paper wrap clean.  ahahaha!

YUMMY YUMMY YUM YUM YUM - OH!
author: Joy C.

description: This place is disgusting. Do yourself a favor and walk across the bridge to Belly Good Crepes.
author: JaM W.

description: I'm not the only one who thinks Genki is so much better than this place! I went here while seeing a move near by and let me tell you, I was disappointing. I paid almost $6 for a nutella, strawberry and whipped cream crepe ($4.25 at Genki) and I HATED that the crepe itself wasn't crunchy and the whipped cream felt super heavy and had a weird aftertaste. I don't get the fascination with this place and won't bother coming here again.
author: Bella S.

description: I think is place is one of the japan town tourist attraction.  Not only because sophie herself work behind the counter, but she is making a good crepes.  #14 is good, especially if you add their gelato ice cream, it makes you drool...!! Try 'em especially if you are from out of town, but remember you cannot take pictures, sophie hates paparazzi cuz her crepes are authentic.
author: Albert W.

description:
i definitely must agree-- best crepes in the bay!

since i was little i make it a priority to stop by japan town everytime i'm in the city, just for sophie's! whether i'm about to have a full on meal or after, i always make room.

they have a good selection of savory as well as dessert crepes to choose from. i've tried just about everything, besides red bean that is... which i'm not too crazy about. and if nothing on the menu tickles your fancy, you are able to mix and match to create your own. they also offer ice cream flavors on it's own too if you don't want it inserted in your dessert.

it is a bit pricier than most other crepe places though. but what i like that is unique about this particular shop is their packaging. the handheld cone makes it fun, rather than those little boring togo boxes. the lines here can get long once in awhile though. there's only two crepe stoves so the wait can be rather long, but atleast it's entertaining to watch them prepare you treats. however, they should really wash that water bowl they use to rinse off the wooden batter spreader cause after awhile the build up gets gross.

just a side note-- funny how there's a no photographing/documentary sign posted on the front glass window, yet there's plenty of pics on yelp! haha :)
author: Julia C.

description: Hits the spot every time we're in Japantown for dinner. There's thin pancakes with whipped cream, fruit, chocolate syrup and ice cream all served in folded paper. This dessert ice cream cone/fruit sandwich is just the right kind of goodnness after a great meal. If you want to change it up a bit you can always spring for a cup or cone of gelato. Something different like black sesame seed gelato is always a fun try when you're feeling weird or have just had bad indian food for dinner. Or you can go more conventional with cookies n cream or vanilla gelato amongst other flavors. Best thing is that it's quite inexpensive and very good. Although I do feel bad for these folks making the crepes while the people waiting outside for their treats gawk and stare at the skill to make these thin pancakes. It's like who's the caged animal here? The crepe specialist or the folks standing outside salivating in anticipation. I know if I was working there I'd be too distracted and quite annoyed saying to myself, "What... you've never seen anyone make a crepe before?! C'mon man I'm working here"
author: graham c.

description:
love love love their crepes!!!!
it is the best here and i havnt had any better ones.
it's cripsy, and perfectly thin.  and if you get the one with fruits, ice cream with whip cream, you will have to agree.
everytime i go to san francisco, i always stop here to get this crepe!
you should try it!
author: Rachel R.

description: Got the Japanese Special.  I will try to replicate this at home because it's that good.  Fragrant green tea gelatto, maccha, red bean.  Not overwhelmingly sweet... just excellent.
author: Suz K.

description:
Best crepe place in SF.  The crepes are slightly chewy and oh so good.  Yummy.  My favorite is the strawberries, vanilla ice cream and whipped cream.

Only downside is that it closes early (10pm even on weekends)!
author: D C.

description: Maybe I'm a bit critical because I make my own crepes, but I wasn't particularly impressed here.  Went here on a Sunday afternoon and there were quite a few people frequenting the place.  There's only three tables, but it spills out into the mall plaza with more seating, so it wasn't crowded.  The staff was friendly enough, and they were quick to take our orders so there was no wait.  I ordered the banana and nutella sweet crepe with vanilla ice cream ($1 extra).  It only took a few minutes for them to produce my order, but my crepe was not warm at all. They advertise "FRESH CREPES" but this made me believe otherwise. The crepe is very crispy and they shape it in a hand cone.  It makes it a bit more difficult to eat, and mine felt heavy on the nutella. (I know, who complains about too much nutella??) Because of the shape and the crispiness, you really only eat the top half of the "cone" crepe and then the rest just goes in the trash.
author: Ellie L.

description: 3 stars seems too low, but I gave Belly Good a 4 and I prefer it over Sophie's. The main difference is that Sophie's uses a hard, crunchy, almost waffle-like shell for their crepes whereas Belly Good uses regular soft ones. I definitely prefer the soft crepes. Both places cost about the same, which is to say they're quite expensive. Crepes will run about $5-7, depending on what kind of fillings you get.
author: Byron C.

description:
by far the best place to get a crepe in a cone.  actually i can't think of any other place?

This sweet spot is a bit hidden away so you'll have to get into the Kinokuniya bldg and head to the second floor and look for a crowd of kids usually holding crepes in a cone.

head inside and get anything that your heart desires... I would say go for a bit of sweetness.  Of course everyone loves nutella so you can't go wrong with that.

The prices are good and you can check out the rest of J town with a treat in your hand!  

Warning make sure you have plenty of napkins before you leave because it may and will get messy.
author: Harry H.

description:
since mister eugene mentioned the crepes....i have to expand on how i love this place too!! i love my nutella, strawberries and a big 'ol ball of gelato....YUM! worth all the whoppin $10 and a gazillion calories. goodness, gracious, why does it have to be so far away!

did i tell you how much i LOVE their crepes?!!
author: Jane Y.

description: Sophie's is convenient and good. Not impressed with the Chicken Salad, Turkey, and Tuna crepes unfortunately, but this is where you gotta taste their dessert crepes. Who likes Nutella?!
author: Leroid D.

description: Dude...It's...an Ice cream crepe cone! It took me the first bite to make me realize how Sophie's  Crepes is different from all the other crepe places. It's the only one I know that turns the conventional crepe into a cone funnel. Simple but in Miami...we dunna do this, it would cause confused head scratching. The gelato was decently creamy and the place is SUPER CLEAN + the folks behind the counter are not disgruntled (bonus points there - who likes grumpies?). I wish they'd amp up their chocolate syrup flavoring on the crepe, don't skimp my man!
author: cindy w.

description:
One of the best crispy crepes I've had. I actually prefer Sophie's over Genki. I think I finished it off in less than a minute, but that's ok- when the crepe gets cold- it doesnt taste as good. 

The worker assembly line is really fast too!
author: Retired B.

description: Mmmmm...my favorite place to grab dessert before or after dinner in Japantown.  They do NOT take credit cards or debit cards, so bring some cash.  If you happen to forget it at home, no worries, there is an ATM in the dining area.  I've never tasted their savory crepes, but the dessert crepes (nutella, banana, strawberry, whipped cream and chocolate syrup for me) are fantastic.
author: Hiromi N.

description: An extra star for having gelato...but minus a star for the crap quality of the crepes.  The strawberries and ice cream were good but the crepe itself tasted like rice paper.  I'm sticking to Genki on Clement for those savory crepes from now on.
author: Mark D.

description: this place is good.  their ice cream is delicous and so as the crepe.  Genki has no comparison with this place.  if you are near by Japan Town, you should give it a try.  the worst thing is that they only sell crepe.  if they have something else to sell like drinks that it will be perfect.
author: Peter K.

description: The best dessert crepe in-a-cone! It's better than it sounds. The crepes are nice and crispy. Plus you can get a range of fillings - from strawberry/nutella to green tea/red bean.
author: Evelyn G.

description: Mouth-watering spanking delicious! Try to eat a light meal before getting a whole crepe yourself.
author: Christina Y.

description: This is one of the best places to get a crepe and it's super popular. The lines are always long. They won't allow you to take a picture from outside their window because they're afraid your going to steal their idea.
author: Jenny K.

description: The crepes and gelato was good. Best place for a cheap date. Just walk around Jap town and bring your date here. Guarantee a happy ending. To your stomach that is.
author: Thyrone A.

description: Not bad. I think people rave about this place due to its great central location and first-mover advantage. I'm kind of a crepe-snob, and this place has decent crepes, but the crepe itself seemed a little hard to me, and the fillings didn't seem all that fresh.
author: Joyce G.

description: The crepes here suck, but they have the best cookies and cream ice cream.  Well, Toscanini's in Boston is the best, but this place is a close second.
author: howie f.

description: Tried the place based on the Yelp iPhone app telling me there was some good food near me. You lied! I don't know if I can ever forgive you.
author: Jerry S.

description:
damn good crepe.

there is a reason this place is always packed. it's cause their crepes are really good. i personally like this place better than Genki crepes (i've only had genki crepes once, so maybe i'm being too quick to judge though). it's all about letter E!! vanilla ice cream, chocolate syrup, strawberries.

I've had the E combo 3 times. The cookies 'n creme gelato was amazing (i sampled it each time i went, but I didn't think it was nearly as good when I got it in a crepe.

My suggestions:
Crepe - Letter E
Gelato - Cookies 'n cream
author: Garrett W.

description: Had a dessert crepe, but went with a basic nutella with fruit one and didn't venture into the ice cream. But have to sit and commend the menu...ice cream crepes, does it get better than that. Just a stop by type of place though, no atmosphere. That brought the rating down.
author: Michael S.

description: The banana ice cream crepe we got was pretty darn good.  If you're in Japantown, go and give it a try.  You won't be sorry you did.
author: Matt P.

description: Try a crepe with nutella and mandarin oranges.  Perfect balance of tartness and sweet nuttiness.  A much better alternative to strawberry and nutella crepes that are sold everywhere else.  Not only delicious but also perfect to bring to Kabuki theatre as a quick snack.  Really saved me from starvation during the busy International Film Festival weeks.
author: Candice B.

description: My MUST-GO-TO place whenever I go to Japantown.  The lines can be incredibly long, but if you have a sweet tooth like me, there's nothing more satisfying than their crepe-cone with gelato (red bean! mmm!) and fresh fruit and whipped cream.  The crepe is light, and crunchy, unlike the other crepe place in the Japan plaza (the crepes there are pale and soggy).  LOVE LOVE LOVE!
author: Grace M.

description: Holy crap!!! This place is ultimate pwnage if you want the most uber food coma after scarfing down some sushi nearby or maybe watching a Mexican chef at a Japanese rest. twirl his knives and make a volcano outta food. It hits the spot evertime, and I've found it to be a guilty vice that stays in my head until I settle for a piece of chocolate
author: Nick A.

description:
if you're around japan town, you gotta go to this place!

you gotta get the crepes with the ice cream in them
author: Raj R.

description: This place is great. Although there is always a line, the crepe-makers are very swift. My favorite is the mixed fruits crepe with nutella, which comes with strawberries, bananas and kiwi. Sophie's is especially good before seeing a movie at the Kabuki 8!
author: Clare G.

description: Why do people like this place?  The service is horrid, the gelato texture is too sticky, and the flavors taste artificial.
author: Big e.

description: Sophie's Crepes is delightfully delicious. Especially after you have some Japanese food, you can head right over and get some crepes! Seems like whenever I stop by Japantown, I can never leave with out getting a crepe. The lines are usually long, but it's definitely worth the wait.
author: Hans H.

description: It's not the best crepes I've had but I settle for Sophie's when I'm in Jtown. I like their sliced to order banana, kiwi, and strawberries with whipped cream and topped with a big scoop of vanilla ice cream.
author: Juliane N.

description:
veryveryvery gooooood.

it's impossible for me to eat these slowly. 

i have to eat fast, even if i get hiccups really bad afterwards.

oh well.

so good.

these are just so ADDICTIVE!!!!

best ones are the strawberry with vanilla ice cream, mixed fruit and red bean.

i also like the japanese- green tea gelato with adzuki bean paste and matcha syrup stuff. yum.

yumyumyummy in my tumtumtummy.

****************

deliciously yummilicious.

don't hate, tolerate.

: P
author: Inari T.

description:
when i want a crepe, this is the place i come to.  u can watch them make your crepe or you can walk over to the stationary store or book store to kill time when there's a bunch of ppl waiting for their crepe.  when you see a bunch of ppl lining up and eating outside the store, you know this place is good.  common sense right? 

this always satisfies my crepe craving everytime.  come here when you're in jtown! u can't miss it!
author: Kapo T.

description: Love the banana and nutella crepes! Yum! Nutella is the best! I don't care how full I am from a meal...this place hits the spot for something sweet! :)
author: Mel P.

description: the crepes are crisper than i'm used to, but i thoroughly enjoyed my nutella and banana crepe nevertheless. i haven't tried any other flavor but there are tons of combinations, and i believe you can build your own crepe too (but maybe i'm making that up?). if you're in japantown, sophie's is a must-go! :)
author: Clara K.

description: if you are a sophie's crepes virgin, don't be deterred when you walk in and think "what? 8 dollars for a crepe? in JTOWN?" it's well worth it. i like the strawberry gelato with whipped cream and banana. expect to wait in line during peak hours. and in case you want to go here after a later dinner or something, remember that they close at 10!
author: Shirley L.

description: i live in the sunset area, so my easy go-to for good crepes would be crepe temptations on judah. however, i will only get my specific crepe with green tea gelato, azuki, and matcha sauce here at sophie's, because they make it amazingly well here. be sure to try it out! if memory serves me correctly, it's listed on the menu as the japanese dessert crepe, or something to that effect. it's my only order here!
author: Eliza D.

description: Whether it's a savory or dessert crepe, Sophie's Crepes never fails me! Only downside is they can be quite packed but it's totally understandable. So far Sophie's is my favorite crepe spot in the bay... so far! ;) I wish more places made cone crepes instead of the flat folded ones!
author: Sabrina K.

description: Lychee ice cream, green tea sauce, and strawberries or red bean paste on a crepe is some sort of Asian/French/California fusion that some genius food scientist must have invented. It's the perfect happy ending to too much healthiness after a day at one of the nearby spas. I don't know about you, but I always like to replace my toxins as quickly as possible.
author: Melinda K.

description: Hands down, Sophie's Crepes makes the best Japanese-style crispy crepes I've ever had. I've been going there for years and will continue to do so for as long as I'm in physical proximity to it! I used to order the 'fancier' sweet crepes with lots of stuff in it, but now, I just get a plain one with chocolate chips. I find the simpler the filling, the better you can taste how good the actual crepe is! I've been to several other crepe shops (French and Japanese-style), but none seem to have that wonderful light crispness that Sophie's crepes have. I'm getting hungry starting to think of them, actually....
author: Rosann Y.

description: I heart Sophie's Crepe's! When I used to work at my horrible job nearby, I would frequent this place for comfort on my lunch hour. Keep it simple, keep it classic: nutella gelato in a fresh crepe. I would eat it very methodically, scooping every little morsel of that thick and creamy gelato out, then devouring the crepe bite by bite.
author: Monica N.

description:
It saddens me to see so many low ratings

I love crepe and Sophie's is hands down the best crepe I have every had.
They are so light and crispy they are able to be served in a paper wrap simular to ice cream cone. Not like most crepes that are thick and soggy. 
I love this place so much that me and my boy friend drive from concord which is about 25 mile away just to enjoy a delictable crepe and go back home. 
We enjoy both the saviory crepes and the sweet crepes. Often since we driive  far and delt with the pain of parking we enjoy one of each crepe between us. As well as enjoying Sopies we like to visit the Japan mall book store located next to Sophie's. We rarely buy anything but there are many interesting books that can consume your time wihtout notice.
I can not deny the long lines that other reviews complain about but I have never seen the staff move without haste. I have had up to 12 orders in front of me ranging from 1 - 4 crepes and always get my order in less then 10min. 
One down side is they are close mondays. So if you live out of SF like I do that is important to remeber when your sole reason to the city is for a decidaten crepe. Also they do not accept credit cards but that is common in SF.
author: Jessica A.

description:
i try to come here as often as i can even if its out of the way because yes its just that good. i usually get the ham and cheese with veggies and i dont know how they do it but each and every time the crepe is thin with just the right amount of crunch to it but my favorite part has got to be the mayonnaise. asian mayonnaise. reminds me of home everytime.

they can only make crepes two at a time so it can get busy sometimes but its definitely worth the wait. plus theres a cute stationary and bookstore right next door to kill time while you wait.
author: georgette y.

description: Does anyone else get annoyed when there are holes in your crepes?  The one disadvantage of having the crepes right by the windows is that people can see their crepe being made - and it drives me nuts when there are missed spots in the crepes.  It's not like it affects the taste of that sweet nutella blending in with the ice cream, bananas and strawberries, but it's a downer when it happens.
author: Dan Y.

description: This was always the place to go for crepes in J-town.  The place is still popular, but I think quality isn't as good as it used to be.  It wasn't super busy when I went, but I think the guys left the crepe on the hotplate for too long because it was almost "well done".   I like mine a little more soft.
author: Irene C.

description: I Like their crepes so delicius and fresh with ice cream and crisp waffle thingys.
author: Keit K.

description:
It was really great how people here milled about in waves. You could mill about the next door bookstore and watch the crowds so that your time would better be spent browsing rather than waiting in line. Most customers ate their crepes in the sitting space right in front of the store. It looked like they were very satisfied with the product.

 I had the crepe with ice cream (lychee) which pleasantly surprised me.   They had a range of dessert crepes as well as the savoury ones.  I would come back again - it is slightly expensive - my ice cream crepe came out to be about $4+.   I would say it was worth it - loved the texture of the chewy crepe with a hint of a crunch at the edges.  I would recommend it.
author: y y.

description:
my first time here! amazing crepes. i think it lived up to it's reputation. i had a chocolate+whipped cream crepe with mocha chip ice cream. amazingly good. they make it right in front of you. and, there's a hugggeee menu on the wall -- you can make your own, too. 

(thanks to my friend to paid for it :D)
author: Betty T.

description: MMM.....good fresh crispy crepe, filled with anything you'd like (if you're willing to pay for it). I got the simple strawberry nutella with vanilla ice cream, classic goodness. For people who want fluffy and soft crepe, this is probably not the place. But you can still go for the variety of gelato...they have black sesame, the only place I know of in town! The line is non-existent if you go at 11am on a weekday.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
Sophies Crepes is pretty much the only thing that makes San Francisco Japan Town worth going to. 
Well.... not exactly but pretty damn close.
The generic vanilla ice cream, nutella, strawberry and bannana crepe is a delicioso classic, but the "Japanese style" is my new favorite. 
I have to take off a star for the service though. The ladies who make and hand you the crepes are beyond rude.
author: T Y.

description: We had the Japanese style sundae with Maccha & Azuki flavoured ice cream.  It was pretty good.   Unfortunately we didn't have the crepe so I can't comment on that yet.
author: Durif M.

description: Green tea/Red bean paste gelato in a crepe was delicious, but the gelato is just as delightful served solo in a cup. I would love if they opened earlier than they do so that I could have a sinful breakfast!
author: Michelle R.

description: I know the crepes are a little too crispy for some people but I like them. I usually order the Strawberry, Vanilla Ice Cream, Whipped Cream and Chocolate sauce crepe. Eating at Sophie's makes me feel like an eager, little kid awaiting a special dessert. Mostly because I have to stand around and wait for my number to be called while watching everyone eating their yummy crepes, but once my number is called.... Yatta!!!
author: Shannon A.

description: The first time I came here was with my uncle. I like the order "F" and their french vanilla ice cream. Plus I like how the bottom of the cone is rather soft than hard like other places. Honestly, this is one of the best crepe stores outta the whole SF, generally.
author: Vivian L.

description: UN EFFING REAL!!! Loved this place! Hit it up on a recommendation after eating at a restaurant downstairs, and was completely satisfied. This place has a long line out the door at like 9 pm for a reason. I got the green tea and azuki bean crepe, and the bride got banana, nutella, and vanilla bean gelato. Unreal. I'm going to move to J-town just to be closer to Sophies.
author: Sean V.

description: Every time I go to Japantown, this is the absolute best place for a dessert fix.  You have a decent selection of yummy fruit crepes and have a create your own option.  They also offer gelato here.  The banana walnut, cookies n cream, hazelnut are my favorite flavors. I usually get a gelato crepe and add nutella. (Everything tastes better with nutella)  The gelato sundaes may look small but trust me, they pack a lot in that little cup. I love the chocolate sundae. The line can be somewhat long, but the staff works so fast that the wait is not bad at all.
author: Jollieanne J.

description: I've heard a lot about sophie's crepes, so had to finally try it.  I've never been a big crepe person until last year when I got back from Paris.  Ironically, I think the crepes they sell here in the States is actually better than the crepes they sell in Paris (dare I say that?).  I ordered a crepe with nutella, strawberry and bananas with vanilla ice cream.  It was very good.  I definitely think that the vanilla ice cream really makes a difference, so I highly recommend adding it.   There was a long line that night, but it went by pretty fast.  They definitely have their crepe making system down.
author: Allie P.

description: Every time I go to the city and visit Japan town I make it a point to get me a dessert crepe at Sophie's they are so delicious and more than enough for me.  I always order the same one banana, vanilla ice cream; whip cream, strawberries, and chocolate syrup... YUMMY a crepe Sunday!!!  They do get a little pricey but you get what you pay for and there is always a line because I tend to go on the weekends, but it's well worth the wait!
author: Rachel R.

description: This place has fantastic, fresh crepes. The savory crepes or ice cream crepes are about 4 stars, but I give them 5 stars for the strawberry and nutella. Even if you've never liked nutella, try it. Best crepe I've ever had.
author: Teo W.

description: This place is simply D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S!!! i literally felt like i was in heaven the moment the green tea ice-cream melts in my mouth.. mm-mmm...mmmmmm......!!!!
author: Iche S.

description: They offer a variety of savory crepes, which can consist of turkey, avocado, and cheese fillings to name a few.  Dessert crepes can be made with nutella, ice cream/gelato, as well as fruits.  I've only had the dessert crepes, and they are to die for!  I'm just blocks away, and I always finish it halfway home.  It's so fattening, it's good.  Be sure to pack in the calories and get it with nutella and ice cream!  A crepe at Sophie's is a must when you're in the J-Town area.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Oh the sweet aroma of freshly made crepes!  Unfortunately I always walk by AFTER I've eaten lunch/dinner, and I'm so full I tell myself - next time!  But when I do get a chance to enjoy it, my favorite is the Japanese crepe, oozing with green tea gelato and azuki. So delicious!  They have a pretty wide selection of gelato and sorbettos as well which are a nice alternative if you just can't finish an entire crepe.  And it's quite facinating to watch them make the delicate crepes from the window.  It always reminds me of the little crepe stands that you see everywhere in Japan.
author: Mai S.

description: Now this is my favorite crepe place. They serve them crispier than i'm used to ( in a good way), easy to carry and DELICIOUS. I've tried a lot of the crepes in that area and this one just suits my preferences best. Also even though the line was long the employees making the crepes took their time to talk to people, and it made me feel welcome. Now it's a must have for me whenever i'm over there.
author: Daniel P.

description: I think this place is great, who doesn't want thick & gooey gelato in a hot crepe?  A must stop while in J-town!
author: Erin S.

description:
i've only tried some of their dessert crepes... and they're yummie
they taste different from other crepes though... they're stiffer and crispier... 
i like the one with green tea ice cream and sweet red bean paste :)
author: charlotte s.

description: I wish we had one of these in Chicago.  I don't know how Sophie does it....but she does it best.  There are unlimited combinations, and they are all reasonably priced.  I love the avocado cheddar crepe.  It's SOOOOO amazing.  Usually, I don't do the whole sweet/salt thing, but it works so well together...I'm getting hungry right now.  Damn.
author: Becky P.

description: A great late night dessert spot in Japantown.  How can you miss - you can have your gelato, you can have your crepes, or you can put them together!
author: Corey C.

description:
$7.00 for a crepe?!?!? yessss! at sophie's crepes! i had the mixed fruit with whipped creme, nutella and a scoop of caramel gelato. my tastebuds thanked me for the euphoric experience, but my waistline did not. 

sophie's - the more i frequent you, the more i must frequent 24 hour fitness!!
author: Nancie T.

description: Definitely not as good as the ones I got on the streets of Japan, but coming pretty damn close. Nutella+cookies&cream gelato= I'm a freakin genius!
author: Courtney S.

description: My name is Maren, and I am a crepe-a-holic. Sophie's Crepes feeds my addiction. Hawaiian (ham, cheese and pineapple) is the best. They're fast, too!
author: Maren P.

description: Sometimes I just want to take a picture of Sophie's crepe making process and see what the punishment really is. They make delicious crepes, although I've noticed that any crepe that has meat in it will be cooked inconsistently. The meat that's at the top will be cooked just right, while everything underneath will be lukewarm and taste sorta weird. I've learned to deal with it though. Crepes + Stewart's Soda go together like Japantown and awkward teenagers.
author: Al M.

description: I don't know what I was thinking giving them ONLY 4 stars. Just went back over the weekend and they totally deserve a 5th.
author: O'Shea J.

description: Try the mixed fruit crepe with nutella and add black sesame gelato. Very good! I highly recommend it. One of the few places I know that sells the special sesame ice cream.
author: Zahir A.

description: I've been here a few times, and each time the line gets shorter & shorter!  (Good for us, but hope they're doing ok)  Yum.  Nobody makes the "Japanese" (green tea gelato, red bean paste, green tea matcha) like Sophie's.  I prefer them over the downstairs crepe place.  The scent of the crepe itself is close to fresh fortune cookies.
author: Aubergine R.

description: A stop at japantown for everyone. its like a must to come here. but to me.. i normally don't have the patience to wait for this kind of things. So everything was good. but the Line was too long. well thats my problem. but that totally kills it for me. but Ice cream and crepe quality was great. but i can see why everyone wants to come here whenever they come to Japantown. Good ice cream!
author: Andrew H.

description: Talk about great texture in your dessert!  Sweet crispy crepe embedded with lychee ice cream or nutella and bananas.  Delicioso!
author: Jeannie L.

description: This place is so great.  I go here after Dino's clam pizza down the street.  Or, if pressed for time, go here first then to Dino's.  Whatever is the case - whether it's dessert substituted for your lunch or dinner or as a snack! this is your best bet.
author: Lorraine D.

description: i always wondered why my friend's crepe was so expensive (about 8 bucks) but everything changed one time when i was too full to buy myself one so i just took some bites from my friends crepe. omg! one bite into that crepe and it got me hooked... and if your wondering what it is.. its strawberry and nutella with lychee gelato.... dont be scared away by the $7.54 price because it is worth every penny
author: JUDY L.

description: The crepe i had was good, dont get me wrong. But it wasnt great, it wasnt everything i expected it to be haha. I think i let myself down because ive never had crepes in my life and the aroma smells so fantastic. And when i finally had one..it was..alright. i guess i hyped it too much. It was good when it was warm, but the heat goes away fast. then its just ok. oh well my fault i guess haha. Im still in search for the crepe that will live up to my hype of it =(
author: Terry S.

description: Sophie makes a killer crepe! Light and fluffy, and stuffed with ice cream, fruit, and whipped cream, it's more like eating an ice cream cone than a thin French pancake. Sophie's is the cherry on top to a fun day spent in Japantown.
author: Alex H.

description: I love this place with a passion. My favorite is strawberries, whipped cream, chocolate syrup and vanilla or chocolate gelato. Makes me so happy!!
author: Jessica O.

description: I heart crepes and this place lived up to its reviews!  Yummmmmy to ice cream and chocolate.  I'm a simple girl ;)
author: Maricris D.

description: The crowd outside Sophie's caught my eye. They were all watching a lady through the window making freshly made crepes. I'm sold. I had to have one. There are so many choices to fill your crepe with. I had time to choose since the line was hella long on a Saturday night. The 15 minute wait for my nutella, banana, and whipped cream filled crepe was worth it. Going to Sophie's is a must whenever I find myself in Japantown.
author: Jean L.

description: Had the gelato crepe. The gelato itself was very tasty but the crepe was a bit tough and bland. Still, the whole package works.
author: Mark C.

description: I love their crepes. I can't really explain it, but their simply perfect. I usually order the egg salad, tuna melt, or pesto chicken. Those are absolutely to die for. It takes me 30 minutes to get to J.Town but it's definitely worth it for these crepes. They are a bit pricey though.
author: Austin N.

description: Yum.  Go to San Francisco Japantown & you will see tons of people walking & lounging around with these crepes.  There is a reason!  They are delicious & whenever I'm in Japantown nowadays, I can't resist getting one!
author: Katrina V.

description: I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! THE BEST CREPES EVER! I can honestly say I'll travel from wherever I'm at after dinner to get me a crepe from Sophie's! My boyfriend can definitely vouch for that. Their service is always warm. They give you a right amount of nutella & ice cream! Ugh, I want one right now so bad!  YOU HAVE TO TRY THIS PLACE IF YOU HAVEN'T ALREADY!!
author: Lynn H.

description:
if you want something simple i would just get gelato in a crepe.. i usually get green tea or lychee....

there's something on their menu i believe called the japanese crepe with green tea ice cream and red beans in it that's good as well if you like that combination

def worth it to check out if you havent yet~
author: quan c.

description: Hands down the best crepe location in the Bay Area for me.  Was introduced here by the wife while we were dating and was pleasantly surprised at how tasty some of their combinations are.  My preference is nutella, strawberries, and whipped creme.  The wife likes the japanese combo of red bean, green tea ice cream and some other stuff.  Looking forward to going back down there when I'm in the area!
author: Jeff W.

description: The crepes here are great! It's thin and crispy, not pancake-like. I usually get the mixed fruit with ice cream but their gelato is pretty good too. Always go for the dessert crepe.
author: Jen S.

description:
Yummm! 

Crepes - How can you go wrong with a crepe filled with hazelnut gelato, bananas, whipped cream, and chocolate sauce?? You just can't! (this is J - plus gelato)

Service - Mediocre: not bad, not good... just give me the damn crepe! And they do - so it's all good. 

Space - Small, cramped, no flow, but... go outside of the creperie and you can enjoy your delicious crepe underneath the nicely lit cherry blossoms (fake trees) while watching your kids burn off the sugar, running circles around the little plaza.
author: Anne S.

description: a trip to japantown isn't complete without a visit to sophie's.  my go-to is usually nutella with banana or strawberries but also love their green tea.  they have a vast variety of toppings and ice cream flavors that fulfill your crepe desires.
author: Helen T.

description: This is the ultmate place for crepes.  If it was only closer to home I would not need to make such a journey (unavoidable--so I make a shopping trip).  I have had crepes elsewhere and they good too but not as great (Qcup, Banana Ice Cream shop in Downtown San Jose JTown :) satisfies the cravings) but this is the best especially with my fav--green tea gelato mmmm...gotta go now bye bye
author: Joy R.

description: The crepe with ice cream is oh-so-tasty.  Try it with banana or strawberries and ask for nutella spread.  Drooool.
author: Helen C.

description:
i try so hard to forget about sophie's everytime i having dinner at japantown. it is hard ! especially after i went to kinokuniya to get my stationary. the smell of fresh crepes.. yum..yum..
they use fresh fruits. i have no idea what they put in the strawberry.. they looks berry berry good. with the sweet kiwi and banana over nutella spread... its just a perfection !! rrgghhh... im just craving it now... devil !!!! they should change their name to Devil's crepes.... :?
author: sherly A.

description: I must have my crepes crispy at the edges.  I can't stand the ones that don't stand up!  It's the perfect thing to carry and munch on while you're checking out J-Town.
author: Grace V.

description:
its good... any thing you want inside a thin pancake cookie thingie.
its good! 
*careful theres a sign that says "NO PICTURES" or they'll sue!*
author: JASON L.

description: Why is there a crepes place in a Japanese mall? ....who knows, but come here.  There is always a bit of a line, but eh, its worth it.  The crepes are oversized, its cheap, its a great dessert place.
author: Marc M.

description: Holy crazyyyy... I've never had a crepe this good! The lines were long, which is what attracted us to this place, but WOW! I had the strawberry kiwi ice cream crepe ($5), and am I glad I had it! The crepe blended in with fruits and ice cream just matched so well - I want more!!
author: Regan C.

description: It is a good price for the portion, but this place is overrated. The strawberries were sour and the the crepe was tasteless. It was saved by the ice cream which tasted decent. Never again.
author: Erica B.

description:
soooo delicious.  i only gave it 4 stars because i'm a little bitter about the price increase.  i love the caramel gelato .. to die for ...  caramel gelato in a plain crepe.  simply delicious.  great place to stop by after dinner. 

has anyone else noticed that warning sign of toxic chemicals in the shop?  what's that about? ;(  correct me if the sign is gone too.

i've come here at least 2 handfuls of times .... it's that good  (regardless of the carcinogens ...)
author: Amanda N.

description:
green tea and red bean crepe!!!  pure heaven!

my first job in sf was a stressed out little non-profit.  my co-workers were AMAZING but the job left us all kinda nutty.  so sometimes when things became unbearable we would walk down to sophie's crepes.  and whoever was having the best of the worst days would buy crepes for all.  i miss sophie's (and that cute stationery store right next to it!).

green tea and red bean--some of the best stuff on earth.
author: becky k.

description: I can't walk by this place without having a red bean crepe with green tea ice cream on top. Yum!
author: vicki c.

description: Yummy crepes! They remind me of Taipei's Ke Li Bing, which are more like big waffle cones, except the cone is a crunchy crepe. I got the strawberry and nutella crepe. It was the perfect size, with really fresh strawberries that perfectly complimented the thick nutella. Prices are a bit high for what you get, but the crepes are worth it... they're delish!
author: Joy C.

description: Great dessert crepes, haven't tried the savory ones.  When combining a dessert crepe with ice cream, you have reached the apex of crepology.  the lines are long and the wait is extreme, but if you have a half hour to kill in japantown and you're in the mood for a satisfying dessert, go for sophie's
author: Teresa W.

description: Sure to satisfy any craving. Even if I think I want a steak, I'll eat a crepe from here and I'm good. My fave is banana w/ nutella and the occasional vanilla bean ice cream. It's different from your run-of-the-mill soggy crepe, which isn't bad. This is just better. They serve light meal crepes and gelato as well. Located in a J-town shopping "mall", it's a bit inconvenient but parking is pretty easy. Moreso, it was worth the one hour lunch break my best friend and I had at my old job haha. Drive back to work with one hand on the wheel, the other holding my crepe!
author: Ramona P.

description: You can never go wrong with Sophie's!  I get the Banana Strawberry Nutella everytime I visit Japantown.  Sometimes the line does get kinda long on the weekends, but they are usually pretty fast with the crepe making.  Prices are fair and if you just don't want a crepe that day, they've also got a fantastic parfait.  If you're coming up from Geary, you can look up to the left into their window and check out if they're packed or not.
author: LittleBird 8.

description: This place is usually a hit with those that have never been when we make a trip out to SF, however, the wait is ridiculous and kinda kills it for me.  Strawberry and nutella crepes with vanilla ice cream is never a disappointment, but it always takes SOOOOO LONG.
author: Can L.

description: I remember as a kid, I used to peek through the windows watching them the crepes. I remember thinking how tasty those treats were. Being the shy kid that I was, I didn't actually order anything from there until a year later and boy was I satisfied. I've been a consistent customer over the past I would almost say 7 years. I don't live in the city anymore, but when I do come back home, this is one of the places I definately have to go to. I've only had the desert crepes and all the ones I've had so far have been really tasty. The gelato there is really good too. I haven't tried the meat crepes too but I consistently see people ordering them.  All in all, yummy!
author: Julie L.

description: This is a very pricey place just for ONE crepe. I have only tried their savory crepes so far: egg & tuna. I didn't enjoy it. The insides are all crushed up and at times I feel like it isn't consistently cooked and stuff. Warm exterior and cold interior is just plain nasty. It was almost 7 for it also. Service was moderately okay, but to be honest, this just isn't the BEST place to go for crepes in my opinion.
author: Jenny L.

description: Damn, I can smell the crepes right now. Sophie's is so good I had to put up a 500 mile away, 3 years from the past shout out. I dun go crazee for that ice cream and nutella crepe dood. So good it makes me write gangster.
author: Jared A.

description: Omg I love this place.  Usually when I got to J-town for lunch this place is a must for dessert.  Who cares if I am full.  It has the best dessert crepes.  I'm not much for the savory ones.  I usually get one with ice cream, strawberries and chocolate syrup.  Mmmm.....thinking about it makes me want one.
author: Allison T.

description: I love this place!!! when I get a chance I try to make it out there for the mandarin orange w/ ice cream crepe. I recently discovered the Japantown Special crepe (I think that's what its called) is sooo yummy too. It's filled with red bean paste, green tea ice cream, a drizzle of green tea sauce, and whipped cream. Ohhh soo good. The only thing that drives me nuts is that there can be quite a wait and very little seating, but I can say it's worth it =)
author: Nicole S.

description:
I went to Sophie's Crepes last thursday by recommendation from a friend.  I decided to stop by since I was visiting the Bay Area and had some extra free time.  I haven't had too many crepes in my life but I do enjoy eating them when I do get a chance.

We headed to Japantown to try them out.  We parked in the parking garage below and headed up.  It's a pretty small place to eat at as there is probably 3 tables inside.  I heard that this place gets pretty packed and queues can stack up.  We got there at an off time so we just walked right up to the front.  There's an assortment of different types of crepes that you can order.  They also have a full sized gelato parlour in house.  I went with the banana crepe with vanilla gelato.  I was a bit bummed because if you want a different flavor gelato, it cost an extra $2, which is a ripoff.  Anyhow, the unique thing about this place is they serve their crepes in a cone-like shape.  It looks delicious.  The only problem is that it's quite hard to eat.  It also gets pretty messy.  I had the gelato melt and drip as I tried to maneuver it out of the paper dispenser to eat more.  As far as flavor, it taste really good.  The combination of freshly diced bananas with the vanilla gelato and outer crusted crepe is a perfect combination.

My only gripe about this place was how messy my crepe got when eating.  It literally started to drip off the paper dispenser that they wrap the crepe around (think like how an ice cream cone has a paper wrapped around the cone).  It could just be bad luck by my part that I got a flawed crepe.  I'm down to try it again and probably would do so if I'm back in the area.
author: Christian M.

description: San Fran, I heart you! Wow, the crepes here are just way too Yummy to pass up! = ) They make them perfectly! Don't miss a chance to try these while you are in Japantown!!
author: Bella D.

description:
WAY better than when i try to make my own crepes. i LOVE their gelato and crepes with strawberries. my friends and i INHALE them...in 5 minutes flat. then get in line to get another crepe. =] and at about $6 a crepe, it's SOOOO worth it. definitely need to try it. be sure to go at awkward hours...the lines get LONG.

 the only con, which doesn't apply to me, is that they only accept cash. but i always use cash. it just sucks for my friends. haha.
author: Ryanne L.

description: Your visit to Japantown isn't complete without stopping by Sophie's Crepes for dessert.  Don't be deterred by the long lines - it's worth the wait!  Try the Japanese crepe with green tea gelato, azuki bean paste and matcha sauce.
author: Nancy L.

description: Whenever I'm in San Francisco, I have to make a pilgrimage to Sophie's crepes. They serve in a cone.  It's extremely light and crispy.  The best crepe, I've ever had.  I've been in search of something similar, but it never compares to Sophie's.
author: waisum t.

description: pretty good place. I like their crepes with ice cream and other interesting food like items.  Attracts lot of asian kids with interesting fashion sense and fancy mobile phones :)
author: ji k.

description: Can't go to JTown and not stop by Sophie's! I love their crepes! My fav is the strawberry, chocolate gellato, chocolate syrup and whip cream... There's always a huge crowd around but the line moves relatively fast. YUM!
author: Lucy C.

description: Definitely save room in your tummy (or skip a meal altogether!) so you can enjoy these scrumptious dessert crepes in Japantown.  My favorite is the banana-nutella-ice-cream combo.  A sweet treat to start or end your day right!
author: Vivien W.

description: The atmosphere is the mall with rundown pale yellow colored wall from years of service. As people get in line to make an order, others are crammed into couples and groups waiting for their delicious order of fresh fruit and ice cream served in a french style ice cream cone shaped crepe. Green Tea and Lychee ice cream is great!
author: Jason C. J.

description: This place makes the best crepes.  I just had the green tea crepe... sooooo good.  I'm starting to drool just thinking about them.  yum yum yum.
author: Sam C.

description: One of the best crepe places I have been in SF.  The quality  is great, ingredients are yummy and fresh.  The prices are a bit steep compared to other places, but it is in japantown- everything is a bit more.
author: Hana ..

description: Mm.. cravings. Strawberries, nutella, icecream wrapped up in a huge crepe cone.. When I crave a dessert crepe, I want Sophie's.
author: Sara D.

description: How much crepe can one person stand? I mean, I take enough crepe from the people I'm with all day, not to mention the godawful crepe they listen to on the radio. And my clients, they start calling first thing every morning, giving me all kinds of crepe. What I'm trying to say is, I know a thing or two about crepe. So the guy behind the counter at Sophie's the other night, when I tell him I want strawberry, banana and kiwi together, right away he starts giving me crepe. You mean mixed fruit he says. Yeah, I said, mixed fruit, what you got a problem with that? He says well if you want mixed fruit say mixed fruit. Mentally I unholster my 357, point it right between his beady eyes and say Go ahead, make my day. But what I actually said was, OK, mixed fruit, sir, please. Sophie's has some damn good desserts, and a good selection of snack items too. Just don't let them give you any crepe.
author: Dan Y.
