description: This little tiny crepe shop makes the best crepes in town. They have a little crunch to them which is why I think they're so great. I just had friends visit from L.A. this weekend, and they've never tasted crepes like the ones from Sophie's. They loved it here, which makes me even happier to have Sophie's crepes here.
author: Lea W.

description: I used to go here almost all the time after a meal in japantown.  I would skip the dessert at the restaurant just to get a Sophie's Crepes.  My sister would always get the Japanese special.  I would get that too, but my usual favorite was banana and nutella.  When my sister's dog was still alive, we would always get a plain one just for him to eat.  He would tear that sucker apart like there was no tomorrow.  I haven't really tried their savory crepes, but I am pretty sure they are good as well...
author: Philip L.

description: I have been here quite a few times... this place is always crowded so get in line while you're still deciding on what to order.  The staff is friendly.  The crepes and their gelatos are good but the price is quite high...  Nevertheless, you will still enjoy the food.
author: Surfer S.

description:
This is a regular stop for me when i'm in jtown. In fact, if i'm eating dinner there, i will consciously save room just so i can get a crepe later. It is that good.

I always get the same thing: Rum Raisin gelato, bananas, and nutella. It's so good. I love the fact that they even have rum raisin as most places don't even carry it.

Some words of advice though: If you order one with gelato, make sure to double sleeve it to prevent leaks. Even if the crepe is wrapped well, the gelato melts easily and will seep through the paper.

Definitely give it a try!
author: Justin M.

description: My friend LOVES crepes and I've been tagging along with her so I've been getting addicted to and craving crepes too ! What can I say .. a crepe is a crepe . & the crepes here are alright . Their crepes are kind of crunchy . Their dessert crepes are okay .. like any other crepe you get anywhere , they tend to get messy and all over the place if you add ice cream . The savory crepes are okay but taste kind of weird . The vanilla bean gelato is pretty good . There's only like 3 tables inside so I would suggest getting it to-go or sitting on one of the benches outside . It gets pretty busy sometimes and there's long lines .
author: Eileen L.

description: I love their Chicken Salad Crepes.  Oishii desu(delicious)!
author: Terry T.

description: I was extremely happy with this place until yesterday. I went here way back when, but now they've lost my business. Their customer service is poor. All they said was, "Sorry" for their mistake in my order and waiting 30mins for a $7.62 crepe (Way too expensive). I ordered a strawberry, bananna, nutella crepe with ice cream and they gave me a crepe  with a dinky amount of bananas, icecream, and nutella. No strawberries. Never going to this place ever again.
author: Annallee D.

description: Yeah, the line is usually long and they only accept cash, but the wait is quick, and is certainly worth it. If I'm in the area,  I can't resist this place for an after dinner dessert.  The banana nutella crepe is great! Their fruit is fresh and the staff is friendly. It's a bit quirky being located in Japantown, but well worth the walk inside.
author: Nikkie M.

description: green tea ice cream crepes!? Yum!!! Crepes are thin and crispy and delicious! Their japanese crepe include ice cream red bean and matcha(did I spell that correctly, probably not).  and their ice cream is really gelato.
author: C D.

description: Nothing like topping off a meal in Japantown with a crepe. Thin, crispy, flaky goodness. Fun to watch the crepes being made and there's lots of good people watching in the surrounding areas.
author: n m.

description: I love this place.  I always make sure to stop by Sophie's everytime I'm in Japantown.  My personal favorite is banana and nuttela with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  Gotta have the ice cream.  YUMMMMM!
author: J S.

description:
4.5

awesome crepe served in a handy dandy cone.  nutella/vanilla ice cream/strawberry combo will get you.  get you real good.
author: Adela K.

description: I had a great ice cream crepe!  It had pistachios and whipped cream!  I can still remember all the flavors in my mouth melding together!  I want to go back and try the other flavors now!
author: Foodie B.

description:
Back when I ate normal, I used to love going to this place for a crepe as dessert.  They have an amazing menu of different crepes, with various fruit items and ice-cream.

The place has two crepe grills near the window, and watching them make the crepes is always a delight.  The place is usually quite crowded on weekends.

There is not a whole of space to eat inside -- that's my only real complaint about Sophie's Crepes.
author: Barn M.

description: You know, for as simple as the ingredients are... these are irresistible! You can't help loving these crepes! They have the largest selection of ingredients I've ever seen, and even though the wait is sometimes long, it's always worth it in the end... we never mind when it's our turn and we get ours! Worth the money, and worth the wait!
author: Krista H.

description:
i still love this place.. i go here almost everyday...
the thing is..
i always get the same things..
egg melt
the strawberries w/ ice cream whipped cream && choco syrup
the bananas w/ ice cream whipped cream && choco syrup
and i love gelato.. so sometimes i switch the vanilla ice cream for various gelato flavors..
the adzuki is my favorite :)

i've tried some of their other crepes..
like their chicken salad..
the california crepe..
the tuna salad..
the egg salad.. --not as good as the egg MELT..
but i don't really like any of these..

the egg melt is the best..
THE best.. :D
author: monica c.

description: another great crepe place in the city... too bad they don't open late like genki.
author: Marisol T.

description: my fav place for crepes.  ordered orange crepes out last visit... wish they gave us more of those tiny oranges.  very tasty!  they prep. your crepes behind glass window.. pretty cool to see how they make the crepes.  def will visit again
author: John H.

description: Extremely enjoyable. Everytime I visit Japantown [which is not enough to me] I have to buy a crepe. Usually, by the time I'm finished with it...I want another one. No other crepe store has yet to top Sophies!!!
author: Chelsea R.

description: How can you resist stopping here while in Japantown. All the available sweet and savory choices. I always end up getting 2 or 3 crepes (because we can't decide on just one) to share with my girl while we watch all the "crazy" tourist people. Our favorite is the "Japanese," green tea ice cream, red bean...mmmm, good. You can't go wrong here...
author: Steve S.

description: I didn't like this place for some reason. Every time I went to japan center I would always pass by it in disgust. So it'd probably take me about 6 years for me to actually try it. Man, I was missing out ! hahaha. The crepes here are delicious. Right when you walk toward this place a great aroma kicks into your nostrils. It smells great and I have  no idea why I resisted this for years. I really like their ice cream and the warm crepe. If you ever get a chance to eat here don't miss it. Don't be like me and let great food pass you by.
author: Allen Y.

description: I don't quite get what all the fuss is about this place.  Sure crepes + gelato = tasty treat, but I think Sophie's is the same as any other place.  I think the big thing is that these are portable.  That's probably the coolest part.  Maybe I just need to find the right portable crepe combination to bump it up a star.  That just means having to eat more crepes and gelato...sigh, life is tough.
author: Karen L.

description: mmmm...crepes!  It's my favorite place to go for a crepe.  They have all sorts of  combinations...with ice cream...with out ice cream...savory...sweet.  I love it with hazelnut gelatto.  Heck I'll take anything with Nutella too.  To top it all off, it's comes in a handy dandy cone.
author: Miss T.

description:
when in japantown doing god-knows-what loling at fat goth kids, young asian high school girls, tourists and nipponophiles, i always like to have a crepe from here, with or without gelato.  green tea gelato is surprisingly more tea-flavoredly delicious than green tea ice cream. the crepes can be more crispy than other places, but works well as an ice creme cone.

my favorite thing i ever saw here was some person complained about something, and they said "sorry, the way it works here is we dont give refunds." and i love that, customers are morons.
author: christopher a.

description: Best. Crepes. Ever. If I want something simple, I'll just get bananas and nutella but if I wanna go all out, I'll get the mixed fruit with nutella and green tea gelato with whip cream. Om nom nom nommerz....
author: Lei M.

description: I can't think of a more perfect way to end a perfect Sunday. A beautiful hike at the Marin Headlands and stuffing your face with a banana and nutella crepe with whipped creme from Sophies. Oh Lord, my stomach hurts.
author: Rebecca R.

description: Totally melt you like an ice-cream!!!  Love the crepess...
author: Elsa K.

description: EVERYTIME i go to Japan Town I always go to Sophies.  She makes the best crepe.  My fav is the Japanese Crepe, green tea ice cream,  and red bean.  I think the portions might have gotten smaller, but it's still good!!
author: linda k.

description:
My God I love this place. LOVE LOVE LOVE it. I drive up to the city from San Jose just for Sophie's. It's the absolute best.
I've only had the fruit crepes, but they are all amazing. What more can I say? They only take cash which sucks, and they're closed Mondays which I always forget, but other than that... Sophie's is the place to go for crepes. Do it.
author: Emily S.

description: My favorite - Green tea and red bean paste! I come here for dessert crepes every time I'm in the area after dinner. Their crepes a bit pricey and fillings are a bit skimpy...I guess everything in Jtown can be pricey. But they did fulfill my sweet tooth. :)
author: Peter G.

description: Pretty good place to get dessert after you eat some ramen or donburi, but I like Genki's crepes in the richmond better.  The crepes here tend to be on the very thin side so when they put in the fillings (which are excellent), it tends to crack and fall apart.  Also, don't get the "asian crepe" or whatever its called with the green tea ice cream and red bean.  Sounds pretty good, right?   No.  The whole is definitely less than the sum of its parts.
author: Chris C.

description:
I love good gelato and Sophie's serves an excellent version of it--nice and creamy but not totally sweet.  They also offer a good variety--altho not a huge variety.  Try the banana walnut--lots of nuts in it--or the rum-and-raisin.  I'm not an ice cream in waffles person but my wife is and she vouches for their excellent waffles.  It's also fun to see the cooks do it in the window.

The gelato isn't cheap but I do like the small servings (that's perverse but it keeps a few pounds off).  The waffles and ice cream are $5 or so but worth it.

Remember that Sophie's is on the second floor of the first building up from the Kabuki Theaters.  A bit hard to find but definitely worth the trip.
author: Murray S.

description: I have tried these types of crepes at 3 other locations in the bay area. Genki on Clement Street, Belly Good Crepes(also in Japantown), and Dessert Republic in San Mateo. This place has by far the best crepes in the Bay Area. The way they make the crepes is just right, not too soft, and not too flaky. They have a great variety of dessert options as well as lunch options. I go to S.F. State and I always go there during my 2 hour break to get a dessert crepe. I highly recommend getting the strawberries, nutella, whipped cream, and vanilla ice cream crepe. (#8 with whipped cream & vanilla ice cream)
author: Kurt W.

description:
BEST crepes in the Bay!!!
price and portion are fantastic; might be more like a small meal than just a snack

they're so groovy cuz they put ice cream in their sweet crepes!!!

one of my classic faves (sweet): banana, vanilla ice cream or interchange with cookies'n cream ice cream, whip, and chcoolate syrup/nutella  [i think it's one of the #s on their menu]

they also have red bean ice cream, green tea ice cream and other flavors
author: Pamster j.

description:
Been going here for years. There are very few dessert places that I plan meals around! 

My favorite is the Japantown special - crepe with red bean paste, green tea gelato and green tea sauce and whipped cream! What a treat!!!
author: C K.

description: It is by far the best crepes I have ever had. Who knew Japantown offered the best crepes in the bay area?! Please get Nutella, Gelato, Strawberries, Banana, Kiwi, with whip cream and you will not be disappointed. Price is not that bad but you really do get what you pay for here.
author: Pre D.

description: Went there today with the boyfriend and we got two special crepes with the green tea.  Mine was just ok.  The crepe was a bit dry and the ice cream had ice crystals. Yuk.  My girlfriends was even worse, she had a hair in hers.  We showed the worker and asked for another one and they said they would charge us again.  I said your kidding right.  But they weren't.  We threw both crepes away and  left.  Will never go back again.  Terrible service.
author: Melissa C.

description:
ever since i discovered nutella as a young child i have been gobblin that stuff up whenever i run across it. 

i like sophies crepes bc the crepes are crispy on the edes but the rest still has a bit of a chew to it, not all crispy like some other places make em. i love getting nutella, french vanilla gelato, and sometimes some fruits. it can be pricey but as a treat from time to time its so worth it. 

i've tried their banana, vanilla, cookies and cream, green tea, and red bean gelato. they're all solid.
author: Hannah O.

description: I LOVE YOU! I love the Japanese crepe, or any gelato crepe.... and the red bean ice cream also. And anything with nutella. yumyum. I also like watching them make your crepe... it's really fun. No pictures allowed, though. My crepe cost around $5. And I spilled green tea ice cream on myself.. but I'm still happy.
author: Judy L.

description: omg. the sesame ice cream is to die for. i was lucky enough to find it here after they stopped selling this ice cream in chinatown some years back. they're a bit overpriced in my opinion, specially when you want to add items. shop's a bit small so enjoy eating  your crepe as you walk around or sit on one of the benches in the square. anyway, try the sesame ice cream. it's the best thing they have here.
author: Diego T.

description: very cute place. have quite a variety of yummy crepes! good price for crepes and hold it walking down the street with friends. There is simoly no better thing than this.
author: Sharon R.

description: I love their dessert crepes, but the employees can be a bit snooty if you try to come 15 minutes before closing. My boyfriend and I were waiting in line and the employees started turning away customers even when there was still 15 minutes left before closing. I thought that was a bit rude. If your sign says open till 11pm, stay open until 11pm and then start turning away customers. Also, they are supposed to open at 10am and there have been times where we've had to call in front of their store after 10am to ask when they would be opening. So, staff are a little flaky and moody at times, but it doesn't seem to affect their dessert. YUM!
author: Linda I.

description: I would take the other crepe place over this 1 any day! The other crepe place is called "Belly Good Cafe &/ Crepes". The wait today was ridiculous! Waited 45-60 minutes just for 1 crepe and it wasn't all that. The guy making the crepes kept breaking them while the girl suppose to be adding the fillings was waaaay too slow. Plus the fillings they were adding to the crepes were very little. Talk about being cheap about it. Especially if you are paying $1.25 for nutella & they don't even use that much. Bananas is $1 extra & they use maybe a quarter of a banana. Whip cream is just a dabble/splash. The only thing that was standard size was the crepe and the 1 scoop of vanilla ice cream. I ended up spending close to 8 bux. My bf ended up going to the other place and getting me a crepe from there to see if i was still waiting and was back in 15 minutes while I was still waiting for the crepe @ this place. Now i know why they have their sign posted. NO REFUNDS NO MATTER WHAT! Unless you want to wait forever, i say avoid this place.
author: Ellen T.

description: had the mixed fruit (kiwi, strawberry, and banana) with ice cream and whipped creme crepe. my favorite part was the kiwi and if i ever go back, i'd definitely get all kiwi. expect more of the japanese crepe-style, meaning more crispy than than the softer french styles. definitely a-ok =)
author: Debbie Chiou S.

description: YUM!  I've passed by this place SO many times in the past while eating at J-Town (mifune/tanpopo) and always wanted to try it but always was too full.  Well, I made up my mind to try it yesterday and try it i did.  We came after dinner at Over the Bridge and ordered the Japanese crepe (green tea gelato, red bean paste, macha sauce), Strawberry and cream crepe (fresh strawberries and whipped cream), and mandarin orange+lychee sorbet+whipped cream+nutella crepe.  In my opinion, the Japanese crepe is the BEST.... really smooth and creamy green tea gelato with red bean paste perfection and slightly bitter macha sauce to balance everything out wrapped in a light crispy crepe....gahhh droool.  If you don't like lots of stuff in your crepe go with the whipped cream and strawberry crepe...not overwhelming and sooo very delicious.  Mandarin oranges and lychee is a very good flavor combo and works great with the nutella in the crepe.  I like how their crepes are light and crispy instead of doughy and dense like Crepes a-go-go in Berkeley.  I'll definitely be back next time and maybe even make my bf order a savory crepe just so I can taste how it is......... definitely a five star place.
author: Peggy W.

description: always a must whenever i'm in japantown. mmmm i know it's pretty expensive for a damn crepe but believe me, it's worth EVERY FREAKIN PENNY!
author: Mika D.

description: Sophie's Crepes isn't very good to me. I used to come here until I found an even better crepe place. Belly Good Cafe and Crepes has much more of a variety than Sophie's. So next time you want a crepe that will amaze you, go to Belly Good Cafe and Crepes.
author: Marina C.

description: it's fun watching crepes being made even if you're not ordering one yourself.  but if you are, i recommend a simple one, strawberries with whipped cream.
author: spiff e.

description: crepes here are pretty good, but i like the ones at genki better.  i think they give less filling in the ones at sophie, but i guess a little bit of nutella goes a long way.  i was not fond of the egg salad one here tho and prefer the sweet crepes.
author: Helen T.

description: how many places can you actually look forward to when you're around the area?  outside of the ever present crowd or the delicious neverending varieties, savory or sweet, the crepes here are not too crispy, not too chewy, just right, like a pocket sandwich that your pitas could never duplicate. try anything you want, the last one i got was a banana, honey and peanutbutter. so good. i hate you, you make me fat.
author: Ben T.

description: pretty much your average crepes. the gelatos and the fruit are what save the crepe. if you like thin, crispy crepes, this is your go-to place.
author: Mayson J.

description: I'm not a desert person at all and i am obsessed with sophie's crepes. nutella + strawberry + strawberry gelato. best best best. you must try this place if you are in SF. the crepe skin is toasty and thin and crispy and sooo good.
author: foodbot c.

description: When I first saw the shop, it was crowded as expected. I thought this place was going to be as good as people said and considering the crowded line I was excited to get a crepe from there. The price was pretty expensive ranging from $4- $6 and additional toppings cost from $1- I don't know ( it depends). I don't think their crepe was that good...I've experienced better. I had a little bit of raw dough ( or whatever that gooey paste they used to make the skin of it) so I had to throw that part away..
author: amandaaa s.

description: i love me some crepes!!! It's so good here, no lie!! I remember my days in high school when i would walk here almost 2x a week. it was rad! come to sophie's, you will not regret it!!!
author: Bernadette B.

description: such yummy, chewy crepes.  haven't tried the savory but if you're gonna try a sweet, try #17.  it's called the japanese (this place is located in san francisco's japantown) which includes green tea ice cream, red bean paste, and macha sauce.  it's pretty awesome!
author: Michelle S.

description: The red bean gelato is good, as is the mocha chip and lychee. The selection of gelato is not great and some of the gelato, like the cookies and cream, tends to taste a little icy.
author: Mama L.

description: Good crepes in the Japantown mall. Prices are a little bit higher than Genki and it is little shorter, but hey a crepe is a crepe! You build your own with the  many different choices they have available. Vanilla and nutella is one of my favorites.
author: M. W.

description: i compare other crepe places to Sophie's.
author: Joanne H.

description: ok, let me get this place straight.i use to look forward coming back home from socal and go to jtown to this place, but I went to get my fix after eating sushi boat (YUM!) and tell me why their crepes have gotten SOOO much smaller.it's like they've gotten so cheap with their ingredients.i usually get the J (banana,chocolate,whipped cream,vanilla ice cream, but i get green tea gelato instead and its $1.50 more :D).the J is usually $4.70, which is pretty reasonable, but i'm very disappointed today by the size of my crepe.i mean i'd come back again because the skin is really good compared to other places i've gone to, but i don't think it's as good as before.
author: Denise K.

description: Sophie's Crepes rival the crepes I ate in Paris on my honeymoon.  I always save room for crepes dessert when my friends and I eat in Japantown.
author: Mona B.

description: in japantown, good desert crepes in a variety of flavors. fruit with ice cream is always good. if you're easily entertained, sit in front of kinokuniya bookstore and watch people on japanese television do weird things.
author: Lijia X.

description: hands down, best crepes! -- just like the ones you can get in japan.  if you like your crepes thin & crisp, then this is the place to come.  it's too bad their second location in north beach didn't stay open for long.  if you like your crepes softer like a pancake, then go to crepe vine.
author: Waynele Y.

description: Quite possibly the best crepe place in the whole Bay Area.  Best place to go to for dessert after having a hearty meal in Japantown ;)
author: Jim N.

description: I love this place! It's the place I normally go for my crepe cravings, the strawberries crepes with ice cream and chocolate are so yummy. Aww but the line can become VERY long during the cherry blossom festival, and I mean god-awful waits like around an hour. So I'd rather go down to the other crepe place in the mall, though they are smaller (but cheaper).
author: Lianna F.

description: OMG, this is the best crepes I've had.  My son loves it, he is only 8 but he can eat the whole strawberry and vanilla icecream crepes all by himself.  We love going there on the weekends, even though there's always a line, it's worth the wait..............
author: G J.

description: it's always worthwhile making a quick stop @ Sophie's Crepes in Japantown, SF. their crepes stay flaky-crispy even with the combination of icecream & nutella. it's also conveniently located near Kabuki AMC theatre, so rather than getting ripped off with a $5 dinky hot dog...you can stop by Sophie's first & spend your $5 with a hearty & fulfilling crepe-sandwich. i love avocado...so i always get the turkey & avocado crepe.
author: Kay V.

description: a couple of friends recommened this great place to have dessert or a snack.  and the price is good.  it's located in Japantown in San Francisco.  the fresh strawberries and vanilla ice cream and chocolate ice cream in a crepe is quite yummy.
author: Tran H.

description: not fuLL from Japanese foOd.. then come to the second fLoor to get yourself a crepe with nutella chocolate, bananas and whipped cream.. SO gOOd.... the line andt he  wait can be a Bee-Coth... but it aLL worth it...~~ their gelato ice cream is good especially their grEEn tea.. hmmmm
author: Lily T.

description: so my rating is because of the gatdang prices! ssoo cheap! i mean, coming from LA where i get crepes @ Santa Monica and they charge you almost 5 bucks for a butter and sugar crepe...and i come here where i got a banana w/chocolate syrup and a scoop of vanilla ice cream for less than 5 bucks...i kicked myself and cursed LA for overcharging me...the chocolate syrup was so yummy...and so was the ice cream, as for the crepe itself...it was ok, not as soft and chewy i would have liked...i think they gave us the one the trainee made...eh... but either way, it was super cheap, and still yummy...
author: Grace P.

description: I am really picky when it comes to crepes because I used to eat crepes all the time when I stayed in Paris with my family. In Paris its typical to just get a crepe with butter and some sugar, so when I saw the large selection at Sophies, I was a little overwhelmed. So me and my friend decided to share one savory crepe and one sweet so we can try two different crepes. The first one had chicken, tomatos, and avocados. It was pretty good the hot crepe combined with the buttery avocados was a nice change from the typical sweet crepes. But the avocado was soo slippery that it kept sliding to the bottom of the cone, so it was hard to get the perfect bite of chicken, avocado, tomato and crepe. We also got a sweet crepe with whipped cream and berry jam. It was real simple, but I love the combination of whipped cream and berries, and the blackberrie jam was really good. But again, the toppings kept falling to the bottom so it was almost like eating a pastry bag and all the cream and jam would squirt out of the bottom. Next time, I will just take it out of the cone and refold it so stuff doesn't leak out the bottom. A pretty good crepe, but a bit expensive for what it is.
author: Samantha T.

description: I LOVE Sophie's Crepe... and it's a must-go for me when I'm at Japantown. They carry high quality gelato that can be put in the crepe. They have flavors like: red bean, green tea, pistachio, vanilla etc... My favorite is their fresh strawberry with nutella crepe... (with a scoop of red bean gelato if I want to indulge myself that day)! Keep in mind though that you cannot change your order once you place it... so double check your order and receipt before you walk away. The price is a bit steep for a crepe... It can cost close to $8-9 for a crepe. The lines are LONG during the weekends. I remember having to wait close to 40 minutes once for a crepe! (*I was told the wait would be 15 minutes) Normal wait time... is close to about 15-20 minutes though. They have only 2 crepe pans... and normally about 2-3 workers trying to put together the crepes. There isn't much of a seating area inside the restaurant (about 3 tables)... but you can enjoy your crepe outside (there are benches) outside and by the bookstore.
author: Loretta T.

description: mocha chip gelato crepe........yum!
author: A. Gun n.

description: 2 strawberry toppings, chocolate sauce, vanilla bean gelato. don't bother me, i'm in heaven.
author: Angie Y.

description: We finally tried this place after all these years. We were hungry and needed a little snack before dinner. We tried the ham and cheese. It was ok, but we could not taste the cheese. After taking a bite, I thought we should have tried a dessert one instead. But the smell of the crepe is sure good.
author: vernice l.

description: We just had a sundae....Yumm! Got the chocolate one with the mocha chip gelato. Well worth the $4.21!
author: M B.

description:
delicious, but $6.25 for an Ice cream cone, is that normal now? 
who sets the price icons for yelp?
author: Jeff E.

description: sophie..sophiee.. u got me addicted to ur fatty yet yummy crepes. ur the reason why my belly explodes ah ILOVEYOU
author: Richard K.

description: The lychee ice cream here is much better than the Pollyann ice cream they use at Genki. Other points of comparison: the crepes are smaller, so you can actually finish a dessert crepe without getting a stomachache, and the red bean paste is not as sickly sweet. I think I'll be going here instead of Genki from now on.
author: A. T.

description: Both the savory and sweet crepes here are excellent.  Also, the quality is consistent....
author: M R.

description: just do it - japanese dessert crepe (green tea gelato, azuki bean paste, matcha sauce). i don't care if you're full.
author: Angi C.

description: Soooo good, soooo adicting!  Get the green tea gelato, best I have ever had.
author: Kat S.

description: Sophie's is slightly under Genki in my book. Their crepe is not as crispy and they use a cardboard crepe holder that makes it very hard to eat. I tried the egg salad + cheese crepe, which I wouldn't recommend. Dessert crepes are pretty good but I wish they would flatten them.
author: Luke F.

description: Thanks to Jeannie L. I have been introduced to the wonderful Sophie's Crepes. The window case full of model crepes made it hard for me to choose. I finally decided on the mixed fruit crepe with nutella and then last minute added the hazelnut gelato inside. IT WAS AWESOME!!!! I think the hazelnut gelato completely made the crepe! I will come here again!!!
author: Matt K.

description: i like this place more than Genki's of course but they always have such a long line. i love how we can watch them make the crepe too which is pretty good. but, seating is very limited here and it can take a while sometimes. but overall, this is the place to go in japantown
author: Kenny L.

description: So to top off a great dinner at Mifune's, we go to Sophie's Crepes for dessert.  We usually all have the green tea gelato with azuki beans.  Mmmm!  We aren't in the City as often as I would like, so I haven't been brave enough to try something other than my go to dessert, but reading everyone else's reviews, I'm gonna have to try something else.
author: Misa T.

description: i only ate here once, but i go to japan town like every week. i think i ordered the cheapest thing(i already spent most of my money at ichiban kan and kinokuniya bookstore) on the menu: a regular crepe with strawberry filling. i didnt like it much since it tasted like a really thin pressed piece of bread with safeway strawberry jam inside. but maybe next time i eat here i'll go all out and order one that comes with whip cream.. also referred to as something more tasty.
author: Amalia D.

description: Tasty but kind of expensive for dessert.  The portion is pretty big for me so I usually share with someone.  I always get the green tea ice cream + strawberries, yum!
author: Priscilla P.

description: Definitely a great treat once in a while, but the service is horrible. Sure, the crepes are pretty good (they better be for what you're paying), but the people who make the crepes constantly mess up orders (probably because of the rush of people) and aren't so friendly about fixing their mix ups.
author: J J.

description: I love coming to Sophie's Crepes! My friend's from So Cal. must come here too before leaving... The dessert crepes rock..... I haven't tried anything else but the fruits and ice cream, but eating crepes as a meal doesn't sound appetizing for me.... I see crepes as a dessert. The only thing that sucks about eating the dessert crepes, is that it's so big the ice cream melts and causes it to be messy. If you're planning to eat this after a meal, I suggest you share with someone because it will definitely stuff you!
author: Connie W.

description: Probably one of the best crepe places I've been to.  They have many savory and sweet crepes to choose from and if you can't decide you can always create your own!  Another positive thing is the crepes get done fast and neat.
author: J N.

description: This place is always crowded on the weekends cause the crepe are just plain delicious.  But they have other good stuff too like the different sundaes they put together.  Great place to get some ice cream dessert after a dinner at the other J-town restaurants.
author: T Q.

description: mmmmm...mixed fruit with green tea gelato
author: Ryan I.

description: the crepes are a bit expensive raging from 4.50-7.00? but it sure is good! it's a yummy dessert-to-go!
author: Amy T.

description: yummy, everytime i go to sf, i try my best to drop by sophie's for some green tea crepes. yummy!
author: Karenka N.
